Job Title: Board Certified Behavior Analyst BCBA LBA
Job Description:
BCBA-Board Certified Behavior Analyst
BCBA LBA

Technology Enhanced Learning and Living (TELL Therapy), a woman clinician-owned therapy center in central Austin, was created in response to the needs of adults with disabilities in Central Texas.

This unique position offers the opportunity to work approximately 30 hours per week, 10 hours with each of 3 clients in the south Austin area. This is an intense, in-person intervention, ideal for the skilled therapist but with ample training for those without previous adult experience.

An innovator from its inception, TELL's mission is driven by its belief in equality in access for all individuals with disabilities, regardless of age. Our behavior professionals are experts in their fields, working collaboratively to support and learn from each other and bring our clients the highest level of therapeutic services.

For over a decade we have been leaders in the field. Ours is one of the first ABA clinics in our community dedicated to meeting the needs of adults with disabilities by providing direct, 1-1 behavior therapy.

At our boutique clinic you will find unparalleled training and growth opportunities, an array of benefits and leadership opportunities. Our bespoke work environment allows our team members to become both mentors to others and a driving force in the community of clinicians who serve and enhance the lives of older Texans with disabilities.

Our team of dedicated speech and behavior professionals work in tandem to meet the needs of this vulnerable group of individuals.

You will have full agency over your professional learning plan, helping you to become a leading authority in ABA service delivery. There is the opportunity to add additional hours as well.

Our clinic offers you a competitive hourly rate, an array of benefits, professional growth, leadership and career expansion.

Leadership advancement is available for an individual with a thorough knowledge of the Medicaid waiver programs and strong writing skills.

Essential Job Functions*

*Reimbursable activities are based on information from the Texas Health and Human Services Commission (HHSC).

Develop and Implement Behavior Support Plans (70%)

* meet with clients, family members and their support staff

* analyze data to determine when, where and the function of problem behaviors

* define behaviors in measurable terms... both those to reduce and replacement behaviors to increase .. and develop measurement/tracking tools

* develop and provide specialized positive behavioral interventions

* develop and demonstrate successful strategies to integrate the behavior support plan into home and community settings

Training (20%)

* meet with parents, attendants, center support staff and others in our client's lives to provide them with the skills necessary to build fluency in the implementation of the BSP

* work with each client's team to design and cross-train in BSP and crisis intervention strategies

* participate in scheduled staffing or other meetings

Organize and Maintain Records (10%)

* maintain up to date client files

* write and submit timely notes and other documents

Competencies

1 currently licensed or certified as a BCBA or LBA

2 able to communicate effectively in person and in writing

CPR required when hired.

A flexible schedule

Reimbursement includes generous hourly rate, paid CEU's and a signing bonus.

Email Jamie with resume/CV & cover letter.

About us

Behavior Keys has been a fixture in San Antonio, TX since 1995, and we pride ourselves on delivering excellent services. We are customer-centric, supportive, collaborative and our goal is to embrace a " total individual" philosophy. At Behavior Keys, we realize every person is unique. We work with families and stakeholders to develop client-centered objectives that build on strengths, while allowing for difference and learning styles. Our approach is engaging, challenging and responsive to ongoing development .

Our work environment includes:

Relaxed atmosphere, good work/life balance

Responsibilities:
- Conduct assessments to identify the needs and goals of individuals with developmental disabilities, particularly those with autism spectrum disorders.
- Develop and implement individualized behavior intervention plans based on assessment results and client needs.
- Provide direct behavioral therapy services to clients, including teaching new skills, reducing problem behaviors, and promoting independence.
- Collect and analyze data on client progress and behavior to inform treatment decisions.
- Collaborate with other professionals, such as speech therapists and occupational therapists, to ensure coordinated care for clients.
- Train and supervise behavior technicians or other support staff working with clients.
- Provide ongoing support and training to parents and caregivers on implementing behavior strategies at home.

Skills:
- Board Certification as a Behavior Analyst (BCBA) or eligibility for certification.
- Experience working with children or individuals with special needs, particularly those with autism spectrum disorders.
- Knowledge of applied behavior analysis (ABA) principles and techniques.
- Strong assessment and data collection skills.
- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate with clients, families, and other professionals.
- Ability to develop and implement individualized behavior intervention plans.
- Strong problem-solving skills to address challenging behaviors effectively.

Organization Overview:
Help, Hope, Solutions provides ABA therapy for children and adolescents on the autism spectrum. We use a unique approach and all individualized programming and goals to ensure the most effective treatment outcomes for our clients. The company embraces a supportive and collaborative environment, and we host staff events to encourage team bonding and promote a motivating and positive work environment!

Position Summary:
The BCBA will have the responsibility of maintaining a caseload of clients and RBT’s to oversee. BCBA’s will be under the direct supervision of the Clinical and Executive VPs and will serve as the point of contact for all RBT’s, Team leads, parents and clients on their caseload.

Responsibilities and Duties:

o Complete Assessments, Reassessments, and treatment plans

o Design individual intervention plans based on assessment outcomes

o Design effective behavior intervention plans to decrease maladaptive behaviors.

o Analyze data, trends, graphs as directly related to client progress

o Monitor treatment progress

o Provide Parent training/collaboration

o Collaborate with ST, OT and PT

o Supervise own caseload of clients and RBT’s

o Train and checklist staff weekly

o Fulfill average weekly billable requirements

o Fulfills documentation in observations, checklists, supervision forms, and maintenance of clients’ folders

Qualifications and Experience:

BCBA is required to:

o Be a BCBA in good standing with the Behavior Analyst Certification Board (BACB)

o Professional communication skills with both the staff and the parents or guardians

o Current state licensure from the Texas Department of Licensure and Regulations (or ability to be licensed through their agency).

o Excellent interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills.

o Independently and efficiently manage, and organize responsibilities related to maintaining client caseload.

o Implement critical thinking and clinical evaluation in designing, testing, and implementing behavior procedures.

o Child development experience preferred

Company Benefits:

o BCBA & Privately Owned Company!

o Eligible for Health Insurance after 90 days of employment

o Eligible for Dental & Vision Insurance after 60 days of employment

o Retirement Plan | 401k Matching (Fidelity)

o Generous PTO & Paid Holidays

o Above Market Salaries for Qualified and Experienced BCBA’s

o Performance Based Bonuses

o Company Paid Licensure Renewal & 8-Hour Supervision Training

o Paid CEUs

o Professional Liability Insurance Provided

o Credentialing with Insurance Companies

o Coaching and Mentorship with Exceptionally Seasoned BCBA’s

o Paid Parental Leave

o Work From Home Flexibility Dependent on Competency Level

Pre-Employment Screening:

o We are a child-focused and insurance credentialed company; therefore, employment is dependent on the results of a criminal background check (Federal, State, and County), the results of a pre-employment drug screening, and the verification of two employment references.

Classification:

o Employee, Salaried – Exempt

Position Overview:
Shoppa’s John Deere is seeking an experienced CRM & Data Analyst to join our team. This role requires in-depth knowledge of Microsoft Dynamics will oversee system configuration, customization, and testing, while also providing training and user support. You will generate insights by using analytics techniques such as advanced data visualization, statistical analysis, randomized testing, predictive modeling, forecasting, and optimization.

Key Responsibilities:

· Provide support in the development, implementation and operational support for our new MS Dynamics 365 Sales and Marketing platform and other related systems.

· Ability to customize and configure MS Dynamics 365 Sales to meet specific business requirements, including creating custom fields, entities, workflows, and business process flows.

· Collaborate with management to seamlessly integrate data sources to generate reports, dashboards, and analytics within MS Dynamics 365 Sales to provide insights into sales performance, pipeline management, and forecasting by using Business Intelligence tools like Tableau, PowerBI and MS Dynamics CRM Analytics.

· Assist in training and support to CRM users, including onboarding new users, conducting training sessions, and addressing user inquiries and issues related to MS Dynamics.

· Assist with gathering/analyzing data from additional data platforms internally and within John Deere brand to identify growth opportunities in all departments by identifying new customers and enhancing current customer experiences.

· Applies analytical techniques to prospect for business insights and find patterns in data which could be valuable for dealership growth.

· Leverages technology to streamline sales and marketing processes and implement improvements to enhance productivity and efficiency.

Experience, Education, Skills and Knowledge:

· 2+ years experience with MS Dynamics 365 Sales and Marketing platform customization and configuration, including knowledge of its features and functionality specific to sales and marketing processes.

· 1+ year(s) background or proven experience in mining data for analytics insights.

· 1+ year(s) exposure/knowledge to statistical tools such as Microsoft Power BI, Power Automate, Power Apps, Tableau, R, Phyton, SAS.

· Experience and knowledge to automate processes, design and build forms, customize system components in a D365 Sales environment.

· Direct experience with data entry, cleansing, import/export, and quality control, ensuring accuracy and completeness of CRM data related to leads, contacts, accounts, opportunities, and projects.

· Functional understanding of CRM systems and experience identifying and developing audience segmentation and key customer engagement processes

· Proficiency in analyzing large datasets and deriving actionable insights to drive marketing strategies.

· Familiarity with tracking tools and platforms such as Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, social media analytics tools, and marketing automation systems.

Are you looking to join a company who is dedicated to its employees and customers? Are you searching for an organization that has committed itself to remaining a debt free family owned and operated business? Let’s face it, are you looking for your career? Then Senox could just be where you call home.

Senox has a new opening for a Manufacturing Data Analyst to join our Procurement Department.

The Manufacturing Data Analyst will work closely with the procurement and manufacturing departments to maintain data accuracy across MRP (Materials Resource Planning) system and support those departments by providing comprehensive data analysis and reporting to help maintain inventory levels and achieve fulfilment goals.

WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR?

We are looking for an Ideal Team Player; a person who is humble, hungry, and people smart. Someone who has attention to detail, the willingness to learn, and the motivation to grow within a company will be the perfect fit.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES

Maintain Master Part Data as it relates to manufacturing and procurement (Part Revisions, Bills of Material, units of measure, bins, location permissions)
Design and generate reports to aid with forecasting, production scheduling, transfer and sales order fulfilment, inventory cycle counting and other needs.
Act as a data resource for team members by performing extensive data gathering and analysis as needed.
Perform input and maintenance of MRP parameters and planning factors as specified by department policy, necessary to support the part master/plant record maintenance of MRP system.
Analyze suggested orders for requirements produced by MRP using reasonable checks established by departmental policies/procedures.
Review errors and discrepancies in MRP suggestion results, taking corrective action to troubleshoot these errors.
Test implemented plan in MRP to assure that desired outcome is achieved.
Take full ownership of data integrity in ERP system for parts and modules used by procurement and manufacturing departments.

SKILLS & Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree preferred.
2-4 years experience with MRP systems, supply chain, forecasting and bills of materials preferred.
2-4 years experience querying and manipulating data for use in reporting.
Adapts quickly to perform other production/planning roles as needed with little instruction and oversight.

WHAT THE IDEAL TEAM PLAYER WILL HAVE

The ability to work effectively with others and loves to add value to a like-minded group endeavor
A sense of energy, passion, honesty, good attendance, and personal responsibility
Skills to say and do the right things to help teammates feel appreciated, understood, and included
Little ego when it comes to needing attention, credit, and is comfortable sharing accolades
Persistence, dedication, organization, and commitment to a task well done
Passion to do work that matters and not just looking for a J-O-B
Desire to see their work impact future generations and a willingness to mentor others
Strong communication and technical skills in order translate business needs into results

A FEW THINGS WE WANT YOU TO KNOW

We have approximately 300 team players and we're growing!
Our interview process is more thorough and involved because we are looking for the right fit.
We work really hard, we love what we do, at the end of the day we go home and enjoy our families.
We are looking for people who have a successful personal life, they make good team players.
We cultivate a pleasant winning environment using the principles of Humble, Hungry, & Smart.

Position Description:

Ecompex is recruiting an Environmental Program Analyst to support the Defense Health Agency (DHA) and deliver professional services aimed at facilitating the successful implementation of the DHA Sustainability Program. The Environmental Program Analyst role is essential in ensuring the Defense Health Agency (DHA) maintains rigorous environmental compliance to sustain readiness, protect health and safety, and minimize compliance risks. The primary objective of this position is to support the DHA Environmental Program Manager in developing and maintaining environmental compliance strategies, managing the program budget, providing hazardous waste management support, conducting environmental compliance assessments, and offering technical support to DHA Medical Treatment Facilities (MTFs). This role plays a critical part in promoting environmental sustainability within DHA. This position will require occasional travel to conduct on-site assessments.

Minimum Qualifications:

· Must be a US Citizen.

· Must possess a Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field.

· Strong understanding and familiarity with the command structure of DHA, Army, Navy, Air Force, and the Office of the Secretary of Defense (OSD).

Desired Qualifications:

· Possession of US driver’s license.

· Knowledgeable in Federal Government Contracting (Federal Acquisition Regulations).

· Ability to travel up to 25-50%.

Required Skills:

· Knowledge of state, federal, and local environmental regulations.

· Experience in environmental compliance.

· Strong knowledge of environmental hazardous waste protocols.

· Strong communication and collaboration skills.

· Ability to analyze data, prepare reports, and make recommendations.

· Detail-oriented with excellent organizational skills.

· Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite.

Responsibilities:

· Collaborate with the DHA Environmental Program Manager to create and update the DHA Environmental Compliance Strategy and Policy.

· Ensure compliance with state, federal, and local environmental regulations relevant to healthcare provision.

· Assist in drafting, editing, reviewing, and resolving comments on the compliance strategy and policy document.

· Conduct annual reviews of the policy, addressing any changes or clarifications as required.

· Prepare Formal Issue Instructions and memos to ensure DHA's adherence to environmental regulations.

· Assist the Environmental Program Manager in managing the compliance and pollution prevention budget.

· Develop and update environmental budgeting guidance documents, including project narratives and justifications.

· Prepare and distribute spend plan worksheets to MTFs.

· Collaborate with Air Force and Navy representatives during program integration.

· Coordinate hazardous waste management efforts across DHA, ensuring consistent protocols and documentation.

· Collaborate with DHA HQ, MTFs, and reporting units to define responsibility for oversight of hazardous waste.

· Implement consistent hazardous waste management protocols to ensure compliance with state and federal regulations.

· Update the Waste Management Pocket Guide, covering various waste streams and relevant regulations.

· Distribute the updated guide electronically and in hard copy to affected DHA MTFs.

· Conduct Environmental Compliance Baseline Assessments (ECBAs) of MTF hazardous waste programs.

· Provide technical support for implementing recommendations from ECBAs.

· Prepare the Final DHA guidance on new environmental rules affecting the program.

· Apply the ECBA methodology to DHA facilities to identify compliance risks and share best practices.

· Conduct at least 8 ECBAs per year at DHA facilities.

· Prepare audit reports with detailed findings, compliance assessments, gap analysis, and recommendations for each Facility site visited.

· Conduct outreach and follow-up interviews with MTFs to assess the status and success of implementing recommendations.

Title: Data Quality Analyst

Location: Austin TX ( 2 days Onsite)

Duration: 6 months + possible extension

General Description:
Responsible for analyzing, assessing, and documenting diverse data from its source through many complex transformations to all applications that consume the data to assist the Data Management and Support (DMS) Team with continuous improvement in its mission to the agency. Additionally the individual will identify the issues from the profiling, follow up with the business, document the business rules, and assist with the processes involved around continuous improvement of the quality of the data and other capabilities of the DMS Team. Strong skills to identify and resolve data issues and effectively apply the broad range of professional concepts, practices, and methods in moderately complex and diverse circumstances. Work is perform under moderate supervision of the Data Management and Support Team Lead with moderate latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgement.

Duties and Responsibilities
Essential Functions:

Expand and continuously refine the data quality program.
Ensures adherence to the data quality programs and standards.
Ensures that the data quality corrective action plan is thoroughly documented.
Promote the importance and awareness of an enterprise data quality program.
Leverages data management knowledge to define and maintain data quality, reference data, and meta-data processes.
Participates in the development of data quality rules, thresholds, and standard/quality expectations for data elements that support critical business processes.
Continuously execute and monitor the Data Quality Lifecycle on a daily basis.
Profiles data for statistical analysis and assessment of data to document the effectiveness of data quality controls and identifies improvement opportunities.
Identifies and implements best practices and tools based on the business needs.
Implement controls to mitigate data quality risks including continuously monitoring data quality results, reports and dashboards.
Impeccable oral and written communication skills are essential for effectively interacting with data users, managers, and other stakeholders.
Complies with all applicable agency policies and procedures, including safety and standards of conduct.
Performs other duties as assigned

Essential Work Behaviors:

Communicates respectfully and works harmoniously with all co-workers, customers, and vendors.
Provides exceptional customer service.
Is flexible; able to work under pressure and; able to adapt to change; and able to work on multiple problems and tasks.
Takes initiative to prevent and solve problems.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
Uses all knowledge, skills, and abilities to apply critical thinking to all aspects of the job. Critical thinking is a process of forming reasoned opinions through observation, information collection, interpretation, analysis, inference, evaluation, and other skills necessary to successfully meet performance standards of the job.

Strong analytical and product management skills, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements.
Demonstrated problem solving skills in a technical environment
Strong written and verbal communication skills; Editing and proofing skills for complex and technical documents.
Ability to understand and clearly communicate technical information to non-IT personnel
Strong organizational skills and the ability to prioritize assignments.
General knowledge of legislature and legislative process.
Familiarity with HIPAA and other data security and confidentiality requirements.
Ability to work independently on difficult, complex tasks.
Ability to use discretion on matters of a confidential or sensitive nature.
Knowledge of health care claims data.

Qualification Requirements
Education/Special Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree in computer science, engineering, statistics, economics, finance, library science, or related business field.

Experience and Training

3 years of experience creating functional and technical documentation, business glossaries, and diagrams, that communicates the desired message to business and technical audiences.
3 years of experience working with enterprise grade databases - preferably SQL Server and Oracle.
3 years of experience developing and writing complex SQL scripts/queries – preferably Oracle and SQL Server.
2 years of experience, within the last 5 years, developing data quality rules, thresholds, and standard metrics/quality-expectations for data elements that support critical business processes.
2 years of experience, within the last 5 years, with an enterprise grade data quality tool such as Informatica Data Quality, SAS Data Quality, Omni-Gen Data Quality, etc.
2 years of experience, within in the last 5 years, in the Data Quality field developing and implementing best practices and tools based on the business needs.
Leads and participates in discussions with cross-functional teams.

Preferred Qualifications

3 years of experience working with complex Excel functions, including but not limited to VLookUp, Macros, Pivot Tables, etc.
2 years of experience with the Microsoft SQL Server BI Stack (RDMS, SSIS, SSRS)
Experience or familiarity with Alteryx & Tableau.
Experience or familiarity with Benefits Administration, Pension Administration, and Payroll oriented data in the PeopleSoft HRMS package or similar package.

Job Description:
Join a team of BCBAs who are committed to a compassionate, play-based approach to ABA therapy!

Who We Are:

Spark Learning is a leading provider of Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) therapy services for children with Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD) and related developmental disabilities in Austin, TX. As a BCBA owned and operated organization, we are committed to providing high-quality, evidence-based interventions that are tailored to the unique needs and strengths of each child. Our team of experienced and dedicated professionals includes Board Certified Behavior Analysts (BCBAs), Behavior Technicians, Registered Behavior Technicians, and Speech Therapists, who work together to ensure the best possible outcomes for our clients.

At Spark Learning, we believe in fostering a culture of continuous learning and professional growth, and we offer ongoing training and development opportunities for our team. We are proud to be a part of the vibrant and diverse community of Austin, and we are committed to making a positive difference in the lives of the families we serve.

Positive and supportive work culture
Ethical and evidence based practices
Competitive salary and sign on bonus
Comprehensive Benefits Package: Health/Dental/Vision/Mental Health benefits, Paid Time Off, Paid Company Holidays, and Retirement Plan
Opportunities for continued professional growth and development
Manageable caseloads and consistent schedules
Opportunities to get involved with and support the autism community
Team committed to utilizing the latest research, new techniques and your ideas
Leadership team of BCBAs who are invested in your success and our high quality clinical standards
Opportunities to work with a variety of clients and in a variety of settings

Your Next Opportunity:

Conduct comprehensive assessments, analyze data, and develop individualized treatment plans based on the needs of the client.
Implement interventions utilizing a play-based approach, incorporating the child's interests and strengths to promote learning and development.
Provide ongoing supervision and training to Behavior Technicians and Registered Behavior Technicians.
Collaborate with families and other professionals involved in the child's care to ensure a holistic and consistent approach to treatment.
Maintain accurate and detailed records of client progress and behavior data.

Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

Job Title: Sr. IT Enterprise APM (Asset Performance Management) Business Analyst
Job Description:
Sr. IT Enterprise APM (Asset Performance Management) Business Analyst

Pemex Deer Parkis a highly complex refinery located 18 miles east of Houston in Deer Park, TX. It is part of the Pemex group, a fully integrated oil company in the Americas, working across the entire value chain: exploration, production, industrial processing/refining, logistics, and marketing. The refinery’s rated capacity is 340,000 barrels per day and has the feed flexibility to process multiple grades of crudes to produce the high-quality transportation fuels the world needs. The Pemex site is co-located with other 3rd party chemical facilities, allowing for further integration and optimization of the refinery and its products. Pemex Deer Park provides a diverse and inclusive work environment that employs approximately 1000 employees with another 1000 contractors on site. We set high standards of performance and ethical behaviors and offer challenging and fulfilling job opportunities in a number of fields. We take great pride in our ability to ensure the health and safety of our workers and the environment while being a good neighbor and having a positive impact on the local community where we work.

Best-in-Class Benefits and Perks:

We value our employees’ time and efforts. Our commitment to your success is enhanced by competitive compensation depending on experience and an extensive benefits package including:

Comprehensive health coverage: Medical, dental, and vision insurance provided.
Robust retirement planning: 401(k) plan available with employer matching.
Financial security: Life and disability insurance for added protection.
Flexible financial options: Health savings and flexible spending accounts are offered.
Well-being and work-life balance: Paid time off and 9/80 Flexible Working Schedule, including limited ability to work remotely.

Plus, we work to maintain the best environment for our employees, where people can learn and grow with the company. We strive to provide a collaborative, creative environment where everyone feels encouraged to contribute to our processes, decisions, planning, and culture.

We seek a Sr. IT Enterprise APM (Asset Performance Management) Business Analyst who will support the IT Enterprise Digital Solutions Manager to drive alignment between IT and the business. Your role will include working with a variety of teams leading activities and projects related to RBI (Risk Based Inspections), RCM (Reliability Centered Maintenance), OTM (Operator Technical Monitoring), LTPTM (Long Term Proactive Technical Monitoring), RCA (Root Cause Analysis), and Predictive Analytics. Your objective is to find daily continuous improvement opportunities, including understanding their business processes, requirements, and use of each application. As the Business Systems Analyst, you will assist in project planning, coordination with vendors, and follow-up on support efforts our remote support teams are giving. From a site perspective, you will link the business and our different IT teams, translating business needs into technical solutions. You will also establish IT Application best practices at the site. We expect you to seek to understand the Refinery business and oil and Gas practices and feel comfortable working in a Plant-type environment. Creativity and customer-centric attitudes are fundamental in this role.

To be successful, you must have:

Understanding of common applications used at a Refinery
Understanding of applications and processes where Value can be created
Strong technical abilities in application design, configuration, implementation, and support
Should have working knowledge of RBI (Risk Based Inspections), RCM (Reliability Centred Maintenance), OTM (Operator Technical Monitoring), LTPTM (Long Term Proactive Technical Monitoring), RCA (Root Cause Analysis), and Predictive Analytics
Understanding of standard business processes in a Refinery or the Oil & Gas industry
Understanding of key ‘pain points’ in typical IT Applications environment
Ease / Proficiency in understanding complex business processes and translating them into technical solutions.
Experience developing “how to use” type documents
Experience creating an applications inventory and portfolio
Team leadership skills: able to lead, communicate, and interact with offsite Support teams
Experience having worked in similar roles or environments
Comfortable working at a Refinery or have worked in similar type plants.
Strong communication skills (written and verbal) among IT, digital, and business stakeholders
Comfortable in a multi-tasking type environment

Preferred Experience in the following software:

Operator Technical Monitoring (Intellatrac / Aveva – Mobile Operator)

Your responsibilities as the Sr. IT Enterprise APM (Asset Performance Management) Business Analyst will include:

Stakeholder Management

Interacts with business stakeholders, their engagements/projects, understanding needs and / or requirements
Represents Health, Safety, Security, and Environmental team needs to be incorporated into the overall Enterprise Architecture
Handles and manages a portfolio of Applications within the mentioned Teams
Actively participate in Business and IT team discussions, bringing in best practices to and from the site

Value Generation & Protection

Maintain & support portfolio of Applications
Define when to purchase (OTS), use current application, or internal development.
Work with businesses to define and document business processes
Lead any new application projects, deployments, and enhancement
Contribute to the creation of knowledge-based articles used for Support
Lead the offsite Applications Support teams
Vendor management and engagement
Contract management, license management
Understand, plan, and deploy application upgrades/patches
Contribute to budget management for Applications – control spend
Definition/control of Application Support Desk KPIs
Define / Modify end-user service model – escalations, levels of service, feedback from end users
Contribute to IT communications – prepare and communicate for specific applications working with IT Operations lead
IT Policies and procedures – define, deploy, and enforce the correct use of applications.
Interact with all IT Teams – coordinating daily activities and projects

Job Description:
Business Intelligence Data Analyst




Company: Spark Energy




Title: Business Intelligence Data Analyst




Location: Houston, Texas (NOT a remote opportunity)




Department: Analytics & Strategic Projects




Reports to: Manager, Business Intelligence




FLSA Status: Exempt




JOB SUMMARY

The primary purpose of the Business Intelligence Data Analyst role is to assist management in making informed business decisions based on the output of the data warehouse by mining for important facts and statistics within the data that help render a true picture of the organization’s performance. Key to this role is the ability to extract and manipulate complex data from multiple sources and systems and synthesize the results into clear dashboards and presentations to monitor the performance of our business. The ideal candidate will have a background doing quantitative and qualitative analysis on transactional and financial data within an Energy company; be comfortable with large and complex data sets and be adept at preparing intelligent dashboards, metrics and reports to drive exceptional business insights.




SUMMARY OF ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS

Implementation and ownership of an internal data governance program
High degree of initiative and enthusiasm about data and the ability to derive value from data
Collect past and present data to establish trends within the organizational data
Analyze existing data to develop projections of the outcomes of implementing certain business strategies based on historical data
Analyze existing data with an eye for identifying and resolving anomalies or inconsistencies within the data
Implementation of a data quality standard and plan for the data warehouse
Ability to collaborate effectively with the BI team and end users to define and mine the right data sources efficiently and accurately
Proficient SQL skills and mastery of Excel
Proven analytical and quantitative skills and an ability to use hard data and metrics to back up assumptions, develop business cases, and complete root cause analyses
Ability to prioritize multiple concurrent projects while still delivering timely and accurate results
Strong verbal and written communications skills that enable you to explain complex insights with clarity and precision
Work with third party vendors to reconcile data integration points on a regular basis
Create high-impact and compelling visuals to present metrics and findings to management and colleagues
Experience in managing large complicated data sets and integrating disparate sources of data into a databases or data warehouse for ease of reporting and analysis
Strong communication & presentation skills (verbal and written) with executive-level reporting experience



MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS




3+ years’ experience as a Data Analyst preferably in a company with large, complex data sources
Experience with database tools and SQL Server 2008/2012 is required
Experience with Tableau or a comparable analytics platform is preferred
Experience with large, raw data sets is required
Retail energy industry experience preferred
Exhibit a professional and positive attitude
Adapt readily to change
Strong problem solving and analytical skills
Self-motivated, results oriented individual
Excellent organizational, interpersonal, problem solving, written, and verbal communication skills
Perform well in a fast-paced, deadline and detail-oriented work environment
Successfully execute many complex tasks simultaneously
Knowledge and ability to facilitate meetings, conduct effective briefings and presentations and to develop consensus both internal and externally

ABILITIES REQUIRED




Ability to meet highest attendance requirements.
Ability to handle multiple tasks concurrently.
Ability to use personal computer, calculator, etc.
Could involve some lifting up to 20 pounds.
Ability to sit for extended periods of time without much movement.
Ability to work in time-sensitive environment with non-flexible deadlines.

About Us

Innovation is in HP’s DNA. From our origins in a Palo Alto garage in 1939, to our current position as one of the world’s leading technology companies, HP has grown to become a leader in technology and corporate culture, inspiring innovators, and entrepreneurs around the globe.


HP brings together a portfolio that spans printing, personal computing, software, and services to serve more than 1 billion customers in over 170 countries. We are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace that attracts exceptional talent and to supporting our employees to succeed at all levels. The Team:

Finance is committed to helping build a Future Ready HP by delivering business results, driving transformation, and developing our people. Finance is a strategic partner to the business and plays an integrated role by providing insights that guide business decisions and support HP’s corporate goals.


In addition to traditional operations such as accounting, reporting, tax, audit and treasury, HP Finance leverages technology and data analytics to gather, analyze, and interpret financial and operational data. This data-driven approach allows for more accurate forecasting, risk assessment, and performance measurement, leading to better decision-making across the organization, positioning HP for long-term success and helping to accelerate growth.


Responsibilities:

As a Finance Data Analyst, you will work with a team to:


Provide financial analysis for a function or business.

Use advanced analytical techniques to extract insights and knowledge from data.

Translate complex data sets into actionable insights that drive informed decision-making and business strategies.

Apply business intelligence and reporting tools (e.g., creation of interactive dashboards).

Utilize process mining tools to improve process performance.

Works with the team to creates stories with the data using visualization tools/methods.

Assures accuracy, integrity, and compliance of cleansed data.

Develop an understanding of HP's financial processes and a working knowledge of the business.

Will have completed at least your bachelor’s degree prior to your anticipated start date with HP.

Able to obtain work authorization in the United States without requiring sponsorship in the future.

Why Texas Association of School Boards (TASB)

We come from humble beginnings — picture a one-person organization created in 1949 to advocate for excellence in public education on behalf of Texas school board members. Flash forward to today, and we have over 500 employees working together to provide 1,024 school districts with purposeful resources so they can focus on what matters most — excellent and equitable education for all 5.4 million Texas students.

As TASBeans (our internal name for employees), we feel privileged to work alongside talented team-members who are passionate about education and enjoy learning from new and different perspectives. We believe what makes our organization highly successful is the rich diversity our employees collectively bring to TASB with different backgrounds, skillsets, cultures and ethnicities, gender identities, interests, abilities, and work styles. And our passion for education and learning doesn’t end there. Our culture has always encouraged employees to grow and become their best selves both professionally and personally through a variety of innovative and collaborative development opportunities. You’re likely beginning to see why we’ve been regularly named by Austin Business Journal as a Top Ten Best Places to Work!

TASB offers competitive pay, rich benefits (including retirement matching of 2:1 up to 5% after one year. This means that if you contribute 5% to the plan, TASB will contribute 10%), onsite daycare, onsite gym, wellness program, tuition reimbursement, remote work options, flexible schedules, and more.

Every role at TASB thoughtfully complements our mission and the educational impact being made in communities across Texas. If you consider your work exceptional and want to help drive our mission forward, keep reading!

About You

As an Enterprise Data Analyst, you will have a passion for all things data. You will possess expertise to enable you to ensure exceptional data quality and integrity within our enterprise data management systems. In addition, you will deliver an exceptional customer experience by providing value-added customer service.

A Typical Day

Provide exceptional support to external members and TASB internal customers for our customer relationship management (CRM) and master data management (MDM) systems.
Manage enterprise data in the organization’s CRM and MDM systems.
Serve as primary data steward and subject matter expert on projects related to our CRM and MDM systems.
If you are still reading, we’d love to meet you!

How You'll Make an Impact

Reconcile enterprise data between the organization’s CRM and MDM systems to keep data synced.
Develop and facilitate data management training for internal customers.
Provide support documentation to create measurements and metrics reports.
Stay informed of CRM and MDM industry best practices.
Collaborate with IT to test and implement systems to capture business operational data.

Skills for Success

Minimum three years of experience working with a customer relationship management (CRM) system, Microsoft Dynamics 365 preferred.
Minimum three years of experience working with a master data management (MDM) system, TIBCO EBX preferred.
College degree or equivalent experience.
Strong written and oral communication skills.
Strong knowledge of CRM for Microsoft Dynamics 365.
Strong knowledge of MDM (Master data management) systems and principles.
Strong understanding of relational databases.
Strong understanding of data governance and data stewardship.
Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite, especially Excel.
Experience facilitation training.
Excellent time and task management.

The TASB Difference

Enjoy competitive pay and rich benefit offerings.
Be part of a collaborative environment where every contribution impacts Texas public schoolchildren.
Thrive in a culture that promotes bringing your whole self to work every day and emphasizes healthy boundaries and work-life balance.
Learn and grow individually and together through frequent professional development; diversity, equity, and inclusion panels; wellness seminars; and more.
Work alongside transparent leaders with an open and consistent feedback approach.
Celebrate as a team with meaningful (and fun) events and tokens of appreciation throughout the year.

Overview:

RES is the nation’s largest ecological restoration company and a preeminent environmental mitigation bank developer. The Company follows a design/build, maintain, sustain, and steward approach and has the internal capabilities to lead a bank through each stage in the asset’s lifecycle.




Environmental mitigation is a core competency at RES and the Company has structured a centralized corporate group to lead RES’ continued investment in the banking space.




One of the group’s core functions is to identify and analyze environmental mitigation markets. The group’s Investments and Capital Allocation team is looking to hire a Data Analyst to build out and manage data analytics. The Data Analyst will report to the Head of Investments and Capital Allocation and will be responsible for all data-related activities that support mitigation bank investment decisions. The position will be based out of our headquarters in Houston, TX.

What your day-to-day might look like?:
Identify new sources of data and pathways to collect data from various sources (query databases, download data from APIs, acquire data from internal excel spreadsheets)
Clean, reprocess, and structure data; build and maintain databases that can be used by other non-technical stakeholders
Analyze data (run statistical analyses, build predictive models, perform hypothesis testing)
Create visualizations, such as charts, graphs, and dashboards; communicate findings to non-technical stakeholders
Collaborate with RES’ operational teams to establish industry-specific data analytics opportunities
Collaborate with Hub teammates to integrate data analytics into investment decision-making


Main responsibilities that you will have to support the objectives and success of the team:

Identification of data sources (public and private)
Data collection: gather data from various sources, which may include public and private databases, internal spreadsheets, internal software systems such as NetSuite and Salesforce, web scraping, external APIs
Data cleaning, reprocessing, and structuring: clean and reprocess data to ensure accuracy and reliability; structure data to enable analysis
Data analysis: perform statistical analysis, data mining, and data modeling to identify trends, patterns, and insights
Data visualization: create clear and meaningful visual representations of data
Hypothesis testing: design and conduct hypothesis tests to validate assumptions and support decision-making
Report generation: prepare reports and presentations summarizing the results of data analysis and focusing on providing actionable insights
Data interpretation: interpret the results of data analysis in the context of business objectives and industry trends to make data-driven recommendations
Data quality assurance: ensure data accuracy, consistency, and reliability by implementing data quality checks and validation procedures
Data monitoring: continuously monitor data sources and processes
Database management: build and maintain databases and data management systems to retrieve, update, and manipulate data


Key Skills, behaviors and knowledge that will make you successful:

Data acquisition and manipulation: proficient in retrieving, cleaning, and transforming data
Communication skills (written and oral): highly proficient in communicating solutions, findings, insights effectively to non-technical audiences; highly proficient in creating reports, dashboards, and presentations for senior management
Analytical skills and statistical knowledge: strong analytical thinking and problem-solving abilities; able to dissect complex data sets and extract meaningful insights; solid understanding of statistics and able to apply statistical techniques for data exploration, hypothesis testing, and modeling
Attention to detail: meticulous in the analysis and the visualization/reporting of the analysis
Teamwork: able to collaborate with non-technical stakeholders across a variety of functions
Adaptability: comfortable working in a constantly evolving environment
Interest in environmental markets


Qualifications:

Previous experience that will support your application:

3+ years-experience in data acquisition, management, and analytics (extracting, cleaning, structuring, analyzing)
Experience transitioning an organization from manual data extraction and disparate “warehousing” to automated data extraction, management, and analysis
Familiarity with data extraction from NetSuite, Salesforce, and other corporate management software applications

Company Description


Utilizing our highly advanced software platform, some of the largest health systems in the world are leveraging BlockIt to restore the connection between the provider and the patient. We are helping patients find the care they need by removing the barriers to be cared for and reducing the administrative and technology distractions. The BlockIt solution is focused on patient scheduling and closed loop referral management.

Our mission is patient-centric. The patient journey as it must be…seamless and simple to navigate for patients, patient advocates, community members, and healthcare providers.



Job Description


The Data Analyst is a new role for blockit, joining a small but rapidly growing data team. This team has an ambitious remit to significantly impact the organization cross-functionally, ranging from client onboarding to schema normalization.

Data-driven transformation through the democratization and access of data via multiple platforms empowers our teams to make smarter decisions. Measuring the impact of those choices gives us the agility to adapt quickly when necessary. With the advent of these initiatives around data storage, centralization and automation, we anticipate massive gains in efficiency, growth in our core metrics, and a rising tide of excitement, morale and engagement.

You’ll be helping to build out a team of mathematicians, statisticians, analysts, and engineers and some of the most brilliant minds in healthcare technology. You will use your passion for big data and analytics to provide insights to the business, responsible for conducting both recurring and ad hoc analysis for blockit’s leadership team and internal stakeholders.

As we build and integrate cutting-edge technology in data infrastructure, cloud services, artificial intelligence, augmented/virtual reality, and machine learning, we’re excited to see blockit’s growth and success.

Primary Responsibilities:

Interpret data trends and patterns in the organization using existing datasets to identify opportunities for improvement and drive growth.
Build, own and manage initiatives to develop and automate tooling, dashboards & training to communicate relevant growth metrics to internal stakeholders, on a regular cadence and ad-hoc basis.
Responsible for generating all recurring and ad-hoc reporting for Key Performance Indicators (KPI) and multi-channel performance reports for internal and external stakeholders.
Deliver reporting and analytics to cross functional leadership teams, presenting insights and recommendations from analyses, utilizing data to influence behavioral change in company decision making.
Collaborate regularly with the engineering team to review data insights, drive performance automation and improvements with data infrastructure, pipelines and applications.
Collaborate with each department, driving projects in the organization to identify opportunities for improvement, aligning recommendations to the company strategy.


Qualifications

Excellent interpersonal skills with an emphasis on verbal/written communication, managing relationships, and professionalism
Highly collaborative, innovative and solution-oriented
Ability to work cross functionally with internal stakeholders in a fast paced environment
Entrepreneurial mindset with an ability to work independently, driving projects and company initiatives
Strong ability presenting abstract data concepts, storytelling and driving actionable results from analytical findings.

Education and Experience

A bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Economics or STEM based degree is preferred
1-3 years Analytics experience working with high volumes of data
Demonstrated experience in experimental design & interpretation, exploratory data analysis and prototyping required
Demonstrated technical experience in statistics, data models, database design development, data mining, normalization, cleaning, and segmentation techniques.
Demonstrated experience working with database experiences including proficiency in SQL, MySQL, python programming and API integration
Knowledge of BI Tools, Hive, No-SQL, Hadoop, Graph, Sigma or other data applications and related languages is a plus
Experience working in a SaaS, healthcare technology/IT, or healthcare B2B environment highly preferred
Experience working in a startup environment is desirable

Additional Information

Collaborative team players with strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills
Leadership presence with an ability to engage and influence key stakeholders across the organization and make an impact
Thought leaders that cultivate a culture of out-of-the-box thinking and innovation

Team collaboration is encouraged to build strong meaningful relationships, while freely exchanging thoughts and ideas

Job Title: Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) - Central & South Austin
Job Description:
Join a team of BCBAs who are committed to a compassionate, play-based approach to ABA therapy!

Who We Are

Spark Learning is a leading provider of Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) therapy services for children with Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD) and related developmental disabilities in Austin, TX. As a BCBA owned and operated organization, we are committed to providing high-quality, evidence-based interventions that are tailored to the unique needs and strengths of each child. Our team of experienced and dedicated professionals includes Board Certified Behavior Analysts (BCBAs), Behavior Technicians, Registered Behavior Technicians, and Speech Therapists, who work together to ensure the best possible outcomes for our clients.

At Spark Learning, we believe in fostering a culture of continuous learning and professional growth, and we offer ongoing training and development opportunities for our team. We are proud to be a part of the vibrant and diverse community of Austin, and we are committed to making a positive difference in the lives of the families we serve.

What We Offer:

Sign on bonus available of $2,500-7,500 based on experience
Positive and supportive work culture
Ethical and evidence based practices
Competitive salary and sign on bonus
Comprehensive Benefits Package: Health/Dental/Vision/Mental Health benefits, Paid Time Off, Paid Company Holidays, and Retirement Plan
Opportunities for continued professional growth and development
Manageable caseloads and consistent schedules
Opportunities to get involved with and support the autism community
Team committed to utilizing the latest research, new techniques and your ideas
Leadership team of BCBAs who are invested in your success and our high quality clinical standards
Opportunities to work with a variety of clients and in a variety of settings

Your Next Opportunity:

Conduct comprehensive assessments, analyze data, and develop individualized treatment plans based on the needs of the client.
Implement interventions utilizing a play-based approach, incorporating the child's interests and strengths to promote learning and development.
Provide ongoing supervision and training to Behavior Technicians and Registered Behavior Technicians.
Collaborate with families and other professionals involved in the child's care to ensure a holistic and consistent approach to treatment.
Maintain accurate and detailed records of client progress and behavior data.

What You Bring To The Table:

Master's degree in Applied Behavior Analysis or related field.
Current BCBA certification in good standing.
Minimum of 2 years of experience working with children with ASD and related developmental disabilities.
Strong understanding of evidence-based interventions and their implementation.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Passionate about making a positive impact and helping clients reach their full potential

Job Title: Business Strategy Analyst I - Bank Operations Analytics
Job Description:
Why USAA? Let’s do something that really matters.

At USAA, we have an important mission: facilitating the financial security of millions of U.S. military members and their families. Not all of our employees served in our nation’s military, but we all share in the mission to give back to those who did. We’re working as one to build a great experience and make a real impact for our members.

We believe in our core values of honesty, integrity, loyalty and service. They’re what guides everything we do – from how we treat our members to how we treat each other. Come be a part of what makes us so special!

The Opportunity
As a dedicated Business Strategy Analyst I, you will support, enable, and propose solutions to the strategy and analytics needs of Bank Operations. This outstanding opportunity will enable the Strategy Analytics professional to collaborate with other professionals across operations and other areas in the banks in the translation of business needs into analytically driven strategy proposal requirements and the fulfillment thereof.

Uses quantitative and qualitative analysis to provide thought-leadership on evolving industry trends, market developments, USAA’s strategic direction, regulatory environment, and macroeconomic trends for the business unit. Provides insights and information-based context for key stakeholders in the business unit to effectively manage, influence, and impact line of business strategy.

We offer a flexible work environment that requires an individual to be in the office 4 days per week. This position can be based in one of the following locations: San Antonio, TX, Plano, TX or Phoenix, AZ. Relocation assistance is not available for this position.

What you'll do:
Collaborates with stakeholders to identify key business assumptions and hypotheses around line of business strategy. Assists experienced Business Strategy Analysts and other subject matter experts with refining hypotheses and identifying business questions to explore further.
Develops the analytical framework and blueprint to answer business questions identified in the business portfolio, product, or member experience.
Collaborates with key stakeholders to evaluate and uncover strategic insights related to Profit & Loss performance including Product Strategy, Pricing, Marketing, Sales, Credit Risk, Distribution Channels, and Member Experience.
Leverages advanced data-driven problem-solving techniques to manipulate and interpret business results. Translates findings into insights for strategy management and execution.
Prepares materials that help communicate the significance of the strategic insights to senior leaders and other key stakeholders. May participate in key stakeholder meetings.
Ensures risks associated with business activities are effectively identified, measured, monitored, and controlled in accordance with risk and compliance policies and procedures.

What you have:
Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Science, Finance, Economics or related discipline; OR 4 years of related experience (in addition to the minimum years of experience required) may be substituted in lieu of degree.
4 years of experience in data/analytics, strategy consulting, or functional business experience within the respective industry of responsibility (i.e. P&C, Bank, Finance, etc.); OR Advanced Degree in Business, Science, Finance, Economics or related discipline with 2 years experience in data/analytics, strategy consulting, or functional business experience within the respective industry of responsibility (i.e. P&C, Bank, Finance, etc.)
Experience identifying business needs and developing strategic plans driven by qualitative/quantitative analysis and market insights.
Demonstrated experience using data analytics to formulate data-driven insights.
Experience performing data analysis using various data analytics tools (i.e. Microsoft Excel, Tableau, R, Python).

What sets you apart:
1-3 years of data analytics or science experience using SQL, SAS, and visualization tools (Tableau) preferred.
1-3 years of MDS experience, or Loss Control/Recovery experience in a large financial institution.
Ability to quickly develop an understanding of front-line end-to-end business processes and drivers of potential operational optimization.
Critical and strategic thinking ability and understanding of operations processes and strategies, especially as applying to Loss Control and Recovery within a large financial institution.
Excellent verbal and written communication and social skills required with ability to present sophisticated and critical issues to management.
US military experience or a military spouse/domestic partner.

The above description reflects the details considered necessary to describe the principal functions of the job and should not be construed as a detailed description of all the work requirements that may be performed in the job.

What we offer:
Compensation: USAA has an effective process for assessing market data and establishing ranges to ensure we remain competitive. You are paid within the salary range based on your experience and market data of the position. The actual salary for this role may vary by location. The salary range for this position is: $78,670 - $150,330 .

Employees may be eligible for pay incentives based on overall corporate and individual performance and at the discretion of the USAA Board of Directors.

Benefits: At USAA our employees enjoy best-in-class benefits to support their physical, financial, and emotional wellness. These benefits include comprehensive medical, dental and vision plans, 401(k), pension, life insurance, parental benefits, adoption assistance, paid time off program with paid holidays plus 16 paid volunteer hours, and various wellness programs. Additionally, our career path planning and continuing education assists employees with their professional goals.

For more details on our outstanding benefits, please visit our benefits page on USAAjobs.com.

Applications for this position are accepted on an ongoing basis, this posting will remain open until the position is filled. Thus, interested candidates are encouraged to apply the same day they view this posting.

USAA is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

Overview:

Welcome Home! Build your career with Lennar:

As one of the nation’s largest builders, Lennar has built over one million new homes for families across America. Since 1954, our communities have catered to all lifestyles and family dynamics, whether you are a first-time or move-up buyer, multigenerational family, or active adult.

At Lennar, Everything’s Included in our homes, and Everyone’s Included on our team. Our Everyone’s Included vision is to be as inclusive and diverse as the communities we build unleashing the power of diversity within our workforce to drive innovation & sustainable growth.

Lennar's Core Values:
Our commitment to Quality, Value, and Integrity is the underlying foundation upon which Lennar was built, and these three fundamental principles still guide us in caring for our customers, associates, trade partners, shareholders, and community.

The Division Business Analyst is responsible for analyzing reports and models, reviewing financials, and data mining to formulate and deliver fact-based pricing strategies to division leadership. This position will work closely with various department to understand factors impacting the pricing and selling process to develop and implement strategic solutions that drive key operational metrics focused on improving financial results. The Division Business Analyst must possess the intellectual curiosity to actively seek out new areas of potential improvement and drill into the details to find the root cause of a problem, which requires the willingness to question results and assumptions, and an internal drive for continuous improvement.
Responsibilities:
Manage overall pricing process including providing recommendations and obtaining approvals on home-by-home pricing and release order and communicating results across the sales organization.
Recommend price adjustments to Management based on an analysis of historical sales trends, current and future market conditions and the overall market supply and demand dynamic.
Collaborate with Division lines of business to develop a deep understanding of the process, strategies and Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) that influence top line Revenue growth.
Provide revenue management functional expertise and leadership to management team and market sales leaders.
Provide an objective point of view to complex business and issues based on a deep understanding of data and analytics as well as business principals.
Regularly translate data, insights, and forecasts into actionable and relevant recommendations by utilizing visualization and/or data analysis tools, presentations and other means to effectively communicate clear and concise recommendations to senior division leadership.
Track, create, maintain, and analyze data.
Develop new skills, techniques, and statistical models for predicting future operational results, costs and key performance metrics.
Consolidate, prepare, and analyze operational data to understand cause and effect relationships and identify and share root causes.
Oversee day-to-day implementation and analysis of the different initiatives.

#CB #LI-VR1

Qualifications:
Education and Experience Requirement:
Bachelor’s Degree in related field (business, finance, etc) preferred.
MBA would be helpful.
2 years as a Revenue and/or Pricing Manager, Business analyst or comparable experience preferred.
Experience in the homebuilding industry would be helpful.
Experience with business software preferred (Salesforce, JDE, Business Intelligence)
Microsoft Office skills (Word, PowerPoint, Excel, etc.)

Physical Requirements:
This is primarily a sedentary office position which requires the ability to work in excess of eight hours per day in the confined quarters of an office. Also requires the ability bend, stoop, reach, lift, move and/or carry items less than 25 pounds. Finger dexterity in operating a computer keyboard and calculator. Requires sitting at a computer monitor for extended periods of time, completing paperwork and to receive/return phone messages.


Additional Requirements:
Demonstrates skills and experience developing and performing quantitative analysis which may include financial and/or statistical modeling.
Experience presenting to and communicating with Executives.
Strong oral, written, listening and presentation skills with a demonstrated ability to effectively communicate in business terms using simple, concise and relatable examples.
Strong quantitative and analytical foundation with the ability to translate data into actionable and relevant insights and answers to questions.
Engages and establish cooperative working relationships with Associates at various lines of business.
Ability to adapt thinking based on new points of view and/or changes in operating environments.
Ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously, delegate work and provide leadership across functions.
Prioritize and plan work activities, use time efficiently, set goals and objectives and develop realistic action plans.
Think critically to identify and resolve problems in a timely manner, gather and analyze information skillfully, develop alternative solutions and work well in group problem solving situations.
Demonstrate accuracy and thoroughness, look for ways to improve and promote quality, apply feedback to improve performance and monitor own work to ensure quality.

PLANO, TEXAS /FINANCE – DATA ANALYTICS /FULL-TIME/ ON-SITE

The Senior Data Analyst is responsible for analyzing data from businesses, cases, sales, and user activity to support operational and strategic advancements across the organization.




Who we are:

LeadsOnline is a powerful digital platform that helps law enforcement investigators and analysts advance criminal cases through the most current data on people and property across the U.S., and helps businesses reduce the hassles of reporting. Law enforcement agencies of every size and mandate use LeadsOnline to find suspects, stolen items, and patterns of individual and organized criminal activity. Businesses, including pawn shops, secondhand stores, scrap metal recyclers, and online marketplaces trust LeadsOnline more than any other system to freely, frictionlessly, and safely report transaction information to law enforcement.

In 2022, LeadsOnline acquired Hawk Analytics, provider of CellHawk, the leader in mapping and analysis of Call Detail Records and other location-based digital evidence. CellHawk is instrumental in extracting rapid answers from messy digital evidence to connect suspects to crimes. We’re thrilled at the good we’re already doing together.

Together, we are building the future of criminal investigations, and need people who are mission-driven, love technology, and who won’t settle for less than excellence to join our team.




Role and responsibilities:

LeadsOnline exists to advance cases, careers, causes, and compliance with its unique data, well-designed technology, and exceptional teamwork. We do this through our principles of service, energy, diligence, and persistence. The Senior Data Analyst is responsible for analyzing data from businesses, cases, sales, and user activity to support operational and strategic advancements across the organization.

Your primary focus involves 1) establishing data integrity and efficiencies, 2) building a foundation of performance reporting and data enablement, and 3) analyzing data to support and drive strategic decisions across functional teams within the company (e.g., Product, Sales, Client Support).

With a comprehensive understanding of the business, you keenly identify trends and patterns to form hypotheses and provide recommendations to solve complex problems. You will be the backbone and support engine to enabling our team to work smarter by making data-driven decisions.




The Senior Data Analyst will be responsible for:

Data Integrity:

Architect and standardize advanced metrics, along with meticulous metric definitions and calculations, fostering a cohesive data interpretation throughout the organization. Thoroughly document metadata where applicable.
Devise and implement sophisticated systems to consistently scrutinize and validate data completeness and configuration accuracy across multifaceted data sources, such as business transactions, case data, sales activity, and pipeline data.
Champion the development and curation of optimal practices for the storage, condensation, transmission, and utilization of intricate technical and operational data. This encompasses formulating strategic approaches like generating concise summary tables, constructing robust data feeds and pipelines, crafting efficient stored procedures, and streamlining workflows.

Foundation of Insights:

Build foundational data structures in support of functional teams across the business to enable continuous awareness into system and operational performance.
Develop dashboards, tools, and automated reports at scale oriented to a) provide insight into performance and b) provide user-friendly access of the data and insights to non-expert audiences for analysis and manipulation.
Establish and maintain effective performance tracking; identify improvement opportunities, form hypotheses, and propose, design and implement tests to drive strategy enhancement and optimization.

Decision Support:

Partner with functional teams to proactively analyze performance; use analytical techniques to assess data and provide recommendations to improve teams’ operational and strategic approach.
Analyze data to determine goals and performance thresholds to drive growth; create processes for automating performance insights via dashboard alerts, notifications, etc.
Provide analytical support for weekly, monthly, and quarterly business insight reviews.
Serve internal and external customers with diligence, persistence, and energy.
Initiate and drive special projects such as: critically evaluating user behavior to uncover what drives usage and adoption and help us uncover what our critical success factors should be along the way (e.g., Facebook’s “7 friends in 10 days”).



Who you are:

Driven, detail-oriented, and highly organized. You work well under pressure and are not afraid of doing hard things.
You are a strong individual contributor but can lead and communicate well with cross-functional teams.
You are an active problem solver and know how to find solutions.
You take extreme ownership in all aspects of your work and share credit when credit is due.
You can manage competing priorities and execute on agreed upon timelines.
You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills and care deeply about the quality of excellence in our products, and for our clients, and will work hard to make sure they are taken care of.
You’re a proactive thinker that is always looking for ways to enhance the current processes.
You have excellent written and verbal communication skills and can effectively communicate professionally and personally to other development teams and their Managers.
You want a tenured, meaningful career with Leads that lets you dig deep and plant roots.
You are energized by the fact that we are a fast-growing, mission-driven, innovative, and acquisitive team – looking for other bright minds to make us and themselves better along the way.



This might be you if you have SOME of the following:

4-5 years of Data Analytics experience; preferably working with big data and are able to make complex analytical concepts look and sound simple to others.
Have deep understanding of and the ability to execute statistical analysis techniques.
Proficiently using various analytical tools such as SQL, Python, Power BI, Tableau, Excel.
Have a Bachelor’s of Science/Bachelors of Arts, preferably in a field relevant to analytics (statistics, information systems, industrial engineering, finance, business, math, etc.).
Masters/Advanced degree in data/analytical field preferred.
Strong individual contributor that can work cross-functionally with various department stakeholders.



What you can expect from us:

We serve with energy, diligence, and persistence. We deeply believe the work we do makes a difference in the lives of our users, the communities they protect, and the victims they serve. We won’t stop pushing to make our products do more and to make each other better. You will have access to technical and soft skill training through sites like Pluralsight and RightNow Media to grow your skills. If we don’t have it and you think you should learn it, just ask. Further, we take our work seriously. Ourselves, not as much. You’ll have fun here.




Employer Paid Benefits

Medical insurance.
Vision insurance.
Dental insurance.
401(k) Safe Harbor match of 4% after 1 year of employment.
Paid maternity leave.
Paid paternity leave.
Disability insurance.
Flex schedule.
Robust PTO package.
$95,000 - $110,000 a year
Company-wide Bonus Target 10%

Title: Finance Analyst

Location: Haslet, Texas

Company Summary:

Vytalogy is a modern wellness company, - we bring a vibrant energy to life. Headquartered in Sherman Oaks, CA, Vytalogy markets products across multiple channels and categories in vitamins, minerals, and supplements (VMS). Our incredible brands, Natrol and Jarrow Formulas, are recognized and trusted as industry leaders for over 85 years. We bring together exceptional talent and harness diverse backgrounds and perspectives to make life more vibrant for everyone, every day.

Position Summary:

The Finance Analyst will assist in analyzing operational costs for the company, budgeting/forecasting, costing products, and acting as the finance business partner for our newly built Texas facility. The primary duty of a role is to gather financial data (e.g., manufacturing consumption, labor costs, etc) and analyze the data in accordance with company directives. This position must have strong communication, interpersonal, analytical, and technological skills. The Finance Operations Analyst will report to the Director Finance - Supply Chain and work closely with the Manufacturing Production team.

Your primary activities will include but are not limited to:

Monitor and report on the performance of labor and overhead standards as compared to actual costs.

Monitoring unit cost and production cost variances.

ERP Application knowledge in the manufacturing space, SAP preferred.
Proven experience as a cost analyst, cost specialist or similar role.
Computer skills – MO Office Products, including Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and Outlook.
Ability to analyze data and make recommendations for process improvement.
