Leeward Renewable Energy is a high-growth renewable energy asset owner, operator, and development company headquartered in Dallas Texas. Leeward currently owns and operates a portfolio of 28 renewable energy facilities across nine states, totaling close to 3000 MW of installed capacity and is actively developing new wind, solar, and energy storage projects in energy markets across the U.S., with ~20 GW of projects under development spanning over 100 projects. Leeward is a portfolio company of OMERS, one of Canada's largest pension plans with over C$121 billion in assets.
POSITION: Data Analyst
Department: Technical Services
Location: Dallas, Texas
Status: Exempt
Job Summary:
Leeward Renewable Energy is currently seeking a Data Analyst for our renewable energy company. This position will be responsible for collecting, analyzing, and interpreting large sets of data related to our wind, solar, and battery storage farms and will work closely with cross-functional teams to develop insights and recommendations that drive operational excellence, enhance performance, and support strategic initiatives. The work will contribute to improving the efficiency, reliability, and profitability of LRE’s renewable energy assets. This position is in Dallas, Texas and provides a perfect opportunity for a professional looking for interesting work within a small team, the ability to expand their experience, work with all levels of the organization, and contribute to the company's success.
Essential Functions:
Collect, cleanse, and analyze data from various sources, including SCADA systems, weather stations, sensors, and other operational data sources.
Develop and maintain databases, data systems, data pipelines, and dashboards to ensure accurate and timely reporting of operational and performance metrics.
Conduct advanced statistical analysis, predictive modeling, and optimization techniques to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies in energy production, equipment performance, and maintenance needs.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including engineering, operations, finance, and business development, to define key performance indicators (KPIs) and develop actionable insights.
Provide regular reports, visualizations, and presentations to communicate findings, recommendations, and performance trends to stakeholders at various levels of the organization.
Support the development and implementation of data-driven initiatives, such as predictive maintenance, energy forecasting, and asset optimization strategies.
Stay up to date with industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in data analysis and renewable energy.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in a relevant field such as data science, statistics, computer science, or engineering. A master's degree is a plus.
Proven experience in data analysis, preferably in the renewable energy or power industry.
Strong proficiency in data analysis tools and programming languages such as Python, R, SQL, and Excel.
Experience with data visualization tools, such as Power BI, Tableau or similar.
Knowledge of statistical analysis, machine learning, and predictive modeling techniques.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to work with large and complex datasets.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey technical information to non-technical stakeholders.
Detail-oriented mindset and ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
Passion for renewable energy and a commitment to sustainability.
Familiarity with renewable energy systems, including wind turbines, solar panels, and battery storage is a plus.
Physical Demands:
Position will require sitting for long periods of time.
Ability to perform physical requirements including standing, sitting, walking, kneeling, twisting, reaching, and climbing at project locations to inspect and repair equipment or collect information.

Description
Take the next step toward your new career today!

Become a part of the diverse and inclusive team within our nationally recognized award-winning Bank that is one of the strongest in the nation. The Business Intelligence Analyst II’s (BIA II) role is to plan, design, develop, and launch efficient business, financial, and operations intelligence in support of core organizational functions and business processes. This includes gathering and analyzing data in support of business cases, proposed projects, and systems requirements. The BIA II is also responsible for generating and compiling reports based on the findings, complete with probable causes and possible solutions to systems issues. This individual will apply proven communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills to help maximize performance and improve the customer experience.

Key Responsibilities:

Participate in meetings with decision makers, operation leadership, and utilize end user data to define business, technology, financial, and operations requirements and key performance goals.
Contribute to design sessions in prototyping new processes or technology enhancements for the purpose of improving performance or customer experience.
Review and analyze the effectiveness and efficiency of existing data and develop strategies for improving or further leveraging these sources for budget, performance, and customer experience insights.
Identify and present business case parameters to define outcome criteria and measure success versus investment.
Join in collaborative efforts in the planning, design, development, and deployment of new reporting for mid and senior level leadership.

Competencies Required:

Developed data analytical skills with experience utilizing standard business intelligence programs such as PowerBI.
Advanced programming knowledge with Microsoft Excel.
Practical knowledge in importing data for use in report software, spreadsheets, graphs, and flow charts.
Proven ability to prioritize and manage workload in a high-pressure environment and to instill a sense of urgency in others as necessary to meet deadlines.
Excellent customer service skills with the ability to effectively identify and develop solutions for business needs.
Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to work independently while supporting a team environment.
Demonstrated process and project management skills.
Problem-solving mindset with developed analytical abilities and organizational skills.
Strong verbal communication and technical writing skills with an ability to effectively interact with and convey information to people who possess varying levels of understanding on applicable topics.


Qualifications
Minimum Qualifications/Experience:

5+ years’ experience with implementation, gathering and analysis of business intelligence and utilizing results to drive business improvement required.
3+ years’ experience in contact center operations within the banking, financial services, or similar industry required.
2+ years’ experience with technology implementation preferred.

Formal Education & Certification:

Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, Accounting or related field, preferred.

Work Status:

Full-Time.

None.

Up to 10% travel expected.

Professional call center environment with extensive use of telephone and personal computers. Conditions involve lifting no more than ten pounds, sitting most of the time, but may involve walking, moving, or standing for brief periods, and occasionally lifting and carrying articles like files, ledgers, folders, etc.

At True Velocity, the possibilities are limitless and so is the greatness of our team members. We are seeking creative, open-minded, and enthusiastic individuals to join our team. We have an opening for an Database Administrator and Power BI Analyst to join our growing team.


Job Summary: We are seeking a skilled and experienced Database Administrator and Power BI Analyst to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for the creation, maintenance, and support of Oracle and SQL databases, with a focus on generating custom Manufacturing Operations Reports using Microsoft Power BI. Your primary responsibilities will include:


Essential Functions:
Database Administration:


Design and implement Oracle and SQL databases to support various business functions, with a strong focus on manufacturing operations data.
Monitor and maintain the health, security, and performance of the databases, ensuring data integrity and availability.
Perform database backups, restores, and disaster recovery planning to minimize downtime.


Data Analysis and Reporting:
Develop custom reports and dashboards using Microsoft Power BI to visualize manufacturing data and key performance indicators (KPIs).
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand their reporting needs and provide actionable insights through data visualization.
Create stored procedures, triggers, and functions in Oracle and SQL to support report data extraction.
Data Integration and ETL:


Implement data integration processes, extract, transform, and load (ETL) to consolidate data from various sources into the databases.
Create UI user interfaces and templates to streamline data entry from manual to automated processes.
Optimize and automate ETL processes to ensure data is up-to-date and readily available for reporting. Support SPC and data decision / outlier distributed reports to highlight issues.


Performance Optimization:
Identify and resolve database performance issues, including query tuning and indexing, to ensure efficient data retrieval for reporting purposes.


Qualifications:
Proven experience in database administration with Oracle and SQL databases.
Advanced ability in Microsoft Power BI for report creation and data visualization.
Strong SQL and PL/SQL scripting skills for database development and maintenance.
Knowledge of ETL processes and data integration techniques and consolidation.
Familiarity with Manufacturing Operations and the ability to translate business requirements into effective reports.
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Effective communication skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams and translate data insights into actionable recommendations.


Physical Requirements and working conditions:
The physical demands and working conditions requirement indicated below are examples of the demands that must be performed in carrying out the essential job functions.


Physical Demands:
Sitting, standing, and walking (up to continuously); frequent use of computer and telephone requiring repetitive finger, hand, and arm movement; occasionally carry office supplies and other miscellaneous items up to 50 pounds. Continuous use of seeing, hearing, verbal communication.


Working Environment:
Working in an indoor setting and manufacturing environment. Position is based at our Nicholson location in Garland, TX. This position is Full-Time.

The Data Analyst performs analysis and synthesis of data and information, uses accepted statistical methods to forecast future needs and costs and communicates in writing and orally.

The position reports to the Data Analysis and Reporting Team Manager and works under general supervision, with moderate latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgement

Essential Responsibilities

This work is primarily related to the state of Texas criminal justice system.
Collect, organize, and assess data for accuracy.
Use statistical methods and software to analyze data sets and project program participation and costs.
Present and explain findings and recommendations to LBB management, legislative committees, and others.
Coordinate and collaborate with other LBB analysts on budget, performance, and revenue issues, as appropriate.
Inform LBB management of significant policy/budget issues and provide concise explanations and options for resolution.
Conduct quality assurance procedures to generate accurate and complete work products.
Prepare written reports that present and interpret data, identify alternatives, and make and justify recommendations.
Evaluate the implications of proposed or adopted federal and/or state legislation, rules, or regulations and make applicable recommendations.
Prepare fiscal and population impact estimates of recommendations and legislation.
Consult with LBB management to initiate studies, identify priorities, and define study scope, methodology, purpose, objectives, time frames, and resource requirements.
Research, evaluate, and refine projection methodologies.
Consult and communicate with external groups.
Contribute to agency projects and perform related work as assigned.

Essential Attributes and Skills

Think critically, take initiative, and use good judgment.
Communicate professionally in writing and orally (including presentations in formal and informal settings).
Create timely relevant, accurate, and polished work products.
Attentive to detail and complete tasks with an appropriate level of independence.
Use business tools successfully (i.e. Microsoft Office Suite, customized applications, desktop pc, laptop/tablet, and smart phone).
Use analytic software (i.e. SPSS, Simul8, etc.) and relational databases to analyze data sets.
Analyze, synthesize, and summarize quantitative and qualitative information.
Identify alternatives and make recommendations supported with empirical evidence.
Maintain confidential and sensitive information.
Follow agency protocols.
Understand legislative/budget processes and budget, performance, and operations of assigned agency/topic.
Willing and able to travel up to 10%.
Work at a computer and desk for extended periods of time.

Attributes Required of Every LBB Employee

Embrace agency mission/core values and follow policies, procedures, and processes.
Work effectively with LBB management and staff, as well as all external customers.
Coordinate, collaborate, and employ good interpersonal skills; demonstrate positive outlook.
Balance concurrent projects, work under pressure, and adapt to changing priorities/deadlines.
Act with motivation, organization, and attention to details; complete tasks with an appropriate level of independence.
Be punctual and have regular attendance.
Work overtime on nights, weekends, and holidays, as necessary to meet agency deadlines.
Education and Experience

Graduation with a baccalaureate degree from a regionally accredited college or university is required.
Course-work or degree in public policy or administration, program evaluation, quantitative research, qualitative research, educational measurement/research, financial affairs, math, statistics, legal research, or a related field is preferred.
Two years of progressively responsible full-time work experience in data collection, analysis, and error resolution is preferred.

Supplemental Information

To apply for this position, you may apply directly through the posting selected on our website, which will redirect you to NeoGov or go to https://www.governmentjobs.com/js_login.cfm An Account will be required to access this website.

Human Resources will not be able to retrieve your credentials or reset your password. Only on-line applications will be accepted via NeoGov.

The person hired may be required to submit official transcripts. Credentials earned at foreign colleges and/or universities must have been evaluated by an acceptable entity and must be equivalent to credentials awarded by U.S. regionally accredited institutions of higher education.

The person hired may not simultaneously be employed by the Legislative Budget Board (LBB) and another state agency or Texas public institution of public/higher education. Any job offer from the LBB is contingent upon proof of
eligibility/authorization to work in the United States on a full-time basis and proof of compliance with the Selective Service Law for males between the ages of 18 and 25.

Data Analyst serves as one of the data representatives for Pecos Children’s Center in Pecos, TX. Solugen
Houston, TX 77035

Position
Data Analyst

Mission
Solugen’s mission is to decarbonize chemicals manufacturing. With Solugen’s first 10,000 tpy commercial plant up and running in Houston, TX the company is continuing to expand with new commercial plants under development and new molecules being developed for commercialization. This role will be crucial in helping Solugen make more informed decisions by collecting, analyzing, and interpreting key business data. The Data Analyst supports the individual departments in identifying business data needs, developing tools to analyze and visualize the data, as well as facilitating cross-departmental dialog for inter-departmental data requests. The successful candidate will be able to work well in an evolving and dynamic environment with many competing demands and work closely with leadership to ensure focus is kept on the highest priority work.

Key Responsibilities
Identify and collect data from data sources including: databases, spreadsheets, surveys, and external sources; ensuring data accuracy, completeness, and consistency.
Clean and preprocess data to remove duplicates, missing values, and outliers, as well as structuring data for analysis and modeling.
Apply statistical and data analysis techniques to explore, analyze, and extract meaningful insights from data, identifying trends, patterns, and correlations within the data.
Develop visual representations of data using tools like charts, graphs, and dashboards to more effectively communicate findings to non-technical stakeholders.
Generate reports and presentations summarizing key findings, insights, and recommendations via data-driven insights to support decision-making.
Conduct hypothesis testing, regression analysis, and other statistical methods to draw conclusions from data using predictive modeling and forecasting.
Develop and maintain data pipelines and workflows while ensuring data security, privacy, and compliance with relevant regulations (e.g., GDPR).
Collaborate with subject matter experts to translate data findings into actionable recommendations.
Identify and solve complex data-related problems.
Develop data-driven solutions to address business challenges.
Stay up to date with the latest data analysis techniques, tools, and industry trends.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including data engineers, business analysts, and business stakeholders, to effectively communicate technical findings to non-technical audiences.
Ensure data quality, integrity, and consistency throughout the analysis process.
Other activities as defined by the department head.

Key Outcomes
Support the design and development of an enterprise data store.
Support data cleansing efforts for critical business data.
Work with data engineers and business stakeholders to develop data pipelines and workflows.
Engage with business stakeholders to define and develop business-relevant reports and dashboards.
Maintain recurring reports and dashboards to ensure data integrity.

Key Competencies
Job Specific
Hands-on Data Analytics experience – report and dashboard design and development, data analysis, and other data administration functions including collection, integration, and distribution.
Experience working with integrating large, disparate data sets to allow cross-functional reporting and dashboarding.
Experience with data historians and visualization tools.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and programming languages such as Python, R, SQL, and data visualization tools like Tableau or Power BI.
Familiarity with data storage and manipulation platforms like Excel, databases, and data warehousing solutions.
Understanding of the industry and business context to provide relevant insights.
Ability to communicate technical concepts to nontechnical users.
Own projects, solutions, and key responsibilities within the larger business initiatives.
Partner with internal and external partners to communicate project status, activities, and achievements.
Proactively identify issues and improvement opportunities – think through and provide suggestions for solving issues and improving processes.
Continuously be learning – be able to step outside his/her comfort zone regularly and learn new skills to bring to bear on the job.
Proactively establish relationships across the organization – be the first to make contact and listen to the needs of end users to help improve their experience with technology.
Have a full awareness and support for our health and safety programs – demonstrate by volunteering for related projects/presentations and vocalize your support in appropriate settings.
Company Specific
Ask a lot of questions, be curious, and have insights into your work.
Be nimble, embrace the speed and ambiguity of startup culture.
A passion for green chemistry and fighting climate change.
Ability to self-manage and set your own priorities and schedule.
Be comfortable working in multiple roles.
Emphasize safety above all else.
Respect for others.
Creative problem solving.
Willingness to learn and research new information technology/engineering/science concepts.

Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in a related field (e.g., Computer Science, Data Science, Information Management); a Master's degree is a plus.
Proficiency in data analytics tools, business intelligence platforms, and data visualization tools.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
Knowledge of relevant data privacy and security regulations.
Ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and business stakeholders.

A business analyst within Tempo Service has many different responsibilities. The responsibilities would include analysis of financials as well as operational data. Once the analysis is complete the Business Analyst would be responsible for communicating what the message the data is portraying as well as suggest a course of action on said analysis. The candidate would be comfortable as a change advocate and would thrive on person-to-person communication. The candidate would also need to portray strong organizational and time management skills to succeed. Since this position requires problem solving at a high level the candidate needs the ability to communicate in person, and in written form, how objectives are to be achieved.

Gather and analyze data to support the divisional goals and to help create a culture of data driven decisions.

Document Processes and streamline inefficiencies.



Research, document, and help promote new business initiatives.



Coordinate with different departmental teams to produce better business outcomes



Test business processes and recommend improvements.



General reporting, revenue, cost, and profitability reporting



Purchase price variance analysis of inventory or sold services



Inventory configuration and maintenance

Technical skills


Basic analytics skills
Proficient ability with Microsoft Office Suite especially Excel

Occidental is an international energy company with operations in the United States, Middle East, Latin America and Africa. We are the largest onshore oil producer in the U.S., including in the Permian Basin, and a leading offshore producer in the Gulf of Mexico. Our midstream and marketing segment provides flow assurance and maximizes the value of our oil and gas. Our chemical subsidiary OxyChem manufactures the building blocks for life-enhancing products. Our Oxy Low Carbon Ventures subsidiary is advancing leading-edge technologies and business solutions that economically grow our business while reducing emissions. We are committed to using our global leadership in carbon dioxide management to advance a lower-carbon world. Visit Oxy.com for more information.




Occidental strives to attract and retain talented employees by investing in their professional development and providing rewarding opportunities for personal growth. Our goal is to meet the highest employer standards by ensuring the health and safety of our employees, protecting the environment and positively impacting our communities where we do business.




Our greatest asset has been, and will continue to be, our people. We are looking for an experienced and motivated individual to fill the position of LCV Data Analyst in our US Onshore Resources & Carbon Management (ORCM), Low Carbon Ventures Business Unit based in Houston, Texas.




The LCV Data Analyst will be part of the LCV Integrated Planning team and will support the Low Carbon Ventures organization in developing and executing data management frameworks to support project planning, coordination, execution, and compliance practices across their portfolio including DOE funded projects.




Key Responsibilities:




Provide data governance and analytics support to project execution and compliance efforts across the DOE funded projects lifecycle.
Plan, design, develop, refine, and maintain Data Architecture to meet federal compliance workflow requirements.
Develop data and reporting standards for federal funded program.
Ensure timely and accurate reporting for audit preparation practices.
Build general and tailored analysis solutions stating trends, patterns, and predictions using relevant data.
Monitor data sources for acceptable levels of completeness, validity and accuracy of technical data, and identify appropriate remediation processes for erroneous datasets.
Develop framework for security and consumption of data assets.
Communicate regularly with all disciplines and groups to ensure accuracy of inputs into the suite of tools/systems.
Responsible for analyzing large sets of data used to analyze trends to proactively focus management’s attention on known or potential areas of concern.
Use automated tools to extract data from primary and secondary sources.
Developing and maintaining databases, and data systems – reorganizing data in a readable format
Weekly and monthly reporting responsibilities. Including performance reports and ad-hoc requests
Creates custom solutions or configuration options to solve operational or workflow issues.
Using tools and libraries like Power BI, Spotfire or Excel to represent data, including program metrics, goals, and performance indices, in a visual format that's easy to understand.
Stay current with changes in government regulations, guidelines, and reporting requirements, including DOE, to ensure full compliance and optimize practices.


Qualifications:




Required:

Bachelor’s degree required; engineering, or data science preferred
A minimum of 5 years of industry experience in data governance, science or analytics or relevant field.
High attention to detail and an unwavering commitment to maintaining the highest ethical standards
Highly collaborative
Highly proactive
Demonstrated proficiency with relational databases. Experience in writing complex SQL queries, Views, Stored procedures, and functions.
Knowledgeable in Exploratory Data Analysis techniques such as, data cleaning and preparation, analysis & exploration
Acknowledged and consolidated experience within the Data domain - Data Management, Data Analytics, Data Warehouse, Business Intelligence, Advanced Analytics, etc.
Proficiency with VBA (Visual Basic) coding and troubleshooting with ability to Develop, maintain, and troubleshoot complex internal MS Excel spreadsheets.
Experience in programming language like Python/R is preferred
Proficiency in newer Microsoft Technologies like Model Driven Apps, PowerApps, MS Flow is a plus
Ability to communicate problems and solutions effectively with business and technical stakeholders.
Ability to learn existing code, troubleshoot and present findings/analysis in a cohesive manner.



Desired:

Skills/ Competencies:

Leadership (an ability to build and manage teams, empower others, lead the team to success, develop people and succession plans).
Creative (strive for significant and continuous improvement)
Results Oriented (driven for value added results in self and in others)
Accountable (committed to short term and long term expectations)
Strong communication skills (verbal/written/listening/presentation)
Risk Taking (take appropriate risks in order to advance while also learning from those failures)
Demonstrated ability or capacity to solve problems and identify enhancement opportunities
Exhibit the qualities of a good team player such as conveying a positive attitude within/outside the organization, contributing ideas, and collaborating with team members to find new ways of working efficiently to extract the maximum value from assigned assets



Relocation: This position is not eligible for relocation.


Occidental does not offer sponsorship of employment-based nonimmigrant visa petitions for this role.
Occidental is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, marital status, political preference, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.



Recruitment Fraud

It has come to our attention various individuals and/or organizations are contacting people falsely pretending to recruit on behalf of Oxy. Please be aware that these recruiting scams and communications do not originate nor are they associated with our recruitment process.

Oxy does not charge a fee at any stage of the recruiting process. We will never:

Ask you to pay for applications, interviews, meetings, processing, training or for any other fees
Use recruiting or placement agencies that charge candidates an advance fee of any kind or
Request personal information such as passport and bank account details at an early stage of our recruitment process.

We recommend against responding to unsolicited business propositions or offers from people you don't know. Do not disclose your personal or financial details. If you believe you have been the victim of a recruiting scam, please contact your local police department.

Who is Eventellect?
Eventellect partners with professional and collegiate sports teams to unify their approach to single game ticket sales and transform it into a strategic business asset. With Eventellect, teams fairly value single game tickets, protect season ticket holders’ investment, and match the right audience with the right experience to maximize revenue, build fan loyalty and ensure team success. We are a fast-growing company that is respected both in Houston (Houston Business Journal’s Best Places to Work 2017, 2018, & 2022) and nationally (INC 5000 list of fastest-growing companies 10 years in a row).

What are we looking for?
Passionate and innovative individuals are what we seek for our Data Analyst positions, as they play a crucial role in unraveling complex data challenges and providing actionable insights. Data Analysts at our company are integral to the evolution of our analytics capabilities, and subsequently, the success of the organization. In our fast-paced environment, you’ll find ample opportunities for professional growth and influence.

Our culture thrives on collaboration, encouraging you to share your data-driven insights and learn from your peers daily. By bringing your unique perspective to the team, you contribute directly to shaping the strategies and decision-making processes across various departments. So, if you have a knack for transforming data into stories and strategies, and you thrive in a team-oriented setting, we would love to have you on board.

Qualifications
Educational Background: Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Mathematics, Information Systems, or a related field.
Business Intelligence Tools: Proven experience and strong proficiency with Business Intelligence tools for data visualization, reporting, and dashboard creation.
SQL Skills: Extensive experience in writing complex SQL queries for data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes. Ability to optimize queries for performance.
Data Analysis: Demonstrated ability in analyzing large datasets, interpreting data trends, and providing actionable insights.
Communication Skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to clearly present data findings and recommendations to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Python Experience: Familiarity with Python for data analysis, manipulation, and automation is a plus.
DBT and Snowflake Experience: Previous experience with DBT for data transformation and Snowflake as a data warehousing solution is a strong advantage.


Responsibilities

Work closely with stakeholders in Data Science, Ticket Strategy, Finance, and Operations to understand their data requirements: Develop strong relationships and maintain regular communication with key personnel in the Ticket Strategy, Finance, and Operations departments. Understand their specific data needs, challenges, and objectives to ensure that the data provided meets their expectations and supports their decision-making processes.
Organize, analyze, and visualize data to create actionable insights for different departments: Ensure that data is stored and categorized in an accessible and logical manner. Utilize various analytical techniques and visualization tools to interpret data trends, patterns, and anomalies. Translate complex data findings into clear, actionable insights that can be easily understood by departmental stakeholders.
Develop and maintain data models in Snowflake, ensuring data accuracy and availability: Build and refine data models within Snowflake, a cloud-based data warehousing solution. Ensure that data is accurate, consistent, and readily available for analysis and reporting.
Visualize data in various BI tools, ensuring that data products are easily accessible and user-friendly: Make data available to a variety of Business Intelligence tools, ensuring that end-users can access the data they need in a format that is intuitive and easy to understand. This may involve creating dashboards, reports, and visualizations tailored to different user needs.
Ensure data integrity and compliance with company data policies: Actively monitor and validate data to ensure accuracy and integrity. Ensure that all data processes and storage comply with company policies and any applicable data protection regulations.
Provide training and support to end-users on BI tools and data products: Offer training sessions and support to end-users, helping them understand how to use BI tools and access the data products available. Assist them in interpreting data and using it effectively in their roles.


What are the perks of working at Eventellect?

A fast-growing company that’s respected in Houston (Houston Business Journal’s Best Places to Work multiple years) and nationally (INC 5000 list of fastest-growing companies 10 years in a row)
A competitive salary plus bonus potential
A comprehensive benefits package, including 90% employee medical coverage, as well as dental and vision coverage, basic term life insurance and short-term disability coverage.
401K program including company match
Unlimited paid vacation policy
A $1,000 annual ticket budget to spend on sports and other live events around the country.
Offsite company events

The Business Intelligence Analyst will be passionate about leveraging technology in order to extract and share data-driven insights. They will be self-motivated and results-oriented and possess the ability to prioritize workload, juggle multiple tasks, work independently, and adhere to deadlines within a collaborative, team environment. The Business Intelligence Analyst is ready to share their experience to push the BI organization to the next level of success.

This position will ensure the successful transmission of data from both internal and external systems, validation of the received data, and creation of operational data models from multiple data feeds for on-demand reporting. The Business Intelligence Analyst will establish controls to ensure the validity of the data and develop processes to automate these tasks.

What You’ll Do: Major Accountabilities
Requirements Gathering/Documentation
Process reporting requirements from various business groups and users. Understand the bigger picture and be able to probe beyond the stated request to really understand the needs and value of information
Responsible for maintaining data lineage for elements in the reporting environment
Responsible for data profiling, design documents, and defining KPI logic
Analytics, Insights and Reporting
Drive rapid prototyping and design for analytics and data products
Translate broader business initiatives into design objectives and ensure data is available and explainable to support measuring and optimization of goals
Create rich visualizations to communicate complex ideas to business leaders and make data-driven stories come to life through visuals
Provide technical and administrative support for enterprise analytics
Mentors customers and business analysts on analytics integration principles and best practices

Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems, Mathematics, Business, or a related technical field
3+ years of related experience
Extremely strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Strong verbal, written, and visual presentation skills
Structured thinker and effective communicator, comfortable with interacting with customers
Expert Knowledge of SQL databases and SQL in at least one of the following environments: Microsoft SQL Server, Oracle, or MySQL required.
Experience working with Microsoft Power BI
Knowledge of Data Warehousing / Data Lake / Business Intelligence strategies and architecture
Experience Designing, modeling, and implementing data solutions to meet the business needs
Desired Qualifications
2+ years of progressive experience in a data services role within the financial services industry
Experience in multidimensional data modeling, such as star schemas, snowflakes, normalized and de-normalized models, “slow-changing” dimensions/attributes, etc.
Experience working with Microsoft Azure stack: Data Factory, Logic Apps, Power Apps, API Management, Audit Logs, etc.

Experience in systems conversion and related data/process requirements

Job Title: Remote Power BI Analyst / Data Modeler
Job Description:
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Kforce has a client that is seeking a Remote Power BI Analyst/Data Modeler. This position sits within a team that is leading the way for digital innovation.

Essential Responsibilities:

Determine business team reporting needs, working with business and technology/data stakeholders to gather requirements, determine current data availability, and feasibility
Validate identified datasets for accuracy through analysis and coordination with data engineering teams
Design pilot measurement plans by working with technology teams to ensure data flows are established
Analyze operational and survey data to determine APEX metric baselines and program impact
Present synthesized insights and impact analysis to the APEX team and relevant leaders within the business
Synthesize existing data for team ideation and prioritization sessions and leverage with team in solution design
Partners with operations leaders to communicate the insights and recommendations based on data
Contribute to building measurement and analytics expertise, tools, and processes in-house to enable high-quality analytics across the data team members
REQUIREMENTS:

Academic background in a quantitative or related field (e.g., Analytics, Applied Mathematics, Economics, Statistics)
Experience with visualization tools, such as Power BI, Tableau, Qlik, etc.
Experience building and manipulating data models within Power BI, using DAX and SQL to massage datasets into a usable state for visualization
Experience or interest in using python, R, or other programming languages for data wrangling, automation, and machine learning (e.g., classification, clustering, response prediction, sentiment analysis, A/B testing)
Experience understanding, processing, analyzing, visualizing, and communicating complex data sets to technical and non-technical audiences, tailoring your message to show business value and impact by understanding the goal and your audience
Experience designing statistically valid experiments to test and prove hypotheses, understanding the difference between correlation and causation to help drive the business forward without making unnecessary assumptions
Experience or understanding of Agile product development and design thinking to execute based on defined timelines
Ability to operate efficiently in a remote working environment through proper organization, communication, and execution to meet the business needs - prior remote working experience a plus
The pay range is the lowest to highest compensation we reasonably in good faith believe we would pay at posting for this role. We may ultimately pay more or less than this range. This range may be modified in the future.

We offer comprehensive benefits including medical/dental/vision insurance, HSA, FSA, 401(k), and life, disability & ADD insurance to eligible employees. Salaried personnel receive paid time off. This job is not eligible for bonuses, incentives or commissions.

WHO WE ARE:

With the Health Division, you’ll be joining a passionate team of self-motivated change agents united by our mission: driving to design the delivery of high-quality healthcare for nearly three-quarters of a million active and retired Texas public educators.

The healthcare industry is complex and we’re a team of problem-solvers who are up for the challenge. With a focus on innovation and collaboration to catalyze the market, we spend nearly $4 billion annually on healthcare to make a difference in our members’ lives. With a career at TRS, you’ll be empowered through a culture of continuous learning, front-line decision-making, coaching and mentorship to shape the future of our work, while transforming healthcare delivery for 1 in 41 Texans.

The Health Data Analyst performs complex data analysis and research on health care claims data and participates in contract administration and vendor procurement activities. Work involves developing data queries and analyzing health care claims data to assess the health plan performance; overseeing the work of vendors supporting the health plans; and supporting the procurement and contracting of health care and related services. This position will proactively work with Health Division staff, agency employees, and health care vendors.

This hybrid position will require the selected applicant to report to the TRS offices, located in Austin, TX, 1-2 times per month or as needed to meet business needs.

All applicants must reside in the state of Texas upon employment and continue to reside in Texas throughout employment with TRS.

This vacancy will be filled at one of two levels - Health Data Analyst or Senior Health Data Analyst. Selected applicant will be offered the position that most closely matches their education and experience.

Salary Range
Health Data Analyst: $70,276 – $87,845
Senior Health Data Analyst: $85,034 – $106,293

WHAT YOU WILL DO:

Research and Data Analysis

Develops and automates queries in TRS’ data warehouse to extract data for use in spreadsheets, models, dashboards, and summaries that support decision-making.
Reconciles financial performance guarantees relating to medical loss ratios, claim trends, pharmacy rebates and discounts, and ROIs. (Senior)
Reviews and reports on health care claims, participant service utilization, and pricing to assist with HIB management decisions.
Facilitates the interpretation of health care data from external sources including data from TRS' health care consultants, insurance companies, or other industry resources.
Analyzes detailed enrollment, claim, utilization and other health care related data to identify trends and anomalies, and to identify areas of action.
Analyze provider reimbursement levels, high cost claims, costs by geographic area and place of service, and claim accuracy.
Identify enrollment and cost trends, cost-saving opportunities, and potential fraud, waste, and abuse.
Reviews and validates reports on health plan performance.
Analyzes claim data to support invoice processing. (Senior).

Health Care Services Procurement & Contract Management

Works with vendors and external partners to carry out research related to the administration of TRS health plans.
Communicates regularly with vendors to address business needs and service issues.
Reviews and analyzes various routine vendor reports on a monthly, quarterly, and annual basis.
Works with TRS' legal and purchasing departments in the renewal of contracts and amendments.
Assists with evaluating HIB’s business needs related to plan performance and vendor services.
Assists with the evaluation of bidder proposals with respect to operational capabilities and financial terms.
Assists with the development of procurement documents, such as statements of work and evaluation criteria.
Negotiates business and financial terms of contracts with vendors and finalizes contract documents. (Senior)

Program Administration

Researches, recommends, and implements methodologies for reporting health care data and statistics including key performance indicators for program activities.
Regularly communicates with vendors related to plan performance and initiatives, claims and utilization, provider network updates, pharmaceutical changes, marketplace situations and trends.
Assists with the reconciliation of financial performance guarantees relating to medical loss ratios, claim trends, pharmacy rebates and discounts, and ROIs.
Supports other areas of the Health Division in analyzing program data and developing key performance indicators and dashboards as needed.
Monitor vendor performance in areas of cost trends, service/process quality and delivery, implementation of plan initiatives, and contract compliance.
Review claim and enrollment data to provide support for invoice processing and benefit decision-making.
Participates on special projects, task forces, and committees as needed.
Coordinates and oversees internal and external audits of contractors and resolves audit findings. (Senior)
Addresses and resolves non-compliance or subpar performance issues with contractors. (Senior)


Performs related work as assigned.



WHAT YOU WILL BRING:

Required Education

Bachelor's degree form an accredited college or university in accounting, finance, mathematics, statistics, business, health care administration, or a closely related field.
High school diploma or equivalent and additional full-time experience in in analyzing and visualizing health care claims data or financial data, administration of a health insurance plan or similarly related experience may be substituted on an equivalent year-for-year basis.

Required Experience

Three (3) years of full-time directly related, progressively responsible experience in analyzing health care claims data or financial data, administration of a health insurance plan or similarly related experience.
A master's degree or doctoral degree in a directly related field may be substituted on an equivalent year-for-year basis.

Senior Required Experience

Five (5) years of full-time directly related, progressively responsible experience in analyzing and visualizing health care claims data or financial data, administration of a health insurance plan or similarly related experience.
A master's degree or doctoral degree in a directly related field may be substituted on an equivalent year-for-year basis.
Experience in pharmacy benefits, analyzing pharmacy claims, formularies, or contracts within the last six (6) months, required.
Preferred Qualifications

Advanced degree in actuary science, finance, mathematics, statistics, business, health care administrations, or closely related field.
Recent experience in health plan consulting, actuarial services, business finance, accounting, or auditing.
Recent experience in pharmacy benefits.

Knowledge of

Data analysis concepts and methods, including education equivalent to at least statistics for business, health benefit claims processing, Medicare, coordination of benefits, standard medical procedures, and billing.
Health care claims data including CPT, HCPCS, DRG, ICD-10, and NDC.
Health care related laws, regulations, policies and procedures.
Self-funded and fully insured group health benefit products and contracts, including Medicare Advantage.
Provider networks, contracts, plan operations and systems.

Skill in

Writing programming code to process data including SQL and other tools such as R or Python.
Researching, compiling and analyzing complex data, including querying a claim data warehouse.
Managing projects, including planning, organizing, and prioritizing work assignments to manage a high-volume workload in a fast-paced and changing environment.
Interpreting and applying complex laws, regulations, policies, and procedures.
Completing detailed work with a high degree of accuracy.

Description

The Data Analyst (analyst) position is responsible for measuring and analyzing sales key performance initiatives (KPIs) and creating tools to communicate insights to our clients and teams. The analyst will leverage business and market relevant information to make data-driven decisions that allow Mosaic to achieve its sales and marketing objectives and quickly adapt tactics. The analyst will play a key role in evolving and growing the data-driven discipline within our team and contribute to our shared success.

The incumbent(s) in this position should exhibit the following Acosta values:

People Minded – Must show dignity and respect to all people

Integrity – Must exemplify the highest degree of ethical behavior

Results Oriented – Must show passion, pride and commitment to succeed

Trust – Must be honest, sincere and confident

Teamwork – Must build trusting relationships

Innovation – Must progress through a combination of creativity, common sense and vision

1.Collect, inspect, cleanse, transform, model and diagram of complex data sets 2.Daily use of various business intelligence and analytical software tools 3.Interpret data, formulate reports and make recommendations to the team 4.Design specific research methods such as questionnaires and market testing 5.Remain fully informed on market trends, other parties researches and implement best practices with a willingness to evolve and grow skillsets 6.Leading the standardized measurement first strategy for clients and team leaders 7.Meeting the physical requirements

Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in marketing, statistics, computer science, geography or related quantitative field

Work Experience Requirements:

3-5 years of related work experience

Intermediate Microsoft Excel skills including formulas, pivot tables, and V-look-up
Basic PowerBI, Tableau, SQL skills; other analytical platform or development skills a plus
Knowledge of retail marketing data collection methods (polls, focus groups, surveys etc)
Strong analytical and critical thinking with the ability to disseminate insight from large datasets
Meet tight deadlines, prioritize workloads and achieve results in a fast-paced, dynamic, environment
Develop understanding of all areas phases of Mosaic business to find new opportunities for measurement
Proven ability to timely complete projects and achieves results in an ambiguous work environment.

Company Description:

ClearBalance is the leading provider of consumer-friendly patient financing programs to U.S. based hospitals and health systems. Our programs provide a positive experience for patients who need the ability to repay their healthcare expenses with manageable monthly payments while our healthcare partners are able to significantly improve operating margins and minimizes patients referred to collection agencies. ClearBalance has been at the forefront of patient pay management since 1992, setting and delivering a high bar for patient financing solutions, patient pay reimbursement, revenue cycle IT expertise, and the patient/consumer experience.

Job Summary

The Data Analyst is responsible for analyzing customer data, generating actionable insights, and contributing to improving customer experiences. Engage directly with customers, gather feedback, and use data to drive informed business decisions aimed at enhancing customer satisfaction and organizational success.

Responsibilities and Duties

Customer Data Analysis:


o Reconcile customer data against our data.




o Collect, clean, and analyze customer data using various tools and techniques to identify patterns, trends, and correlations.




o Interpret data and provide insights to assist in understanding customer behavior, preferences, and needs.




o Perform root cause analysis on data errors and fix recuring errors.




Customer Engagement and Feedback:




o Interact with customers to gather feedback, understand their requirements, and identify pain points.


Data Visualization and Reporting:




o Create visually appealing and easy-to-understand dashboards, reports, and presentations to communicate insights and findings to both internal and external stakeholders.




o Provide regular updates and insights to the team and management based on the analysis of customer data.


Security and Compliance


o Protects company data at all times.


o Educates oneself on security measures to protect company property (e.g. shoulder surfing, phishing attacks, etc)


o Be aware of all potential threats and surroundings.


o Never write down information from your computer’s monitor.


o Do not share any company information unless you have confirmed that person’s identity.


o Maintains knowledge of the Bank Secrecy Act (BSA) and the ClearBalance policies that support compliance with BSA.


o Performs all duties in a manner that fully supports compliance with all laws and ClearBalance policies.

Qualifications:

Must have SQL experience.
Prefer an MIS or Computer Science degree and 1 or 2 years of experience.
Some healthcare experience or Patient Accounting System interaction would be beneficial.
Revenue Cycle experience would be a plus but not required.
Strong analytical skills and the ability to interpret and present complex data.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Proficiency in data analysis and visualization tools (e.g., Excel).
Previous experience in a remote work environment is a plus.

Perks & Benefits

Become part of an amazing team making a difference
Company has strong desire and track record of promoting from within
Health, dental and vision insurance coverage
401k with company match
Health and wellness programs
Employee marketplace for discounted purchases

Reporting & Data Analyst – DomiFi and Advantage Customer Operations

As a part of the DomiFi and Advantage Customer Operations team, the Reporting & Data Analyst will be a central point of control and information for the Operations team. The Reporting Analyst will manage and execute daily, weekly, monthly report jobs and conduct regular analysis using various techniques, e.g. data analysis, explanatory and predictive modeling, data mining. Works directly with department leaders to identify reporting and analytical requirements. May be required to produce ad hoc data and reports. Will lead, facilitate, and assist with implementing or developing systems and/or process to capture business operation information.

Responsibilities:

Prepare daily, weekly, monthly report and batch reports necessary for operational processes within the call center, collections, billing, and the back-office operations team.
Build and maintain dashboards and reporting that provide insights to customer care, retention, complaints, collections, and back-office/billing performance and identify and report upon trends and patterns in the dataset that impact the organization.
Act as a key contact between the Customer Operations team and Data Strategy and Operations team to enhance and automate processes and reporting.
Lead and facilitate projects as necessary.

What to Expect

Tesla’s Finance team combines traditional financial planning and analysis with broader business decision-making and strategy, directly supporting Tesla’s leadership. Finance is embedded in daily operations, supporting both near-term execution and long-term planning. Team members are expected to analyze data and provide recommendations and to lead cross-functional decision-making and implementation of the recommendations. Tesla Finance is lean and dynamic, comprised of five subgroups: Corporate Finance, Energy Finance, Engineering Finance, Manufacturing Finance, and Sales, Marketing and Service (SMS) Finance. We encourage rotation across subgroups for high performers.

Corporate Finance works with all Finance subgroups and other leaders to:
Lead Tesla’s corporate forecast process
Work with finance and non-finance stakeholders to analyze the impact of proposed business decisions (including actual performance) on Tesla’s financial health
Develop the company’s income statement, balance sheet and cash flow forecast
Synthesize these forecasts for review with Tesla’s Leadership and Board of Directors
Develop and track cross-company efforts to improve gross margin and cash flow
Lead long term planning for Tesla, including new products/capabilities, and capital needs
Work directly with CFO, General Counsel, and other Execs to optimize G&A spending/investments


Engineering Finance works with Engineering and Supply Chain to:
Manage R&D investments/planning for Engineering (e.g. return on investment analyses for new technology development, resource planning, etc.) and develop associated forecasts
Track, report, and proactively manage profit improvement (e.g. design proposals, supply chain initiatives) on existing vehicles
Support product development by establishing cost targets and guiding engineering, design and supply chain decisions towards attainment of these targets (i.e. cost vs. performance tradeoffs)


Manufacturing Finance works with Manufacturing and Supply Chain to:
Manage all manufacturing investments globally and develop associated forecasts
Includes evaluation of major CapEx decisions, expansion plans, and business cases on automation, manufacturing scope, insource vs. outsource choices, and location
Lead manufacturing cost improvement for all products, including feedback on estimated manufacturing costs for future programs, identification of focus areas for cost, and execution of identified initiatives


Sales, Marketing and Service (SMS) Finance works with the Sales, Services and Marketing teams to:
Manage investments into SMS activities, develop associated forecasts, and lead profitability analysis/improvement initiatives as the global and regional level
Lead pricing efforts, including options and services, and business planning for global retail, service and sales enablement
Develop and evaluate ROI for new markets, new business models, superchargers, pre-owned vehicles, and services;

Energy Products Finance works with Engineering, Supply Chain, Manufacturing and SMS teams to:
Develop and maintain financial projections, track actual performance against plan for energy storage and solar products, inclusive of deployment activities
Drive cost optimization in product development for existing and future products with a focus on establishment and attainment of cost targets
Lead pricing efforts for Energy Products, including installation and services, and business planning for global retail, service and sales enablement
What You’ll Do


Analyzing key performance indicators, especially revenue, cost of sales, operating expenses and capital expenditures (includes developing financial models and decision-making tools)
Providing strategic insights and conclusions based on this analysis
Guiding planning and resource management (e.g., headcount, investment approvals, etc.) for specific verticals within Tesla, including development of financial forecasts
Identifying initiatives for improvement of Tesla’s financial outlook, including developing, tracking, and executing business initiatives with Tesla’s leadership
What You’ll Bring


Evidence of exceptional ability, especially within an ambiguous environment
Bachelor's Degree in Business, Economics and/or equivalent professional experience
Ability to read and interpret financial statements recommended
Quantitative degrees are a plus
Demonstrated success driving tangible impact / influencing within a broader organization
Excellent analytical skills (e.g. Microsoft Office applications, financial modeling, etc.)
Strong written and verbal communication skills, particularly with senior business leaders
Highly collaborative, team oriented, and comfortable leading cross-functional projects

Business Analysts have an integral role in Labatt’s many continual improvement efforts by researching problems and opportunities, making detailed assessments through interviews and quantitative analyses, working with internal software developers to codify robust, standardized processes and tools, and by working with end users to drive cultural and procedural changes. Aid in crafting and executing strategic initiatives within specific departments such as sales, marketing, or purchasing

Job Description:
Platform Solutions Across Platform Solutions (PS), we power our clients to serve and create better loyalty with their own clients and customers by delivering agile and modern cloud-based, developer-centric financial solutions. PS is comprised of four main businesses, underpinned by key horizontal functions across engineering, operations and risk management:

Transaction Banking , a cash management and payments platform for clients building a corporate treasury system
Enterprise Partnerships , consumer financial products that companies embed directly within their ecosystems to better serve their end customers
Merchant Point-of-Sale Lending , a platform that provides custom credit financing for home improvement merchants to offer directly to their customers
ETF Accelerator , a platform for clients to launch, list and manage exchange-traded funds

Responsibilities

Manage the day-to-day activities of a Fraud Operations team
Provide direction to the team on productivity and SLAs, problem solving, setting timelines and next steps
Provide individual coaching, mentoring, and feedback to the team on a regular basis
Educate Fraud Investigators on identification and prevention of fraudulent activity
Conduct training, monitor quality and quantity of case work and provide feedback on performance
Manage significant caseload and utilize the company investigation system
Open and prepare cases and follow all documented procedures to ensure proper cases detail is completed
Review existing operational processes and identify opportunities for continuous improvement

Coordinate the investigation of any fraud issue with the appropriate Stakeholders as appropriate
Communicate professionally with customers, merchants, financial institutions and other personnel to resolve system problems or request additional information and / or documentation to support a decision on whether fraudulent activity has occurred

Ability to research and make appropriate decision regarding complex cases

What this job involves-
The Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst works closely with an account/platform manager to study formal and informal data to help better understand performance. Using experience, the individual will uncover several perspectives on a problem or opportunity, determining any and all drivers towards or barriers to successful performance, and makes recommendations based on what is discovered.
Understanding of contract key performance indicator and reporting requirements and client expectations.

Devise and promote creative data visualization to derive actionable intelligence.

Financial modelling, analysis, and compilation of quantitative data.

Familiarity with various lease admin, occupancy planning and finance systems (Portfolio, TME or Azara, Property HUB, etc) to perform portfolio strategy and analysis.

Author and update internal and external documentation, and formally initiate and deliver requirements and documentation.

Prepare presentation material as required.

Forecast/trending of performance data.

Process mapping and efficiency analysis

Develop recommendations based on data interpretation and analysis to transform behaviours and techniques.

Develop automated tools and dashboards with IT team to provide real-time insights to business data.

Use of advanced statistical concepts to determine significant sources of variability.

Provide subject matter expertise for all data related processes and analyses.

Analyse trends of monthly Key Performance Indicator results for performance improvement concepts.

Create, maintain, and optimize the account wide dashboard.

Draft and distribute reports weekly, monthly, quarterly, and annually.

Data Management - Ability to process large amounts of data in an organized manner.

Comfort Around Higher Management - Can deal comfortably with more senior managers; can present to more senior managers without undue tension and nervousness; understands how senior managers think and work; can determine the best way to get things done with them by talking their language and responding to their needs; can craft approaches likely to be seen as appropriate and positive.

Technical Learning - Picks up on technical things quickly; can learn new skills and knowledge; is good at learning new industry, company, product, or technical knowledge; does well in technical courses and seminars.

Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Finance, Information Technology, or related field required.

2-4 years relevant experience

High level skill with Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PPT) required. SharePoint experience a plus.

Experience with other data and statistical applications are a plus (PowerPivot, Tableau, SAS, Access, Minitab, Sigma Excel, SQL)

The Data Analyst II performs routine (journey-level) data analysis work. Work involves creating and running queries to generate data sets, analyzing the data, and producing reports and graphics based on that data. Activities include a mix of running routine reports, responding to ad hoc report requests, and developing new reports to address identified needs. Responsibilities include ongoing development and technical support of local databases plus training and support of the individuals throughout the hospital using them. Works under moderate supervision, with limited latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgment.
Performs other duties as assigned. Other duties as assigned include but are not limited to actively participating and/or serving in a supporting role to meet the agency’s obligations for disaster response and/or recovery or Continuity of Operations (COOP) activation. Such participation may require an alternate shift pattern assignment and/or location.





Essential Job Functions:
Attends work on a regular basis and may be required to work a specific shift schedule or, at times, even a rotating schedule, extended shift and/or overtime in accordance with agency leave policy and performs other duties as assigned.
Creates and supports databases and related data collection systems that are used by customers throughout the hospital. Assures that these systems function smoothly and return accurate and reliable results that can be used for data analysis. Monitors use of these data systems to promote accuracy of data input by various users. Creates or adjusts queries to meet ongoing changes in customers’ data needs. Provides relevant analysis of results as needed and discards unnecessary information.
Consults with internal and external customers to clarify their specific data needs and how those needs can best be met. Identifies existing reports that address ongoing data needs and ensures that customers can readily access those reports. Adjusts existing reports to better address existing needs. Creates new reports in response to newly identified needs.
Conducts ad hoc data analysis in response to specific requests from Hospital Management, State Hospitals Central Administration, and department heads throughout the hospital.
Runs production reports that involve some compilation of results on a daily, weekly, monthly, and quarterly basis. Interprets the results to identify outliers in the data from ongoing measures and places results into optimal format for presentation.
Uses queries and reports to conduct audits or monitor for possible irregularities in how the electronic medical record and other databases are implemented. Assists in using the results of such analysis to provide training, modify procedures, or take other responsive action.

Performs other duties as assigned. Other duties as assigned include but are not limited to actively participating and/or serving in a supporting role to meet the agency’s obligations for disaster response and/or recovery or Continuity of Operations (COOP) activation. Such participation may require an alternate shift pattern assignment and/or location.




Knowledge Skills Abilities:
Knowledge of common statistical measures and their relevance to data analysis
Knowledge of the operation of electronic medical records and the specific types of information contained within them
Skills in managing data in relational database management systems, including the creation of queries, linking of tables, extraction of relevant data, and assessment of the accuracy and validity of data within such systems
Skills in the use of computers and common software programs used in data collection and analysis
Ability to compile, review, and analyze data from existing data systems and to create reports and presentation graphics based on the results
Ability to communicate with clinicians and department heads regarding their data needs
Ability to maintain accuracy and attention to detail
Ability to communicate effectively both orally and in writing



Registration or Licensure Requirements:
None



Initial Selection Criteria:
Graduation from an accredited four-year college or university with major coursework in data science, business analytics, computer science, computer information systems, management information systems, accounting, finance, mathematics, statistics, economics, or a related field is preferred; experience and education may be substituted for one another
Experience in data analysis, research, and report design
Experience with common database software programs
Experience creating queries and reports

Job Summary

The Business Analyst works with different leaders across the enterprise to identify opportunities that drive business and operational efficiencies, designs, plans, executes process changes, and embeds the new processes and procedures into the organization for long term sustainability. Focus areas include, but are not limited to, executive level reporting, data analysis, financial and resource modeling, and evolving into a subject matter expert who can easily liaise between Finance, Payroll and Operations. The ideal candidate will be highly self-motivated, with strong trouble shooting and analytical skills. This role will report to the Director of Operations Support and will work closely with the Vice Presidents, General Managers, Accounting and Finance.




Responsibilities
Project Planning through Execution
Drive Strategic Planning to identify and prioritize projects that align with corporate goals and objectives.
Assist project delivery of multiple concurrent projects.
Business case development and presentation to Senior Leadership Team.
Documentation for new operating model.
KPI development to measure and monitor long term sustainability.
Documentation, training, and on-going support to internal customer
Supporting Operational compliance and financial reporting processes:
Review and monitor Plans vs Actual while tracking, managing, and reporting out KPIs.
Prepare weekly, monthly, quarterly and routine reports and presentations to management including but not limited to communication on operational performance (i.e. OTP, MBR), operational efficiency (i.e. Hours per Flight, overtime) and ops compliance (i.e. safety, training).
Design and improve reporting and tracking mechanisms with a focus on Microsoft PowerBI
Minimum Requirements
3-5 years’ experience in, project management, engineering, operations, or related field
Knowledge of change management and influential factors.
BA in Business, Finance, or related area of study preferred.
Strong excel skills.
Excellent analytical skills.
Excellent oral, written and communication skills.
Experience in Aviation, Automotive, Consumer Products, Industrials, Manufacturing, Production, Logistics valued.
Personable and professional demeanor.
Ability to multi-task and work independently as well as in different (local) teams.
Must be able to work under high demand and pressure.
Ability to work with tight deadlines.
Preferred Skills
Knowledge of planning processes and procedures
Awareness of Budgets & Forecasts contribution
Ability to communicate efficiently and effectively
Ability to work in the field – cooperate & collaborate through influence.
Change management skills.
Physical Requirements/Working Conditions
Remain in a stationary position 50% of the time.
Occasionally move about inside the office to access file cabinets, office machinery, etc.
Constantly operates a computer and other office productivity machinery such as a calculator, copy machine and computer printer.
Walk short distances.
Reach above and/or below shoulder.
Handle/grasp documents or office equipment.
Sit and/or stand for short or extended periods of time.
Lift/carry/move objects, files and documents up to 10 pounds.
Work in an office environment using standard office equipment.
Talk, listen, and speak clearly on telephone.
Maintain regular and punctual attendance consistent with the ADA, FMLA, and other federal, state, and local standards.

Company Name: United Way of Metropolitan Dallas, Inc.
Job Description:
Overview:

United Way of Metropolitan Dallas is looking for a Data Analyst to work cross-functionally with departments organization-wide to drive continuous improvement, learning, and data-informed decision making. Key areas of focus will include conducting in-depth analysis on revenue, donor retention, performance of key activities, community needs, and organizational impact. Using data from a variety of sources, the Data Analyst will utilize Microsoft PowerBI, Salesforce, and other systems to develop visualizations, dashboards, and reports containing actionable data and strategic insight to help United Way further its mission in the community.

Responsibilities:
Work with staff organization-wide to understand departmental analytics needs, creating analytics which answer business questions, identify challenges/opportunities, and measure effectiveness
Analyze and interpret data to identify patters and trends which impact organizational decision making
Build compelling visualizations, using tools such as Microsoft PowerBI, to support storytelling and translate data into actionable information
Present data trends and complex information in consumable formats tailored to various internal and external audiences
Create and maintain automated reports and dashboards which provide users organization-wide with self-service access to in-depth information
Develop dashboards, reports, and other analytical tools for use in forecasting, data maintenance and process improvement
Write/update SQL queries needed for data analysis and reporting needs
Test and validate data presented
Perform system maintenance as needed to ensure consistent operation of the organization’s data mart and reporting systems
Conduct training sessions and assist staff with maximizing usage of reporting and dashboarding systems
Be a resource and advocate for data-inform decision making by teaching and empowering others to use existing data and modify processes to expand data available
Qualifications:
To perform the job successfully, competitive applicants should demonstrate the following competencies:

Mission-Focused: Create real social change that leads to improving lives in our community
Relationship-Oriented: Able to communicate effectively to develop, grow and sustain productive relationships. Knows how to capture and record relevant information and how to interpret and utilize the information to forge partnerships, collaborate, cultivate, grow, sustain and strengthen internal and external relationships
Results-Driven: Dedicated to shared and measurable goals; creating, resourcing, scaling, and leveraging strategies and innovations for broad impact
Stewards: Our actions, behaviors, and decisions on behalf of our donors must be transparent, meet the highest ethical standards, and align with organizational goals

REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES:
Bachelor’s Degree in Business Analytics, Information Technology, or other data-driven discipline
5+ years of experience in a hands-on data analytics role, having autonomously manipulated and drawn actionable conclusions from large amounts of data
Advanced knowledge and experience working with Microsoft PowerBI and DAX
Advanced knowledge and experience with SQL queries and server administration
Advanced knowledge and experience with Microsoft Office Suite, including Excel formulas, pivot tables, and charting functions
Proven experience creating compelling dashboards and visualizations for professional presentation
Prior experience building and maintaining automated reporting systems
Experience with Salesforce NPSP
Strong data analysis and evaluation skills (quantitative and qualitative)
Ability to plan project timelines and deliver results according to deadlines
Ability to work independently, to prioritize and execute multiple projects
High attention to detail
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Driven to understand various business processes and the connection to the data needed/produced
Driven to continuously learn new skills and information

D.R. Horton, Inc., the largest homebuilder in the U.S., was founded in 1978 and is a publicly traded company on the New York Stock Exchange. The Company also provides mortgage financing and title services for homebuyers through its mortgage and title subsidiaries. Please visit our website at www.drhorton.com for more information.

Act as liaison between the SBUs and IT to ensure system development and implementation proceeds as anticipated. Designs appropriate application systems structures which will provide a solid foundation for well-written and reliable application programs.
