Description
WHAT WE DO
The mission of Texas Commission on Law Enforcement (TCOLE) is to ensure that Texas is served by law enforcement professionals. We are the regulatory body that oversees the licensing and certification of peace officers, jailers, and telecommunicators across the state. The Data team reports to the Data Officer, under the IT Operations team and works closely with the Public Information Team, Application Development Team, Cybersecurity, and Network team to produce and support TCOLE’s data-driven mission.

GENERAL DESCRIPTION

The person in this role will be able to query data, ensure accuracy, and transform it into digestible visuals. If you are looking to join a growing IT team in a small State agency that has a big reach and great impact on Texas law enforcement, this is the job for you!


Work involves complex (senior-level) data analysis work involving writing complex SQL database queries and reporting results. Works under general supervision, with moderate latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgment. Works both independently and with other staff in performing work of greater complexity.

This position reports in person to the TCOLE Headquarters building at 6330 E Hwy 290, suite 200, Austin, TX 78723.

WORK PERFORMED
Collects, queries, and analyzes data using standard statistical tools, applications, methods, and techniques.


Interprets data analysis results to identify significant differences and trends in data to inform decisions.


Creates data visualizations to represent the data.


Consults with internal and external customers to identify data analytics needs.


Cleans and prunes data to discard irrelevant information.


Responds to time-sensitive ad-hoc open records requests.


Provides recommendations for the selection of data management tools and the development of standards, usage guidelines, and procedures for those tools.


Develops data quality measures, analyzes data quality results, and implements necessary changes to ensure data quality improvement.
Performs related work as assigned.


Qualifications
EXPERIENCE AND EDUCATION

Four(4) years experience and/or education in a field relevant data analytics. Graduation from an accredited four-year college or university with major course work in a field relevant to the assignment is generally preferred. Experience and education may be substituted for one another.




KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES
Strong SQL database query skills
Ability to utilize data visualization tools
Ability to find patterns in data and interpret data
Ability to prep and clean data
Experience with data management and data quality tools
Strong communication skills
Problem solving, critical thinking, and decision making skills


PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Familiarity with Power BI and/or MicroStrategy
Familiarity with Microsoft Office 365 tools

Our client, an automotive company here in Irving, TX, is a nationwide leader that provides and administers specialized programs for automotive product. This company is a parent company to roughly 4-5 other umbrella companies that specialize in various automotive specialties.

They are currently looking for an experienced IT Business Analyst to help guide their organization to IT best practices. You'll be responsible for researching progressive systems solutions, evaluating their impacts, and partner with software teams on best practices. The ideal candidate will be a detailed planner, expert communicator, and top-notch analyst. This person should also be wholly committed to the discovery and development of innovative solutions.

This is a full-time role, onsite 5 days a week in their Irving office. Salary will be around $80-90K depending on experience. They also offer an annual merit bonus on top too.

Responsibilities
Partner with stakeholders across business units (ex: sales, finance, security, compliance) to develop analyses and documentation in a collaborative way, communicating effectively and efficiently with production, managerial, and executive teams
Evaluate, analyze, and communicate systems requirements on a continuing basis, and maintain systems processes, including the delivery of monthly status reports to all appropriate parties
Author and update internal and external documentation, and formally initiate and deliver requirements and documentation
Conduct daily systems analytics to maximize effectiveness and troubleshoot problems
Develop meaningful and lasting relationships with partners for optimized systems integration, and respond to questions and concerns from managers and executives with supporting research and recommendations

This will be a full time direct hire position, onsite 5 days per week in their Irving, TX office. Required Skills & Experience
Five or more years of experience in analytics and systems development
High proficiency with SQL and database management
Proven analytical abilities
Experience in generating process documentation and reports
Excellent communication skills, with an ability to translate data into actionable insights
Desired Skills & Experience
Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent) in information technology or computer science
Strong working knowledge of relevant Microsoft applications, including Visio
Proven ability to manage projects and user testing
Extensive experience with data visualization
High proficiency in technical writing
The Offer
$80-90K Base Salary + Bonus eligible upon meeting personal, and company, goals
You will receive the following benefits:
Medical Insurance
Dental Benefits
Vision Benefits
Paid Time Off (PTO)
401(k)

Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the US on a full-time basis now and in the future.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst - Power BI
Location: First 6 months onsite - then after its 2 days/week onsite
Term: Contract to Hire or Direct Hire

Company offers a family-oriented environment and a people-first work culture. This is a team of warm and outgoing personalities operating north of Lewisville, TX seeking a BI Analyst with strong Power BI skills.

The Senior Business Intelligence Analyst will work with Technology Services, Fusion Teams, IT infrastructure teams, developers, testers, vendors, and business users to ensure rapid thorough analysis of complex business needs, applying analytics techniques and developing solutions to drive strong outcomes. Activities include analyzing and creating reports using documented procedures, assuring quality and data accuracy, and delivering the reports and dashboards on time to internal customers. You will recommend, design and create technical solutions to solve business problems and to increase business efficiency. Your designs will be current, insightful, user-friendly and help drive insights from the data. Successful candidate must have strong experience in data analysis, creating, and maintaining data catalogs, data engineering as well as reporting and analytics tools. The Business Intelligence Analyst will serve as liaison between departments and generate documentation for systems and applications across various platforms. Previous technical experience and technical aptitude are required.

Primary Position Responsibilities
Creates, updates and maintains reporting solutions utilizing Power BI for multiple business partners.
Creates, updates and maintains data consistency and data quality with strong data catalog and data dictionary management
Engages business partners to understand requirements, map to logical and physical data models and develop thoughtful insights into the data
Uses a variety of OLAP tools and methods to access data from a variety of sources such as Oracle, PL/SQL, MS SQL server and IBM DB2
Creates and runs complex SQL queries in order to analyze data and develop solutions
Provides great service and technical support of issues, including data validation and maintaining reporting accuracy
Provides ad hoc query and reporting to business requests, as needed
Interfaces with Business Units, Client Services Desk, vendor and other IT areas to develop reporting solutions
Assists manager in developing/revising and documenting policies and procedures for supporting data governance and reporting best practices.
Desired Skills
PowerAutomate
PowerApps

OVERVIEW
The Houston Public Works Department (HPW) is the largest and most diverse public works organization in the country. Accredited by the American Public Works Association, our over 4,000 dedicated public servants work together to create a strong foundation for Houston to thrive.

Within the HPW Department, the Houston Permitting Center Service Line (HPC) administers & enforces over 400 permit types for the City of Houston and its jurisdictions, annually reviews over 70 thousand commercial & residential plans. All members of the Houston Permitting Center team are service providers, and we work with the shared values of respect, ownership, communication, integrity, and teamwork.

DESCRIPTION OF DUTIES/ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
Staff Analyst - Business Analyst

Functions in an analyst role reporting to the Senior Staff Analyst will provide analytical, administrative and/or management systems services.

The position will serve as a business process analyst representing the permitting organization in support of HouPermits, the permitting system that is currently in development. This business analyst will support system implementation, and work in a support role translating business needs into system requirements.

Responsibilities aligned with our Five to Thrive:

Respect – we listen and care

Ownership – we find solutions instead of excuses
Assists with tracking business requirements against the system development to ensure the requirements are considered and any gaps in system functionality are understood and accommodated.
Assists with testing and provides feedback, including recommendations for improvement to either system configuration or business processes.
Participates in quality management reviews, in particular reviews of the designs, prototypes and other requirements work products to ensure they fulfill the requirements.
Investigates and makes recommendations for addressing issues of medium to high complexity and/or sensitivity.
Completes special projects as assigned, working on a wide variety of financial, administrative, professional, management and community issues and problems of medium to high complexity.
Makes recommendations for process improvements.
Communication – we are reliable and clear
Assists in translating business requirements and use cases into test conditions and expected results for product, performance, and user acceptance testing.
Serves as a liaison to the business user community. Participate in a user and task analysis to maintain the business community's perspective.
Compiles data, produces information and interprets results through conclusion or recommendation formulation. Develops reports, special documents or publications as assigned.
Prepares, edits, and revises department policy and procedure manuals. Responds to correspondence, requests for information, etc. as assigned by supervisor.
Participates in the development of standard operating procedures, administrative policies, and documents updates and changes when needed.
Exhibits excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Integrity – we are truthful and keep our word
Handles highly confidential information.
Models and fosters a service line culture that upholds ethical practices, customer focus, encourages individual integrity.
Models and exemplifies the Code of Conduct.
Teamwork – we work together
Works in partnership with all leaders and subject matter experts in the service line to gather and document business requirements and understand the needs of HouPermits system users.
Serves as a resource for the Change Management Team as they evaluate training and performance support needs and design the training and performance support products.
Represents supervisor at meetings and functions to gather information and to articulate supervisor’s opinions and recommendations.
Interprets administrative policies and oversees communication with department personnel regarding these policies.

WORKING CONDITIONS
This position is physically comfortable; the individual has discretion about walking, standing, etc. There are no major sources of discomfort in a normal office environment. The individual has discretion about walking, standing, etc.

This is a Department of Houston Public Works Emergency Management position at the Tier III Level.

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS

EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS
Requires a Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Public Administration or a field directly related to the type of work being performed.

Graduate degrees related to the type of work to be performed may substitute for the experience requirement on a year-for-year basis.

EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS
Three years of professional administrative, financial or analytical experience related to the type of work being performed are required.

Professional experience related to the type of work to be performed may substitute for the education requirement on a year-for-year basis.

LICENSE REQUIREMENTS
None



PREFERENCES

Preference will be given to candidates with knowledge of permitting, plan review, or any inspection discipline.

**Preference shall be given to eligible veteran applicants provided such persons possess the qualifications necessary for competent discharge of the duties involved in the position applied for, such persons are among the most qualified candidates for the position, and all other factors in accordance with Executive Order 1-6**

GENERAL INFORMATION

SELECTION/SKILLS TESTS REQUIRED None
However, the department may administer a skill assessment evaluation.

SAFETY IMPACT POSITION No
If yes, this position is subject to random drug testing and if a promotional position, candidate must pass an assignment drug test.

SALARY INFORMATION
Factors used in determining the salary offered include the candidate's qualifications as well as the pay rates of other employees in this classification.

Pay Grade 26

Job Summary

Travis County Auditor’s Office has an opening in its Risk Evaluation and Consulting (REC) Division for a data analyst/scientist. The REC Division supports the Auditor’s Office by bringing an independent systematic approach to ensure financial transparency and accountability by performing risk assessments, statutory, information system, contract compliance, and legislative analysis audits. We are looking for individuals who want to work in a progressive, challenging, and team-oriented work environment that accelerates employee growth and recognizes performance.

This is a grant funded position (funded until the end of calendar year 2026).

The position’s duties include applying statistical analysis and visualization techniques to various datasets, implementation of continuous monitoring processes, validating datasets, interview domain experts to gain an understanding of the business mechanics that generate various datasets, and working with staff internal auditors to provide data necessary to complete various audit objectives.

The County Auditor is the CFO of Travis County government, a $1 billion organization with approximately 6,000 employees. We offer a stable work environment, casual dress attire, quality computer equipment, professional development, 12 paid holidays, vacation accrual of up to 3 weeks per year, a flexible start of workday, excellent pension plan, and an extensive benefits package. We offer a flexible work schedule that is primarily remote, however, applicants must reside or be willing to relocate to Travis County or the surrounding area.



Duties and Responsibilities

Manage data extraction, storage, transformation, and processing through data analytics routines, and generate output for visualizations and audit testing for internal auditors.
Perform quality assurance and serve as a subject matter expert on data integrity, extraction, and compilation.
Work with large and complex data sets to solve a wide array of challenging problems using different analytical and statistical approaches.
Apply professional skepticism when assessing data sources and validating the completeness and accuracy of data received.
Identify, design, and develop data analytics extract routines to support audit activities performed by the staff internal auditors.
Interact and collaborate with the internal auditors in working towards departmental goals.
Execute on special projects and other assignments as requested by management.
Performs additional duties as needed within the department.

Minimum Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, Accounting, or related field. Ideally, Master’s or PhD in related field and two years of relevant work experience, OR any combination of education and experience that has been achieved and is equivalent to the stated education and experience and required knowledge, skills, and abilities sufficient to successfully perform the duties and responsibilities of this job.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities Requirements:
Knowledge of:



Statistical concepts and methods and their application to process automation, advance data analytics, and machine learning.
Algorithms for classification, regression, clustering, and anomaly detection.
Relational databases, including SQL, and large-scale distributed systems such as Hadoop and Spark.
Policies, practices, procedures, and terminology of assigned function.
Skills in:

Conducting qualitative and quantitative research and in using computers, software, and statistical tools and programs, including SPSS, SAS, Python, Visual Studio, Java, HTML, C#, VS Code etc.
Developing ETLs to analyze data using SQL, Power BI, Tableau, and Python.
Verbal and written communication, including presentations and communicating technical issues in non-technical language.
Problem-solving and decision-making.
Ability to:

Develop measuring instruments to ensure relevance, reliability, and validity.
Extract meaningful business insights from data and identify the stories behind the patterns, using data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, and Python.
Evaluate statistical data, by conducting qualitative and quantitative analysis.
Establish and maintain positive and effective working relationships with staff at all levels of the organization.



Work Environment & Other Information

A criminal, education, and employment background check is required. Candidates must be legally authorized to work in the U.S. Sorry, no visa sponsorships.
Candidates who meet the above qualifications are encouraged to apply. Visit Travis County’s website to complete an application at: Travis County




Benefits
Employment at Travis County comes with a full array of benefits. We offer comprehensive health insurance, a no-cost, on-site Health and Wellness clinic, longevity pay, paid vacations, sick time and personal holidays, not to mention an industry competitive salary structure and a friendly, stable work environment.

FY2023 Travis County Benefit Guide

In this valuable Travis County Benefits Guide you will find benefit summaries, eligibility requirements, costs, contact numbers and addresses as well as other general information on the benefits available to Travis County Employees and Retirees.

Credit Union
Employees may join the Travis County Credit Union which offers low-interest loans, savings plans through payroll deduction, safe deposit boxes and other benefits.

Deferred Compensation
Employees may enroll in a tax- free sheltered investment plan through payroll deduction.

Direct Deposit
Employees may sign up for direct bank deposit.

Employee Assistance Program
Travis County provides a confidential counseling and referral service free of charge to county employees and their family.

Employee Organizations
Membership in the American Federation of State, County, and Municipal Employees Union is available through payroll deduction.

Employee Health & Wellness Clinic
Employees may access the clinic for a variety of wellness program and health care services with no co-pay, no deductible and no co-insurance costs.

Holidays
An average of eleven paid holidays are designated by the Travis County Commissioners Court at the beginning of each fiscal year.

Longevity
Longevity pay is paid for each year completed after three years of continuous service. Peace Officers in a law enforcement activity, whose job requires state peace officer certification, receive pay after one year of certification.

Parking
A limited number of assigned parking spaces are available to employees in the Courthouse Complex.

Personal Holidays
Regular, full-time employees are eligible for up to three paid personal holidays each calendar year. Part-time employees shall be granted personal holidays on a prorated basis. New employees earn personal holidays for the calendar year in which he/she begins employment, based on the month in which employment begins:

January – March
3 personal holidays
April - June
2 personal holidays

July - September
1 personal holiday

October - December
None

New employees are eligible to take personal holidays after 90 days of employment.

Retirement
Travis County is a member of the Texas County & District Retirement System with mandatory participation by certain classes of employees. Matching of two hundred twenty-five (225%) and a seven percent (7%) of the gross salary is deducted each pay period. An employee is fully vested after eight years of service. Benefits are prorated for part-time employees.

Sick Leave
Regular employees earn sick leave at a rate of eight hours per month with unlimited accrual during employment. Part-time employees earn sick leave on a pro-rated basis.

Parental Leave
Each Full-time Paid Parental Leave Eligible (PPL) Employee is entitled to a total of 320 hours of Paid Parental Leave in a 12 month period. Paid Parental Leave for Part-time PPL Eligible Employees is prorated based on the number of hours that they are regularly scheduled to work.

Tuition Refund
Certain classes of full-time employees may receive reimbursement for fees associated with pre-approved, job related course work completed satisfactorily.

Vacation
Based on years of county service, regular, full-time employees earn vacation time at the following rates:

0 to 5 years
4.0 hours per pay period
6 to 10 years
4.5 hours per pay period
11 to 15 years
5.0 hours per pay period
16 to 20 years
5.5 hours per pay period
21 plus years
6.0 hours per pay period

Part-time employees earn vacation leave on a pro-rated basis.

Workers' Compensation
The county provides all employees workers' compensation coverage with benefits in accordance with state statute, if the employee sustains an injury out of, or in the course of work.

Why Us?:
With a mantra of Empowering Human Potential, Hanger, Inc. is the world's premier provider of orthotic and prosthetic (O&P) services and products, offering the most advanced O&P solutions, clinically differentiated programs and unsurpassed customer service. Hanger's Patient Care segment is the largest owner and operator of O&P patient care clinics nationwide. Through its Products & Services segment, Hanger distributes branded and private label O&P devices, products and components, and provides rehabilitative solutions to the broader market. With 160 years of clinical excellence and innovation, Hanger's vision is to lead the orthotic and prosthetic markets by providing superior patient care, outcomes, services and value. Collectively, Hanger employees touch thousands of lives each day, helping people achieve new levels of mobility and freedom.
Could This Be For You?:

We are seeking a Master Data Analyst, Inventory - Hybrid (home/office). We are looking for a systems and data expert with inventory expertise who can create solutions to problems at the enterprise-level and individual tasks. This role will have a significant impact to inventory operation and accounting processes to support the company in its growth and evolution. This role will collaborate with leaders across the organization at all levels and will play a key role in the company’s transformation efforts.


The Master Data Analyst role will report to the Vice President of Inventory & Product Accounting. Success in this role will depend on the ability to: drive visibility on process improvement opportunities that facilitate the success of a world class accounting and inventory management organization; foster teamwork and cross-functional initiatives; understand and drive development and ongoing maintenance of end to end process and systems documentation; facilitate re-engineering of existing processes to improve visibility, efficiency, control and cross-functional integration; adhere to task timeliness and accuracy expectations; and assess and obtain relevant stakeholder buy in on the impact of proposed process/systems changes on the internal control and SOX key control environments.


This is a hybrid opportunity based out of our Corporate HQ office in Austin's Domain.

Your Impact:
As the Master Data Analyst, Inventory you will:


Play a leadership role with finance, accounting, operations leadership, and clinic support functions to support cohesive and efficient business processes in clinics and supply chain programs.
Define analytical approaches to problem-solving, reviews and vets with stakeholders.
Lead and executes entire projects from start to finish, including data gathering and manipulation, synthesis and modeling, problem solving, and communication of insights and recommendations.
Partner with leaders across the company to develop significant and sustainable business improvements.
Perform root cause analyses and recommends holistic solutions leading to systemic and sustainable business and process improvement.
Define and monitor metrics to identify patterns, trends, and emerging challenges.
Continually evaluate, reengineer, and implement accounting and inventory processes and controls to incorporate effective and sustainable modifications; including, but not limited to raw material valuation (standard loads for freight, handling, rebates, consumables, etc.), cut-off, inventory reserves, assumptions used in estimates, labor and overhead capitalization procedures and resulting standard loads, and data integrity of inputs used in models.
Act as a liaison with internal audit and external audit firm in tandem with leadership, identifying potential obstacles and resolving issues timely and effectively.
Assess, design, recommend, and implement processes to provide the organization profitability at a disaggregated level to use in decision-making about products, locations, payers, etc.
Partner cross-functionally with other teams, departments, and external suppliers on projects and initiatives, as required.
Devise new and enrich existing methods for identifying data patterns and trends in available information sources.
Guide less experienced team members in development of continuous improvement concepts and workflow automation tools.
May provide advice and guidance to less experienced Team Members.
Minimum Qualifications:
To be formally considered for the role, the following requirements must be met:
Bachelor’s degree
Some graduate coursework or continuing education preferred
8 years of progressive experience, preferably with a multi-location, geographically dispersed organization
Knowledge of Alteryx, Knime, or similar workflow automation tools
Advanced-level experience using Excel, including the ability to work with big data, complex tables, and look-ups
Preferred qualifications:

Who we are
Shellpoint Mortgage Servicing (SMS) is one of America’s top-five non-bank mortgage-servicing companies. What is mortgage servicing? Our clients are businesses that own mortgage loans (such as banks and real estate investment firms). On their behalf, we manage (or “service”) their loan portfolios, which means that we collect homeowners’ mortgage payments, pay their tax and insurance bills, and help homeowners in default to get current.

The Escrow Analyst I Specialist will be responsible for reviewing and completing escrow analysis in accordance with RESPA (Real Estate Settlement Procedures Act) for all escrow loans and non-escrow loans with negative escrow advances. Perform all duties in accordance with the company guidelines, applicable federal, state, and local regulations.

Responsibilities:
Perform daily Ad-Hoc escrow analysis for the portfolio – including the review of escrow line detail, and preliminary shortage and overage reports to clear all exceptions for a final analysis that is compliant with RESPA Regulations.
Solves problems rapidly and cost-effectively with minimal disruption.
Perform monthly bulk escrow analysis for the portfolio following the Mass State Schedule
Research illogical collection amounts, due dates, or large changes in payment
Document findings by adding notes to the loan
Complete the steps to process the escrow analysis and create a change in monthly payment
Process requests received from the mortgage holder, clients, or other departments
Monitor work volumes and adjust work types or production to meet department needs
Maintain consistent attendance to ensure fulfillment of essential duties and responsibilities.
Qualifications/Skills:
Minimum of 1+ years residential mortgage loan servicing experience.
Proficient with Microsoft Office (Excel, Word and Outlook).
Detail oriented with excellent organizational, analytical and problem-solving skills.
Must be able to multi-task in a fast-paced environment.
Possess excellent communication (written and verbal) and customer service skills.
Ability to effectively and accurately communicate with all levels within the organization.
Proven ability to work well both independently and as a team member.
Ability to make sound decisions based upon department, company policies, procedures, knowledge and experience.
Onbase imaging system experience a plus.
Knowledge of SQL (Preferred but not required).
Flexible to changing priorities, project scopes, and deadlines.
Educational Requirements:
Bachelor’s Degree preferred, not required or equivalent mortgage experience

Data Analyst, Digital Investigations Team (Austin)

Position Description

Applied Materials, Inc. is the global leader in materials engineering solutions used to produce virtually every new chip and advanced display in the world. Our expertise in modifying materials at atomic levels and on an industrial scale enables customers to transform possibilities into reality. At Applied Materials, our innovations make possible the technology shaping the future.

The Global Litigation & Compliance Organization has an exciting position for a mid-level Data Analyst to join a multi-disciplinary group that works collaboratively within Legal and jointly with the Information Security, Business Unit, and Corporate Services teams to conduct a wide range of business intelligence, visualization, and investigation support functions.

This team is responsible for designing, creating, and maintaining regular, ad-hoc and automated reports, dashboards, presentations, and analysis to provide insights into the company’s overall risk profile and effect governance based upon data.

This position requires strong visualization & design skills, analytic capabilities, technical prowess, communication skills, and creativity.

Major Areas of Responsibility

Responsibilities for this position include data wrangling, exploration, analysis, representation, and visualization. This position will also be responsible for developing and maintaining group presentations, department SharePoint sites and dashboards supporting the different teams and strategic initiatives. IT experience will be required to access and support disparate IT systems and assist legal personnel on a variety of technical issues.

This role requires the ability to gather reporting requirements, manage stakeholders, design & develop visuals, and analyze diverse data sources. The resulting analytics and visualizations will be used by executive-level decision makers to gain actionable insights.

Specific Responsibilities
Design, develop, and maintain metrics, presentations, reports, analyses, and dashboards that will be used to drive key business decisions, strategy, policy, and investigations.
Data wrangling including data discovery, data mining, data structuring, cleaning, enriching, and validating.
Data exploration to identify statistical relationships, trends, patterns, and anomalies.
Organize and transform data into comprehensible, usable, and actionable information.
Develop visualizations to explain risks and showcase key data insights for stakeholders.
Ensure the accuracy, timeliness and confidentiality of data sources and derived information.
Elicit reporting and analysis requirements from the Legal Team and deliver solutions.
Build data analytics algorithms and dashboards to identify events and users that may be indicative of policy non-compliance, fraud, privacy, or IP risk.
Build solutions by partnering with key stakeholders, including the IT, Information Security, Big Data and Enterprise Process Solutions teams.
Develop and design presentations—primarily in PowerPoint—that advance key business objectives and tell the story through clean, concise, and well-organized slides.
Distill clear messaging from the data and utilize smart visuals to effectively deliver insights to C-Suite executives allowing them to make informed business decisions.
Develop and maintain customized templates and graphics to project a professional, consistent “look and feel” for the department.
Educate and train the users on the supported sites, dashboards, and reports.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Data Analytics, Computer Science, Mathematics, or other technology-related field from an accredited university
Excellent data visualization skills and advanced PowerPoint presentation development skills
Must have strong User Interface (UI) and User Experience (UX) design experience.
Solid working experience with SharePoint and Web development
Experience with Tableau and Tableau Prep
Professional use of SQL, Hadoop, Hue, Hive, Impala or SAP ERP
Basic programming skills in one of the following: Python, R, JavaScript, or SQL
Strong attention to detail, passion for data accuracy, and high personal integrity
Ability to perform statistical analysis of data
Working knowledge of web development tools – e.g., XML, Java, JavaScript, and HTML
Excellent communication skills:
Clearly articulate and visually present complex data relationships and analysis results.
Create concise diagrams, charts, and reports to communicate the findings to the target audience.
Implement and document workflows & processes.
Ability to work both independently and collaboratively within a global team.
Capable of gaining the trust of legal and business stakeholders to achieve the desired objective.
Desired Qualifications
Working knowledge of Open-Source data analysis tools
Project management experience

Job Summary:
The Operations Analyst will own the forecasting and planning activities associated with Lab Capacity and Labor and will provide recommendations and support to the operations team. The Operations Analyst will help support a variety of business initiatives by collaborating with project managers, operations, IT, and finance teams. This role will require strong analytical and reasoning skills to extract and interpret data and to create tools to simplify and automate the planning process. Additionally, this role will require strong interpersonal and communication skills for collaboration, effective knowledge sharing and trust. The Operations Analyst will play a key role in ensuring timely and accurate projections that will maximize capacity and drive improvements in costs.

Essential Responsibilities/Duties:
Maintain an accurate capacity and labor planning model.
Create and sustain quality tools and reporting mechanisms for planning management.
Foster positive day-to-day relationships with business partners.
Maintain accurate data across multiple applications and data sources. Data mine various applications and databases to compare and reconcile discrepancies.
Create informational MS-Excel graphs from raw data, create formulas to analyze data, create pivot tables, create v-lookups, etc.
Create and monitor Key Performance Indicators related to inventory levels to inspect opportunities for data and forecasting improvements.
Continually review and scrub data ensuring that various internal and external databases/systems are accurate and aligned.
Participate in and contribute to department projects led by others.
Review historical trends, research demand drivers, prepare forecast data and evaluate forecast results and identify areas of improvement.
Incorporate business intelligence and forecast information gathered from operations, sales, CDC, and other industry resources to determine seasonality trends and potential spikes.
Utilize Redshift tables to build PostgreSQL queries and Tableau reporting.

Qualifications:
Education –
Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Engineering, Supply Chain, Logistics, or Operations Management. Master’s degree preferred.
Competencies/Skills –
Effective analytical and data skills.
Ability to review and determine root cause of repeating and singular fail issues.
Skilled in MS Office, including Excel (creating formulas, graphs of various configurations with dual scales, pivot tables, v-lookups, etc.), PowerPoint, and Visio (process flow maps, etc.).
Proficient in Tableau and PostgreSQL.
Strong interpersonal skills.
Experience –
3+ years’ experience with Data Analytics at scale.
Previous experience developing automated data reports.
Demonstrated track record of self-driven problem solving of large-scale ambiguous problems.
Certifications/Licenses –
N/A

Mental/Physical Demands & Work Environment:
Vision, hearing, speech, movements requiring the use of wrists, hands and/ or fingers. Must have the ability to sit or stand for extended periods. Must have the ability to work the hours and days required to complete the essential functions of the position. Physical effort requires handling weight objects up to 50 lbs. Learning, thinking, concentration, and the ability to work under pressure, particularly during busy times. Must be able to pay close attention to detail and able to work as a member of a team to ensure excellent customer service. Must have the ability to interact effectively with co-workers and customers, and exercise self-control and diplomacy in customer and employee relations’ situations. Must have the ability to exercise discretion as well as appropriate judgments when necessary. Must be proactive in finding solutions.


This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of all activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee(s) that in this position. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change, or new ones may be assigned at any time with or without notice.

BI Analyst/Developer:

Manage the BI development team in order to ensure effective BI tools are developed for the business.
Provide team with support and advice on various BI projects.
Maintain awareness of the overall BI strategy and ensure it is implemented throughout the team.
Monitor the development and maintenance of exiting ETL.
Ensure data is transformed into the correct format for the warehouse and loaded into the warehouse accurately.
Take ownership of the data warehouse and integrity of all information loaded into it.
Review code of the team and identify errors and provide feedback to relevant parties.
Manage the quality of code within the BI team.
Conduct business analytics in order to monitor and improve business processes.
Use data to support decision making and to identify market opportunities.
Provide ongoing support where changes to solutions or fault-finding is necessary.
Design data warehouse flows and schemas based off analysis, including staging, fact, dimensions, and cubes and reporting models in the semantic layer.
Define the business requirements and translate them into technical specifications.
Ensure the business is provided with operational support and technical issues for BI processes are solved effectively.
Perform a general management function for the BI development team.
Conduct performance reviews and monthly KPI discussions with the BI development team.
Set team objectives and monitor progress towards achieving them.
Coach and mentor the BI developer and BI Analyst Developers.
To manage own professional and self-development.
Will work in unanticipated locations. Requires Bachelors in computer Science, Engineering or related and 1 year experience.

Signet Jewelers is the world's largest retailer of diamond jewelry, operating more than 2,800 stores worldwide under the iconic brands: Kay Jewelers, Zales, Jared, H.Samuel, Ernest Jones, Peoples, Banter by Piercing Pagoda, Rocksbox, JamesAllen.com and Diamonds Direct. We are a people-first company and this core value is at the heart of everything we do, from empowering our valued team members, to collaborating with our customers, to fostering the communities in which we live and serve. People – and the love their actions inspire – are what drive us. We’re not only proud of the love we inspire outside our walls, we’re especially proud of the diversity, inclusion and equity we’re inspiring inside. There are dynamic career paths awaiting you – rewarding opportunities to impact the lives of others and inspire love. Join us!

POSITION SUMMARY:

To provide Signet Marketing leadership with visibility and insights into customer, performance of marketing activities, and business health and across all logos. The Sr. Analyst accomplishes this by utilizing the power of visual analytics via Tableau and the Signet customer Data Lakes (CRM/CDP) to pull actionable insight out of disparate datasets. While an Analyst surfaces what happened the Sr. Analyst sheds light into why it happened, what are the potential implications of what happened and what we can do about it in order to have a material impact on the business. The Sr. Analyst can work both independently and in a collaborative environment and has a passion for analyzing complex datasets and converting them into insights that drive decisions that create value.

MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES/ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

Design and build visualizations and interactive user interfaces in Tableau to present complex data in an easily digestible visualizations that surface insights and drive action. (e.g. Customer profile dashboards, marketing campaigns and audience performance dashboards).

Build data extracts using SQL and data analysis skills to curate data sets from multiple data sources necessary to perform any given analysis.

Partner with business teams to understand the full context of data/analysis request, especially the question behind the question.

Present findings/recommendations to all levels of management based on data and analysis of results. Communicate data findings with technical and non-technical partners.

Identify opportunities for process improvements and automation to standardize analysis workflows and improve efficiency.

POSITION QUALIFICATIONS:

Education Required: Bachelor’s degree in related field

Required or Acceptable Job-Related Experience: Data manipulation and visualization experience via Tableau / Power BI, SQL, Advanced Excel

Years of Job-Related Experience Required: 4+ years

Technical/Other Skills Required:

Technical: Required: Tableau/Power BI and SQL Ideal: Python/R, familiarity with Web and Marketing analytics (Adobe, Google), and Customer analytics (clustering, segmentation)

Soft Skills: Intellectual and analytical curiosity, willingness/ability to learn new concepts quickly, proven ability to generate insights and pull the “So What?” out of data and recommend a “Now What”

BENEFITS & PERKS:

Competitive healthcare, dental & vision insurance

401(k) matching after one year of employment

Generous time off + company holidays

Merchandise discount

Learning & Development programs

Much more!

At Shell Energy Solutions, we believe there’s a better way to power your business and home.

Aligned with Shell’s ambition to be a significant global power business and to become net zero by 2050, our cleaner, affordable and simple solutions help companies manage their energy spend and plan their sustainability roadmap - a fresh approach for environmentally conscious businesses that are looking to boost their sustainability credentials. We also have set out to deliver the very best experience to our customers across all our channels.

Shell Energy Solutions mission is delivering cleaner energy solutions for a brighter tomorrow by guiding customers toward a better energy future, enabling customer choice and by providing market-leading energy solutions.

Going above and beyond for our customers is what we’re all about and we have set out to deliver the very best experience to our customers across all our channels. But bigger challenges lie ahead, and we need to keep moving forward. Are you ready to help us get there?

WHERE YOU FIT IN

We are looking for a savvy Data Quality & Cataloguing Analyst to join our growing team of data platform experts. The hire will be responsible for aiding in our data maturity journey. The ideal candidate is an experienced data analyst and data wrangler who enjoys optimizing data systems and processes.

The Data Quality & Cataloguing Analyst will support our software developers, database architects, data engineers and data scientists on data initiatives and will ensure optimal organization and quality of data. They must be self-directed and comfortable supporting the data needs of multiple teams, systems and products. The right candidate will be excited by the prospect of solving complex problems, is driven to enable users to succeed, and can build effective stakeholder relationships.

Reporting into the Data Platform Manager, the role requires self-motivated, dedicated and responsible individual with the ability to perform well under pressure.

JOB DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES

Create and maintain data dictionaries and catalogs.
Interface with business stakeholders and leadership to understand and define data needs.
Analysis data quality via data profiling and build long term metrics with data profiling scorecards.
Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements.
Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, etc.
Work with stakeholders including the Executive, Product, Data and Design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data needs.
Ensure data separated, accessible, and secure in accordance with relevant governance and compliance requirements.
Build data views and reports to expose and drive data insights.
Work with data and analytics experts to strive for greater functionality in our data systems.
Other duties as assigned

ESSENTIAL SKILLS & EXPERIENCE

Successful job applicants will be able to perform these functions. Reasonable accommodations will be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

5+ years of experience in a Data Analyst role.
Experience using the following software/tools:
Experience with data profiling and quality tools: Collibra, Informatica Data Quality/Analyst, Talend, etc.
Experience with data tools: Dremio (primary), Databricks, Spark, etc.
Experience with relational SQL and NoSQL databases, including MSSQL, Postgres, MongoDB, TimescaleDB, etc.
Experience with creation of Data Dictionaries/Catalogues
Experience creating reports in Power BI (primary), Tableau, etc.
Familiarity with data warehouse technologies: RedShift, SQL DW, Snowflake
Familiarity with Master Data Management principals.
Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases.
Experience building and optimizing data pipelines and curated data queries.
Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement.
Build processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management.
A successful history of manipulating, processing and extracting value from large, disconnected datasets.
Working knowledge of message queuing, stream processing, and data lakes.
Be a proactive team player - we’re a small team with big ambitions in doing things at speed. As we work across a number of channels, projects, and conflicting priorities, being able to navigate and juggle multiple things on the go is required as well as being proactive enough to anticipate the next steps and actions.
Good communication skills, written and oral, for example ensuring sales agents are kept informed of any delays in turning around pricing requests, or outlining the rationale behind a decision not to approve credit for a customer.
Analytical mindset, demonstrate ability to problem solve and create practical solutions to overcome problems and mitigate risks.
Comfortable working in a target-driven and fast-changing environment, and able to respond to changing business needs
Excellent attention to detail
Proficient use of Microsoft Office programs including Word, Outlook and strong Excel skills
Excellent analytical, organization and time management skills, with the ability to maintain a strict level of attention to detail

Self-motivated with the desire to consistently improve performance and gain further knowledge
Ability to meet deadlines, learn quickly and demonstrate effective problem solving and follow-up skills

mdf commerce Inc . is an international team of approximately 650 experts who develop a broad set of SaaS solutions to optimize and accelerate commercial interactions of its B2B and B2G customers.

Working in the eprocurement sector, we are currently looking for a Business Analyst to join our team at Periscope . In this role, the Business analyst will provide professional and analytical services to support the implementation and upgrade of Periscope SaaS product solutions for clients. A SaaS (Software as a Service) implementation does not generally include custom development, but rather takes our existing product and determines how a client’s business needs may be met from the standard software.

This role includes exploration of the client’s business needs and mapping them to eProcurement solutions. The position will provide high-quality professional services to enable the highest quality business solution(s) for clients. The Business Analyst will work closely with new clients to effectively implement their contracted solutions. Periscope is looking for a self-starter who is hungry to learn and expand their skill set.

What will your main responsibilities look like?

In this role, you will be led to:

Develop robust knowledge of product functionality and potential usage/configuration solutions for clients.
Work closely with the client’s key stakeholders and subject matter experts to understand, analyze and assess their requirements and inputs, facilitate discussions, and suggest the solution configurations to address their needs.
Document client configurations for client sign off.
Liaise with development, and support to ensure clarity on client configurations and timeliness of delivery.
Communicate with clients throughout the project lifecycle to properly manage the client relationship and deliverable expectations.
Review the client solution for completeness, usability, and conformance to business processes prior to System Validation of the configurations.
Deliver training and orientation on products to clients.
Provide go-live support.
Travel required (50%).

What elements of your professional background will be necessary and useful in this role?

Your minimum of 3 years of experience as a Business Analyst implementing SaaS products.
Your strong experience working independently on project teams (as sole client facing Business Analyst).
Your proficiency in drafting User Acceptance Testing scripts.
Your strong client facing presentation skills.
Your proficiency in Excel, PowerPoint, and Visio.
Your strong listening, facilitation, and presentation skills.
Your excellent customer service and communications skills.
Your high attention to detail and action oriented.
Your ability to effectively communicate with stakeholders at all levels of the organization.
Your ability to work within stringent timelines and to collaborate across departments to achieve results.
Your ability to prioritize multiple tasks effectively.
Your self-starter with ability to research and learn both system and process independently.
A government experience would be preferred.
A bachelor’s degree in business (or related field) would be preferred.

Our offer:

A flexible work schedule (40 hours/week);
Work from home, no minimum number of days in the office is imposed;
Work equipment provided while working from home;
Competitive benefits, 401K, and compensation programs;
Flexible paid vacation, personal, and sick days off;
Closed office during the holidays—Paid vacations between Christmas and New Year’s Day.

Job Title: Business Strategy Analyst I - Bank Operations Analytics
Job Description:
Why USAA? Let’s do something that really matters.

At USAA, we have an important mission: facilitating the financial security of millions of U.S. military members and their families. Not all of our employees served in our nation’s military, but we all share in the mission to give back to those who did. We’re working as one to build a great experience and make a real impact for our members.

We believe in our core values of honesty, integrity, loyalty and service. They’re what guides everything we do – from how we treat our members to how we treat each other. Come be a part of what makes us so special!

The Opportunity
As a dedicated Business Strategy Analyst I, you will support, enable, and propose solutions to the strategy and analytics needs of Bank Operations. This outstanding opportunity will enable the Strategy Analytics professional to collaborate with other professionals across operations and other areas in the banks in the translation of business needs into analytically driven strategy proposal requirements and the fulfillment thereof.

Uses quantitative and qualitative analysis to provide thought-leadership on evolving industry trends, market developments, USAA’s strategic direction, regulatory environment, and macroeconomic trends for the business unit. Provides insights and information-based context for key stakeholders in the business unit to effectively manage, influence, and impact line of business strategy.

We offer a flexible work environment that requires an individual to be in the office 4 days per week. This position can be based in one of the following locations: San Antonio, TX, Plano, TX or Phoenix, AZ. Relocation assistance is not available for this position.

What you'll do:
Collaborates with stakeholders to identify key business assumptions and hypotheses around line of business strategy. Assists experienced Business Strategy Analysts and other subject matter experts with refining hypotheses and identifying business questions to explore further.
Develops the analytical framework and blueprint to answer business questions identified in the business portfolio, product, or member experience.
Collaborates with key stakeholders to evaluate and uncover strategic insights related to Profit & Loss performance including Product Strategy, Pricing, Marketing, Sales, Credit Risk, Distribution Channels, and Member Experience.
Leverages advanced data-driven problem-solving techniques to manipulate and interpret business results. Translates findings into insights for strategy management and execution.
Prepares materials that help communicate the significance of the strategic insights to senior leaders and other key stakeholders. May participate in key stakeholder meetings.
Ensures risks associated with business activities are effectively identified, measured, monitored, and controlled in accordance with risk and compliance policies and procedures.

What you have:
Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Science, Finance, Economics or related discipline; OR 4 years of related experience (in addition to the minimum years of experience required) may be substituted in lieu of degree.
4 years of experience in data/analytics, strategy consulting, or functional business experience within the respective industry of responsibility (i.e. P&C, Bank, Finance, etc.); OR Advanced Degree in Business, Science, Finance, Economics or related discipline with 2 years experience in data/analytics, strategy consulting, or functional business experience within the respective industry of responsibility (i.e. P&C, Bank, Finance, etc.)
Experience identifying business needs and developing strategic plans driven by qualitative/quantitative analysis and market insights.
Demonstrated experience using data analytics to formulate data-driven insights.
Experience performing data analysis using various data analytics tools (i.e. Microsoft Excel, Tableau, R, Python).

What sets you apart:
1-3 years of data analytics or science experience using SQL, SAS, and visualization tools (Tableau) preferred.
1-3 years of MDS experience, or Loss Control/Recovery experience in a large financial institution.
Ability to quickly develop an understanding of front-line end-to-end business processes and drivers of potential operational optimization.
Critical and strategic thinking ability and understanding of operations processes and strategies, especially as applying to Loss Control and Recovery within a large financial institution.
Excellent verbal and written communication and social skills required with ability to present sophisticated and critical issues to management.
US military experience or a military spouse/domestic partner.

The above description reflects the details considered necessary to describe the principal functions of the job and should not be construed as a detailed description of all the work requirements that may be performed in the job.

What we offer:
Compensation: USAA has an effective process for assessing market data and establishing ranges to ensure we remain competitive. You are paid within the salary range based on your experience and market data of the position. The actual salary for this role may vary by location. The salary range for this position is: $78,670 - $150,330 .

Employees may be eligible for pay incentives based on overall corporate and individual performance and at the discretion of the USAA Board of Directors.

Benefits: At USAA our employees enjoy best-in-class benefits to support their physical, financial, and emotional wellness. These benefits include comprehensive medical, dental and vision plans, 401(k), pension, life insurance, parental benefits, adoption assistance, paid time off program with paid holidays plus 16 paid volunteer hours, and various wellness programs. Additionally, our career path planning and continuing education assists employees with their professional goals.

For more details on our outstanding benefits, please visit our benefits page on USAAjobs.com.

Applications for this position are accepted on an ongoing basis, this posting will remain open until the position is filled. Thus, interested candidates are encouraged to apply the same day they view this posting.

USAA is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

Main Functions:

Ensures master data integrity in key systems as well as maintaining the processes to support the data quality.
In collaboration with subject matter experts and data stewards, defines and implements data strategy, policies, controls, and programs to ensure the enterprise data is accurate, complete, secure, and reliable.
Provides assistance in resolving data quality problems through the appropriate choice of error detection and correction, process control and improvement, or process design strategies collaborating with subject matter experts (SMEs) and data stewards.
Work closely with the business/IT to ensure alignment of master data rules and the operations of the application meet all requirements.
Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Bachelor's degree in information science, data management, computer science or related field preferred.
Five or more years of experience in data analysis or computer programming.
Experience working with industry standards, regulations, and guidelines in database warehousing and other relevant systems.

Who is QTC and what is Reserve Health Readiness Program III (RHRP-3)?

To provide high-quality, timely, and customer-focused medical examination service solutions, we honor our core values of integrity, innovation, agility, collaboration, inclusion and commitment. Reserve Health Readiness Program – 3 (RHRP-3) provides health readiness support services, such as mental health assessments and post-deployment health reassessments, to the military Reserve Components nationwide and Active Duty Components in remote areas. They deliver services by group events and in-clinic individual appointments and by providing call center support.



What part would you play in this mission?

You will oversee the status of operational issues, manage schedules, and prepare reports for the RHRP-3 Program. Monitor and develop resolutions to meet productivity, quality, and client-satisfaction goals and objectives. Managing the operational aspects of ongoing projects and serves as a liaison between project management and planning project team, subordinate employee recruitment, selection and training, performance assessment, work assignments, and recognition/disciplinary actions.

Job Summary

The Workforce Analyst (WFA) ensures service level attainment through effective scheduling and resource management for internal/external service teams. This position is responsible for monitoring service levels during operating hours to ensure effective management of the volume of incoming phone, outbound dialing operations and email contacts. This position is key to delivering the highest levels of customer service with each customer interaction. The WFA provides input for workforce monitoring, planning as well as, supporting development of programs that advance call center efficiency. This role is responsible for supporting the day-to-day operations and performing key analysis related to all contact centers activities, contact volumes and ensuring contact center performance meets service level goals and other KPIs.




Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Real-time monitoring service levels and performance of all queues and contact channels.
Optimize staffing as needed to best meet contact volume patterns and improve efficiency
Perform key analysis related to all contact centers activities, contact volumes and ensuring contact center performance meets service level goals and other KPIs.
Analyze real-time call trends and make appropriate staffing and schedule adjustments
Provide real-time updates to call center to ensure on-phone and off-phone activity is managed efficiently throughout the day.
Monitor/track call outs, tardiness, and PTO. Entering real-time exceptions into workforce management tracking system (absence, tardiness, trainings, meetings, overtime, etc.).
Support changes within routing profiles and agent skill sets.
Monitor agent schedule adherence using real-time adherence software
Provide daily adherence and performance reports to supervisors
Coordinate shift assignments, shift, and vacation PTO bids
Coordinate continuity of coverage
Review and process VTO/NPT/OT requests in real-time
Build and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders from all sites to ensure shared objectives are met.
Consult with WFM leadership/ADO/PM so decisions can be made regarding OT, VTO, and off-phone activities
Track contributing factors to productivity (absentee, volume spikes, adherence issues)
Perform other duties and responsibilities as assigned



Competencies:

Proven experience with workforce management platforms performing real-time monitoring
Understands and adheres to confidentiality requirements in relation to team member information.
Problem solving skills, ability to approach problems logically and troubleshoot.
Time management skills, ability to multitask, prioritizing to accomplish multiple tasks with multiple deadlines.
Supports and participates in a collaborative team-oriented environment.
Excellent analytical and mathematical skills.
Strong organizational and planning skills with an eye for detail.
Ability to handle multiple projects and tasks
Proven ability to analyze data and make decisions.
Excellent problem solving and decision-making skills.
Experience in Microsoft Office Suite and Tableau reporting.
Experience with extensive call center telephony systems, including IVR, CRM, WFM, speech analytics, call recording, etc.
Ability to work cross organizationally.
Excellent interpersonal skills and communication skills including, but not limited to; strong listening skills, verbal and non-verbal communication skills, stress management, problem solving and decision- making skills.
Must be able to multi-task.



Education and/or Experience: (includes certificate & licenses)

Bachelors degree from an accredited college in a related field, or equivalent experience/combined education
4-7 years of experience in a call center environment, preferably experience in a high-volume multi-skilled and multi-site contact center
Project management and medical case management life cycle experience preferred
Familiarity with Workforce functions preferred
Proven expertise with Cisco, Calabrio and CUIC Reporting platform preferred

The SAP Analyst (MDG) role will primarily be responsible for suporting the MDG functionality of S/4HANA and partnering with the business to understand their requirements, ensure process standardization by utilizing out-of-the box SAP software capabilities, integration, hands on systems configuration, testing and operational monitoring to continuously improve efficiency and quality of the process.
PRINCIPAL ACTIVITIES: This position does the following in accordance with all applicable Federal, State and local laws / regulations and the Company’s policies, procedures and guidelines:

Support the Functional Consultant during business process discussions by means of interviews, workflow analyses and facilitated discussions with users.
Translates users' business requirements into detailed functional designs for development, testing and implementation.
Identifies and communicates risks and issues impacting business rules, functional requirements and specifications. Participates in and contributes to managing the scope of applications and related changes.
Identifies and communicates risks and issues impacting business rules, functional requirements and specifications. Participates in and contributes to managing the scope of applications and related changes.

Drive continuous process improvements by monitoring and analyzing the KPIs, proposing process and system changes, providing the details on scope, estimate the cost of implementation, timelines, improve quality and the business outcomes

Bachelor’s Degree in Finance, Information Sciences/Technology, Supply Chain or related fields required.
5 years of experience in Development/ Configuration/solutions evaluation/ Validation and deployment of SAP MDG.

Strong understanding of the MDG functional processes around Data model, UI, BRFs, Workflow enhancements objects for various master data elements like business partner (Customer/vendor), Material master, and Financial Master.
Well versed in master data governance and management principles and best practices.

Knowledgeable with SAP Customer and Material Master data domains.
Experience developing and communicating MDG standards and MDM solutions across different business entities and functions.
Expertise with SAP MDG configurations for Data modeling, UI modeling, process modeling, rules and derivations, BRF+, replication configurations.
Experience with S4 HANA and a good understanding of SD, MM, PM, and BP processes.

Job Description:
Be a part of the nationwide law enforcement initiative that removes the tools of crime from criminal organizations, depriving wrongdoers of proceeds from their crime and impacting the infrastructure of criminal enterprises.
ProMinds Inc. (ProMinds) has over seven years of experience in providing best-in-class solutions in professional IT and administrative consulting. At ProMinds, we believe in working not for our clients but with them. ProMinds has a vacancy for a Data Analyst. In this role, you will be supporting the overall mission of the Drug Enforcement Administration (DEA).

Agency Overview

The Drug Enforcement Administration (DEA) is responsible for conducting national and international investigations targeting global drug trafficking networks and drug-related terrorism involved in the illegal growing, manufacturing, or distribution of controlled substances appearing in or destined for illicit traffic in the United States. A component of DEA's strategic mission is the use of the Asset Forfeiture Program, implementing major investigative strategies against drug networks and cartels, resulting in significant seizure and forfeiture activities.

Harris Health System is the public healthcare safety-net provider established in 1966 to serve the residents of Harris County, Texas. As an essential healthcare system, Harris Health champions better health for the entire community, with a focus on low-income uninsured and underinsured patients, through acute and primary care, wellness, disease management and population health services. Ben Taub Hospital (Level 1 Trauma Center) and Lyndon B. Johnson Hospital (Level 3 Trauma Center) anchor Harris Health’s robust network of 39 clinics, health centers, specialty locations and virtual (telemedicine) technology. Harris Health is among an elite list of health systems in the U.S. achieving Magnet® nursing excellence designation for its hospitals, the prestigious National Committee for Quality Assurance designation for its patient-centered clinics and health centers and its strong partnership with nationally recognized physician faculty, residents and researchers from Baylor College of Medicine; McGovern Medical School at The University of Texas Health Science Center at Houston (UTHealth); The University of Texas MD Anderson Cancer Center; and the Tilman J. Fertitta Family College of Medicine at the University of Houston.

We believe in our core values of honesty, integrity, loyalty and service. They’re what guides everything we do – from how we treat our members to how we treat each other. Come be a part of what makes us so special!

The Opportunity

As a dedicated Business Intelligence Analyst I, you will support the military benefits team, specifically in assisting the business with data support for benefits and protections afforded by the Servicemember Civil Relief Act.

Analyzes sophisticated business problems and incidents using data from internal and external sources to provide insight to analysts and decision makers. Identifies and interprets trends and patterns in datasets to locate influences. Builds specifications for reports and analysis based on business needs and required or available data elements. May participate in consultation to users and in cross functional teams to address business issues. Prototypes solutions for displaying information based on business needs.

We offer a flexible work environment that requires an individual to be in the office 4 days per week. This position will be based in the San Antonio, TX Office. Relocation assistance is not available for this position.

What you'll do:
Independently participates in collecting sophisticated business requirements by partnering with customers to define the business problem and data needs.
Applies an intermediate understanding of multiple data structures and sources to lead the development and implementation of business intelligence solutions, which may include data visualization, data transformation, or data collection.
Works closely with IT execution teams on the development of analytic infrastructures, data engineering, or related business intelligence efforts. Includes collaborating on the design and implementation of technical standards and governance practices.
Applies data visualization standard processes - often selecting the right data ‘tool for the job’ - to identify and interpret trends or patterns while following standard Enterprise branding.
Understands the value of prototyping, usability, and the end-user experience to improve the impact of the final data visualization product (dashboard, report, insight, or analysis).
Acts as a trusted data visualization advisor to the partner/end-user in order to drive business value. Develops advanced knowledge to influence relevant data, information, and application architecture decisions.
Actively participates in industry, COE, or other discipline-relevant groups/panels to stay ahead of industry trends and share standard processes with team.
Ensures risks associated with business activities are optimally identified, measured, supervised, and controlled in accordance with risk and compliance policies and procedures.

What you have:

Bachelor's degree in quantitative analytics field such as Economics, Finance, Statistics, Mathematics, Actuarial Sciences, Operations Research, Data and/or Business Analysis, Data Science or other business-related subject area; OR 4 years of related experience in statistics, mathematics or quantitative analytics or related experience (in addition to the minimum years of experience required) may be substituted in lieu of degree.
4 years of experience in data/analytics or functional business experience within the respective industry of responsibility (i.e. P&C, Bank, Finance, etc.) OR advanced degree in quantitative analytics field such as Economics, Finance, Statistics, Mathematics, Actuarial Sciences, Operations Research, Data and/or Business Analysis, Data Science or other quantitative discipline with 2 years experience in data/analytics or functional business experience within the respective industry of responsibility (i.e. P&C, Bank, Finance, etc.).
Experience identifying and implementing innovative approaches to address business problems and solutions.
Experience developing business deliverables that leverage business intelligence platforms, data management platforms, or SQL-based languages (Tableau, Business Objects, Snowflake, Hadoop, Netezza, NoSQL, ANSI SQL, or related).
Proven ability to build business knowledge through meaningful partnerships at the individual contributor, leadership, and EMG levels.
Demonstrated advanced communication skills with the ability to deliver presentations to all levels of management.
Proven ability to embed intuitive story telling within business intelligence solutions.

What sets you apart:

Advanced SQL knowledge; complex query experience.
Proven ability to dissect business requirements into data insights.
Ability to work independently with new data sources.
Experience with large account/transaction level data sets.
Working Tableau knowledge preferred or other visualization tools.
Working SAS knowledge.
Snowflake experience.

The above description reflects the details considered necessary to describe the principal functions of the job and should not be construed as a detailed description of all the work requirements that may be performed in the job.

What we offer:

Compensation: USAA has an effective process for assessing market data and establishing ranges to ensure we remain competitive. You are paid within the salary range based on your experience and market data of the position. The actual salary for this role may vary by location. The salary range for this position is: $78,670 - $141,570.

Employees may be eligible for pay incentives based on overall corporate and individual performance and at the discretion of the USAA Board of Directors.

These benefits include comprehensive medical, dental and vision plans, 401(k), pension, life insurance, parental benefits, adoption assistance, paid time off program with paid holidays plus 16 paid volunteer hours, and various wellness programs. Additionally, our career path planning and continuing education assists employees with their professional goals.
