Department: Business Transformation

Our Company Promise

We are committed to provide our Employees a stable work environment with equal opportunity for learning and personal growth. Creativity and innovation are encouraged for improving the effectiveness of Southwest Airlines. Above all, Employees will be provided the same concern, respect, and caring attitude within the organization that they are expected to share externally with every Southwest Customer.

Job Description:
Southwest Airlines promises to provide Employees with equal opportunity for learning and personal growth. The Sr Big Data Analyst serves as an internal consultant and subject matter expert responsible for leading the end-to-end life cycle of data management on various platforms, volumes, variety, and velocity of data. This role is also responsible for procurin g data and performing thorough data analysis to identif y patterns that aid with data science, machine learning, artificial intelligence, or optimization development. This Sr Big Data Analys t is a strategic problem solver and organized collaborator who is excited about the opportunity to partner with Network Operations, Ground Operations, and other operational w orkgroups throughout the Company .

Additional Details:
The culture of Southwest Airlines means we embrace a flexible workplace and value the camaraderie, collaboration, and innovation that occurs when we come together and interact face-to-face at our vibrant Corporate Campus. This role is a hybrid position based out of our Corporate Campus in Dallas, TX, which requires Employees to work onsite on our Corporate Campus at least three days a week. The Department designates the specific three days of the week Employees must work on-site.

Southwest Airlines is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We continue to look for opportunities to reflect the comm unities we serve, and welcome applicants with diverse thoughts, backgrounds, and experiences.

Responsibilities
Leads complex self-service data integration projects that bring together data from disparate sources in order to make it available to business customers such as data scientists, analysts, and analytic users
Leads informal teams to apply advanced data integration methodologies and tools to massive data sets in order to create solutions which can be utilized in descriptive, diagnostic, predictive, and prescriptive analytics
Drives interaction with functional leaders across multiple and concurrent projects
Drives formulation and communication of solutions and options
Serves as a subject matter leader for data assets and monitors the ongoing effectiveness of data assets in use by business customers in self-service environments
Supports the ongoing development of the Southwest Airlines data science center and community
May perform other job duties as directed by Employee's Leaders
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
Advanced knowledge of both inductive and deductive reasoning and problem solving approaches
Advanced Knowledge in evaluating appropriate data analytics and statistic method(s) for a business problem
Knowledge in developing plans and leading moderately or highly complex data integration projects including acting as a functional leader in stakeholder meetings, solution definition and planning, detailed task and deliverable definition and creation, and project schedule creation
Skilled in one or more data programing languages and open source tools
Skilled in one or more data integration and business intelligence tools

At AWS, we’re looking to hire an RTA (Real-Time Analyst) to be part of the AWS Premium Support Community Support Workforce Management team. The RTA will be responsible for real time monitoring of service levels and site performance during the day to ensure effective management of the incoming volume. This position is responsible for monitoring, measuring and and analyzing operational performance and progression metrics in by utilizing out WFM systems and standardized protocols to ensure each component combines seamlessly for all stakeholders. The position will have high visibility to all the operations teams internal and third-party.

Key job responsibilities
Intraday real time monitoring of service levels and backlog for all queues at all sites.

Support changes within routing profiles
Update and send reports related to the performance of each site including but not limited to shrinkage, occupancy and KPI’s
Build and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders from all sites to ensure shared objectives are met
Review tickets assigned to the WFM team that require real-time assistance to different stakeholders
In partnership with the Operations and WFM teams, the RTA monitors and reports on the execution of corrective/preventive changes to plans, in order to achieve KPIs.

Job Title: IT Business Analyst III - 100% remote in Texas
Job Description:
Performs business analysis activities related to IT applications utilized by HHSC program areas. Work involves the gathering, development, and documentation of user requirements; the review, assessment, and development of business processes; the creation of test plans and coordination of user acceptance testing; the performance of post implementation support of systems; and support of the systems development life cycle. Coordinates with program areas to provide excellent customer support and cultivate positive, productive relationships, which include working collaboratively with business stakeholders and development teams to ensure requirements meet the customer needs. Ensures all supported systems comply with departmental and state policies and standards. Recommends improvements to modernize operations and improve efficiency.

Works under limited supervision, with considerable latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgment. This position is classified as a fulltime position (40 hours a week). Work outside of regular hours may be required. Travel to other work location may be required. Performs other duties as assigned.




Essential Job Functions:
(30%) Analyzes complex technical, business, and managerial processes to assess system change impact on business operations. Performs analysis of program policies and procedures to determine their effect on automated systems and functional areas, such as system capabilities, limitations, and workflows. Conducts technical analysis to include elicitation of business requirements and translate them into written software requirements for new or existing program applications. Documents clear, concise, and thorough technical specifications for simple to complex requests. Conducts gap analysis to ensure requirements fully address project scope.

(25%) Interfaces with customers and other IT teams to provide automated solutions and coordinate testing. Writes software use cases and test cases. Performs defect validation testing, QA testing, and regression testing on supported applications. Reviews and tracks deliverables.
(15%) Provides guidance in troubleshooting and solving problems relating to systems supported by the IT Applications Group. Analyzes enhancement requests and issues (software and hardware) reported by users to devise optimum solutions.

(15%) Builds effective working relationships with program staff and gain knowledge of their business processes for development of requirements. Works with customers to analyze complex technical, business and managerial processes. Acts as the liaison to provide updates to program, mitigate issues and risks, monitor timelines, and oversee communications. Prepares updates and reports for diverse audiences.

(10%) Coordinates, plans, and schedules meetings associated with customer-related service request responses, business requirements solicitation and coordination, and team reviews of technical specifications and related documentation. Supports development process by taking meeting notes, and identifying and tracking action items, as needed. May involve coordination with vendors.

(5%) Other duties as assigned. May include but are not limited to actively participating and/or serving in a supporting role to meet the agency’s obligations for disaster response and/or recovery or Continuity of Operations (COOP) activation. Such participation may require an alternate shift pattern assignment and/or location.





Knowledge Skills Abilities:
Knowledge of facilitation techniques in discussing requirements.
Knowledge of Business Analysis and Technical Analysis.
Knowledge of System Development Life Cycle (SDLC) Methods.
Knowledge of process improvement methods.
Knowledge of principles and practices of project management.
Knowledge of testing methodologies and strategies.
Knowledge of Agile and Waterfall system design and development methodologies.



Skill in eliciting business and technical requirements.
Skill in problem-solving.
Skill in analyzing hardware, software and data issues.
Skill in documenting application and software issues.
Skill in planning, investigating, and developing application solutions.
Skill in effective verbal and written communication and presentation skills.

Ability to analyze systems, processes, and procedures.
Ability to write and revise standards and procedures.
Ability to explain abstract concepts in concrete terms to a variety of audiences, including technical, non-technical and executive personnel.
Ability to write detailed test plans and cases.
Ability to create and verify test data using SQL.
Ability to identify and analyze complex business problems and define user needs.
Ability to communicate effectively verbally and in writing with co-workers, customers, and managers.
Ability to use creative thinking and planning to solve problems.
Ability to handle multiple projects.



Registration or Licensure Requirements:




Initial Selection Criteria:
Graduation from an accredited college or university. May substitute direct work experience on a year for year basis.
Must have at least 4 years in gathering requirements from customers/stakeholders and preparing business/technical documentation.




Additional Information:
This position can telework full time from any location in Texas consistent with HHS telework policies. Applicants from outside Texas must be willing to relocate within 60 days of hire.


MOS Code:
There are no direct military occupation(s) that relate to the responsibilities, and registration or licensure requirements for this position. All active duty, reservists, guardsmen, and veterans are encouraged to apply if they meet the qualifications for this position.




Top 10 Tips for Success when Applying to Jobs at HHSC and DSHS






HHS agencies use E-Verify. You must bring your I-9 documentation with you on your first day of work.




In compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA), HHS agencies will provide reasonable accommodation during the hiring and selection process for qualified individuals with a disability. If you need assistance completing the on-line application, contact the HHS Employee Service Center at 1-888-894-4747. If you are contacted for an interview and need accommodation to participate in the interview process, please notify the person scheduling the interview.

At ERCOT, our diverse and dynamic work environment provides a platform on which employees can work together to build the future of the Texas power grid and wholesale market utilizing the latest technologies and resources. We encourage you to join our talented, dedicated workforce to develop world-class solutions for today and tomorrow’s energy challenges while learning new skills and growing your career.
ERCOT is committed to fostering diversity and inclusion at all levels of our company. It is the cornerstone of our corporate values of accountability, leadership, innovation, trust, and expertise. We accept and celebrate those that join us and recognize that individuals with a wide variety of talents, ideas, and experiences propel the innovation that drives our success. A diverse and inclusive workforce strengthens us and allows for a collaborative environment to solve the challenges that face our industry today and in the future.
ERCOT offers the flexibility to work both in and out of the office within the state of Texas, providing our employees with an enhanced work life balance.
Market Credit Systems Analyst serves as liaison between business community and the IT organization and IT departments to gather, interpret and document business requirements and translate into application requirements, operational requirements, use cases and test cases to provide technical solutions. Designs, codes, tests, documents, and maintains applications to meet ERCOT business needs based on the ERCOT defined Software Development Life Cycle. Works closely with customers, business area subject matter experts, team members and other internal technical teams to design, develop and maintain complex ERCOT applications in support of market needs and internal corporate requirements. Uses toolsets that adhere to the frameworks of the technical stack used across the Application Services division and ensures that products and solutions comply with the organization’s architectural standards. The Applications Developer works with ERCOT business partners to design, develop, and support complex business applications and tools.
JOB DUTIES
Understands the basic principles, theories and concepts related to the profession and learns how to apply them within the ERCOT culture.
Follows standard practices and procedures in analyzing situations or data from which answers can be readily obtained.
Contributes to specific objectives and outcomes as directed.
Defines data requirements and maintains comprehensive understanding of the aggregate systems environment in order to identify critical interfaces and implementation strategies
Uses understanding of IT systems to design and maintain database structures
Develops complex SQL queries and reports and support other activities as needed by the Risk Management, Credit Administration and Treasury teams
Reports and resolves data issues and inconsistencies to the processing and outputs to maintain normal systems operations used by internal and external stakeholders
Developing and managing SAS programs and internal reports using Base SAS, SAS Macros and SAS SQL
Creating test scenarios and associated test data
Developing SQL queries/reports as needed
Leads model testing efforts and designs key test scripts
Able to develop knowledge and expertise of ERCOT Protocols, data integration, business processes, and computation methodologies
Performs validation and testing of models to ensure adequacy
Uses test results to interpret system logic and recommend alternative testing or approaches in the event of exceptions
Conducts quality assurance of calculations, processes, procedures, and data integration for systems and programs used to assess market risk and financial conditions
Prepares reports defining and evaluating problems and recommending solutions
Generates data extracts and reports requested by internal ERCOT staff, market participants and regulators
Identifies and recommends improvements to information technology procedures and software to improve accuracy, efficiency, and timeliness
Communicates issues and resolution status to colleagues and upper management
Performing and assisting in functional, regression, integration and user acceptance testing activities
Experience Required
Requires minimum 5 years job related work experience in excess of degree requirements
Requires minimum of 5 years of progressively responsible experience in Systems Analysis
Requires minimum of 5 years with data validation, quality assurance and integrated processes in a quantitative / analytical field
Experience with SQL and SAS
Experience working with excel including complex formulas, pivot tables and graphs
Comfortable interpreting and manipulating algebraic equations
PREFERRED EXPERIENCE:
Prefer minimum 2 years' experience in a position requiring knowledge of ERCOT protocols as they relate to risk management
EDUCATION
Bachelor's Degree : Computer Science, Business, Engineering or related field (Required)
or a combination of education and experience that provides equivalent knowledge to a major in such fields is required
WORK LOCATION:
The majority of job duties can be performed remotely from your Texas residence
May be required to be on-site at the Taylor or Austin facilities at least once a month, or more based on the business needs and as determined by the Manager
Work arrangements are subject to business needs and are subject to change accordingly
Remote work schedules shall be performed within Texas. Log-ins during out of state business travel, and any temporary remote work arrangements must be submitted and approved by HR

Overview:
Fisher Investments is looking for a Systems Operations Analyst to help develop long-term data strategy within our 401k Solutions group. As part of the Marketing and Data Operations team, you will assist within marketing automation, data and system operations, designing data architecture and process flows that directly affect our sales and marketing efforts, empowering Fisher Investments' continuous growth.


The Opportunity:


As a 401k Solutions Systems Operations Analyst you will support our marketing technology stack and analyze data from multiple sources providing partners with meaningful and accurate information. You will share input and ideas with your team that will ultimately support sales and marketing strategy. You will report directly to the 401k Solutions Marketing and Data Operations Manager, who will guide your career development by sharpening your knowledge across multiple systems and gain range within your skillset.


The Day-to-Day:

Identify potential process improvements, recommend solutions, and lead the project to implement those solutions to improve results and increase productivity
Help on a wide range of projects, including creative execution and development, and work closely with other internal partners
Support Agile methodology and collaborate with other team members to design, develop, test, release, and support new products or services
Accept stories and participate in daily scrums with other team members to discuss project status and identify any issues that may affect progress
Coordinate with members of other departments to ensure that projects meet organizational goals
Design data architecture and process flows
Support Agile methodology and collaborate with other team members to design, develop, test, release, and support new products or services
Accept stories and participate in daily scrums with other team members to discuss project status and identify any issues that may affect progress

Experience with data analytics, data visualization tools, project management and workflow tools such as Jira, ServiceNow
2+ years experience administrating and developing solutions in platforms such as Salesforce, Marketo, DOMO or similar sales and marketing tools.
3+ years experience with SQL (PL-SQL, T-SQL, SQL PL or SQL PSM)
1+ years experience development languages: (at least two (2) of the following): (C++, C#, Java, HTML, APEX or JavaScript)

Why Fisher Investments:


We work for a bigger purpose: bettering the investment universe. We take great pride in our inclusive culture, our learning and development framework customized for every employee, and our Great Place to Work Certification. 100% paid medical, dental and vision premiums for you and your qualifying dependents

Responsible for design, implementation, and support of the University Data Warehouse applications, ETL processes, web applications, and visualizations. Reporting to the Director of Data Warehouse, the systems analyst works with stakeholders to develop, update, and maintain data queries, institutional reports, automated processes, participate in data governance initiatives, and investigate new architectures and technologies in support of the strategic mission of the university.

Preferred Education and Experience

Interested in a career with both meaning and growth? Whether your abilities are in direct patient care or one of the many other areas of healthcare administration and support, everyone at Parkland works together to fulfill our mission: the health and well-being of individuals and communities entrusted to our care. By joining Parkland, you become part of a diverse healthcare legacy that’s served our community for more than 125 years. Put your skills to work with us, seek opportunities to learn and join a talented team where patient care is more than a job. It’s our passion.


Primary Purpose
Develop and manage multiple complex research data projects in support of Parkland’s institutional objectives: (1) Design and implement technical solutions that facilitate efficient, reliable, and compliant research data collection, storage, analysis, and reporting. (2) Design and implement transparent supporting processes and procedures. (3) Recruit and lead additional analysts as needed and within budget.


Minimum Specifications


Education
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Health Systems Research, or a related field.
Prefer Master's degree


Experience
Must have at least two years of experience supporting acute care, ambulatory care, or inpatient operations in an Epic environment to include the following activities:
Capturing data request/reporting requirements from clinical end users,
Complex reporting using multiple data sources and reporting tools including Clarity and Crystal reporting
Previous experience working with integrated electronic medical records (EMR)
Previous coding experience using SQL, PL SQL or SAP, HANA, R
Knowledge of front-end Epic applications strongly preferred.


Equivalent Education and/or Experience
May have an equivalent combination of education and experience to substitute for both the education and the experience requirements.


Certification/Registration/Licensure
Epic Clarity data model certifications preferred.


Skills or Special Abilities
Demonstrated experience working efficiently, consistently producing high-quality documentation and work product, and within compliance at all times.
Demonstrated experience analyzing complex tasks/systems/problems, identifying possible solutions, identifying stakeholders, and seeking feedback, then designing, implementing, and evaluating agreed-upon solution.
Demonstrated expertise collecting, cleaning, organizing, and processing complex data from Clarity and other sources.
Must have strong clinical and business knowledge to facilitate efficient communication with clinical stakeholders to ensure capture of high-quality requirements, identification of best data sources and evaluation of work product.
Must have excellent people skills (thoughtful, empathetic, and articulate).
Must have excellent English language verbal and written communication skills
Must have a working knowledge of Windows-based systems, as well as MS Office Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint, and Outlook software. Advanced skills in Excel preferred.
Self-directed quick learner.


Responsibilities
Lead initial requirement gathering and subsequent refinement ensuring all necessary clinical, technical, regulatory, and operational stakeholders are involved as appropriate. Ensure high-quality documentation is maintained throughout life of project, and as appropriate provide regular updates to interested stakeholders. Based on demand and resource availability, recruit, lead and manage additional analysts. Ensure quality and compliance produced by all team members.
Define project deliverables and estimate time to completion. Predict and eliminate risks to deliverables and timeline. Provide regular updates to internal stakeholders and clinical researchers regarding risks and issues, and when necessary, propose revisions to deliverables or timelines.
Minimize technical risks and issues through creative problem solving. Lead development and testing of potential solutions to mitigate risks or resolve issues in close collaboration with clinical researchers and technical experts.
Conduct retrospective reviews leading to the development or revision of processes and procedures maximizing efficiency, reliability, and transparency. As appropriate, obtain stakeholder support or approval for proposed changes. Meet regularly with clinical researchers to obtain feedback and address any concerns or suggestions.
Ensure consistent high-quality work products.

Global Risk and Security (GR&S) at Vanguard enables business strategy, protects client and Vanguard interests (e.g., assets and data), and stewards a strong risk culture. Our teams leverage enterprise-wide insights, deep expertise, and trusted advice so that across Vanguard leaders and crew drive faster, stronger, risk-informed decisions.

Within GR&S, the Enterprise Security and Fraud (ES&F) sub-division is responsible for the global protection of Vanguard crew, property, data, and client assets. We are the trusted advisors that protect the pride of Vanguard with state-of-the-art security and fraud capabilities. We are a world-class destination of highly-engaged, passionate, and diverse talent expected to continuously learn and develop in an ever-changing security landscape.

In this role, you will:

Lead the policy creation for various facets of DLP at Vanguard.
Lead, develop, manage, maintain and enhance security controls (alerts, rules, policies, and signatures) for the security platforms.
Conduct threat modeling exercises by leveraging threat intelligence frameworks. Orchestrate threat hunts in coordination with department and divisional partners to determine gaps in existing security controls.
Ensure proper defense depth design, configurations, and best practice for preventive solutions pertaining to the network environment for new and evolving cyber threats. Identify malicious activity by performing analysis on logs, traffic flows, and other investigative detective activities.
Provide support on tool and vendor assessments for Vanguard's DLP needs.
Provide written assessments focused on threats, vulnerabilities, and technologies relevant to Vanguard Infrastructure.
Lead with IT and business teams to ensure prompt and effective distribution of findings so incidents are addressed in the most effective and efficient manner possible. Provide department support to the business on enterprise-wide security initiatives and projects.
Mentor junior team members to improve their technical acumen.


What it takes:

Minimum of eight years related work experience.
Undergraduate degree or equivalent combination of training and experience required. Graduate degree preferred.
Experience in DLP (Cloud, Email, Network, and End Point) preferred.
Expertise is configuring policy in DLP platforms and regular expressions preferred.
Preferred CISSP within one year of hire.

Special Factors

Sponsorship

Vanguard is offering visa sponsorship for this position.

About Vanguard

We are Vanguard. Together, we’re changing the way the world invests.

For us, investing doesn’t just end in value. It starts with values. Because when you invest with courage, when you invest with clarity, and when you invest with care, you can get so much more in return. We invest with purpose – and that’s how we’ve become a global market leader. Here, we grow by doing the right thing for the people we serve. And so can you.

We want to make success accessible to everyone. This is our opportunity. Let’s make it count.

Inclusion Statement

Vanguard’s continued commitment to diversity and inclusion is firmly rooted in our culture. Every decision we make to best serve our clients, crew (internally employees are referred to as crew), and communities is guided by one simple statement: “Do the right thing.”

We believe that a critical aspect of doing the right thing requires building diverse, inclusive, and highly effective teams of individuals who are as unique as the clients they serve. We empower our crew to contribute their distinct strengths to achieving Vanguard’s core purpose through our values.

When all crew members feel valued and included, our ability to collaborate and innovate is amplified, and we are united in delivering on Vanguard's core purpose.

Our core purpose: To take a stand for all investors, to treat them fairly, and to give them the best chance for investment success.

How We Work

Vanguard has implemented a hybrid working model for the majority of our crew members, designed to capture the benefits of enhanced flexibility while enabling in-person learning, collaboration, and connection. We believe our mission-driven and highly collaborative culture is a critical enabler to support long-term client outcomes and enrich the employee experience.

GENERAL PURPOSE OF JOB
The Clinical Analyst is responsible for gathering data and converting it into meaningful information used by the Health System’s leadership. Through the development of analytical tools that review operational volumes, expenses, service utilization, quality metrics, market share and profitability, the Clinical Analyst will provide information employed in strategic planning and initiative tracking. Analyst will write reports to gather information out of various DHS systems. Analyst will follow proper procedure to validate data, as well as be responsible to educating end users. The Analyst will have a primary focus area, including but not limited to clinical, operational, or financial.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Maintains utmost level of confidentiality at all times. Adheres to hospital policies and procedures. Provide leadership in the development of hospital initiatives or programs related to data collection, retrieval, analysis, and interpretation to assist in optimizing patient outcomes and/or effectiveness and efficiency. Must be able to extract internally generated data from current clinical modules within the electronic medical record. In addition to the internal data, will need to work with external data sources to provide external benchmarking comparisons and identify through clinical data. Exhibits the ability to produce reports for internal clinical data and external data as necessary. Serves as an expert on clinical data production/interpretation. Collaborate with colleagues, provide insight on data generation, interpret results, and help facilitate recommendations/solutions. Facilitate standardization of definitions to help provide consistent measurements of data through the facility. Assess other clinical databases for attributes, data validation, and necessity. Ensures the integrity of project data, including data extraction, processing, storage, manipulation, analysis and distribution. Works with management to develop statistical analysis that address proposed projects and analyzes data using basic statistical methods (if needed), interprets results and provides written summaries of analyses. Use the scientific discovery process by applying the latest statistical techniques to uncover new business opportunities and increase revenue. Generate monthly, quarterly, and annual reports, including departmental dashboards. Able to maintain global perspective and see impacts and results beyond the traditional organizational walls (departments, services, geographic location). Serve as a subject matter expert for matters regarding cardiac databases. Navigate the Electronic Medical Record system to obtain designated data elements and input into appropriate database software. Stand attune to changes with the databases; communicate those changes to cardiac team and Decision Support. Review Data Quality Reports (DQR) during the submission process. Communicate data issues with the team for missing elements from the medical record to ensure the most complete data submission. Work with the Heart Center Quality Committee to review outcome metrics and help identify process improvement initiatives from abstracted data. Performs other related work as required.
EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCE
Bachelor’s degree, required
Prior experience with information systems, preferred
Pediatric experience with cardiac patients in direct patient care, including involvement in teaching and staff guidance, recommended
Pediatric CICU experience, recommended

About L3Harris Technologies:

L3Harris Technologies is an agile global aerospace and defense technology innovator, delivering end-to-end solutions that meet customers’ mission-critical needs. The company provides advanced defense and commercial technologies across space, air, land, sea and cyber domains. L3Harris has approximately $18 billion in annual revenue and 47,000 employees, with customers in more than 100 countries.

Job Description:

The Spec. Business Analyst will join a dynamic, fast passed organization and provide financial support and management in a matrixed organization. The analyst will work with business partners throughout the organization to drive financial results, as well as work with the leadership team to identify risks and opportunities to financial goals and plans. This analyst will also be responsible for forecasting, developing and maintaining metrics and charts, and providing explanations to deviation to forecast, which requires advanced excel skills.

Essential Functions:

Collect data, allocate costs, and prepare reports that augment the company's cost accounting system.
Ensure that costs are allocated according to established procedures.
Gather historical cost data on such activities as material purchases, labor, equipment depreciation, repairs, assembly, operating expenses, etc.
Investigate cost structures for new and existing areas of the company.
Price new services or products by developing unit costs and projecting expenses.
Prepare reports that compare budgets with actual expenses. May prepare existing or projected profitability analyses.
Compile and review budgets for corporate or organizational units using actual performance, previous budget figures, estimated revenue, expense reports, and other data sources to control funds and provide for proper financial administration.
Prepare financial plans, monitor implementation of financial policies

Qualifications:

A Bachelor’s degree in a related field of study and four (4) years of related experience or equivalent combination of education and experience. In lieu of a degree, minimum of 8 years of prior related experience.
Position requires the ability to obtain and maintain a security clearance, which requires US citizenship.
Must have basic knowledge of Excel, Access, Microsoft Word applications.

Preferred Additional Skills:

Soft skills (I.E. Proficient in MS Office, Strong communication…)
Must have good communication skills.
Must be able to work independently for short durations.

About the role

The purpose of this position is to provide analytical support through research, data collection and data management of information for the organization.

What you’ll do

Responsible for data collection, data input and/or aggregation and data auditing to support accurate metric reporting and analysis performed by the organization.
Reviews accuracy of information provided and responds to requests from management and vendors.
Assists in generating Business As Usual (BAU) reports. Supports ad-hoc presentation/analysis development and responds to information requests from management.
No formal supervisory responsibilities in this position.



What you’ll need

To perform this job effectively, an individual must perform each duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the functions.

Bachelor's degree (BA/BS) from 4-year college or university preferred with 0-2 years of related experience and master's degree preferred.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Strong organizational and analytical skills. Ability to provide efficient, timely, reliable and courteous service to customers. Ability to efficiently present information.

Requires knowledge of financial terms and principles. Ability to calculate intermediate figures such as percentages, discounts, and/or commissions. Conducts basic financial analysis.

Ability to understand and carry out general instructions and solve problems in standard situations. Requires intermediate analytical and quantitative skills.

Experience in the use of Microsoft applications with emphasis on Excel and PowerPoint.

You'll receive a comprehensive benefits package, 401k, paid time off and other amazing perks such as career growth.

Department Summary
The University of North Texas Kristin Farmer Autism Center (KFAC) conducts evidence-based direct services, research, and training to positively impact individuals with Autism Spectrum Disorders, their families, and the community.

Benefits package for this position with the University of North Texas is well above the industry standard. We encourage all to apply.


Position Overview
Persons in this position will serve as key members of the clinical team at the UNT KFAC Autism Center, and also support the center’s research and training mission. The employee will be responsible for developing and implementing Individualized treatment plans for children enrolled in our early childhood classrooms, including data collection and analyses of children’s progress towards specified goals and objectives. The ideal applicant has strengths in several of the following areas: (1) a comprehensive understanding of child development, (2) experiences with naturalistic teaching strategies, (3) experiences in partnering with and coaching parents, (4) experiences with partnering with community schools in supporting children’s transitions to least restrictive settings, (5) experiences with working as part of a multi-disciplinary team, and (6) collaborative and effective practices in managing a team of behavior technicians.


Additional Posting Details

Minimum Qualifications
Master’s Degree in Applied Behavior Analysis, Special Education, or Psychology, and two years of related work experience. Board Certified Behavior Analyst, licensed in the State of Texas or ability to become a Texas licensed Board Certified Behavior Analyst within 60 days of hire.


Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
Strong understanding of autism spectrum disorders and evidence-based practices.
Ability to work with clients with disabilities.
Ability to be patient, flexible, versatile and cope with stressful situations.
Ability to follow verbal and written instructions.
In depth knowledge of the principles and practice of Applied Behavior Analysis. This includes general behavioral assessment and Ethical Standards in Behavior Analysis.
In depth knowledge of the behavioral impact of developmental disabilities, as well as the cognitive, educational, vocational and social challenges encountered by persons with developmental disabilities.
Ability to work independently and prioritize tasks/goals for self and others.
Effective written and verbal communication skills with individuals and groups at all professional levels.
Strong problem solving skills.
Ability to work effectively with various technology including word processing software, internet based databases, etc.


Preferred Qualifications
The preferred candidate will have strengths in several of the following areas: (1) a comprehensive understanding of child development, (2) experiences with naturalistic teaching strategies, (3) experiences in partnering with and coaching parents, (4) experiences with partnering with community schools in supporting children’s transitions to least restrictive settings, (5) experiences with working as part of a multi-disciplinary team, and (6) collaborative and effective practices in managing a team of behavior technicians.

Description:

Summary The Clinical Operations Analyst is responsible for researching, documenting, and analyzing multi-faceted data with statistical, financial, and clinical emphasis. Identifies data trends, develops programs to solve problems, and assists

in presenting and implementing recommendations and solutions. Is responsible for developing, coordinating,

implementing, and evaluating data collection and reviewing related to DSRIP reporting to HHSC and E-Clinical Works.

Applies information learned in order to best identify and implement process improvements. This position serves as the

E-Clinical Works Subject Matter Expert for the Clinic System.


Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned.

Documents and recommends workflow changes and functional requirements, specifications, and design solutions needed to support the business requirements for common and moderately complex problems. Does this in coordination with the appropriate clinical program / clinical service, region / division, and designated approved end-user advisory group.
Acquires and maintains a moderate understanding of the functional architecture, security, and compliance requirements of assigned systems and integration.
Utilizes appropriate tools to meet ad hoc informational needs. Understands the data model and data use of assigned systems.
Participates with information systems in basic to moderately complex issues, incidents, problems according to agreed upon service levels and according to defined standards and processes. Collaboratively works with peers, information systems, internal and external stakeholders, and vendors.
Collaborates with key clinical and business stakeholders to determine business rules, needs, specifications, feasibility (workflow and cost), and priorities for application development / configuration / acquisition requests and projects with a basic to moderate level of complexity and according to organizational standards and processes. Consults with key business stakeholders, and collaborates with information systems on selection and acquisition of 3rd party solutions.
Collaborates with key stakeholder group(s) (e.g. Clinical Programs, Clinical Services, Regions / Divisions, etc.) and key IS staff in the acquisition, configuration, development, testing, and implementation of solutions (vended and internally developed) with a moderate level of complexity.
Participates in the creation and management of project plans for projects with a basic to moderate level of complexity. Consistently meets agreed upon deadlines or escalates issues, concerns, and barriers to key project leaders. Assists in the prioritization of tasks / assignments.
Participates in the development and implementation of communication plans to stakeholder groups and manages customer and stakeholder expectations.

Education and/or Experience

Bachelor’s degree (B. A.) from four-year college or university; or five years of related experience in the field.

Must be proficient in all Microsoft Office programs. Must possess strong research and analytical skills, and be able to problem-solve and identify system issues. Project Management experience a must. Must be able to demonstrate excellent communication and presentation skills.

Overview:
Who We Are
Hicuity Health is the leader in delivering expert telemedicine care in support of patients and bedside care teams in acute and critical care environments. Since our founding in 2006, Hicuity Health has pioneered provider-to-provider telemedicine, fueling success with clinical and technical innovation.

What We're Solving
Hicuity Health leverages telemedicine to address clinical needs and staffing shortages for a diverse range of clients and care venues nationwide, including health systems, hospitals, post-acute care facilities, and at-home acute care environments.

Our Mission
For nearly two decades, Hicuity Health has delivered “Care Innovated” to its clients and patients. Across a range of services, Hicuity offers clinical, technical, and operational expertise that improves patient care and supports healthcare facilities nationwide.

The Role
As the leading high acuity telemedicine provider in the United States, we are seeking a highly motivated and talented individual to join our team of high performing Clinical Support professionals as the Data Specialist. The Data Specialist performs a variety of both complex and routine clinical support duties. Coordinates with clinical team members as appropriate, in collecting information for clinicians to coordinate treatment strategies and to facilitate the remote treatment of patients. Abstracts clinical data from multiple clinical information systems, and accurately enters data into the eCareManager Application (eCM), ensuring accuracy and completeness.

This position works out of our Operations Center located in Houston, TX.


You Will:
Assists in the management of patient information across Hicuity Health Operation Center locations.
Consistently verifies patient census for assigned client hospitals.
Enters information appropriate for new admissions
Retrieves patient data from hospital’s systems and enters it in eCM with speed and efficiency.
Completion of Care Plan data points needed for Best-Practices and APACHE scoring
Provide direct support to clinical staff in the monitoring center with the clinical use of eCM.
Assists client hospitals with the use of eCM when necessary.
Demonstrates attention to detail with accurate, timely and complete data entry and retrieval.
Answers, prioritizes and directs phone calls in the Hicuity Health Operation Centers.
What We Are Looking For:
What We’re Looking For
High School diploma or equivalent.
Knowledge of medical terminology and laboratory data required.
Past experience as a patient care technician, hospital unit secretary is desirable.
Strives to continuously build knowledge and skills
Demonstrates dependability, reliability and flexibility.
Proficiency with Windows-based computer skills, telephone and fax operations.

As Part Of Our Team, Team Members Receive
Hicuity Health fuses a friendly and collegial work environment with high performance standards.
Our compensation plans include:
Base salary
Generous shift differentials

Company Description


MDC Data Centers offers the ideal solution for networks seeking efficient and effective connectivity throughout Mexico. Our approach is based on centralizing the core points of presence for Mexican and North American networks in our neutral spaces located along the US border. This convergence of northbound and southbound networks creates a dense network ecosystem on the border, which is further strengthened by our unique International Fiber Crossing infrastructure and secure, neutral hosting environment for network connections. Together, these components form our Border Interconnection Platform™, which aims to facilitate connections that empower customers and communities by uniting networks, countries, and people.

With data centers in McAllen, Laredo, Eagle Pass, El Paso, Nogales, and San Diego, MDC Data Centers, serves the Mexican market allowing American and International carriers to connect to the largest concentration of Mexican carriers in carrier-neutral facilities.

https://www.mdcdatacenters.com/



Job Description


Are you ready to embark on a thrilling financial journey?

We're seeking a dynamic Financial Analyst to join our team and significantly impact our organization's financial success!

As a Financial Analyst, you'll be at the forefront of financial data analysis, helping us optimize pricing strategies, make informed investment decisions, and manage risks. Your expertise will be pivotal in evaluating our financial performance and shaping our financial strategies. Join us to promote connectivity!

What would you be doing?

Analyses business and financial data
Creates financial models
Creates financial models based on analyses to support organizational decision-making
Develops financial plans and reports for organizational leaders
Analyzes industry trends and makes recommendations based on those trends
Evaluates capital expenditures and depreciation
Develops automated reporting and forecasting tools for more efficient use of data
Complete assigned Daily, Weekly, Month-end, Quarter-end, and Year-end Processing and tasks encompassing a variety of financial functions in a timely and accurate manner
Participate in aspects of the forecasting process
Audit participation as assigned
Capital Project Request analysis & initiation/tracking of capital requests
Review and analysis of financial data and preparation of analysis for decision support & ensure GAAP compliance
Compile and maintain measurements of effectiveness and efficiency
Fixed Asset processing & Cycle Count process compliance
Interface with various functional areas such as Program Management, Purchasing, Operations, Build team to enhance the understanding of financial data
Costing, Inventory, Forecasting, Budgeting.
Account reconciliations as assigned
Coordinate & participate in Continuous Improvements & team projects.
Support and cross-train other financial functions
Performs other related duties as assigned.


Qualifications


Education:

Degree in accounting, finance, engineer, economics, businesses or other areas with an emphasis on mathematical and logic proficiency.
Desirable MBA with a focus on finance.

Technical skills and work experience

Bilingual – English and Spanish required.
2-3 years of previous accounting, bookkeeping, and administrative duties
Proficient with Microsoft Office, including Microsoft Outlook, PowerPoint, Word, Teams, and Advanced Excel.
Comfortable with software tools such as Asana, Slack, Google Workspaces.
Experience working with a NetSuite system environment and Quickbooks is a plus.
Experience working in a Manufacturing environment, IT company, or telecommunications company is a plus.
Ability to independently develop comprehensive reports and spreadsheets demonstrating appropriate logic and understanding of advanced financial concepts.
Advanced knowledge and application of accounting principles demonstrated by experience with financial reporting and analysis.
Ability to analyze data, research errors, understand the related financial impacts, and formulate the required corrective actions.
Ability to coordinate and drive projects to closure
Ability to manage time and juggle multiple priorities to execute high-quality deliverables.
Ability to independently develop comprehensive reports and spreadsheets demonstrating appropriate logic and understanding of advanced financial concepts.

Competencies:

Analytical Proficiency: Excel in financial modeling and analysis, which is critical for evaluating pricing strategies' financial viability.
Market Insight: Demonstrate experience in market research, collecting data on industry trends and competitors to shape informed pricing decisions.
Risk Management: Trained in risk assessment, capable of quantifying and mitigating financial risks associated with pricing approaches.
Effective Communication: Proficient at conveying complex financial information clearly, facilitating stakeholder decision-making.
Cost Analysis: Possess the capacity to analyze cost structures, ensuring pricing covers expenses while generating profit.
Strategic Alignment: Demonstrate the ability to align pricing strategies with broader business goals, thereby supporting the data center's objectives.
Resilience: Perform effectively when faced with time pressures, adversity, disappointment, and welcome feedback.
Teamwork: Show enthusiasm in helping coworkers and engaging with them to achieve goals and explain concepts.
Flexibility: Exhibit curiosity for multicultural environments, adapt approach as needed to promote collaboration, and easily adjust to changes.
Planning: Demonstrate the ability to think in the short, medium, and long term to make projections and prioritize activities to meet deadlines.

Additional Information


A Global Team

MDC was founded on the principle of bridging two countries together, so we get the idea of not just accepting the difference in people, but celebrating it and recognizing the value it brings to our customers and employees.
Our ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world - both in the marketplace and in the workplace - is critical to our success.

General Summary

The Marketing Analyst I will be responsible for collecting and analyzing marketing outbound / response data, joining that to behavioral data, preparing reports (ad hoc and dashboards), and assembling test / control files / lists to support marketing initiatives. This role will support efforts to acquire customers, retain them, and measure their value / performance in relationship to Elevate. This role will support the senior members of the Marketing Analytics Team with secondary support to the Marketing channel leads.

Principal Duties and Responsibilities

Utilize SQL queries to extract/shape/clean data from relational databases and stand-alone data
Collect, merge, shape, and analyze marketing campaign/response and customer data
Deliver PowerBI dashboards, reporting and integrations between CRM, Demand Gen, Direct and UX
Develop customer lists / files in support of customer acquisition, retention, and research initiatives, including direct mail, email, SMS, affiliates, and digital media
Analyze marketing data with Campaign Managers, Demand Generation, Data Analytics, and UX to spot trends, weaknesses, and opportunities in data
Design test use cases, setup, and measure results
Perform other ad hoc analysis and projects as needed
Assisting in the preparation and presentation of findings to the marketing leadership team

Experience and Education

Job Title: Risk Management - Home Lending Data Analyst - Associate
Job Description:
JOB DESCRIPTION


As part of Risk Management and Compliance, you are at the center of keeping JPMorgan Chase strong and resilient. You help the firm grow its business in a responsible way by anticipating new and emerging risks, and using your expert judgement to solve real-world challenges that impact our company, customers and communities. Our culture in Risk Management and Compliance is all about thinking outside the box, challenging the status quo and striving to be best-in-class.

As a Senior Associate of Risk Data Strategy team within Chase Home Lending Risk Management, you will be responsible for assessing and recommending changes to overall data strategies, policies and controls. The associate will take part in driving better data, stronger controls on data quality and processes, and higher level of transparency for the Home Lending Risk group and regularly interact with leaders and teammates in Risk Management, Finance, Lending and Marketing to add business value.﻿

As a Strategic Analytics Associate, you'll work with the risk team to generate thoughtful analytics and recommendations to the business concerning strategy development, implementation, operational controls, and performance monitoring.

Job Responsibilities:

Overall, 7 years of experience in banking and financial domain at least 5 years in analytics and working with global teams
Good understanding of Credit Risk and providing risk point of view
Experience in data analytics with ability to carry our segmentation, data mining and evaluate time-series data
Sound understanding of a data querying language or manipulation tool such as SAS, SQL, or Python
An undergraduate and/or graduate degree in a field such as (but not limited to) Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, MIS, IT, Economics, Risk Management, Analytics, Finance, or Accounting
Exposure/awareness of Alteryx and Tableau or similar tools
Experience working with stakeholders – building trust through hard work and honest assessments of projects, strong communication, high emotional intelligence
Working as part of a highly productive team, where culture and cooperation are critical for success.
Drive projects with stakeholder management across reporting, analytics and strategy.

Preferred qualifications, capabilities, and skills:

Any prior experience working with large relational databases is a plus
Any prior experience synthesizing large quantities of data using tools such as Teradata, ORACLE or Snowflake is a plus
Any prior experience working within a consumer bank, particularly within a risk or compliance function, or within the home lending line of business is a plus
Any prior experience building and operating within a well-controlled data environment (following established procedures, recommending enhancements to controls) is a plus

Chase is a leading financial services firm, helping nearly half of America’s households and small businesses achieve their financial goals through a broad range of financial products. We also help small businesses, nonprofits and cities grow, delivering solutions to solve all their financial needs.

ABOUT THE TEAM

Our Consumer & Community Banking division serves our Chase customers through a range of financial services, including personal banking, credit cards, mortgages, auto financing, investment advice, small business loans and payment processing. We’re proud to lead the U.S. in credit card sales and deposit growth and have the most-used digital solutions – all while ranking first in customer satisfaction.



For many, owning a home is the ultimate dream and we’re here to help customers make responsible choices throughout the home buying process through our online tools and advice. Whether purchasing a first home or vacation home, refinancing an existing loan or tapping into a home equity line of credit, we offer comprehensive services to help homeowners at every stage of their journey.

Who we are
Shellpoint Mortgage Servicing (SMS) is one of America’s top-five non-bank mortgage-servicing companies. What is mortgage servicing? Our clients are businesses that own mortgage loans (such as banks and real estate investment firms). On their behalf, we manage (or “service”) their loan portfolios, which means that we collect homeowners’ mortgage payments, pay their tax and insurance bills, and help homeowners in default to get current.

The Escrow Analyst I Specialist will be responsible for reviewing and completing escrow analysis in accordance with RESPA (Real Estate Settlement Procedures Act) for all escrow loans and non-escrow loans with negative escrow advances. Perform all duties in accordance with the company guidelines, applicable federal, state, and local regulations.

Responsibilities:
Perform daily Ad-Hoc escrow analysis for the portfolio – including the review of escrow line detail, and preliminary shortage and overage reports to clear all exceptions for a final analysis that is compliant with RESPA Regulations.
Solves problems rapidly and cost-effectively with minimal disruption.
Perform monthly bulk escrow analysis for the portfolio following the Mass State Schedule
Research illogical collection amounts, due dates, or large changes in payment
Document findings by adding notes to the loan
Complete the steps to process the escrow analysis and create a change in monthly payment
Process requests received from the mortgage holder, clients, or other departments
Monitor work volumes and adjust work types or production to meet department needs
Maintain consistent attendance to ensure fulfillment of essential duties and responsibilities.
Qualifications/Skills:
Minimum of 1+ years residential mortgage loan servicing experience.
Proficient with Microsoft Office (Excel, Word and Outlook).
Detail oriented with excellent organizational, analytical and problem-solving skills.
Must be able to multi-task in a fast-paced environment.
Possess excellent communication (written and verbal) and customer service skills.
Ability to effectively and accurately communicate with all levels within the organization.
Proven ability to work well both independently and as a team member.
Ability to make sound decisions based upon department, company policies, procedures, knowledge and experience.
Onbase imaging system experience a plus.
Knowledge of SQL (Preferred but not required).
Flexible to changing priorities, project scopes, and deadlines.
Educational Requirements:
Bachelor’s Degree preferred, not required or equivalent mortgage experience

QTC is seeking an Workforce Analyst Sr for our Reserve Health Readiness Program III (RHRP-3).



Who is QTC and what is Reserve Health Readiness Program III (RHRP-3)?

QTC is the nation’s largest provider of disability and occupational health examination services. We are PASSIONATE about our country’s veterans, UNITED as a team and INSPIRED to make a difference. To provide high-quality, timely, and customer-focused medical examination service solutions, we honor our core values of integrity, innovation, agility, collaboration, inclusion and commitment. We celebrate diverse thinking and welcome contributions from all.
Reserve Health Readiness Program – 3 (RHRP-3) provides health readiness support services, such as mental health assessments and post-deployment health reassessments, to the military Reserve Components nationwide and Active Duty Components in remote areas. They deliver services by group events and in-clinic individual appointments and by providing call center support.



What part would you play in this mission?

You will oversee the status of operational issues, manage schedules, and prepare reports for the RHRP-3 Program. Monitor and develop resolutions to meet productivity, quality, and client-satisfaction goals and objectives. Managing the operational aspects of ongoing projects and serves as a liaison between project management and planning project team, subordinate employee recruitment, selection and training, performance assessment, work assignments, and recognition/disciplinary actions.

Job Summary

The Workforce Analyst (WFA) ensures service level attainment through effective scheduling and resource management for internal/external service teams. This position is responsible for monitoring service levels during operating hours to ensure effective management of the volume of incoming phone, outbound dialing operations and email contacts. This position is key to delivering the highest levels of customer service with each customer interaction. The WFA provides input for workforce monitoring, planning as well as, supporting development of programs that advance call center efficiency. This role is responsible for supporting the day-to-day operations and performing key analysis related to all contact centers activities, contact volumes and ensuring contact center performance meets service level goals and other KPIs.




Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Real-time monitoring service levels and performance of all queues and contact channels.
Optimize staffing as needed to best meet contact volume patterns and improve efficiency
Perform key analysis related to all contact centers activities, contact volumes and ensuring contact center performance meets service level goals and other KPIs.
Analyze real-time call trends and make appropriate staffing and schedule adjustments
Provide real-time updates to call center to ensure on-phone and off-phone activity is managed efficiently throughout the day.
Monitor/track call outs, tardiness, and PTO. Entering real-time exceptions into workforce management tracking system (absence, tardiness, trainings, meetings, overtime, etc.).
Support changes within routing profiles and agent skill sets.
Monitor agent schedule adherence using real-time adherence software
Provide daily adherence and performance reports to supervisors
Coordinate shift assignments, shift, and vacation PTO bids
Coordinate continuity of coverage
Review and process VTO/NPT/OT requests in real-time
Build and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders from all sites to ensure shared objectives are met.
Consult with WFM leadership/ADO/PM so decisions can be made regarding OT, VTO, and off-phone activities
Track contributing factors to productivity (absentee, volume spikes, adherence issues)
Perform other duties and responsibilities as assigned



Competencies:

Proven experience with workforce management platforms performing real-time monitoring
Understands and adheres to confidentiality requirements in relation to team member information.
Problem solving skills, ability to approach problems logically and troubleshoot.
Time management skills, ability to multitask, prioritizing to accomplish multiple tasks with multiple deadlines.
Supports and participates in a collaborative team-oriented environment.
Excellent analytical and mathematical skills.
Strong organizational and planning skills with an eye for detail.
Ability to handle multiple projects and tasks
Proven ability to analyze data and make decisions.
Excellent problem solving and decision-making skills.
Experience in Microsoft Office Suite and Tableau reporting.
Experience with extensive call center telephony systems, including IVR, CRM, WFM, speech analytics, call recording, etc.
Ability to work cross organizationally.
Excellent interpersonal skills and communication skills including, but not limited to; strong listening skills, verbal and non-verbal communication skills, stress management, problem solving and decision- making skills.
Must be able to multi-task.



Education and/or Experience: (includes certificate & licenses)

Bachelors degree from an accredited college in a related field, or equivalent experience/combined education
4-7 years of experience in a call center environment, preferably experience in a high-volume multi-skilled and multi-site contact center
Project management and medical case management life cycle experience preferred
Familiarity with Workforce functions preferred
Proven expertise with Cisco, Calabrio and CUIC Reporting platform preferred

Typical Day:

Positions are located ONSITE at our San Antonio, TX location

Pay and Benefits:

Pay Range $65K – $72K annually

PLANO, TEXAS /FINANCE – DATA ANALYTICS /FULL-TIME/ ON-SITE

The Senior Data Analyst is responsible for analyzing data from businesses, cases, sales, and user activity to support operational and strategic advancements across the organization.




Who we are:

LeadsOnline is a powerful digital platform that helps law enforcement investigators and analysts advance criminal cases through the most current data on people and property across the U.S., and helps businesses reduce the hassles of reporting. Law enforcement agencies of every size and mandate use LeadsOnline to find suspects, stolen items, and patterns of individual and organized criminal activity. Businesses, including pawn shops, secondhand stores, scrap metal recyclers, and online marketplaces trust LeadsOnline more than any other system to freely, frictionlessly, and safely report transaction information to law enforcement.

In 2022, LeadsOnline acquired Hawk Analytics, provider of CellHawk, the leader in mapping and analysis of Call Detail Records and other location-based digital evidence. CellHawk is instrumental in extracting rapid answers from messy digital evidence to connect suspects to crimes. We’re thrilled at the good we’re already doing together.

Together, we are building the future of criminal investigations, and need people who are mission-driven, love technology, and who won’t settle for less than excellence to join our team.




Role and responsibilities:

LeadsOnline exists to advance cases, careers, causes, and compliance with its unique data, well-designed technology, and exceptional teamwork. We do this through our principles of service, energy, diligence, and persistence. The Senior Data Analyst is responsible for analyzing data from businesses, cases, sales, and user activity to support operational and strategic advancements across the organization.

Your primary focus involves 1) establishing data integrity and efficiencies, 2) building a foundation of performance reporting and data enablement, and 3) analyzing data to support and drive strategic decisions across functional teams within the company (e.g., Product, Sales, Client Support).

With a comprehensive understanding of the business, you keenly identify trends and patterns to form hypotheses and provide recommendations to solve complex problems. You will be the backbone and support engine to enabling our team to work smarter by making data-driven decisions.




The Senior Data Analyst will be responsible for:

Data Integrity:

Architect and standardize advanced metrics, along with meticulous metric definitions and calculations, fostering a cohesive data interpretation throughout the organization. Thoroughly document metadata where applicable.
Devise and implement sophisticated systems to consistently scrutinize and validate data completeness and configuration accuracy across multifaceted data sources, such as business transactions, case data, sales activity, and pipeline data.
Champion the development and curation of optimal practices for the storage, condensation, transmission, and utilization of intricate technical and operational data. This encompasses formulating strategic approaches like generating concise summary tables, constructing robust data feeds and pipelines, crafting efficient stored procedures, and streamlining workflows.

Foundation of Insights:

Build foundational data structures in support of functional teams across the business to enable continuous awareness into system and operational performance.
Develop dashboards, tools, and automated reports at scale oriented to a) provide insight into performance and b) provide user-friendly access of the data and insights to non-expert audiences for analysis and manipulation.
Establish and maintain effective performance tracking; identify improvement opportunities, form hypotheses, and propose, design and implement tests to drive strategy enhancement and optimization.

Decision Support:

Partner with functional teams to proactively analyze performance; use analytical techniques to assess data and provide recommendations to improve teams’ operational and strategic approach.
Analyze data to determine goals and performance thresholds to drive growth; create processes for automating performance insights via dashboard alerts, notifications, etc.
Provide analytical support for weekly, monthly, and quarterly business insight reviews.
Serve internal and external customers with diligence, persistence, and energy.
Initiate and drive special projects such as: critically evaluating user behavior to uncover what drives usage and adoption and help us uncover what our critical success factors should be along the way (e.g., Facebook’s “7 friends in 10 days”).



Who you are:

Driven, detail-oriented, and highly organized. You work well under pressure and are not afraid of doing hard things.
You are a strong individual contributor but can lead and communicate well with cross-functional teams.
You are an active problem solver and know how to find solutions.
You take extreme ownership in all aspects of your work and share credit when credit is due.
You can manage competing priorities and execute on agreed upon timelines.
You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills and care deeply about the quality of excellence in our products, and for our clients, and will work hard to make sure they are taken care of.
You’re a proactive thinker that is always looking for ways to enhance the current processes.
You have excellent written and verbal communication skills and can effectively communicate professionally and personally to other development teams and their Managers.
You want a tenured, meaningful career with Leads that lets you dig deep and plant roots.
You are energized by the fact that we are a fast-growing, mission-driven, innovative, and acquisitive team – looking for other bright minds to make us and themselves better along the way.



This might be you if you have SOME of the following:

4-5 years of Data Analytics experience; preferably working with big data and are able to make complex analytical concepts look and sound simple to others.
Have deep understanding of and the ability to execute statistical analysis techniques.
Proficiently using various analytical tools such as SQL, Python, Power BI, Tableau, Excel.
Have a Bachelor’s of Science/Bachelors of Arts, preferably in a field relevant to analytics (statistics, information systems, industrial engineering, finance, business, math, etc.).
Masters/Advanced degree in data/analytical field preferred.
Strong individual contributor that can work cross-functionally with various department stakeholders.



What you can expect from us:

We serve with energy, diligence, and persistence. We deeply believe the work we do makes a difference in the lives of our users, the communities they protect, and the victims they serve. We won’t stop pushing to make our products do more and to make each other better. You will have access to technical and soft skill training through sites like Pluralsight and RightNow Media to grow your skills. If we don’t have it and you think you should learn it, just ask. Further, we take our work seriously. Ourselves, not as much. You’ll have fun here.




Employer Paid Benefits

Medical insurance.
Vision insurance.
Dental insurance.
401(k) Safe Harbor match of 4% after 1 year of employment.
Paid maternity leave.
Paid paternity leave.
Disability insurance.
Flex schedule.
Robust PTO package.
$95,000 - $110,000 a year
Company-wide Bonus Target 10%

Job Title: Budget and Resource Management Analyst - Traffic Safety Division
Job Description:
Budget and Resource Management Analyst - Traffic Safety Division - (2303959)
Position Information


Are you looking for an exciting and rewarding career opportunity? Look no further! TxDOT's Traffic Safety Division is looking for a Resource Management Analyst who will be at the forefront of ensuring the division's management and staff have the essential resources they need to perform their jobs.

This includes being involved in division financial activities, analyzing and making recommendations on the effective management of budget and financial resources. The successful candidate will have the chance to work with a dynamic division team of professionals focused on all aspects of traffic safety, taking on challenging and meaningful projects, and contributing to the success of TxDOT.

This position is located at our new headquarters in South Austin. To see the campus and all it offers, please watch our Stassney Campus Preview.



Minimum Salary: 62,400.00 Maximum Salary: 88,703.00 Pay Basis: Yearly


Work Locations: Stassney Hq - Main 6230 East Stassney Lane Austin 78744


Travel: Yes, 5 % of the Time
Shift: Day Job Shift Details: 40 hrs/wk
Location Flexibility: Hybrid
Benefits and Perks


At TxDOT, we value employee work-life balance. In keeping with our commitment to this value, our employees benefit from a wide array of programs and activities that include:

Low Turnover
Retirement Pension
Alternative Work Schedules
Paid Leave/Holidays
Health Premiums paid at 100% for full-time employees

For a complete list of our total compensation package please visit our website at: Total Compensation Package
To view benefits available to all State of Texas employees visit: Benefits at a Glance | ERS (texas.gov)


Position Description


Monitors budget and other financial activities and assists with budget preparation in the Traffic Safety Division; analyzes human resources, equipment and resource data management; and performs budget/resource forecasting and reporting. Analyzes expenditures, revenues, economic trends, and process effectiveness to develop and run scenarios for administrative planning purposes. Work requires contact with other governmental officials. Employees at this level perform work independently on assignments; however all unusual issues are referred to the supervisor.

Essential Duties:

Analyzes data trends and creates reports or correspondence to explain resource expenditures, economic impacts, or monthly/ad hoc reports to division leadership.
Assists in preparing large multi-appropriation budgets and resource allocations to be incorporated into the department's biennial Legislative Appropriations Request.
Compiles data for upcoming fiscal year budget requests and/or financial and special reports.
Analyzes need for internal budget adjustments and completes journals within division appropriation parameters.
Researches legal statutes and historical financial information.
Utilizes PeopleSoft on a daily basis, researches and coordinates complex reconciliation of errors or discrepancies in the system, and is knowledgeable with the division's accounting chart fields or charge codes.
Reviews requests for additional funds or resource reallocation; evaluates justification, recommends actions and answers inquiries on division budget/resource related matters.
Assists with the division's invoice and bill paying process, and with procurement and contracting functions.
Communicates financial processing policies and procedures to Traffic Safety Division personnel and may provide training or guidance.
Performs other job responsibilities as assigned.


Minimum Qualifications:

Education: Bachelor's Degree in Accounting, Finance or related field.

Experience: 1 year budget analysis and forecasting or related work experience. (Experience can be satisfied by full-time or prorated part-time equivalent).

Substitutions: Relevant work experience may be substituted for degree on a year per year basis OR related graduate level education may be substituted for experience on a year per year basis. Substitutions for Minimum Qualifications

Licenses and Certifications: Valid driver’s license. This position requires driving a state vehicle.




Preferred Qualifications:

Currently certified as a Certified Texas Contract Manager (CTCM)

Competencies:

Forecasting methodologies
General accepted accounting principles, procedures and terminology
Fiscal planning and management practices
Budgeting, bookkeeping, and accounts payable practices and procedures
Researching, analyzing, and interpreting policies and state and federal laws and regulations specific to functional areas
Providing customer support and developing customer relations
Maintaining effective working relationships with others
Analyzing and organizing business and technical data
Preparing and maintaining confidential and sensitive records, files and reports
Using computers and applicable programs, applications and systems
Exercises logic and reasoning to define problems, establish facts and draw valid conclusions; makes decisions that support business objectives and goals
Planning, coordinating and handling multiple projects within areas of responsibility to meet short and long term deadlines
Maintains composure when handling problems, stressful situations, continuous change, and unexpected developments



Physical Requirements and Working Conditions:

Sedentary work: Lift up to 10 lbs at a time and occasionally carry files/small tools
Fingering-picking, pinching, typing; working primarily with fingers rather than whole hand
Talking and Hearing -expressing or exchanging ideas by spoken words; perceive sound at normal speaking level
Close Visual Acuity-work includes data/figures; view a computer screen; extensive reading
