At AES, we raise the quality of life around the world by changing the way energy works. Everyone makes an impact every day in our small, global teams. Apply here to start an extraordinary career today.
At AES, we are accelerating the future of energy, together, while transforming the customer experience and delivering outstanding products and solutions. We are looking for a Team Lead, Data Analytics (BESS), to report to the Manager of Structuring and Analytics (BESS) in the AES Clean Energy commercial business. The role will support the commercial platform in modeling and valuing Battery Energy Storage Systems, and partner with other business functions in Structured Origination, Term Trading, Structured Trading, Engineering, and Risk Management. Employees of varying experience are welcome to apply, and the role may be changed to accommodate differing experience levels.
This is a phenomenal opportunity to work toward a 100% carbon-free energy future, drive the business, build groundbreaking renewables experience, and grow with the team owning the energy transition.
Main Responsibilities


Lead development of battery dispatch model functionality as needed to support customer transactions, including innovative, first-to-market deal types.
Work with regulatory, engineering, market operations, and trading teams to improve modeling accuracy and adapt to changing market conditions.
Coordinate with members of the Commercial team to communicate model results and changes to broader AES partners.
Act as an internal subject matter expert in BESS project valuation and modeling, using model results to educate and coordinate with other teams across the AES CE business.
Support the AES Clean Energy deal pipeline with development of project revenue models for Battery Energy Storage Systems (BESS).
Coordinate with Business Development, Mergers and Acquisitions, and Origination teams to ensure asset revenues and Power Purchase Agreements are adequately reflected within the investment due diligence process.
Deliver improvements and automation for existing battery dispatch models to shorten turnaround times and apply findings holistically to the business infrastructure.
Develop a deep understanding of commercial impacts affecting AES CE business, grow their own skills, contribute to building the wider team, and progress along the career path.
Qualifications
Extensive experience with US Wholesale power markets (ERCOT, CAISO preferred)
Knowledge of renewable and BESS asset revenue streams and their valuation.
Deep experience in at least one programming language (e.g., Python, R, MATLAB, C/C++), R and Python preferred.
Experience with optimization models and linear optimization.
Previous experience building production level models for power market.
Strong quantitative and analytical skills, communication skills and attention to detail.
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Finance, Engineering, Math, Physics, Data Science, Business Analytics or similar. Master’s Degree in those areas preferred.
3-4 years of relevant work experience in the energy industry in related functions such as trading, portfolio management, asset management, investment advisory, quantitative analytics, risk analytics and similar.
AES is an Equal Opportunity Employer who is committed to building strength and delivering long-term sustainability through diversity and inclusion. Respecting all backgrounds, differences and perspectives enables us to improve the lives of our people, customers, suppliers, contractors, and the communities in which we live and work. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity and/or expression, race, national origin, ethnicity, age, religion, marital status, physical or mental disability, pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical condition, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under applicable law. E-Verify Notice: AES will provide the Social Security Administration (SSA) and if necessary, the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) with information from each new employee's I-9 to confirm work authorization.
The expected salary for this position, at commencement of employment, is between $105,000 and $131,750/Annual; however, base pay offered may vary depending on multiple individualized factors, including market location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. The total compensation package for this position may also include other elements such as annual bonus, in addition to a full range of medical, dental, vision, life, financial, and/or other benefits (including 401(k) eligibility and various paid time off benefits, such as vacation, sick time, and parental leave), dependent on the position offered. Details of participation in these benefit plans will be provided if a candidate receives an offer of employment. If hired, employee will be in an “at-will position” and the Company reserves the right to modify base salary (as well as any other discretionary payment or compensation program) at any time, including for reasons related to individual performance, Company or individual department/team performance, and market factors.

McKesson is an impact-driven, Fortune 10 company that touches virtually every aspect of healthcare. We are known for delivering insights, products, and services that make quality care more accessible and affordable. Here, we focus on the health, happiness, and well-being of you and those we serve - we care. What you do at McKesson matters. We foster a culture where you can grow, make an impact, and are empowered to bring new ideas. Together, we thrive as we shape the future of health for patients, our communities, and our people. If you want to be part of tomorrow's health today, we want to hear from you.

McKesson is in the business of better health, and we touch the lives of patients in virtually every aspect of healthcare. We partner with payors, hospitals, physician offices, pharmacies, pharmaceutical companies, and others across the spectrum of care to build healthier organizations that deliver better care to patients in every setting. We believe in the importance of strong, vital organizations because we know that patients can only be healthy when our system is healthy.

Every single McKesson employee contributes to our mission-by joining McKesson you act as a catalyst in a chain of events that helps millions of people all over the globe. Talented, compassionate people are the future of our company-and of healthcare. At McKesson, you'll collaborate on the products and solutions that help us carry out our mission to improve lives and advance healthcare. Working here is your opportunity to shape an industry that's vital to us all.

We understand the importance of a system that works together. Your expertise drive and passion can help us improve everything we touch, from providers to payors to pharmacies. Join our team of leaders to begin a rewarding career.

Position Description:
We are seeking a Lead Data Governance Analyst to join our team! This will be a critical role for the new Enterprise Data Governance Function & Organization.

Key responsibilities include:


Defining data policies and standards: establishing data policies, guidelines and standards that govern the collection, storage, usage, and sharing of data across the organization.


Ensuring compliance with relevant regulations and industry best practices.


Data stewardship: identifying and assigning data stewards who are managing and maintaining quality, integrity and security of specific data domains.


Data classification and lifecycle management.


Data privacy and security - collaborating with security and privacy teams to define privacy practices, regulations, implementing access controls, data making and encryption.


Monitoring and auditing governance processes, tracking and reporting of key metric and performance indicators.

Qualifications::


Typically requires 10+ years relevant experience.

Critical Skills:


Strong understanding of databases and data structures.


Lean Six Sigma/Continuous Process Improvement: Process mapping, create and implement controls, and train the stakeholders on the process and the controls.


Minimum 3-5 years of relevant business experience and working on digital product team.


Experience designing and refining value case (e.g., financial value to the business, strategic value, etc.


Experience working in CDO, Big Data or Analytics function @ enterprise level.

Additional Knowledge & Skills:


Intermediate facilitation skills with the ability to drive issues to closure.


Strong analytical and time management skills.


Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Education:


Bachelor's degree (in computer science, mathematics or related field) or equivalent experience.

Job Title: Data Analyst II (Enterprise Data Intelligence), Information Technology, Dell Medical School
Job Description:
Job Posting Title:
Data Analyst II (Enterprise Data Intelligence), Information Technology, Dell Medical School
-
Hiring Department:
Dell Medical School
-
Position Open To:
All Applicants
-
Weekly Scheduled Hours:
40
-
FLSA Status:
Exempt
-
Earliest Start Date:
Immediately
-
Position Duration:
Expected to Continue
-
Location:
UT MAIN CAMPUS
-
Job Details:
General Notes
This role will define and develop processes to collect, distill and interpret data with a view to aid better, more informed decision making. They also examine and explore data from multiple disparate sources with the goal of discovering insights including value-based contracting, business case development and quality metrics. Additionally, this role will manage and respond to internal and external data needs, including coordinating requests, understanding the purpose of the requests, corresponding with requestors to clarify needs, and making every effort to deliver the analytics in an appropriate format and a timely and efficient manner. This role will translate analytic findings into business solutions that provide impact and align with the mission and vision of the organization.
Purpose
The purpose of this position is to help manage, design and analyze data in order to build data driven business insights and high impact analytics to generate significant business value collaborating with various departments.
Responsibilities
Conceptualize, create, and maintain operational and research related data models in Redshift for database reporting visualization by working closely with Decision Support, Clinical, and Research teams and learning data frameworks, regulations, and security of data.
Facilitate collaboration between our research teams and data partners for the acquisition of data for quality operations and research publications following IRB and regulatory standards.
Strategize on making analyses easily repeatable and generalizable by other team members in the future by documenting assumptions, methodology, validation and testing to facilitate sharing of knowledge and insight.
Continue to learn and grow skills relevant to their assigned job duties via both formal training and on-the-job research to be able to mentor other analysts and strategize new solutions.
Other related duties as assigned.
Required Qualifications
Bachelors degree in a related field and 3+ years in data programming or healthcare setting (SQL, Redshift, etc). 2+ years of experience using Tableau or similar visualization tools to build dashboards and analyze data. Knowledge of Data Warehouse concepts and techniques. Experience with advanced analytics, strong attention to detail, likes to solve problems, and is intellectually curious and an innovator. Excellent oral and written communication skills. Experience defining and developing measurement frameworks, KPIs, and information governance standards around those frameworks. Ability to communicate well, present ideas and solution to executives and coherently discuss complex topics with both technical and business audiences. Highly competent with quantitative data analysis and utilizing data to drive decision-making, specifically related to financial analysis and data support to determine the financial viability and efficacy of proposed service lines. Ability to tell a story with data both verbally and visually. Have an open mind to pick up new analytical techniques as required. Demonstrate expert skills in analytical and statistical techniques and approaches used to drive fact-based decision-making. Successful partnering experience with technology departments, data integration and decision science-based resources to solve complex business problems. Provides subject matter expertise in operationalizing recommendations. Experience in mentoring fellow analyst and keeping relevant skills up to date. The Dell Medical School is especially interested in qualified candidates who can contribute to diversity and excellence within the learning health system. At the Dell Medical School we strive to create a vital, inclusive health ecosystem. To ensure alignment, we follow these fundamental values: https://dellmed.utexas.edu/culture. Relevant education and experience may be substituted as appropriate.
Preferred Qualifications
Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Data Science, Analytics, Economics, Finance, Statistics, Mathematics, Actuarial Sciences or other quantitative discipline. Experience with health data analytics, particularly with AthenaHealth analytics or Cerner. Experience with AWS, Python, or Java. Understanding of AWS platforms and tools. Application of data privacy practices and laws to ensure privacy, security, and confidentiality, including HIPAA and IRB Approval. Proficient skills with Exploratory Data Analysis and Statistics. Proficient skills with modeling and forecasting beyond simple regression. May consider professional experience and industry certifications in lieu of education.
Salary Range
$80,000 + depending on qualifications
Working Conditions
May work around standard office conditions.
Repetitive use of a keyboard at a workstation.
Required Materials
Resume/CV
3 work references with their contact information; at least one reference should be from a supervisor
Letter of interest
Important: You will be prompted to submit your resume in the first step of the online job application process. Then, any additional Required Materials will be uploaded in the My Experience section; you can multi-select the additional files or click the Upload button for each file. Before submitting your online job application, ensure that ALL Required Materials have been uploaded. Once your job application has been submitted, you cannot make changes.

Description

The Railroad Commission of Texas is a state agency with primary regulatory jurisdiction over the oil and natural gas industry; pipeline transport and pipeline safety; natural gas utilities; the LP-gas industry, and surface mining operations. You can find more details about us on the Railroad Commission of Texas’ website here https://www.rrc.texas.gov/about-us/.


To support our mission to serve Texas, we need great people to join our team. We provide a great working environment along with outstanding benefits, including:


Generous paid time off including vacation, sick time, and at least 12 paid holidays per year
Telework options for eligible positions
Flexible work schedules
Retirement pension with a 150% agency match – you can watch this YouTube video that describes this amazing benefit https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AJI6M7g73-w
401(k), 457(b) and Roth
Health premiums 100% paid for full-time employees
Tuition Reimbursement
Wellness and Exercise Leave
Career development programs/opportunities for advancement



For a complete list of our total compensation package please visit our website at https://www.rrc.texas.gov/about-us/jobs/. To view benefits available to all State of Texas employees visit the Employee Retirement Systems website at https://ers.texas.gov/benefits-at-a-glance.



General Descriptions

The Railroad Commission of Texas (RRC) recognized as a worldwide leader in the regulation of oil and gas exploration and production, seeks a Business Analyst II to perform routine (journey-level) professional administrative and business analysis work. Work involves gathering, developing, and documenting user requirements; reviewing, assessing, and developing business processes; creating and validating user acceptance testing; assisting with post-implementation support of systems; and providing support for the systems development life cycle. Works under moderate supervision, with limited latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgment. Business Analyst will typically perform a liaison function between a program area of the agency and other stakeholders, subject matter experts, and information technology department to identify business requirements of the users and to coordinate the automation of new or improved existing systems to enhance business operations.

Essential Job Duties

Advises management on agency operations by identifying priorities and defining study scope, purpose, objectives, time frames, and resource requirements.
Analyzes data using standard statistical tools, methods, and techniques.
Compiles and queries data.
Coordinates collection of information, metrics, and procedures from throughout distinct operational areas and facilitates the revision and development of common procedures.
Develops solutions to highly complex organizational issues and concerns, develops organizational change strategies and plans, and/or conducts training for their implementation.
Gathers, analyzes, and documents user requirements, business processes, and problems to automate or improve existing systems; elicits and documents business needs for new systems.
Interprets historical, current, and projected data to identify problems, causes, and areas for which procedural or system changes are indicated.
Oversees, and/or designs, evaluates, and recommends changes to processes, procedures, workflows, forms, and reports.
Reviews and evaluates new or improved business and management practices for application to agency-wide programs or operations.
Reviews and evaluates recommendations for improvement and corrective action to standardize or improve agency-wide systems.
Serves as a liaison between the business area and information technology division for automation projects, rule change proposals, and other IT-related activities.
Performs related work as assigned.

Position may require some travel.

For Military Crosswalk information please visit: Military Crosswalk for Occupational Category - Information Technology (texas.gov)



Qualifications


Minimum Qualifications

3-5+ years’ professional experience in methods analysis, management, data analysis, or organizational development work.
Graduation from an accredited four-year college or university with major coursework in business administration, computer science, management information systems, or a related field is generally preferred.
Experience and education may be substituted for one another
Valid Texas Driver's License and good driving record.
Must reside in the Austin area or be willing to relocate.

Preferred Qualifications

Background in energy industry, technology and/or science
MBA and/or MS in Computer Science, Engineering or related fields
Experience dealing with oil and gas critical infrastructure
Experience with oil and gas facility weatherization techniques and review
Experience dealing with regulatory processes for example permitting, inspection and/or licensing
Experience with process improvement strategies and methodologies
Proven ability to lead change and design more efficient processes
Proven ability to resolve conflict and deal with challenging situation
Knowledge of forms, workflow, and records design and control procedures.
Knowledge of software development life cycle and systems development life cycle concepts; business and management principles involved in strategic planning, resource allocation, leadership technique, production methods, and coordination of people and resources; and project management principles and practices.
Skill in the use of statistical analysis, analyzing data sets, reporting and data compilation software, work flow modeling software including MS Visio or other similar software, and project planning and management software.
Skill in the use of a computer and applicable software, in conducting data searches, in evaluating and translating large amounts of data, and in critical thinking.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities

Ability to analyze and interpret technical information, including regulations, policies, and automation system documentation/specifications; to communicate in writing; to translate user/business needs into a technical style; to communicate technical instructions to system users; to analyze, evaluate, and integrate business rules into system requirements; to exercise sound judgment in making critical decisions; and to communicate effectively.
Ability to lead diverse activities while maintaining a high degree of efficiency in achieving the commission goals thru consistent, effective assessment and implementation of improvements.
Ability to respond effectively in high priority, high pressure, or highly visible situations (e.g. Elected Official, Legislative, or Executive requests) when necessary and meet changing demands, priorities, and timelines.
Ability to analyze systems and procedures, write and revise standards and procedures, handle multiple projects.
Ability to develop cost-benefit and return on investment analyses; and to document and baseline operational metrics.
Ability to take initiative and work independently.
Ability to address issues/concerns in a professional manner.



Work Hours and Telework: Standard office hours for Commission employees are 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m., Monday through Friday. Our agency offers alternate schedules for employees, as long as it does not adversely affect operations and service levels, and standard hours of operation are maintained. The Commission may also offer telework based on the agency’s approved Telework Plan. Alternate work schedules and telework may be discussed with the hiring manager during the interview process.




APPLICATIONS SUBMITTED THROUGH WORK IN TEXAS: Work In Texas (WIT) applicants must complete the CAPPS Recruit Prescreening Questionnaire to be considered for the posting. Applicants must be authorized to work for ANY employer in the U.S. We are unable to sponsor or take over sponsorship of an employment Visa.

Job Description:
Responsibilities: Interface and liaison with business to define requirements, expertise in business architecture / solutions in ERM

Required Skills: 7+ years of overall relevant industry / domain experience in Risk Regulatory Reporting Banking

Nice to have skills: Industry knowledge of products / solutions in the field Risk Regulatory Reporting

About Virtusa

Teamwork, quality of life, professional and personal development: values that Virtusa is proud to embody. When you join us, you join a team of 36,000 people globally that cares about your growth — one that seeks to provide you with exciting projects, opportunities and work with state of the art technologies throughout your career with us.

Great minds, great potential: it all comes together at Virtusa. We value collaboration and the team environment of our company, and seek to provide great minds with a dynamic place to nurture new ideas and foster excellence.

Virtusa was founded on principles of equal opportunity for all, and so does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status or any other basis covered by appropriate law. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need.

Why USAA?
Let’s do something that really matters.

At USAA, we have an important mission: facilitating the financial security of millions of U.S. military members and their families. Not all of our employees served in our nation’s military, but we all share in the mission to give back to those who did. We’re working as one to build a great experience and make a real impact for our members.

We believe in our core values of honesty, integrity, loyalty and service. They’re what guides everything we do – from how we treat our members to how we treat each other. Come be a part of what makes us so special!

The Opportunity

As a dedicated Business Support Analyst Senior, you will support the Credit Risk-Risk Decision Engine Production Management team, and be responsible for the development and maintenance of Tableau Statistical Process Control reports. Additionally, you will be the Subject Matter Expect for the Experian Sandbox Environment and User Provisioning to support all PCO Stacks.

This position can work remotely in the continental U.S. with occasional business travel.

What you'll do:

Develops and maintains an understanding of overall complex business functions with in-depth knowledge of specific areas/functions and related activities.
Provides expertise in development of business goals and objectives to exploit all distribution channels, leverage use of data, and simplify processes.
Provides operational support on current complex processes and supports business operations and management in identifying opportunities and solutions to meet current and future business needs.
Validates information and interfaces with other departments to include presentations of documented findings, alternatives and recommended actions.
Participates in the planning, research, analysis, development, and implementation of new and modifications to existing applications and processes to provide new or improved capabilities, products, and/or services.
Maintains broad system knowledge, stays current on all system enhancements, identifies training needs and implements plans.
Maintains broad business knowledge, stays current on key business strategies & initiatives and identifies opportunities for support and enablement.
Assists with the documentation of new and revised departmental procedures.
Gathers information for complex processes, analyzes data and trends, identifies root causes, and develops work products.
Serves as a resource to team members on escalated issues of a routine nature.
Reviews and analyzes reports and provides recommendations to improve matrix and reporting controls,
Develops and analyzes additional ad-hoc reports as needed by Management and or Regulatory Agencies.
Contributes on policies, standards, risk management and controls related to relevant processes.
Ensures risks associated with business activities are effectively identified, measured, monitored, and controlled in accordance with risk and compliance policies and procedures.

What you have:

Bachelor's degree; OR 4 years of related experience (in addition to the minimum years of experience required) may be substituted in lieu of degree.
6 years of experience in end-to-end analysis and/or operations experience, including: requirement gathering and documentation, operational planning and forecasting, data analytics, or current/future state analysis, in direct support of business planning initiatives and optimization of business operations.
Advanced knowledge in a wide variety of systems coordination, process/product review initiatives and the development of management information requirements for related business functions.
Knowledge of business operations and systems/business requirements processes.
Experience facilitating and driving collaboration to common understanding of business requirements and driving standard enterprise wide business processes.
Knowledge of business analysis tools for ex: MS Visio MS Excel, Tableau, SQL.

What sets you apart:

5+ years of experience in Tableau report creation
5+ years of experience in Statistical Process Control
5+ years of experience in User Security Provisioning
5+ years of experience working within a Sandbox Environment
US military experience through military service or a military spouse/domestic partner

The above description reflects the details considered necessary to describe the principal functions of the job and should not be construed as a detailed description of all the work requirements that may be performed in the job.

What we offer:

Compensation: USAA has an effective process for assessing market data and establishing ranges to ensure we remain competitive. You are paid within the salary range based on your experience and market data of the position. The actual salary for this role may vary by location. The salary range for this position is: $86,520 - $165,340.

Employees may be eligible for pay incentives based on overall corporate and individual performance and at the discretion of the USAA Board of Directors.

Benefits: At USAA our employees enjoy best-in-class benefits to support their physical, financial, and emotional wellness. These benefits include comprehensive medical, dental and vision plans, 401(k), pension, life insurance, parental benefits, adoption assistance, paid time off program with paid holidays plus 16 paid volunteer hours, and various wellness programs. Additionally, our career path planning and continuing education assists employees with their professional goals.

For more details on our outstanding benefits, please visit our benefits page on USAAjobs.com.

USAA is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

Job Description:

Strategically responsible for providing a holistic view of risks across key enterprise functions and identifying high compliance risks across the enterprise; transforming data into actionable information and plans; improving timeliness of identifying higher risk actions within the enterprise; providing uniform methodology for visualizing risks; engaging key functional areas within the entities to prioritize risk areas of focus; and, providing increased monitoring capabilities regarding issue recurrence and issue mitigation and remediation effectiveness.

Tactically responsible for the following processes: compliance dashboards and other reporting mechanisms throughout the enterprise; compliance data mining, including identifying trends and potential risks using various data modeling and machine learning methodologies; as well as compliance audit standardization.

Required:

Bachelor’s degree and/or equivalent work experience (preferred areas: Business, Computer Science, Economics, Healthcare Administration, Health Information Management, Data Analytics/Science, Mathematics or Statistics).
3-5 years of experience in data science/management, validation, and analysis.
Intermediate to advanced programming/querying proficiency in SQL and Python.
Proficiency in Excel and data visualization and analytics tools such as Tableau, Power BI, and MicroStrategy.
Skilled in effective report/dashboard development.
Ability to communicate technical information to a non-technical audience.

Preferred:

3-5 years of experience in healthcare industry.
Intermediate knowledge of Healthcare Compliance oversight and monitoring concepts.
Intermediate to advanced Programming/querying skills in SQL, R, SAS, Python, etc.
Familiarity with cloud and enterprise data warehouse tools such as Big Query, Azure SQL, SSMS,
Familiarity with enterprise ETL processes.
Knowledge of any Governance, Risk, & Compliance (GRC) program.

Job Title: DATA ANALYST II - FRAUD & ID PROGRAM
Job Description:
It’s about insights that are out of sight

Does deciphering a secret code and discovering its hidden meaning excite you? Would you consider data to be your second language? Do you want the autonomy to improve processes and find solutions? If so, being a Data Acquisition Analyst with Frost could be for you.

At Frost, it’s about more than a job. It’s about having a flourishing career where you can thrive, both in and out of work. At Frost, we’re committed to fostering an environment that reflects our values and encourages team members to be the best they can be. In joining our adaptable, integrity-driven team, you’ll become part of Frost’s over 150-year legacy of providing unparalleled banking services.

Who you are:

As a Data Analyst II – Fraud & ID Program with Frost, you are our data master. In this role, you will provide thoughtful leadership and guidance in deriving value from the organizations' data resources. By turning data into insights, you will help us discover key business initiatives that impact lines of business and customer relationships. You will use your effective communication skills and analytical mindset to act as a liaison in projects or task forces to provide direction, expertise, and support to Data Warehouse Analysts and the Data Community. More than that, this role is about constant improvement and doing so with our signature all-win approach in mind.

What you’ll do:

Provide thought leadership and guidance in deriving value from the organizations' data resources through the effective integration of data warehouse technology and knowledge
Enable the acquisition and conversion of data into insights that support key business initiatives that impact LOB and customer relationships
Act as a liaison in projects or task forces to provide direction, expertise, and support to Data Warehouse Analysts and the Data Community
Facilitate ingestion of external data feeds into the Data Warehouse to supplement current Data Warehouse assets such as credit bureaus, county and state agencies, or third-party vendors
Function as a liaison between end users and vendors to determine business needs and collaborate on workable solutions
Establish standards for requirements gathering, coding, and testing of Data Warehouse deliverables
Provide expertise in a variety of SQL tools and techniques to improve the performance of critical applications and queries
Provide guidance to less experienced Data Acquisition Analysts and ETL programmers
Always take action using Integrity, Caring, and Excellence to achieve all-win outcomes

What you’ll need:

Bachelor's degree in Business, Data Analytics, Statistics or MIS discipline
2+ years of experience in data analytics
Advanced knowledge and skill in SQL tools and techniques
Strong organizational, analytical, and interpersonal skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Proficiency in Microsoft computer applications

Additional Preferred Skills:

Competency with data acquisition methodologies and concepts
Competency with metadata creation and maintenance
Competency with Advanced Analytics or data science
Experience working in agile teams
Experience in the banking industry
Familiar with Fraud analysis and prevention

Our Benefits:

At Frost, we care about your health, your family, and your future and strive to have our benefits reflect that. This includes:

Medical, dental, vision, long-term, and life insurance
401(k) matching
Generous holiday and paid time off schedule
Tuition reimbursement
Extensive health and wellness programs, including our Employee Assistance Program
Referral bonus program + more!

Since 1868, Frost has dedicated their expertise to provide exceptional banking, investment, and insurance services to businesses and individuals throughout Texas. Frost is one of the 50 largest U.S. banks by asset size and is a leader in banking customer satisfaction. At Frost, it’s about being part of something bigger. If this sounds like you, we encourage you to apply and see what’s possible at Frost.

We are seeking a highly motivated Business Product Owner with business analyst experience to work with subject matter experts and stakeholders in developing our supply chain distribution systems. This position requires a proactive, highly motivated individual with an aptitude for creativity, critical thinking, and modeling. This person will be expected to take ownership and drive positive change.

The successful candidate must be a self-starter who is comfortable with ambiguity, is analytical, detail-oriented, and possesses the ability to work well with internal and external cross-functional teams.

Primary Responsibilities:

Develops and executes software quality assurance through the development and maintenance of test plans.
Participate in special projects as requested by management.
Assist in partnering with the business and technical team on solution design with a focus on streamlining workflow and standardizing the event processes.
Assist with solution providers/vendors for gap analysis and plan and prioritize to fill vendor gaps to meet functional requirements.
Assist in partnering with QA team members to optimize defect logging, tracking, prioritization, and remediation.
Provide Post-Production support around enhancements, bug fixes, and new processes.
Provide analytical support.Analyzing data for patterns and trends.

Visualizing data to make it easier to understand.
Presenting data in such a way that it tells a compelling story.
Develop and deploy metrics to answer key business questions.
Communicate complex analysis and insights, both verbally and in writing.

Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Supply Chain, Finance, Computer Information Systems, or other business/analytical disciplines or equivalent experience.
Ability to write detailed use cases and functional requirements and to work with development members to confirm application design.
Ability to write queries and organize data effectively.
Strong data analytics skills to drive rapid decision-making.
Strong self-leadership and interpersonal skills.
Optimistic, self-motivated, and take ownership of deliverables and outcomes in a time-sensitive environment.
Strong written and verbal communication and collaboration skills.

Preferred Qualifications:

Supply Chain knowledge and experience are a plus.
Experience in Agile Methodology.
Experience with forecasting.
Understanding of best practice analysis and visualization techniques.

Benefits:

401(k).
Dental Insurance.
Health insurance.
Vision insurance.
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity, equality, inclusion, and respect for people.
The salary will be determined based on several factors including, but not limited to, location, relevant education, qualifications, experience, technical skills, and business needs.

Additional Responsibilities:

Participate in OrangePeople monthly team meetings, and participate in team-building efforts.
Contribute to OrangePeople technical discussions, peer reviews, etc.
Contribute content and collaborate via the OP-Wiki/Knowledge Base.
Provide status reports to OP Account Management as requested.

About us:
OrangePeople is an Enterprise Architecture and Project Management solutions company. Our most valuable asset is our people: dynamic, creative thinkers, who are passionate about doing quality work. As a member of the OrangePeople team, you will have access to industry-leading consulting practices, strategies & and technologies, innovative training & and education. An ideal Orange Person is a technology leader with a proven track record of technical achievements and a strong process/methodology orientation.

Job Title: Trauma Data and Outcomes Analyst (Must have healthcare exp)
Job Description:
Who We Are
JPS Health Network is a $950 million, tax-supported healthcare system in North Texas. Licensed for 582 beds, the network features over 25 locations across Tarrant County, with John Peter Smith Hospital a Level I Trauma Center, Tarrant County's only psychiatric emergency center, and the largest hospital-based family medical residency program in the nation. The health network employs more than 7,200 people.

Acclaim Multispecialty Group is the medical practice group featuring over 300 providers serving JPS Health Network. Specialties range from primary care to general surgery and trauma. The Acclaim Multispecialty Group formed around a common set of incentives and expectations supporting the operational, financial, and clinical performance
outcomes of the network. Our goal is to provide high quality, compassionate clinical care for every patient, every time.

Why JPS?
We're more than a hospital. We're 7,200 of the most dedicated people you could ever meet. Our goal is to make sure the people of our community get the care they need and deserve. As community stewards, we abide by three Rules of the Road:

1. Own it. Everyone who wears the JPS badge contributes to our journey to excellence.
2. Seek joy. Every day, every shift, we celebrate our patients, smile, and emphasize positivity.
3. Don't be a jerk. Everyone is treated with courtesy and respect. Smiling, laughter, compassion - key components of our everyday experience at JPS.

When working here, you're surrounded by passion, diversity, and dedication. We look forward to meeting you!

For more information, visit www.jpshealthnet.org.
To view all job vacancies, visit www.jpshealthnet.org, www.jpshealthnet.org/careers, or www.teamacclaim.org.




Job Title:


Trauma Data and Outcomes Analyst (Must have healthcare exp)


Requisition Number:


32509

Full Time

TRAUMA & FORENSIC SERVICES


Compensation Type:


Salaried

Business / Professional


Hours Worked:


8:00 AM - 4:30 PM


Location:


John Peter Smith Hospital


Shift Worked:


Day


Job Description:

Job Summary: The Trauma Data & Outcomes Analyst has a direct impact on enhancing healthcare practices and promoting injury prevention. This position plays a vital role in analyzing and interpreting data related to traumatic injuries. The Trauma Data & Outcomes Analyst collects, manages, and analyzes large volumes of trauma data to provide valuable insights and support decision-making in the field of trauma care and injury prevention. This position is responsible for project management and maintaining a good working relationship with all team members and key stakeholders.

Essential Job Functions & Accountabilities:

Collaborates with organizational, regional and state trauma professionals and registries to collect comprehensive trauma data.


Collaborates with the Trauma Registry Manager to ensure the accuracy, integrity, and confidentiality of collected data through meticulous data quality practices.


Develops and maintains databases to store and organize trauma-related information.


Utilizes statistical software and analytical tools to analyze and interpret trauma data.


Identifies patterns, trends, and risk factors associated with traumatic injuries.


Generates reports and visualizations to present data findings effectively to stakeholders.


Collaborates with healthcare teams to identify areas of improvement in trauma care based upon data analysis.


Participates in quality improvement initiatives, providing data-driven recommendations to enhance patient outcomes.


Monitors and evaluates the effectiveness of interventions implemented for trauma care improvement.


Conducts research on trauma-related topics, including new treatment methods, risk factors, and outcomes.


Prepares comprehensive reports, research papers, and presentations based on data analysis findings.


Communicates research findings to healthcare professionals, policymakers, and relevant stakeholders.


Works closely with multidisciplinary teams, including trauma surgeons, nurses, and administrators, to ensure effective data collection and analysis.


Provides training and support to staff members involved in data collection processes.


Stays updated with the latest advancements in trauma data collection methods and analytical techniques.


Creates accurate and meaningful reports for departmental and management decision making using MS Access, MS Excel, and other reporting tools as necessary.



Job description is not an all-inclusive list of duties and may be subject to change with or without notice. Staff are expected to perform other duties as assigned.




Qualifications:


Required Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in relevant field such as statistics, epidemiology, public health, or a related discipline.
Certifications required within 18 months of hire: Certified Specialist in Trauma Registry (CSTR) and Certified Abbreviated Injury Scale Specialist (CAISS).
Minimum of three years’ experience in a health care setting.
Experience conducting analyses on large databases.
Preferred Qualifications:
Master's degree in a relevant field.
Current licensure by the Board of Nurse Examiners for the State of Texas or proof of reciprocity of licensure between the State of Texas and another state.
Experience conducting analyses on large trauma related databases.
Experience in healthcare or trauma related research.
Familiarity with implementing quality methodologies and best practices.

Ability to analyze systems and procedures, write and revise standards and procedures, handle multiple projects.
Ability to develop cost-benefit and return on investment analyses; and to document and baseline operational metrics.
Ability to take initiative and work independently.
Ability to address issues/concerns in a professional manner.

At Jack Henry, we deliver technology solutions that are digitally transforming and empowering community banks and credit unions to provide enhanced and streamlined user experiences to their customers and members. We are currently looking for a Technical Business Analyst to join our Banking Core Development group. As a Technical Business Analyst, you will work with a team of 5 in support of development enhancements to our Silverlake and 20/20 core platforms and other ancillary applications such as our ACH, wires and account analysis and reconciliation functions. This role contributes to the software development process by ensuring complete and accurate documentation of system requirements and serves as a liaison between customers and core and deposit development departments during the product development phase.

This position can be worked remotely within the United States.

What you’ll be responsible for:
Interacts with customers to gather system requirements.
Defines the system and functional requirements of the product.
Prepares business requirements and functional specifications.
Serves as a resource and/or participant in business process re-design activities. Assists the customer in determining if and how system enhancements may improve process flow and business function.
May perform application, system and regression tests.
Responsible for creating business requirements and system documentation, as well as contributing to end-user and project management documentation.
Works with quality assurance and programming teams to ensure changes are migrated into production correctly.
Interacts with technical teams to convey business requirements.
Works with industry research groups to prepare for product trends.
May perform other job duties as assigned.
What you’ll need to have:
Minimum of 4 years of experience with core banking platform in an operational, back office, technical or leadership position within a financial institution.
What would be nice for you to have:
Bachelor’s degree preferred.
Experience with ACH, Account Analysis, Wire or other deposit functions.
Jack Henry Xperience Experience.
Excellent attention to details.
Experience with core banking platforms, Silverlake or 20/20 core platforms strongly preferred.
Experience with R360 or a rewards platform.
Previous experience as a Business Analyst or an Analyst in a bank or FinTech environment.
Strong knowledge of the financial industry.
Strong communication and customer interaction skills.
Strong project management skills.
Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office applications.
Good grammar and writing skills.
Able to define system and functional requirements.
Able to meet aggressive deadlines.
Able to interact with and communicate well with other technical associates.

Summary: The Quality Control Analyst position, under general direction, will be responsible for performing review of routine and non-routine quantitative and qualitative analysis of samples submitted to the Quality Control (QC) Laboratory. The data reviewer is responsible to ensure activities are reviewed in an efficient and cGMP compliant manner.

External US:

Essential Functions:

Review of QC analytical testing for GMP in-process, release and stability testing as needed:
pH, Osmolality, Conductivity & qPCR, RP-HPLC, SEC, Agarose Gel Electrophoresis, UPLC, CE, IEF, Protein Purity Assays, Peptide Mapping, DNA Sequencing and/or UV/Vis Spectrometry preferred
Review technical transfer, qualification and validation protocols as needed.
Review laboratory logbooks and equipment logbooks
Technical Writing to include:
Writes and revises Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) and other Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP) documentation as appropriate.
Qualification protocols
Transfer Protocols
Creating manuals for processes/activities
Sample plans (support & edit)
Assisting and initiating closure of deviations, CAPAs and Change Controls
Reviewing Methods for accuracy:
HPLC, Chromatography (Ion Exchange, SEC, RP-HPLC, Residual Analytes)
Reviews data obtained for compliance to specifications and reports excursion/out of specifications
Provides OOS investigational support as needed.
Perform other duties as assigned.


Required Skills & Abilities:

Ability to review raw data, assess assay and system suitability criteria,
Excellent communication skills.
Ability to work independently or in a team.
Ability to follow safety procedures outlined in the Chemical Hygiene Plan.
Utilize MSDS sheets to properly assess chemical hazards, spill response procedures, and PPE requirements if indicated.
Excellent attention to detail.
Computer proficiency required.
Excellent written and oral communication skills.
Excellent organization and analytical skills.


Working Conditions & Physical Requirements:

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to:

Experience prolonged standing, some bending, stooping, and stretching.
Use hand-eye coordination and manual dexterity sufficient to operate a keyboard, photocopier, telephone, calculator, and other office equipment is required.
Ability to sit for long periods to work on a computer.
Potential for exposure to hazardous chemicals, gases, fumes, odors, mists, and dusts, and other hazardous materials.
Ability to wear personal protective equipment including safety glasses, lab coat, and gloves.
Ability to lift up to 30 pounds on occasion.
Attendance is mandatory.


Minimum Qualifications:

Associates degree preferably in Chemistry, Biochemistry, or a degree in a scientific discipline with 1-2 years of hands on data review experience, and / or laboratory experience in a GMP or GLP environment.


Preferred Qualifications:

Familiar with monoclonal antibody and gene therapy testing methodologies.
Familiar with Empower Software Platform

REPORTS TO: Asst. Superintendent for Non-Instructional Data Quality

WAGE: Exempt

PAYGRADE: Para 9

MIN: $46,646
MID: $54,873

Days per Year: 226


PRIMARY PURPOSE:

Under minimal supervision, the PEIMS Analyst performs work independently in the comprehensive area of collecting and reporting Public Education Information Management System (PEIMS) data management. Utilize software and local, state and federal policies, including but not limited to, State and Federal agencies, such as the Texas Education Agency (TEA) and the Office of Civil Rights (OCR) in order to effectively extract and analyze data. All employees of SISD are expected to act with integrity, support organizational goals, communicate in a clear and respectful manner, champion the needs of our students and drive continuous improvement.

QUALIFICATIONS:

Required:
60 + hours from an accredited college or university or related field or equivalent work experience
Preferred:
Five years’ experience in school business



SPECIAL KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS:
Knowledge of Texas Public School PEIMS Guidelines and TSDS
Skill in interpreting and assisting in implementing the application of law and regulations pertaining to collecting and reporting school district data and understand data in XML format
Ability to maintain confidentiality of privileged and sensitive information
Ability to perform duties with attention to detail, speed accuracy, follow-through, courtesy, cooperativeness and work with minimum supervision.
Efficient data entry skills
Ability to communicate effectively verbally and written utilizing tact and diplomacy and maintain effective working relationships with district personnel and campus staff
Ability to comprehend complex systems and technical information and explain effectively to a wide variety of stakeholders
Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists.
Proficient in the usage of accounting, database software, internet software, email and word processing software
Skills in Windows operating system along with district standard software packages such as: MS Word, MS PowerPoint, Publisher, Excel) and web-based data management systems.
MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES:
PEIMS Reporting/Data Management:

Assist with the central collection of all district PEIMS and related data mandates and submission dates to TEA
Promotes the accurate collections, integration, formatting, and reporting of all data required for PEIMS according to the Texas Student Data Standards
Communicate with TEA and related agencies when needed to clarify or ensure that the district is in compliance with proper recordkeeping and data reporting.
Manage and support TEAL and TREx account applications
Manage and oversee duplicate enrollments
Comply with policies established by federal and state law, State Board of Education rules and local board policies.
Receive and assist with PEIMS/TSDS related information from ESC and TEA and disseminate to other staff in a timely manner, including updates on PEIMS Data Standards and SAAH
Assign state unique IDs as required throughout the school year
Send enrollment tracking files and manage the district’s TSDS email account
Campus Level Data Support:
Assist campuses with establishing and documenting recordkeeping and procedural guidelines for accurate collection and reporting of data
Provide appropriate and related assistance and support to district personnel as needed
Compile, maintain, and file all reports, records and other documents as required including auditable records and statements
District Level Data Support:
Assist other departments and programs with establishing and documenting recordkeeping and procedural guidelines for accurate collection and reporting of data
Assist the Data Management and Compliance Team in planning, organizing and supporting the overall activities of data management needed by the district.
Supports district efforts to respond to data submission audits or audit inquiries from TEA or related entities.



Training/Professional Development:
Assist with creating training materials and provide staff development in proper recordkeeping to support accurate PEIMS reporting.
Proposes and documents procedural guidelines for the accurate collection of student’s enrollment, attendance, and discipline data for PEIMS reporting.
Provide training and support to campuses and to business and personnel office staff responsible for processing PEIMS/TSDS data
Receive advanced training in information security and confidentiality, and the governing state and federal laws, rules and regulations and disseminate appropriately
Receive advanced training in district and other data systems, including the student information system, the financial information system and the human resources information system and proactively adjust procedures for processing PEIMS/TSDS data as needed
Perform all other duties as assigned.

WORKING CONDITIONS:

The usual and customary methods of performing the job’s functions require the following physical demands: physical mobility, standing, prolonged sitting, some lifting, carrying, pushing, and/or pulling. Repetitive motions and prolonged use of computer. This position will also require both in district and statewide travel. Mental demands: Ability to solve problems and deal with a variety of situations; ability to interpret a variety of data; ability to interpret policy; ability to apply knowledge of current research and theory, ability to be effective in both oral and written communication; ability to maintain emotional control under stress. The ability to work with frequent interruptions and independently. Irregular hours as necessary during peak times.


The foregoing statements describe the general purpose and responsibilities assigned to this job and are not an exhaustive list of all responsibilities and duties that may be assigned or skills that may be required.

Works under minimal supervision, with extensive latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgment. Employees at this level may independently perform the most complex professional organizational and policy analysis work. May serve as a team lead or supervisor.



Essential Job Functions:
Collects and analyzes data in areas such as workload, operational, business, and managerial practices; staff utilization; organizational structure and development; and space utilization.

Conducts periodic reviews of HR processes, guides, policy, and procedures.


Researches and provides HR guidance related to HR input on agency data.


Oversees, coordinates, reviews, and recommends human resources personnel actions to ensure compliance with agency, state, and federal regulations for state office management, under the direction of the DFPS HR Director of Operations/Executive Coordinator.

Job Summary:
Our Client, a global leader in the distribution of pipe, valve, and fitting products, is looking for a Business Analyst (with finance, documents, and warehouse professional experience) to join our ERP implementation team. Oracle Fusion ERP will require implementation of B2B integrations (XML/EDI) with banks and A2A integrations (document management and warehouse) within Our Clients application landscape MuleSoft. The ideal candidate will possess strong financial acumen, technical expertise, and exceptional problem-solving skills.

Key Responsibilities:
1. B2B Bank Integrations: Manage the integration of financial systems with various banking platforms, including electronic banking interfaces, online payment gateways, and treasury management systems.
2. A2A Application Integrations: Lead the integration of document management and warehouse applications with ERP (Oracle Fusion) and MuleSoft.
3. Data Analysis: Analyze financial data, transactional information, and related reports to identify opportunities for process improvement and ensure data integrity.
4. Documentation: Create and maintain detailed documentation of integration processes, best practices, and workflows to ensure consistency and knowledge transfer within the team.
5. Quality Assurance: Conduct thorough testing and validation of integrated systems to ensure compliance with regulatory standards, data security, and operational reliability.
6. Issue Resolution: Investigate and resolve any issues related to applications and bank integrations promptly, working closely with internal teams, vendors, and financial institutions.
7. Compliance and Risk Management: Ensure compliance with financial regulations and data security standards. Assist in the development and maintenance of risk management protocols.
8. Collaboration: Collaborate with internal teams, customers, and vendors to facilitate smooth integrations, gather requirements, and manage project timelines.
9. Training: Provide training and support to internal finance and operations teams on integrated systems and best practices.

Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, Business, Information Systems or a related field.
Proven experience as a Business Analyst in a B2B or e-commerce environment.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Knowledge of B2B integration tools and platforms.
Proficiency in data analysis and reporting tools.
Understanding of finance, order processing systems and supply chain processes.
Project management skills.
Ability to adapt to changing technology and industry trends.
Detail-oriented and highly organized.

Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with EDI (Electronic Data Interchange) and API integration.
Experience with Oracle Fusion ERP
Experience with document management applications like OnBase
Experience with middleware applications like MuleSoft, webMethods, etc.
Familiarity with pipe, valve, and fitting products or the industrial distribution industry.

in presenting and implementing recommendations and solutions. Is responsible for developing, coordinating,

implementing, and evaluating data collection and reviewing related to DSRIP reporting to HHSC and E-Clinical Works.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned.

Documents and recommends workflow changes and functional requirements, specifications, and design solutions needed to support the business requirements for common and moderately complex problems. Does this in coordination with the appropriate clinical program / clinical service, region / division, and designated approved end-user advisory group.
Acquires and maintains a moderate understanding of the functional architecture, security, and compliance requirements of assigned systems and integration.
Utilizes appropriate tools to meet ad hoc informational needs. Understands the data model and data use of assigned systems.
Participates with information systems in basic to moderately complex issues, incidents, problems according to agreed upon service levels and according to defined standards and processes. Collaboratively works with peers, information systems, internal and external stakeholders, and vendors.
Collaborates with key clinical and business stakeholders to determine business rules, needs, specifications, feasibility (workflow and cost), and priorities for application development / configuration / acquisition requests and projects with a basic to moderate level of complexity and according to organizational standards and processes. Tableau
Alteryx
BI Tool background

Accounting Department

Exempt

JOB DESCRIPTION SUMMARY

The Inventory Analyst assists in the planning, organizing, measuring, and evaluating stock levels for Joel Osteen Ministries and Lakewood Church. The primary responsibility of this position is to maintain accurate records of inventory, analyze data to forecast demand and optimize inventory management. Additionally, this position requires significant communication with a wide variety of internal and external customers, including third party warehouses and vendor negotiations. It requires an understanding of the operations and objectives of a supply chain management system.

This position reports to the Financial Reporting Manager.

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTION

Conduct various inventory analysis tasks with a working knowledge and understanding of products, purchase orders, and cost management practices
Perform analysis to evaluate inventory levels and make recommendations for the sale, write-off or repurchase of items based on historical trends
Utilize Excel to evaluate quantities based on anticipated cost, historical and anticipated demand levels; streamline appropriate stock levels according to seasonal business highs and lows
Analyze and identify the cause of inventory discrepancies and errors within Microsoft D365 CE & F&O to provide resolutions
Assist and execute inventory strategies to achieve annual inventory turn objectives
Assist with the development of key performance indicators to measure the effectiveness of the inventory management operations
Generate and analyze monthly inventory reports (On hand inventory, sales, cost of sales & fundraising); make decisions and solve problems to optimize inventory based on cost and service level
Positively and professionally represent Lakewood Church to suppliers, communicating company needs and gathering information from them regarding their production schedules
Create, interpret, and present key process measures to management as necessary
Support the Bookstore with inventory functions throughout the year
Other related duties as assigned

MINISTERIAL DUTIES

As an Employee of Lakewood Church, you are a part of an over 60-year legacy of faith. As a part of the Lakewood team, you are a key part of our mission in taking the Hope found in Jesus to the world. This means that as part of your job responsibilities, you are considered a spiritual leader in the Church. You are responsible for communicating the Church’s beliefs and our mission to our congregants, to maintain a lifestyle consistent with the Scriptures, and are required to belong to the Church as part of our faith community. This will also include:

Regular attendance at Church services and classes,
Serving as a Prayer Partner or as a volunteer in any ministry of the Church, and
Serving our community through local outreaches from time to time when needed by the Church

QUALIFICATIONS

Uncompromised commitment to Lakewood Church’s vision, values and core beliefs.
Professional appearance and conduct
Demonstrated Christ like character
Advanced level skills in Outlook, Word, and Excel (Pivot Tables & VLOOKUP Required)
Ability to multi-task and demonstrate effective time management skills
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Ability to create relevant reports and metrics, analyze and problem solve in an intricate supply chain environment
Prior experience with Microsoft Dynamics D365 CE and F&O preferred
Able to lift up to 25 pounds

EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE

College degree in Business or related field, or equivalent work experience
2-3 years of recent related experience in supply chain management

Excellent communication skills, and the ability to interface effectively with all levels of the organization, including senior management teams

Knowledge and application of Project Management principles
Demonstrated ability to recognize problems and recommend solutions, leveraging strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Collaborative and data driven with strong analytical and technical skills

Creative and innovative thinker with an ability to translate large, complex data into simple, actionable recommendations
Ability to influence conversations and work through building of relationships, thoughtful framing of issues, and building influence through excellent work
A constant example of modeling Crown’s PURPLE values

Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Business Analytics, Business Administration, or related field

Experience/Minimum Requirements

Five (5)+ years’ of work experience with a proven data and analytical-driven mindset and track record for analyzing moderately complex problems and synthesizing insights into actionable recommendations
Five (5)+ years’ of wireless/tower industry experience within data analytics and/or project management preferred, not required
Demonstrated ability to prioritize, organize and work effectively on multiple complex requests/projects in a deadline-driven environment
Expertise with Microsoft Excel, visualization tools (e.g., Power BI)
Strong experience with data mining principles and tools, including knowledge of predictive analytics and mapping

Organizational Relationship

Working Conditions: This role falls into our hybrid work model working in the office on Monday through Thursday. On Fridays, teammates on the hybrid schedule will have the option to work from the office or home. There is an expectation of collaboration with teammates and stakeholders for moments that matter that could require travel.

Additional Information: We offer a total benefits package and professional growth development for teammates in any stage of their career. Along with caring for our teammates, we’re an active member in the communities where we live, work and do business. We have a responsibility to give back, which we do through our Connected by Good program. Giving back allows us to improve public spaces where people connect, promote public safety and advance access to education and technology.

We are looking for a highly motivated business data analyst to work with subject matter experts and stakeholders in developing our supply chain scheduling systems. This position requires a proactive, highly motivated individual with an aptitude for creativity, critical thinking, and modeling. This person will be expected to take ownership and drive positive change.

The successful candidate must be a self-starter who is comfortable with ambiguity, is analytical, detail-oriented, and possesses the ability to work well with internal and external cross-functional teams.

Provide analytical support.

Strong data analytics skills to drive rapid decision-making.
Excellent presentation, interpersonal, and organizational skills.

Experience managing projects through different software development lifecycles including Waterfall and Agile.
Proven experience developing, implementing, and supporting business intelligence and data visualization tools including Tableau, PowerBI, or similar for large datasets.

Preferred Qualifications:
