The Judiciary Budget Analyst performs evaluations, assesses performance measures reports, develops budget and policy recommendations, communicates in writing and orally, and works on special projects for the Legislative Budget Board relating to the Judicial Branch of the state of Texas.

The position reports to the Judicial Manager and works under general supervision, with moderate latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgment.

Essential Responsibilities

Examine budgets/requests to assess whether funds are appropriately allocated, budgeted and expended as directed.
Develop budget and policy recommendations and accurately reflecting them in information systems as directed.
Identify funding adjustments as necessary to improve operations or conform to targeted spending levels as directed.
Identify and inform management of budget/policy issues and providing concise explanations and options for resolution.
Collect, organize and analyze data and preparing written materials, including publications, as directed.
Conduct quality assurance procedures to produce accurate and complete work products as directed.
May represent the agency at external meetings/events and then provide written or oral summaries of key issues.
May orally present and explain recommendations to LBB management, legislative committees and others.
May plan and conduct research projects and field studies, write, and edit reports suitable for publication or may be assigned to assist other staff in completing these tasks.
May develop procedures and tools to implement plans/programs and measure/report progress. Read legislation to determine if there are potential fiscal impacts.
Prepare written fiscal and policy analyses of legislation.
Provide assistance in preparing riders and amendments for General Appropriations Bills and other legislation as directed.
Assign legislation with potential fiscal impacts to appropriate agencies and LBB analysts. Review and edit fiscal notes. May serve as lead analyst and writer on selected fiscal notes.
Coordinate fiscal note production through effective communication and stakeholders (legislators, committee directors and staff, agency contacts, and LBB analyst and management).
Ensure that fiscal notes are distributed within the deadlines established by the appropriate legislative chamber and/or committee.
Contribute to agency projects and perform related work as assigned.

Essential Attributes and Skills

Work effectively with LBB and assigned agency management and staff, and legislators/legislative staff.
Think critically, take initiative and use good judgment.
Communicate professionally in writing and orally (including presentations in formal and information settings).
Create timely, relevant, accurate, and polished work products.
Complete tasks with appropriate levels of independence and attention to detail.
Use business tools successfully (i.e. Word, Excel, Access, Google Chrome, email, customized applications, desktop pc, laptop/tablet, and smart phone).
Analyze, synthesize, and summarize quantitative and qualitative information.
Identify alternatives and make recommendations supported with evidence.
Maintain confidential and sensitive information and follow agency protocols.
Understand legislative/budget processes and budget, performance, and operations of assigned agency.
Work at a computer and desk for extended periods of time.

Attributes Required of Every LBB Employee:

Embrace agency mission/core values and follow policies, procedures, and processes.
Work effectively with LBB management and staff, as well as all external customers.
Coordinate, collaborate, and employ good interpersonal skills; demonstrate positive outlook.
Balance concurrent projects, work under pressure, and adapt to changing priorities/deadlines.
Act with motivation, organization, and attention to details; complete tasks with an appropriate level of independence.
Be punctual and have regular attendance.
Work overtime on nights, weekends, and holidays, as necessary to meet agency deadlines.

Education and Experience:

Graduation with a baccalaureate degree from a regionally accredited college or university is required.
Earned graduate degree is preferred.
Coursework or degree in public policy or administration, program evaluation, budgeting, quantitative/qualitative research, finance, accounting, economics, natural resources, law, legal research or a related field is preferred.
Two years of progressively responsible experience in a relevant policy area is preferred.

Supplemental Information

To apply for this position, you may apply directly through the posting selected on our website, which will redirect you to NeoGov or go to website https://www.governmentjobs.com/js_login.cfm. Human Resources will not be able to retrieve your credentials or reset your password. Only on-line applications will be accepted via NeoGov.

Examples of an applicant's work product and/or copies of transcripts may be required as condition of interview. Finalist may be given a work-related exercise. The person hired may be required to submit official transcripts. Credentials earned at foreign colleges and/or universities must have been evaluated by an acceptable entity and must be equivalent to credentials awarded by U.S. regionally accredited institutions of higher education.

The person hired may not simultaneously be employed by the Legislative Budget Board (LBB) and another state agency or Texas public institution of public/higher education. Any job offer from the LBB is contingent upon proof of eligibility/authorization to work in the United States on a full-time basis and proof of compliance with the Selective Service Law for males between the ages of 18 and 25.

LBB is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate in employment or in the provision of services on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, or disability. Applicants should communicate requests for disability-related accommodations during the application process to LBB Human Resources at HR@LBB.state.tx.us

Job Title: Senior Policy and Data Research Analyst
Job Description:
**Candidates are highly encouraged to officially apply through the company's application system at:

https://capps.taleo.net/careersection/304/jobdetail.ftl?job=00037908&tz=GMT-05:00

About the Comptroller's Office
Innovation, collaboration, and a commitment to excellence best describes the culture here at the Comptroller's Office. We take pride in the work we do serving as Texas' accountant, tax collector, treasurer, and much more!

Culture
Our agency workforce is as diverse as the people of Texas we serve. We value our employees and take very seriously our collective commitment to public service. Personal development opportunities are strongly encouraged through available workshops, teambuilding exercises, and on the job training. We offer flexible scheduling that helps employees maintain a healthy work-life balance.

If you are seeking to gain knowledge, build your career, and network among goal-oriented professionals, this is the place for you!

General description
We’re looking for a Senior Policy and Data Research Analyst to join our Data Analysis team in the Data Analysis and Transparency division to provide accurate, data-driven, unbiased economic research on relevant issues affecting the Texas economy. Your day-to-day will involve policy and data analysis to support the Comptroller’s fiduciary responsibilities, to facilitate sound decision-making by state lawmakers and agencies and to inform the public. As a Senior Policy and Data Research Analyst, you will write articles for publication on important economic matters affecting the state, produce legislatively mandated reports and update databases to help Texas citizens stay continuously informed. You will conduct research to provide agency leadership and other divisions with information necessary for public engagement. As a Senior Policy and Data Research Analyst you may serve as project manager for Data Analysis team projects and reports.

This position is part of a team of people who are open-minded, collaborative, adaptable and dedicated to getting the numbers right. You would be a great fit for this role if you are self-motivated, resourceful, have leadership abilities and can deliver results as a sole contributor and as part of a team.

This position may be eligible for a flexible/hybrid work schedule if certain conditions are met; working arrangements may change at any time as business necessitates.

Work Hours
40 hours a week between the hours of 7 a.m. – 6 p.m. with occasional evening, weekend, and holiday hours. Hours may change based on business needs, especially during legislative sessions. This position may be eligible for a flexible/hybrid work schedule if certain conditions are met; working arrangements may change at any time as business necessitates.

Qualifications - External

Minimum Qualifications

Bachelor's degree.
Seven (7) years full-time experience in writing, research and planning, data analysis, financial analysis, and/or policy development relating to general government programs.

Preferred Qualifications

Master's degree with major course work in public affairs, public administration, government, economics, research methodology, sociology, journalism, education, English or related field.
Experience analyzing Texas state finances and appropriations.
Experience performing economic analyses and using statistical software.
Experience managing projects, including project planning, developing project timelines and independently managing multiple team members.
Experience researching, writing and editing articles and/or research reports.
Experience with cross-agency and inter-agency related work.

Substitutions
A master's degree with major course work in public administration, history, research methodology, sociology, economics, or related field may substitute for two (2) years of experience working in research and planning, data analysis, policy development relating to general government programs.

In this role you will:

Plans, coordinates, conducts, and administers data analysis and research projects. Develops plans, policies and procedures for data analysis and research projects. Designs studies and methodologies. Oversees the methods of analysis and the presentation of results, including written reports. Reviews and organizes data collection and applies statistical methods. Oversees the methods of analysis and the presentation of results, for printed and Web-based reports. Reviews and organizes data collection and applies statistical methods. Writes reports or articles on data analysis and research projects. May lead small teams on data analysis projects.
Prepares estimated project completion timelines, maintains records of work accomplished, time expended and prepares necessary reports. Instructs employees on specific tasks, job techniques and makes available written instructions and reference material. Provides input on team member performance to division manager for evaluation purposes. Translates complex data and information into relevant and valuable content for public and internal publications. Monitors trends in data tools, concepts and technologies. Analyzes economic trends affecting Texans and explains these in an understandable form for printed and Web-based agency publications.
Prepares and presents reports for print and online publication. Reviews data, legislation, regulations, and policies to determine impact. Evaluates findings relative to specific projects. Monitors consultant contracts. Provides input to and prepares correspondence, speeches, articles, press releases, reports, etc. Delivers presentations to outside groups and individuals. Testifies at hearings and legislative meetings. Drafts and reviews legislation, as requested by management. Drafts fiscal notes and determines administrative costs for pending legislation, as requested by management. Monitors legislative hearings of interest as appropriate.
Prepares and provides work status briefings to management. Works with other federal, state, and local agencies, legislators and/or constituents. May train, lead, assign and/or prioritize the work of others.
Performs other related duties as assigned.

The Comptroller's Office is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity.

BigCommerce's mission is to help merchants sell more at every stage of growth, from small startups, to mid-market businesses to large enterprises. We focus on being the best ecommerce platform so our customers can focus on what matters most: growing their businesses.

We are equally passionate about growing our employee's careers and providing them an incredible experience as we rapidly expand across the globe. We are proud to have been recognized numerous times for our product and workplace culture. We empower our people and customers to build, innovate and grow, so together we can redefine the ecommerce industry.

BigCommerce is disrupting the e-commerce industry as the SaaS leader for fast- growing, mid-market businesses. We enable our customers to build intuitive and engaging stores to support every stage of their growth.

BigCommerce seeks an analytics expert with exceptional interpersonal savvy, systems thinking, and collaborative leadership skills to build infrastructure and expand the impact of our Analytics function. This person will be a key analytical leader and builder during an exciting growth period for BigCommerce filled with change and opportunities to make an impact. This leader will be the advocate for analytics across BC.

What You'll Do
Spearhead the design and development of streamlined dashboards that synthesize complex data into actionable visualizations, enabling quick and informed decision-making by cross-functional teams
Bring industry best practices for efficiency in design and impact in data visualization to the forefront and inspire and lead others to do the same
Proactively identify gaps in corporate data insights and recommend a prioritized roadmap to address them
Partner closely with Operations Executives (up to and including COO) and Strategic Operations teams to understand key challenges and opportunities in a demanding environment, as well as provide insightful recommendations in a concise, absorbable manner
Collaborate with business stakeholders to develop and maintain a deep understanding of business levers that require measurement and controls
Translate stakeholder requirements into precise technical specifications, ensuring seamless communication between business needs and data-driven solutions
Work closely with data engineers, business application administrators, and other stakeholders to ensure reliable data collection and measurement capabilities that all teams will benefit from
Foster a culture of repeatability, scalability, and sharing amongst data-centric teams at BC, with a goal of building sustainable tools and processes that will last well into the future
Work independently to constantly identify and mitigate risks to schedule, scope, and resources while balancing competing priorities across multiple initiatives and stakeholder requests
Design and conduct statistical analyses of business performance in order to optimize and improve investment
Identify trends in data and provide recommendations on how to respond
Mentor less experienced team members and help them develop their technical skillsets
Who You Are
6+ years in a data/analytics role using advanced SQL to analyze large datasets and answer business questions
Deep expertise with business intelligence tools including data visualization, dashboard strategy, and backend optimization (Tableau, Looker, or Periscope Data preferred)
Exposure to Python or similar scripting or programming languages
Experience with eCommerce and/or SaaS subscription models and related metrics a plus
Strong business acumen, critical thinking skills, operational, and interpersonal savvy
Demonstrated ability to apply statistical models and techniques to business problems
Knowledge of digital marketing analytics, website tracking and related technologies (experience with Google Analytics, Segment, Optimizely and/or Marketo a plus)
Experience with company financials, assessing overall financial health a plus
An energetic and creative problem solver who couples a scientific quantitative approach with business acumen
Curious, hungry, absorbs information quickly and seeks answers in a tactful and efficient way
An engaged, people person with experience in cross-functional roles and indirect influencing with impeccable verbal and written communication skills
Ambitious, self-motivated, goal-oriented, proactive, comfortable independently solving problems despite ambiguity and collaborating as necessary
A builder, a person who enjoys creating infrastructure to help teams unlock their best work
Excellent verbal/written communication and interpersonal relationship skills
Ambitious, self-motivated, goal-oriented and analytical
Excellent time-management skills
A bachelor's degree in a quantitative field (Statistics, Math, Business Administration, Finance, Economics), or applicable career experience

#LI-LP1

$104,500—$145,000 USD

Our employees make the difference. With nearly two decades of international expertise, Link2USA has helped hundreds of global companies thrive by connecting the most qualified professionals with the most innovative worldwide firms. We are proud to partner with leaders in the fields of Cybersecurity, Adtech, Fintech, Shared Economy, Big Data, Business Intelligence, IoT, Information Technology, ConTech, InsurTech, Software Technologies (DevOps), and more (backed by the most prominent Investment and VC firms). Who we are currently partnered with:



We are an outdoor lifestyle brand dedicated to engineering high-quality products! Our primary focus is coolers, drinkware, and outdoor gear that are overbuilt but not overpriced! As an organization, we prioritize teamwork and value the contributions of every team member. Your work with us will have a direct impact on how we serve our customers.

As a Marketing Data Analyst, you'll report directly to the Chief Data Officer. you will be responsible for leveraging your technical expertise and analytical skills to optimize digital marketing strategies and drive customer acquisition, engagement, and retention for our direct-to-consumer channels. You will play a pivotal role in analyzing complex data sets, implementing advanced tracking methodologies, and leveraging cutting-edge digital tools to improve our brand's online presence, maximize return on investment (ROI), and enhance the overall customer experience.

What You'll Be Doing Everyday…

Data Analysis and Insights:

Conduct in-depth analysis of digital marketing campaigns using tools such as Google Analytics, Looker, Tableau and BigQuery, providing actionable insights to optimize marketing efforts.
Design, plan and execute experiments, including A/B tests, match-market tests and incrementality tests.
Analyze promotional campaigns, product launches and seasonal events.
Utilize statistical modeling techniques, such as regression analysis and cohort analysis, to identify patterns, trends, and opportunities for campaign optimization.

Marketing Optimization:

Collaborate with the marketing team to strategize, execute, and optimize performance marketing campaigns across platforms such as Google Ads, Facebook Ads, and other relevant channels.
Running incrementality tests and developing our attribution model to appropriately determine where to spend our next dollar
Running hold out market tests to evaluate impact of awareness/upperfunnel campaigns
Partner with the marketing team to define core metrics from which to understand marketing success and drive daily actions.
Collaborate with the CRM team to develop data-driven email marketing campaigns, leveraging behavioral triggers and segmentation strategies to optimize customer communication.
Implement advanced customer journey analysis, funnel analysis, and predictive modeling techniques to identify opportunities for improving customer experiences and maximizing customer lifetime value.

Reporting, Visualization, and Automation:

Develop and maintain automated reporting processes using data visualization tools such as Tableau and Looker, to deliver regular reports and dashboards on key digital marketing metrics and KPIs.
Provide advanced data visualizations and storytelling techniques to effectively communicate complex insights to stakeholders.
Identify opportunities to automate data collection, reporting, and analysis processes, leveraging APIs, scripts, and automation tools.

What You'll Need…

Bachelor's degree in marketing, computer science, statistics, or a related field (preferred not required).
3+ years experience as a digital marketing analyst or similar role, with a strong technical focus, preferably within the D2C industry.
Experience with attribution models, incrementality testing, metrics development, and hold out market tests.
Expertise in using tools such as Google Analytics, Tableau, Looker, and BigQuery..
Proficiency in data manipulation and analysis using programming languages such as Python, R, and SQL.
In-depth knowledge of digital advertising platforms (e.g., Google Ads, Facebook Ads) , as well as Email / SMS tools (e.g. Klaviyo, Attentive) and customer data platforms
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and critical-thinking skills, with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.
Strong project management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks, manage multiple projects simultaneously, and meet deadlines.

What We Offer…

Employee discounts
Health benefits include: medical, dental, vision, and mental health
Disability insurance
Life insurance
Paid parental leave
Tuition and professional development assistance
Paid holidays
PTO
401(k) with a company match and immediate vesting!

Description:

Company Overview:

We are looking for a roll-up-your-sleeves and do-what-it-takes mentality for this

position. Southern Champion is a fun, family-owned alcohol beverage company in

Carrollton, Texas. Great benefits in a fast-growing company.

As Sales Operations Analyst, you will ensure the company’s supply meets the customers’ demand. Your duties

include overseeing the company’s supply chains, ensuring timely delivery and keeping the company on

budget.

Requirements:
Sales Operations Analysts improve the efficiency of supply chain operations through data collection and
analysis. Utilize interpersonal and problem-solving skills to gather information from different departments and external sources to recommend ways of improving the supply chain to our customers.
Specific Sales Operations Analyst duties:
Collect data on sales operations as it relates to sales order demand.
Identify and assess customers’ needs to achieve satisfaction.
Keep records of customer interactions, process customer accounts and file documents
Analyze data to identify areas of sales operations to improve efficiency.
Develop and execute projects to enhance supply chain operations.
Build sustainable business relationships and trust with Distributor Buyers through open and interactive communication.
Establish and maintain internal professional relationships with Logistics and Sales teams.
Assess distributor operations and enforce compliance with order standards.
Provide accurate, valid, and complete information by using the correct methods/tools.
Follow communication procedures, guidelines, and policies.
Measure sales operations performance and report to management.
Other duties as assigned.
Must have 2 years of experience.
Bachelor's degree or equivalent.

Overview

Who we are

Collaborative. Respectful. A place to dream and do. These are just a few words that describe what life is like at Toyota. As one of the world’s most admired brands, Toyota is growing and leading the future of mobility through innovative, high-quality solutions designed to enhance lives and delight those we serve. We’re looking for diverse, talented team members who want to Dream. Do. Grow. with us.

An important part of the Toyota family is Toyota Financial Services (TFS), the finance and insurance brand for Toyota and Lexus in North America. While TFS is a separate business entity, it is an essential part of this world-changing company - delivering on Toyota's vision to move people beyond what's possible. At TFS, you will help create best-in-class customer experiences in an innovative, collaborative environment.

To save time applying, Toyota does not offer sponsorship of job applicants for employment-based visas or any other work authorization for this position at this time.

Who we're looking for


The Analytics & Risk Management teams at Toyota Financial Services are looking for a highly motivated and detail-oriented Senior Analyst to join the Analytics Job Family; someone who shares our passions for data, creative problem solving, and continuous improvement.

This role will be embedded within a specific business unit with the primary responsibility of delivering real-time insights and rapid turnaround analysis for the assigned business unit. Candidates should be as comfortable quickly packaging and presenting their ideas to leadership as they are analyzing complex data sets, creating insightful visualizations and writing SQL/R/Python code.

Leaders across the Analytics Job Family are committed to creating an engaging space for talented individuals to grow their careers and do their best work. Successful candidates will need to possess high levels of innate curiosity, persistence, resourcefulness, initiative, aptitude for learning complex topics quickly and a desire to make a tangible impact and grow within the Analytics Job Family.

What is the Analytics Job Family

The posting for the Analytics Job Family serves to help fill open "technical analytics” roles across a wide array of TFS business units including:

Analytics

Business includes sales, marketing, wholesale/remarketing metrics

Finance includes profitability and performance metrics

Insurance and voluntary protection products

Pricing of retail and lease products

Data Analysis

Support business units with analytical initiatives & data exploration

Risk Management

Residual Value risk from vehicle valuations

Commercial risk from dealership loans

Credit risk from consumer loans

Note that specific job postings may also be available for other roles in these business units which are outside of the Analytics Job Family.

What you'll be doing

Become a subject matter expert for the business unit by developing a comprehensive understanding of how the department’s strategies, data, and systems work together for the benefit of our stakeholders and customers.

Develop actionable insights through data analysis, synthesis of disparate data sources, creative problem solving and collaboration with key stakeholders across the Analytics Job Family and the broader Toyota organization incl. Sales, Finance, Marketing, Servicing, Manufacturing, Data Science, etc.

Use SQL, R and/or Python to clean and structure data prior to analysis.

Propose actions to department, executive and international audiences through effective storytelling / presentations (PowerPoint), data visualizations (Tableau, Power BI), and clear written / verbal communication.

Build your analytical, technical, communication, and people skills through training, mentorships, and on-the-job experience for advancement into analytical leadership roles.

As this posting covers an array of different positions, frequency/depth of above activities may vary.


What you bring

Bachelor’s degree or higher in Analytics, Statistics, Finance, Accounting, Math, Computer Science, Economics, Engineering, or similar analytical / STEM field

3+ years of relevant professional work experience (paid, non-academic, non-intern)

Demonstrated experience with both coding and analysis tools (SQL, R, Tableau, Python and/or similar) and a high level of proficiency with both Excel and PowerPoint (testing of coding and analytic abilities will be conducted as part of the application process)

Working knowledge of statistics and modelling techniques with experience identifying trends and indicators through quantitative/qualitative analysis

Project management and presentation skills including proposing strategic recommendations to management and clearly articulating technical concepts to non-technical audiences.

Possess both the curiosity and resourcefulness needed to master complex concepts, methods, and systems in order to improve existing processes and develop creative solutions to new business challenges.

Ability to be self-directed and work independently while in a hybrid work environment. While these roles are predominantly work from home, team members are required to join us in-person at our Plano, TX headquarters on a regular basis.

Added bonus if you have

MBA or Master’s degree in an analytical field

Background in Auto Finance or Consumer Lending industries

Professional experience in one or more areas of the Analytics Job Family (see list above)

Intermediate to advanced statistics knowledge

Note that specific job postings may also be available for other roles in these business units which are outside of the Analytics Job Family.

What we’ll bring

During your interview process, our team can fill you in on all the details of our industry-leading benefits and career development opportunities. A few highlights include:

A work environment built on teamwork, flexibility, and respect.

Professional growth and development programs to help advance your career, as well as tuition reimbursement.

Vehicle purchase & lease programs.

Comprehensive health care and wellness plans for your entire family.

Flexible work options based on business needs.

Toyota 401(k) Savings Plan featuring a company match, as well as an annual retirement contribution from Toyota regardless of whether you contribute

Paid holidays and paid time off

Referral services related to prenatal services, adoption, childcare, schools and more

Tax Advantaged Accounts (Health Savings Account, Health Care FSA, Dependent Care FSA)

Relocation assistance (if applicable).

Belonging at Toyota

Interested in a career with both meaning and growth? Whether your abilities are in direct patient care or one of the many other areas of healthcare administration and support, everyone at Parkland works together to fulfill our mission: the health and well-being of individuals and communities entrusted to our care. By joining Parkland, you become part of a diverse healthcare legacy that’s served our community for more than 125 years. Primary Purpose
The individual in the Business Intelligence Specialist role is a project leader, recognizing timelines and priorities, and organizing the work efforts of both small initiatives and departmental improvements. The BI Specialist may be entrusted with resources and personnel to complete objectives without supervision. In general, the BI Specialist has reached a level of mastery across multiple disciplines in the data management field which allows the ability to see big picture consequences to make tactical decisions. The BI Specialist generally has a strong interest or specific advanced knowledge of a complex concept or tool that is critical for the department, and often serves as the top-level technical expert in one of more highly specialized areas of systems analysis and reporting. The BI Specialist is expected to have strong time and project management skills, to have advanced speaking and communications skills, and to have the ability to think outside the box when designing solutions to both customer and departmental challenges. The BI Specialist proactively identifies areas of improvement within their scope of knowledge. The BI Specialist has attained a level of advanced knowledge or training to work independently not only on tasks assigned by supervisors, but also on problems outside the scope of daily work activities.


Minimum Specifications


Education
Must have a bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business Administration, or a related field.
Masters preferred.


Experience
Must have six years of experience using Business Intelligence (BI) tools, including Crystal reporting, WEBi reporting and dashboards.
Must have six years of SQL (Structured Query Language) server-based SQL coding or Oracle PL-SQL (Procedural Language/Structured Query Language) experience.
Must have a minimum of two years as a subject matter expert in a single reporting or data discipline.
Prefer previous experience within a healthcare organization.
Prefer previous experience with an Electronic Medical Record (EMR) application such as Eclipsys, Epic, Clarity, or Epic within a healthcare organization.


Equivalent Education and/or Experience
May have an equivalent combination of education and experience to substitute for both the education and the experience requirements.


Certification/Registration/Licensure
Prefer related certification(s) in Epic and/or Clarity.
Prefer related certification(s) in SAP data reporting.
Prefer related certification(s) in Cisco data management.
Prefer Category I Project Management Professional (PMP) certification by the Project Management Institute (other project management training considered).


Skills or Special Abilities
Must have an expert level knowledge of SQL (Structured Query Language) / Oracle relational and multi-dimensional database structures, schemas, stored procedures, views, and queries.
Must be able to build and run SQL queries, Crystal reports, and use other reporting tools.
Must have an expert level knowledge of Reporting and Analytics.
Must have expert level knowledge regarding EMR, word processing, database, and spreadsheet software.
Must have an expert level knowledge of commonly used programming concepts, practices, and procedures within the Information Technology field.
Must have advanced knowledge of critical tools and concepts and can explain these concepts to others on the team.
Must have strong analytic and computer skills in addition to an extensive knowledge of database management and data analysis.
Must be able to develop system specifications and decision flows, in the form of flow charts or equivalent techniques, from written business requirements.
Must have experience with data modeling, warehouse design and virtual universe structures.
Must be able to demonstrate critical thinking skills, about system issues.
Must demonstrate an understanding of patient data and the use of this data in a healthcare environment, as applicable.
Must be able to accept verbal and/or written problems or direction from senior staff and business users and demonstrate an ability to prepare specifications that reflect provided information (with coaching from senior personnel).
Must have exceptional planning skills with a results-oriented record of achievement and the ability to set goals, meet deadlines, and evaluate results particularly regarding significant changes within an organization and with respect to the organization’s relationship with the community or marketplace.
Must have a high level of attention to detail, can manage multiple projects at once, and be able to demonstrate excellent analytical, organization and prioritization skills.
Must have excellent verbal and written communication skills to interact effectively with customers, team members and IT management.
Must be a quick learner. Good analytical and problem-solving skills.
Must be able to work in a team environment and have strong interpersonal skills.
Must be able to demonstrate excellent time management skills and management reporting skills.
Must be able to demonstrate excellent discernment and assessment in professional decision-making.
Must be an independent worker and self-starter, having the ability to provide internal motivation and drive.
Must set high standards of performance for self.


Responsibilities
Performs root cause analysis or configuration overview for clinical leadership and succinctly and accurately relay findings or information as well as recommendations to leadership as needed.
Proactively identifies areas for improvement in applications and develop solutions for those problems outside of leadership-assigned projects or tasks.
Serve as a mentor for senior and intermediate analysts, providing them feedback on protocols, procedures, and other processes in place at Parkland.
Organizes the work effort for large initiatives (such as Meaningful Use, New Parkland Hospital, Epic Upgrade, 1115 Waiver, etc.) and ensures that timelines are met and that projects are implemented successfully.
Leads the design, development, and implementation of complex customer analytic solutions by applying an expert level understanding of Business Intelligence best practices
Applies an expert knowledge and understanding in systems and data analysis to conduct in-depth evaluation of source system data and processes. Uses industry standard data modeling and reporting tools to generate richly documented, creatively designed data models, reports, and other content as requested by leadership.
Facilitates communication and problem resolution with physicians & staff in both inpatient and outpatient settings.
Documents each step of development to ensure adequate communication within the team and customers.
Actively provides prompt responses to customer problems and inquiries. Makes the customer’s experience the priority in all operations.
Resolves ITSM incidents and requests independently within SLA timelines. Takes ownership and resolves complicated/code intensive incidents and requests.
Performs upgrades and/or routine maintenance for the report writing team.
Mentors and trains other team members by introducing them to new technologies, methods, and learning resources.
Handles conflict between team members, utilizing diplomacy, without allowing personal feelings to influence or impact the outcome negatively.
Models’ behavior for team members by following all department procedures (Weekly Status Reports, Customer Delivery, Customer Communications, Request Creation, etc.)


Job Accountabilities
Identifies ways to improve work processes and improve customer satisfaction. Makes recommendations to supervisor, implements, and monitors results as appropriate in support of the overall goals of the department and Parkland.
Stays abreast of the latest developments, advancements, and trends in the field by attending seminars/workshops, reading professional journals, actively participating in professional organizations, and/or maintaining certification or licensure. Integrates knowledge gained into current work practices.
Maintains knowledge of applicable rules, regulations, policies, laws, and guidelines that impact the area. Develops effective internal controls designed to promote adherence with applicable laws, accreditation agency requirements, and federal, state, and private health plans. Seeks advice and guidance as needed to ensure proper understanding.

We are recruiting for a Principal IT Disaster Recovery Analyst to join our team in Dallas, TX or Miramar, FL in a contract to hire role. Candidate must be in or willing to relocate to Dallas, TX, or Miramar, FL when hired on full-time as the position will become hybrid. The position focuses on enabling the IT Disaster Recovery process and providing expertise in D/R concepts, plan authoring, validation and testing of critical systems. The role is highly focused on the development, delivery and maintenance of technical and complex Ransomware planning and the support of simulation tests and tabletop exercises.

Responsibilities

· Coordinates with various information technology and business groups to identify critical systems and dependencies, and the potential vulnerabilities and risks that could result in catastrophic impact.

· Coordinates and executes Ransomware Rebuild simulation tests, documents results recovery time capabilities, issues, and resolutions through post-testing analysis.

· Serves as tertiary back-up during tabletop exercises or actual catastrophic disaster recovery or business continuity events.

· Gather and analyze data. Interpret gathered data.

· Submit reports to the relevant department heads and management

· Formulate procedural manuals if required

· Collaborates with business and IT stakeholders to identify, analyze, understand and prioritize activities by business value and urgency.

· Develops consultative partnerships with internal teams and leaders to understand their strategic objectives, key performance indicators and reporting requirements.

· Supports communications, meetings, and other collaborations as appropriate to effectively perform work and to understand, resolve, and/or mitigate risks, issues, obstacles, and conflicts

· Collaborate cross-functionally to enhance overall delivery of reporting across the business units and within the department.

· Establish and collect KPI to measure business value delivered by projects and solutions.

· Present to leadership recommendations on opportunities

· Lead the education and training of end users, working to increase end user proficiency and adoption of implemented solutions

· Understand, communicate and reinforce standard process concepts and methodology within the ETP organization

· Develop opportunities to automate ETP processes and functions

· Communicate systems and procedural changes to end users through excellent written and oral communications

· Monitor, coordinate metrics and act on exceptions to address issue

Requirements:

· Bachelor’s Degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or equivalent work experience

· Strong understanding of Ransomware recovery and architecture of Isolated Recovery Environments

· Subject matter expertise in IT Disaster Recovery with a minimum of 3 years of Disaster Recovery experience

· 3+ years of experience with developing / testing recovering strategies for cloud (IaaS / SaaS) based applications

· 3 + years of experience with automation and orchestration tools for recovering applications at alternate locations

· Working knowledge of recovery tools such as SRM and Zerto

· Strong project manager skills with 5+ years of hands on experience

· Experience developing business impact analysis documents

· Strategic mindset to lead recovery strategy planning efforts

· Demonstrated ability to coordinate complex integrated disaster recovery exercises

· Thorough knowledge of data management in order to assist in the preparation of recovery procedures

· Experience with Office 365, Teams and SharePoint

· Strong Visio, technical writing, and project management skills

· Can analyze an issue and troubleshoot

· Responsible for mentorship of junior team members

· Proficient change management skills

· Preferred ITIL v3 foundation certification

· Experience in Support and Incident, Problem, Event and Change Management

· Understanding of data center operations and the interaction between the teams that support the systems and network Infrastructure

· Exposure with Enterprise Monitoring tools, Microsoft SCOM, SolarWInds, SquaredUP, Automated Escalation software.

· Exposure to Incident Command System (ICS) / National Incident Management System (NIMS) concepts with special focus on Incident Commander responsibilities

· A mix of Infrastructure skills across server, database, network and support desk

· Thorough understanding of data center operations and the interaction between the teams that support the systems and network Infrastructure

· Expertise in problem management, root cause analysis methodologies and incident resolution

· Experience with APM (Application Performance Monitoring) and other Monitoring Solution tools.

· Experience in an Operations Control Center

SpaceX was founded under the belief that a future where humanity is out exploring the stars is fundamentally more exciting than one where we are not. Today SpaceX is actively developing the technologies to make this possible, with the ultimate goal of enabling human life on Mars.

SR. BUSINESS ANALYST (STARLINK ENTERPRISE)

Starlink, our revolutionary satellite constellation, will deliver low-latency broadband internet worldwide. The Starlink Enterprise Account Management team serves as the point of contact for Starlink's growing base of enterprise customers from contract signature, through successful activation, ensuring all contract terms are fulfilled. This role will be responsible for analyzing data about Starlink enterprise customers and translating it into reporting, recommendations, and tooling to improve both our customers' experience and internal Starlink operations. Our ideal candidate has self-starter that has a passion for building analytics from scratch, prototyping tools, and working cross-functionality to simplify systems.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

Conduct analyses (SQL queries, other methods) that identify issues and opportunities impacting our customers, including actionable recommendations that quantifiably change outcomes
Define and develop department-level metrics and associated dashboards that quantify the health of our customer accounts and influence change
Integrate with all levels of the business to understand current workflows and identify systematic gaps
Develop automation that accelerate revenue, mitigates business risk or creates efficiencies within Starlink Business Operations and across teams
Own data integrity, tool maintenance, and reporting quality
Train internal users, external technical teams, and leaders on dashboard, API, and tool usage; assist in troubleshooting
Improve data capture for future Account Management use cases, identifying front-end requirements and collaborating with software development teams on table structure
Support new market launch, continuous improvement, and cross-functional strategic initiatives

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:

Bachelor's degree
5+ years of professional experience in reporting and analytics within customer operations, manufacturing, quality, human resources, purchasing, operations, cost accounting, supply chain management, or consulting
3+ years of professional experience building required datasets to create and manage dashboards using data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Power BI, Looker)
3+ years of professional experience in at least one analytics language (e.g. Python, R)
1+ years of experience leading projects

PREFERRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:

Bachelor's degree in business, supply chain, management information systems, computer science, engineering, or economics discipline
Advanced SQL proficiency (i.e. advanced joins, views/table distinctions, and basic query optimizations)
Advanced understanding of database structures, query optimizations, ETL development
Experience automating analytics tasks (i.e. intermediate coding skills (VBA, Python, C#, etc.)
Start-up, consulting, or other demonstrated experience in high-growth, fast-paced, rapidly changing environment
Strong project management and self-directed prioritization skills
Exceptional ability to communicate technical concepts to non-technical audiences at all organizational levels
Ability to develop and maintain strong relationships across disciplines and with multiple levels of management
Experience working with customer operations teams and tools (e.g. ticketing, account management, communications tools)

ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS:

Must be willing to work long hours and weekends as needed

COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS:

Pay Range:

Sr. Business Analyst: $110,000.00 - $145,000.00/per year

Your actual level and base salary will be determined on a case-by-case basis and may vary based on the following considerations: job-related knowledge and skills, education, and experience.

Base salary is just one part of your total rewards package at SpaceX. You may also be eligible for long-term incentives, in the form of company stock, stock options, or long-term cash awards, as well as potential discretionary bonuses and the ability to purchase additional stock at a discount through an Employee Stock Purchase Plan. You will also receive access to comprehensive medical, vision, and dental coverage, access to a 401(k) retirement plan, short & long-term disability insurance, life insurance, paid parental leave, and various other discounts and perks. You may also accrue 3 weeks of paid vacation & will be eligible for 10 or more paid holidays per year. Exempt employees are eligible for 5 days of sick leave per year.

ITAR REQUIREMENTS:

To conform to U.S. Government export regulations, applicant must be a (i) U.S. citizen or national, (ii) U.S. lawful, permanent resident (aka green card holder), (iii) Refugee under 8 U.S.C. § 1157, or (iv) Asylee under 8 U.S.C. § 1158, or be eligible to obtain the required authorizations from the U.S. Department of State. Learn more about the ITAR here.

Job Title: Sr. Data Analyst, Residential Energy Operations
Job Description:
What to Expect
Data is deeply embedded in the product, engineering, quality, and customer experience culture at Tesla. As a Senior Data Analyst, you will help to identify, distill, and resolve issues that affect customer experience, product/process throughput, and quality within the residential energy business. By using data and reporting metrics to identify potential problems, you will drive change across the organization by assisting teams with data-driven insights. An ideal candidate is skilled at data analytics, reporting, and data processing concepts and is naturally motivated to seek out and fix problems in a methodical way.
What You’ll Do
Define and own “source of truth” metrics for executive reporting for use in assessing operational performance and quality
Interface with business leaders to receive and distill requirements – allowing them to make confident and effective decisions via thorough analytical support and reporting
Create and maintain ETLs – identify data sources, write custom SQL queries, validate data against source applications, and make modifications according to new requirements
Coordinate with data engineering teams to establish data pipelines and verify data integrity
Create and maintain business-critical reporting suites using data visualization tools
Automate repetitive tasks with Python and SQL
Write clean, tested code that can be maintained and extended upon by other analysts
Work with quality and process improvement teams to provide key analytical support in identifying process and software improvements
Maintain documentation and support aligned business units and their core applications
Keep up to date with relevant technologies and frameworks for identifying trends and crafting new ways of looking at data
Ensure safe and secure data handling practices by partnering with key data protection, privacy, and information security leaders
What You’ll Bring
Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Mathematics, Computer Science, or equivalent
4+ years of experience in business analytics or data management experience
Expert SQL user – can write complex custom SQL queries using advanced aggregation functions and optimization techniques
Proficient Python user – can write efficient ETLs to establish critical data pipelines
Proficiency in using data visualization tools (i.e., Tableau, PowerBI, etc.)
Firm grasp of database management and database performance concepts
Demonstrated ability to provide insights and conclusions from large, dense datasets
Excellent interpersonal communication and collaboration skills – and the ability to operate in a highly cross-functional environment
Self-motivated, fast learner capable of first principle thinking in an ever-changing data landscape
Detail-oriented with excellent organizational skills
Master’s Degree in Data or Business Analytics is a plus
1 + years of experience with renewable energy generation systems

At Jack Henry, we deliver technology solutions that are digitally transforming and empowering community banks and credit unions to provide enhanced and streamlined user experiences to their customers and members. Our best-in-class products are just the start as we lay the groundwork for the future of digital banking and payments. We hope you'll join us. We can't do it without you.

We are seeking a Technical Business Analyst to join our team within our Loan Modernization group at Jack Henry. In this role, you will be responsible for analyzing information derived from various sources to assist multiple development teams in enhancing the Loan Modernization product. You will have the exciting opportunity to work on modernization efforts which carry cross collaboration with several teams on the Lending side. The ideal candidate is familiar with Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) and has substantial experience within lending and mortgage financial industry. They have excellent attention to details and can effectively communicate and collaborate with various teams.

This position will be filled to work Remotely within the U.S.

The target salary range for this position is $50,796 – $75,000, based on location and experience.

What you'll be responsible for:

Work with Product Management to understand the features to be developed and prioritization.
Share development team needs with Product Management (time constraints, technology needs, dependencies, etc.).
Work with scrum master to maintain & work a prioritized backlog.
Create issues in Jira with a description of the feature and acceptance criteria.
Lead and participate in planning, retrospectives, & demos.
Create functional specifications and system documentation, as well as contributing to end-user and project management documentation.
Work with quality assurance and programming teams to ensure changes are migrated into production correctly.
Evaluate third-party vendor changes and documenting integration enhancement needs.
Interact with technical teams to convey functional requirements.
May perform other job duties as assigned.

What you'll need to have:

A minimum of 2 years of experience writing requirements, YAML/Swagger, JSON, XML, and API design.
Strong knowledge of the financial industry.
Strong project management skills.
Strong communication (written and verbal) and customer interaction skills.
Excellent attention to details.
Ability to travel up to 5% to attend JH meetings, trainings, and/or professional conferences.

What would be nice for you to have:

Bachelor’s degree in IT or Business.
Experience with Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe).
Previous experience as a Business Analyst or an Analyst in a bank or FinTech environment.
Previous experience in lending (consumer and/or commercial) or experience with lending software (analysis, testing, or reporting).
Experience with Atlassian Jira or Confluence products.
Ability to define system and functional requirements.
Ability to interact with and communicate well with other technical associates.
Experience with microservices, Rest APIs, Domain Driven Design, Behavior Driven Development, SOAP and Postman.

Responsible for oversight and leadership of the Bank’s Analytics and Credit Scorecard Programs (‘Programs’) . Serves as a leader and ambassador of the Analytics group and assists with all aspects of the Programs, including developing repeatable, auditable, and sustainable processes; reporting and analysis to inform Executive Management and assist with first line credit risk management. Supports data, business, and forward-looking analytics for all programs, which includes capital and CRE stress testing, Credit Risk Scorecards, Current Expected Credit Losses (‘CECL’), portfolio analytics, market and economic analytics, etc. Directly manages staff and/or other managers with equivalent or less senior titles.


Essential Job Functions:

Leads and manages the development of sustainable, auditable, and repeatable processes to support Programs that enhance first-line credit risk management.
Managers and/or provides delivery of analytical support to Executive and first line management, as well as business units across the enterprise, with a focus on the commercial and consumer loan portfolios.
Leads and/or manages the development and implementation of a recurring schedule of analytics reporting on the Bank’s commercial and consumer loan portfolio using SAS, R, VBA, PL/SQL, PowerBI, and/or other tools.
Directly manages staff and managers within the Analytics team.

Oversees the completion of all Analytics projects and ensures adherence to required timelines.
Communicates the status of projects to the the Managing Director and project stakeholders.
Provides the Board with updates on strategic and/or critical Analytics initiatives.
Develops and leads training to business unit managers and stakeholders.
Regularly exercises discretion and judgment in the performance of essential job functions.

Experience using analytical software such as SAS, SQL, R, Python, Power BI and/or Tableau.

Ability to develop and execute queries and/or reporting for large data sets.
Ability to use critical thinking and creativity to solve business problems.

CBC is a boutique organization with the majority of our team residing in Los Angeles and Dallas. Gather multiple timeline/schedule updates from various resources (e.g. partner teams) and consolidate them into a single view for external reporting

Consolidate, analyze, and report various program progress and feedback

Experience consolidating and reporting information from multiple sources
Proactive with clear, effective communication skills

Position Title: Business Performance Data Analyst III - P3

Company Summary

Crown Castle is the nation’s largest provider of shared communications infrastructure: towers, small cells and fiber. It all works together to meet unprecedented demand—connecting people and communities and transforming the way we do business. Whenever you make a call, track a workout or stream music and videos, we’re the ones providing the communications infrastructure that makes it all possible. From 5G and the internet of things to drones, autonomous vehicles and AR/VR, we enable the technologies that help people stay safe, connected and ready for the future. Crown Castle is publicly traded on the New York Stock Exchange (CCI), is part of the S&P 500 and is one of the largest Real Estate Investment Trusts in the US.

We offer a total benefits package and professional growth development for teammates in any stage of their career. Along with caring for our teammates, we’re an active member in the communities where we live, work and do business. We have a responsibility to give back, which we do through our Connected by Good program. Giving back allows us to improve public spaces where people connect, promote public safety and advance access to education and technology.

Position Summary

As a Business Performance Analyst III, you are responsible for using your data visualization, and in-depth analytical skills to independently provide accurate, complete, timely and insightful reports and analysis used by business management to inform decision making. You work closely with department and/or functional managers on a wide range of assignments with minimal direction to proactively determine requirements, build and update reports and quality test all output prior to distribution. As a senior member of the organization, you will conduct multiple complex analysis with the aim of providing accurate insights with impact on a significant part of the organization and critical to ensuring the success of our business.

Essential Job Functions

Independently develops and deploys reporting, data visualization, and analysis on multiple projects/programs in parallel that is accurate, complete, and properly summarized to aid in management decision making and project delivery.
Responsible for extracting and summarizing data from corporate ERP systems and database.
Independently creates analysis and reporting for complex problems that provides management with clear and concise explanations of relevant trends and/or exceptions.
Produces weekly, monthly, and quarterly trend and activity reports as well as other operational and management reports. Ensures that reports are produced per scheduled timelines for review by functional management teams.
Works directly with department and/or functional teams to improve complex data pipelines and correct issues when identified
Partner with multiple senior level stakeholders to design and develop reports and ensures that they perform as expected.
Skillfully supports multiple complex ad-hoc reports
Act as a mentor / resource to less tenured colleagues to help guide their success.
Participate in peer reviews of work products and documents.

Education/Certifications

Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Data Analytics, Data Science, Computer Science, Accounting/Finance, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, or related quantitative discipline

Experience/Minimum Requirements

Five (5)+ years Accounting/Finance/Business reporting and data analysis experience
Extensive experience in writing SQL, and one or more programming languages (Python or R)
Extensive experience in writing complex DAX functions in Power BI
Experience with relational database, strong knowledge of SQL server and Snowflake
Excellent analytical skills: ability to synthesize large sets of data and integrate complex analytical insights into meaningful reports and recommendations
Resourceful problem solver: ability to work with other functions, research and find information

Other Skills/Abilities

Strong knowledge of data visualization and best practice
Ability to prioritize multiple complex projects and work well under pressure
Customer focus in problem-solving approach
Excellent interpersonal and verbal communication skills and team first mentality
Strong knowledge of telecommunications and network construction in both the Public and Privates rights-of-way a plus.

Organizational Relationship

Reports to: Manager Business Performance Analytics

Title(s) of direct reports (if applicable): N/A

Working Conditions: This role falls into our hybrid work model working in the office on Monday through Thursday. On Fridays, teammates on the hybrid schedule will have the option to work from the office or home. There is an expectation of collaboration with teammates and stakeholders for moments that matter that could require travel.

Job Title: Lead Database administrator and Business Data analyst
Job Description:
Applies developed subject matter knowledge to solve common and complex business issues within established guidelines and recommends appropriate alternatives. Works on problems of diverse complexity and scope. May act as a team or project leader providing direction to team activities and facilitates information validation and team decision making process. Exercises independent judgment within generally defined policies and practices to identify and select a solution. Ability to handle most unique situations. May seek advice in order to make decisions on complex business issues.

Responsibilities

Designs and establishes secure and performant data architectures, enhancements, updates, and programming changes for portions and subsystems of data pipelines, repositories or models for structured/unstructured data.
Analyzes design and determines coding, programming, and integration activities required based on general objectives and knowledge of overall architecture of product or solution.
Writes and executes complete testing plans, protocols, and documentation for assigned portion of data system or component; identifies and debugs, and creates solutions for issues with code and integration into data system architecture.
Leads a project team of other data engineers to develop reliable, cost effective and high-quality solutions for assigned data system, model, or component.
Collaborates and communicates with project team regarding project progress and issue resolution.
Represents the data engineering team for all phases of larger and more-complex development projects.
Build cloud-based database systems of high availability and quality.
Design and implement database in accordance to requirements.
Minimize database downtime and monitor database performance to provide fast query responses.
Provide proactive and reactive data management support and training to users.
Determine, enforce and document database policies, procedures and standards.
Perform tests and evaluations regularly to ensure data security, privacy and integrity.
Diagnose and troubleshoot database errors.
Review SQL code and database changes.
Manage database deployments to all environments.
Create and manage database reports, visualizations, and dashboards.
Provide database reports to the users, in appropriate format and in a timely manner.
Recommend and implement emerging database technologies.
Establish consistent customer service SLAs and commit to high quality in the customer experience.
Work with engineering teams to resolve production incidents.
Coordinate database processes across different products and organizations.
Provide ad-hoc data analysis reports for executives and upper management.
Track and manage database related bugs using JIRA.
Collect data from a variety of sources and transform into insights to improve business decisions.
Provides guidance and mentoring to less experienced staff members.

Knowledge & Skills

Using data engineering tools, languages, frameworks to mine, cleanse and explore data.
Fluent in NoSQL & relational based systems and ability. Expert level of transactional SQL language is a must.
Fluent in complex, distributed and massively parallel systems.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with ability to represent complex algorithms in software.
Strong understanding of database technologies and management systems.
Strong understanding of cloud-based systems/services.
Database architecture testing methodology, including execution of test plans, debugging, and testing scripts and tools.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills; mastery in English and local language.
Ability to effectively communicate product architectures, design proposals and negotiate options at management levels.
Other desired programming languages will be Java, C++, or Python.
Scala language with Spark SQL is a nice to have.
Understanding of analytics pipeline with AWS services (EC2, RDS, S3, EMR, Redshift, etc.)

Scope & Impact

Collaborates with peers, junior engineers, data scientists and project team.
Typically interacts with high-level Individual Contributors, Managers and Program Teams.
Leads a project requiring data engineering solutions development.

Education & Experience

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering or equivalent.
Proven working experience as a Database Administrator
Hands-on experience with database standards and end user applications
Experience with AWS cloud services and Linux environments
Excellent knowledge of data backup, recovery, security, integrity and SQL
Familiarity with database design, documentation, and coding
Problem solving skills and ability to think algorithmically
Understanding of relational and dimensional data modeling
Strong mathematical and statistical knowledge
Typically 5-10 years’ experience.

Job Title: Business Intelligence Analyst (ETL/ADF/Power BI), Remote - Institutional Business Intelligence
Job Description:
Minimum Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Information Technology, Mathematics, Public Health, business, healthcare administration or related field or equivalent. Six (6) or more years of relevant work experience required, including extensive experience using SQL to query, manipulate, and organize data from relational databases.

Job Summary:

The Business Intelligence Analyst is responsible for providing meaning to the data in UTMB systems and developing methods to leverage that data in UTMB applications. Responsibilities include standardizing and cleaning data, building prediction models, modeling outcomes, and developing metrics for complex data analysis projects that can be multi-disciplinary or interdepartmental. Addresses data requirements for analytic reporting and operating areas with expertise in specific data systems and/or analytical methodologies. Works with expert proficiency with a variety of tools (ex: ADF, SQL, Power BI, Tableau, etc.) to extract data, write queries, develop programming logic, run reports, manipulate data, and analyze datasets to meet the needs of the organization.

Preferred Qualifications:

Strong proficiency with ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes, including complex data pipelines and workflows.
Demonstrated experience with Microsoft Power Bl, including DAX, Power Query, data modeling, visualization, and dashboard development.
Hands-on experience with Azure Data Factory for orchestrating and automating data movement and data transformation.
In-depth knowledge of data warehousing principles and data modeling, with a strong understanding of star schema and dimensional data models.
Experience with cloud services (especially Microsoft Azure) in a data engineering or business analytics context.

Job Duties:

Collects, aggregates, and analyzes data from multiple internal and external sources to drive insights into business performance. Utilizes business intelligence tools to create reports and dashboards, and produces actionable reports that show key performance indicators, identify areas of improvement into current operations, and display root cause analysis of problems.
Develops summaries of findings and recommends actions; drives business decisions by providing quantitative and qualitative data analysis and reporting of patterns, insights, and trends to decision-makers.
Develop, implement and validate new predictive models, conduct QA of models’ outcomes and monitor performance regularly.
Uses analytics and metrics to improve processes and provide data-driven forecasts of potential costs, risks, and profits of new business initiatives.
Works with internal clients to develop and translate business requirements into project charters, business and technical requirements, and ultimately produce effective and insightful interactive analytics.
Serves as a technical lead for compiling, cleaning, manipulating, and analyzing data related to department projects. Diagnoses and responds to data integrity and functional or interactive issues in existing and future dashboards quickly and effectively.
Formulates validation strategies and methods to ensure accurate and reliable data.
Serves as technical lead and expert, provides guidance to team members.
Adheres to internal controls and reporting structure.
Perform other similar and related duties as required or directed

Knowledge/Skills/Abilities:

Strong critical thinking skills to help predict the needs of various business units and leaders across UTMB rather than require them to provide detailed prescriptive direction.
Deep knowledge and familiarity with business intelligence tools such as Power BI, Qlik or Tableau to design and develop reporting analytics and visualizations.

Job Description

As a Supply Chain Analyst you’ll utilize data to predict and improve UPLIFT Desk’s delivery of products and services to its customers, while working cross-departmentally with all areas of the organization and externally with suppliers and freight-forwarders. Your technical skills in supply chain management will optimize production, inventory levels and transportation methods, while driving continuous improvement in operations, processes, and cost. This position reports to the Vice President of Logistics.

Required Qualifications

Able to sit or stand at a desk for an 8 hour shift. We provide electric height adjustable sit/stand desks, ergonomic chairs, and equipment needed to do the job.
BA/BS degree in a related field, such as Supply Chain, Business, Finance, Logistics, Data Analysis or Engineering and a minimum of 5 years of related work experience
Excellent computer literacy, proficiency with G-suite, and skilled at manipulating and analyzing data with Google Sheets and/or Excel
Ability to adapt to new technology and software platforms and integrate information across multiple systems
Demonstrated experience working with suppliers, producing inventory forecasts and demand plans and coordinating international shipping and freight brokerage

Preferred Qualifications

7+ years of related experience as a Supply Chain Analyst, Data Analyst, Logistics Analyst, or a similar role
Experience using Netsuite ERP for inventory and vendor management
Experience using BlueRidge Analytics for demand planning, replenishment, inventory optimization, and sales & operations planning
Knowledge of and experience with warehousing and order fulfillment processes and principles, to include Lean/Six Sigma or other cost-reduction, efficiency, logistics, and quality management methodologies
Attention to detail and strong organizational and critical thinking skills to proactively solve problems and manage communication with internal and external stakeholders

What You’ll Do

Use Netsuite, BlueRidge and other platforms to gather, integrate, review, validate, analyze and report data to drive actions and insights throughout the supply chain
Liaise with freight-forwarders and drayage companies to coordinate the delivery of inbound inventory
Communicate with overseas partners regarding manufacturing, quality issues, product changes, ordering and delivery of our products
Partner with vendors to continuously improve service levels and cost
Maintain a positive working relationship with internal stakeholders in Product Development, Warehousing and Sales
Foster excellent communication at all levels of the organization regarding inventory issues, logistical information, stock levels and inbound deliveries
Report information and present strategic options and recommendations to executive leadership based on data analysis
Continuously improve processes and procedures related to supply chain management and demand forecasting

Benefits

A merit-based environment that rewards growth and accomplishment regardless of seniority
Generous paid time off
4% 401K company matching with instant vesting (after one year)
Excellent group health insurance available to employees and dependents, including domestic partners (4 medical plans, 2 dental plans, and a vision plan to choose from)
Flexible spending account (FSA) for health care and child care costs
Company-paid & Supplementary Life Insurance; Long-term & Short-term disability
Free UPLIFT Desk (after one year)
50% discount on all UPLIFT products
Free healthy (and not so healthy) snacks and drinks
On-the-job training and skills development
A supportive and engaging work culture that promotes healthy living

About UPLIFT Desk

As a fast growing, mid-sized Direct To Consumer (DTC) brand company, it’s our mission to deliver sincere, world-class customer service. We provide optimally designed, quality office solutions to customers. We focus on happier & healthier customers and employees!

UPLIFT Desk has revolutionized the way people shop for office furniture. It all starts with our award winning UPLIFT Standing Desk, made even better when accessorized with our entire UPLIFT office furniture line. Our product line includes most furniture an office could need. We design office products that optimize customers’ comfort, health, and productivity. Our Product Development team focuses on designing the highest quality ergonomic office furniture. Then our Content teams ecommerce website offers customers the ability to highly configure products. Our amazing Order Processing and Warehouse teams make sure we have inventory and ship orders the same day. Customers receive award winning support from our Sales and Customer Service and Warranty teams. We offer the best 15 year warranty in the business! Our Interior Design and Contract Sales teams specialize in large office furniture layouts for commercial buildings that serve most Fortune 500 companies.

Award winning UPLIFT Desk is loved globally!

Rated Best Standing Desk by New York Times Wirecutter 3 years in a row
Hundreds of thousands of happy customers around the world sit and stand at an UPLIFT Desk
Google reviews - 4.8 rating with 4000+ reviews

We value our environment:

We plant 5 new trees in U.S. National Forests for every solid wood desk sold. By partnering with the National Forest Foundation, we're able to plant tens of thousands of new trees each year

Solar Powered Operations - Our Austin facilities produce over a megawatt of electricity through roof-mounted solar panels on three large warehouses

We use sustainable materials in our products. Some examples are:

Bamboo Desktops, Drawers, & Motion Boards - The world's fastest-growing plant, Moso bamboo is a grass that grows as quickly as an inch an hour

Eco Curve Desktops - Eco Curve desktops use 100% recycled MDF and have the lowest carbon footprint in the industry due to not using edgebanding, backer boards, adhesives, or solvents
Rubberwood Desktops - Pará rubber trees produce 99% of the world's natural rubber latex. The rubber production lifespan of these trees is exhausted after about 25-30 years. Our rubberwood desktops give the trees a second life
