About the Comptroller's Office
Innovation, collaboration, and a commitment to excellence best describes the culture here at the Comptroller's Office. We take pride in the work we do serving as Texas' accountant, tax collector, treasurer, and much more!

Culture
Our agency workforce is as diverse as the people of Texas we serve. We value our employees and take very seriously our collective commitment to public service. Personal development opportunities are strongly encouraged through available workshops, teambuilding exercises, and on the job training. We offer flexible scheduling that helps employees maintain a healthy work-life balance.

If you are seeking to gain knowledge, build your career, and network among goal-oriented professionals, this is the place for you!

General description

An IT Business Analyst for The Texas Comptroller of Public Accounts IT Division is a professional who analyzes and evaluates the business needs and requirements of various IT applications and projects. They also design, develop, and implement IT solutions that align with the agency’s strategic goals and objectives.

This position is part of a team of people who are open-minded and collaborative, adaptable, dedicated to their craft and aren’t afraid to roll up their sleeves. You would be a great fit for this role if you are self-motivated, resourceful, can deliver results to spec and work well with a team.

Work Hours
8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m., Monday through Friday, 40 hours. Occasionally, work non-standard work hours to include additional hours on evenings, weekends and holidays. Hours may change based on business need.

Teleworking may be considered if certain working conditions are met. The candidate must have permanent residency within the state of Texas and must be able to meet in office requirements, which can vary among different sections (i.e. report to office 1 day/month, 1day/week, etc.). Travel reimbursements are not provided for teleworking.

Minimum Qualifications

Bachelor's degree.
Two (2) years of experience performing business analysis or product owner work.
Experience utilizing Business Analysis or Product Owner tools such as Atlassian Jira, MS Word, Excel, SharePoint and Visio.
Experience writing and documenting in an IT project environment.
Experience in Agile software development methodology

Preferred Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in computer science, computer information systems or management information systems.
Experience in development and conducting training on new and existing systems
Experience utilizing project management applications such as MS Project, Atlassian Confluence
Experience utilizing productivity applications such as Service Now, WebEx, MS Teams
Experience with CPA Systems and Business Processes

Substitutions
One (1) additional year of related work experience may substitute for thirty semester hours of educational requirement with a maximum substitution of 120 semester hours (four years).

LICENSES AND CERTIFICATIONS (Preferred)

PMI Professional in Business Analysis (PMI-PBA)
Certified Agile Product Owner or Scrum Master

In this role you will:

Gathers user stories/requirements from customers for both new systems and enhancements to existing systems. Schedules, facilitates and documents information from meetings with customers. May help coordinate story/requirement efforts involving multiple Business Analysts or Product Owners and cross divisional communications.
Documents user and system stories/requirements using standard methodologies and communicates stories/requirements to technical employees for design and development of systems. May help coordinate the collaboration of stories/requirements documents produced by multiple Business Analysts or Product Owners. Reviews and monitors system design and development functionality.
Coordinates, analyzes, and resolves production system defects according to defined team processes and standards.
Develops and documents test cases and scenarios used to test new systems and enhancements to existing systems. Communicate requirements and test cases to the testing team(s) to ensure the thorough testing of all test cases and scenarios.
Conducts testing of both new systems and enhancements to existing systems to ensure the system is properly tested prior to moving to production.
Performs all other related duties as assigned.

JOB SUMMARY:

The Global Operations Analyst is responsible for supporting supply chain, global operations and EHSS with analytics and reporting: from analyzing estimates and quotations data, to procurement and logistics data, planning and inventory data, to generation of demand management reports and supporting S&IOP process, compliance programs and EHSS. This position ensures goals, objectives, actions, strategies, and tactics produce the desired results consistent with the needs of the organization and attainment of Company and Department key performance indicators and targets. This position is responsible for developing data-driven solutions to optimize operations, EHSS and supply chain operations, increase efficiency, and reduce costs. This role supports data generation, analytics, complex reporting, dashboards and scorecards administration and maintenance. This position plays a crucial role in optimizing the procurement process for direct and indirect goods and services. This position is responsible for analyzing procurement activities and assisting in compliance reporting and identifying cost-saving opportunities. This position collaborates with cross-functional teams to drive efficiency, minimize risk, and achieve the organization's goals.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:

This job description represents only the primary areas of responsibility; specific position assignments will vary depending on the needs of the department. To perform the job successfully, an individual must be able to execute each essential duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

 Generates data, analytics, reporting.  Identifies, visualizes, and analyzes data from a variety of sources to obtain business insights and provide reporting analytics.  Develops clear data analyses, visualizations, and stories that identify trends and issues, drive actions with data that produce favorable business outcomes. Conducts statistical analyses and builds predictive and prescriptive models to support data'driven decision making.  Provides analytical support across supply chain disciplines such as spend, performance, demand management, inventory management, capacity management and others.  Analyzes supply chain data and identify areas for improvement.  Builds Should-Cost and Total Cost of Ownership economic models for materials and services.  Develops and maintains dashboards, scorecards, and reports to track KPIs and provide insights to management for EHSS, Operations and Supply Chain.  Provides support to management team and senior leadership.  Develops processes and tools to measure key performance indicators.  Develops and implements predictive analytical models to optimize operations and reduce costs such as optimization models for inventory management and others and evaluate leading indicators.  Monitors, analyzes, interprets data, and report industry trends to identify new opportunities for improvement and cost reduction.  Assesses external market trends and conditions to identify opportunities and risks in managed spend categories.  Provides monthly analysis of Company spend to enable informed decision-making.  Monitors and evaluates risks.  Analyzes data to provide a variety of reports such as: inventory reports to optimize inventory levels, lead times reports, safety stocks, MOQ’s, forecast consumption and accuracy, supplier spend data and others. Develop and create schedules for products and services.  Extracts data, analyzes, and prepares reports to measure key supplier performance-to-plan. Provides reports on supplier performance, recommends continuous improvement opportunities.  Support Supplier Performance Management process and S&IOP process. Identifies new Demand and Supply forecasting techniques or technologies to improve overall S&IOP process. Support the full integration of operations into the S&IOP process. Partner with the finance organization to link S&IOP process with financial forecasts.  Conduct comprehensive analysis of direct and indirect procurement data, including spend analysis, market trends, supplier performance, and cost optimization opportunities. Gathers data and analyzes company spend, supply market data, and other related commercial information to drive value across supply chain activities and assists in identifying sourcing. Provides analytical support for category sourcing initiatives, contract negotiations, and bid evaluations.  Support EHSS and Company real estate management with development of dashboards, scorecards, and tracking analytics.  Developing tools and processes to improve the efficiency of analytical work. Develops, documents, and implements processes and systems in support of company goals. Creates specifications for system enhancements when necessary.  Collaborate with representatives from EHSS, Accounts Payable, Finance, Supply Chain, IT to continually seek advancement of integrated systems and drive operational excellence.  Leverage ERP systems knowledge to identify and prioritize areas of greatest opportunity for improvement and applications of data analysis.  Advance best practices for use of business intelligence and other data analytics tools. Identify, prioritize, and solve high-impact business problems.  Performs other duties of a similar nature and level as assigned.

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:

Bachelor’s degree in data science and analytics, engineering, mathematics/statistics, business or major in related quantitative discipline. Master’s degree in related quantitative discipline preferred.  Data analysis statistical modeling experience with strong background in supply chain modeling, decision support tools development.  Experience with analytical programming languages such as SQL preferred.  Experience administering corporate level dashboards and scorecards.  ERP experience (Epicor, D365 preferred).  Demonstrated experience with business intelligence software Power BI, SharePoint, advanced Excel user knowledge and knowledge of building Macros preferred.  Familiarity with Hyperion, TM1 preferred.  5 years’ relevant data analytics experience required.  Previous experience as Data Scientist preferred.  Functional knowledge of planning and supply chain (i.e., planning, procurement, finished good supply chain) with focus on data analytics and ability to develop quantitative models in a supply chain context.  Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.  Strong project management skills that demonstrate the ability to initiate, prioritize and complete projects on time.  Excellent verbal, written communication skills and report presentation skills.  Industrial equipment manufacturing experience preferred such as: pumps, motors, valves, raw materials, actuators, welding, machining, painting, fabrication, resin, and fiberglass reinforced plastic.  Experience with ISO requirements and quality standards preferred.  Lean Six Sigma experience preferred.  Experience with supply chains with multiple locations preferred.  Microsoft Office experience including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, and Teams.

LICENSING/CERTIFICATIONS:

 Data Science certification preferred.  CPIM, APICS or ISM certification preferred.  Green Belt Lean Six Sigma certification preferred.

TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS:

International air travel may be required, as necessary; must have ability to travel across borders

We are recruiting for a Principal IT Disaster Recovery Analyst to join our team in Dallas, TX or Miramar, FL in a contract to hire role. · Monitor, coordinate metrics and act on exceptions to address issue

Job title: Serialization Lead Business Analyst

Current Need

We are searching for a DSCSA Serialization Lead Business Analyst in Irving, TX to join the team.

Position Description

McKesson SAP Distribution Center Technologies – ATTP Center of Expertise team is leading the Technology Implementation of the Drug Supply Chain Security Act (DSCSA) across all the Business Units in the US. We are looking for a Serialization Lead Business Analyst to be part of our team. This is a Techno-functional role that will have responsibility to lead the implementation, support and evolution of Technology solutions of DSCSA implementation guidelines for McKesson Business Units. This role will work both with our different stakeholders as well as on the technical aspects of DSCSA implementation guidelines and impact to our core Serialization System (ATTP) and WMS/ ERP/Analytics and Customer Facing applications. Configure ATTP software and participate in on-boarding initiatives with suppliers and customers.

This position reports to the Senior Director of SAP Distribution Center Technologies.

Key Responsibilities:

Leads the implementation of DSCSA regulations for McKesson Business Units.
This role is considered the technological DSCSA expert for one of the McKesson Business Units
Drives alignment on key project activities, metrics as well as roadmap for each BU
Works with Development and support teams to address Business Unit needs
Gathers and translates requirements from DSCSA guidelines and our DSCA implementation team to define, design and develop solutions for our ATTP Team that meet business requirements.
Collaborates and supports WMS / ERP / Analytics and Customer Facing application teams in the adoption of new DSCSA regulations.
Design, configure and maintain programs related to SAP ATTP
Collaborates with suppliers and Customers for specific BU to drive adoption of DSCSA regulation
Participates on industry’s technical forums related to DSCSA Implementation
Documents, Recommends, and Presents systems enhancements and alternatives to meet business requirements.
Drives continuous improvement activities for this area: Leads Root Cause Analysis of major incidents, provides solutions that will increase systems availability and customer satisfaction.
Be part of an on-call rotation schedule for after-hours escalations from support teams.
Works on Agile/Waterfall methodologies to Configure solutions in the space like SAP and related technologies as well as to test development/customizations in this area.

Minimum Requirements Typically requires 7+ years of relevant experience

Critical Skills

Working Experience with DSCSA Serialization solutions (SAP ATTP) including configuration of those solutions
Understanding of GS1 (EPCIS) Standards as well as master data requirements for serialization
Implementation of DSCSA regulations
Functional background in Logistics and WMS Processes
Communication to multiple levels of the organization
Ability to work with both Business Users as well as technical aspects including understanding of programming code.
The ideal candidate is a self-starter
Understands processes and procedures associated with enterprise applications.

Preferred Skills

Experience with SAP HANA Studio, ABAP, and SAP ECC
Understanding of Distribution Center operations
Experience working in an Agile / SAFe Lean environment using Jira preferred

Education: Degree or equivalent experience

Our Company
Lancer Worldwide, a Hoshizaki Company, is an award-winning global leader in beverage dispensing. Through innovation and a commitment to dedication in action, we create products that benefit our customers worldwide, and give them a distinct advantage in the marketplace. We offer our teammates the opportunity to grow personally and professionally, to contribute to the success of a dynamic organization, and to serve others in a manner that exceeds their expectations. We welcome talented, passionate, and highly motivated individuals to join our team.

Summary
The Procurement Analyst position is responsible for overseeing the acquisition of necessary materials, monitoring and analyzing crucial functional metrics to enhance profitability and efficiency. It involves maintaining control over procurement data and ensuring compliance with essential initiatives. Responsibilities also include updating and managing the master list of procurement items, as well as keeping key indicators current, including extensive data records such as vendor details, prices, accounts, and addresses.

Essential Functions
Track raw material and packaging consumption statistics.

Ensure current and accurate pricing and sourcing information is maintained.
Create analytical tools for monitoring inventory levels.
Analyze procurement data to identify pricing and volume trends, facilitate quotation analyses, and generate presentation materials.
Act as the main knowledge repository for Business System operations and contribute to continuous improvements.
Support and oversee internal and external certification processes, ensuring follow-up actions until completion.
Generate reports on purchasing activities for upper management.
Supply sales and customer service teams with up-to-date price and delivery information.
Maintain Directories/Folders and Web Portals with the latest information pertinent to the Supply Chain and Procurement team, ensuring propriety.
Other duties as assigned.

Knowledge,Skills and Abilities

Preferably familiar with ERP materials management or controlling modules.
Proficient in Microsoft Office, with a focus on Excel and PowerPoint.
Knowledge of Dynamics AX or D365 materials management module is advantageous.
Possesses strong mathematical, data management, and analytical skills.
Demonstrates the ability to identify and implement process improvements.
Competent in reading and interpreting data.
Exhibits exceptional attention to detail, accuracy, organizational, and time management skills.
Capable of working independently or collaboratively within a team, consistently meeting deadlines.

Education and Experience

A minimum of 3 years of purchasing experience is necessary.
Preferred background includes 3+ years in manufacturing or finance, with a focus on supply chain or finance operations.
A Bachelor's degree in supply chain management or business administration is required, with preference given to those holding a Bachelor's Degree.
Certification in Business Intelligence or any data analyst software or web course will be considered a plus.

Developing & maintaining dashboards (Power BI & web-based) and producing and distributing related insights reporting.

Strong analytic skills with the ability to extract, collect, organize, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets for insights.

Interpret Procurement Category specific trends/behaviors and translate into efficient reporting dashboards and tools.

MINIMUM EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:

Has 4+ years’ experience in an analytical and/or procurement position.

Proficiency in data visualization tools such as Power BI, or similar.

Strong Excel skills (VLOOKUP, concatenate, pivot tables, upload from text file)

Strong reporting & analytics capabilities including ability to produce and oversee complex reports & models and generate visuals providing insights and recommendations for senior leadership.

Project management leadership demonstrated.

Job Title: Lead Analyst, Data Management & Quantitative Analysis
Job Description:
Overview
Corporate Trust Analytics Modelling Analyst
Bring your ideas. Make history.
BNY Mellon offers an exciting array of future-forward careers at the intersection of business, finance, and technology. We are one of the world's top asset management and banking firms that manages trillions of dollars in assets, custody and/or administration. Known as the “bank of banks” - 97% of the world’s top banks work with us as we lead and serve our customers into the new era of digital.
With over 238 years of rich history and industry firsts, BNY Mellon has been built upon our proven ability to evolve, lead, and drive new ideas at every turn. Today, we’re approximately 50,000 employees across 35 countries with a culture that empowers you to grow, take risks, experiment and be yourself. This is what #LifeAtBNYMellon is all about.
We’re seeking a future team member for the role of CLO Analytics Modelling Analyst to join our Corporate Trust CLO Analytics team. This role is located in Houston, TX - Hybrid.

In this role, you’ll make an impact in the following ways:
Develop deal specific models, reports and user tools according to legal documents and client specifications using in house systems and other supported applications for standard and routine deals, for the CDO/CLO product.
Troubleshoot, resolve issues at all levels for moderately complex financial structures and run and/or maintain deal models on active standard or routine deals.
Analyze moderately complex finance structures and legal documentation, including amendments.
Liaise directly with internal client services, business partners, clients and other third parties to resolve deal specific issues related to the deal model or the onboarding of the deal.
Investigation and resolution of cases raised while meeting required turnaround times and quality standards for client service/admin teams.
Work closely with Client Services to interpret and identify needed changes according to document guidelines.
Perform quality control according to the internal procedures.

To be successful in this role, we’re seeking the following:
Ability to comprehend, interpret and analyze legal documents on moderately complex financial structures and interact with stakeholders where necessary to resolve issues.
Knowledge and experience in Structured Credit or Fixed Income products.
Knowledge of PC desktop tools such as MS Access and Excel.
Knowledge of SQL or an advanced reporting or modelling platform is also preferred.
Bachelor’s degree and 3-5 years' experience.

For over 230 years, the people of BNY Mellon have been at the forefront of finance, expanding the financial markets while supporting investors throughout the investment lifecycle. BNY Mellon can act as a single point of contact for clients looking to create, trade, hold, manage, service, distribute or restructure investments and safeguards nearly one-fifth of the world's financial assets. Freese and Nichols Inc., is looking for an Workday HRIS Analyst in our corporate headquarters in Downtown Fort Worth, Texas. As Workday HRIS Analyst, you will work with the functional stakeholders of Workday in Human Resources and Accounting and technical stakeholders in Business Technology to troubleshoot issues and explore enhancements to Workday, roughly 2 years post-implementation in a growing organization.
Primary Responsibilities include:
Working closely with the HR team to understand business processes, goals, and gaps in order to implement solutions that address business needs
Troubleshooting complex system/user issues to drive resolution and determine root cause, conduct workflow analysis, and streamline processes
Administration and maintenance of HR-related systems, including Workday
Leading, managing and supporting key technical initiatives to deploy Workday functionality (e.g. employee self-service, mobile app, manager self-service, performance management, new hire onboarding, benefit open enrollment, absence management, etc.) as well as initiatives related to other HR-related systems
Configuring, testing and deploying Workday solutions to optimize business processes in assigned functional area(s)
Managing Workday business process, security, and integration administration
Creating business process documents, process flows, and decision-making documents
Building, testing and deploying various integrations including Enterprise Interface Builder (EIBs), benefits, payroll, and related integrations
Building, testing, and deploying various notifications
Establishing and maintaining user access, security roles and permissions
Serving as a technical resource for future Workday implementations or enhancement.
Conducting Workday bi-annual new release testing and coordinates turning on new features
Acting as a point of contact for users to research, troubleshoot and resolve production issues in a timely manner
Serving as liaison between internal customers and external Workday consultant
Providing end-user support
Assisting with the development and maintenance of Workday training materials and standard operating procedures
Developing and maintaining processes to ensure integrity of data throughout the organization by running reports, auditing, analyzing information and troubleshooting errors
Creating, maintaining, delivering, and supporting a variety of regular and ad-hoc reports and dashboards for HR and internal leadership
Providing compliance reporting such as Equal Employment Opportunity Commission (EEOC), Veterans' Employment and Training Service (VETS) and Affirmative Action Plan (AAP) reporting
Assisting with data maintenance to ensure continued accuracy of analytics
Developing and maintaining HR SharePoint sites and primary resource for SharePoint information architecture
Assisting and supporting HR initiatives and special projects
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Human Resource Management or related field
3+ years' experience with Human Resource Information Systems
Proficiency in Workday HCM modules (Core HCM, Advanced Compensation, Benefits, Talent, Learning, Recruiting, etc.).
Expertise in Workday functionality, advanced reporting, security, business processes, and configuration options.
Experience capturing requirements and documenting business processes
Ability to apply systems knowledge to troubleshoot and analyze issues
Ability to analyze data and recommend solutions
Strong attention to detail and ability to handle data with confidentiality
Knowledge of Human Resources practices (i.e., benefits, compensation, recruiting, performance management, etc.)
Ability to organize and prioritize work assignments
Ability to manage time and resources effectively to meet deadlines
Flexibility and willingness to scale from tactical to strategic
Proficiency in all Microsoft Office applications with an emphasis on Excel and PowerPoint
Demonstrated ability to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing, to a wide variety of organizational members.
Ability to work independently as well as in a team environment
Preferred
Experience with HRIS implementations/enhancements
SharePoint experience

Description:

MISSION

Our mission is to enhance well-being by connecting individuals with vital health resources through a compassionate workforce that embodies the spirit of neighbors helping neighbors.

VALUES

HealthOne is guided by a cultural framework that embodies our values and drives our decisions.

Our PURPOSE is to care for people by connecting them to resources that help protect them in health related situations. To fulfill our purpose, we align our PRIORITIES to ensure each decision we make is ethical, empathetic, economical, and efficient. We care for PEOPLE by being welcoming, authentic, truthful, consistent and humble. We are continuously looking for ways to improve our PROCESS and how we get things done.

HealthOne seeks individuals with integrity and heart to embody our values. Whether you’re starting your career or looking to develop additional skills to reach your full potential, HealthOne provides the means to help you achieve your goals.

JOB PURPOSE

The IT Business Analyst will be a vital link between our information technology capacity and our business objectives by supporting and ensuring the successful completion of analytical, building, testing and deployment tasks of our software product’s features. The IT Business Analyst reviews, analyzes, and evaluates user needs to create systems solutions that support overall business strategies. The incumbent also documents system requirements, defines scope and objectives, and assists in the creation of system specifications that drive system development and implementation. This position is a liaison between IT and users and have both business and technical expertise.

Requirements:

ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES

Understands business requirements and produces requirement specification documents
Creates application design documents
Understands and follows the company’s software development life cycle process
Reports on common sources of technical issues or questions and makes recommendations to product team
Works closely with project team to maintain a continuous knowledge of project status in order to identify potential issues and/or opportunities
Ensures client issues are dealt with in an efficient manner, informing all parties of any outstanding issues or problems
Communicates client's goals and represents client's interests to the team
Continuously finds ways to improve monitoring, discover issues and deliver better value to the customer
Performs quality assurance
Defines reporting and alerting requirements
Owns and develops relationships with partners, working with them to optimize and enhance our solutions
Works closely with management to prioritize business and information needs
Locates and defines new process improvement opportunities
Maintains documentation in CRM tool
Regular and predictable attendance
Consistently demonstrates compliance with HIPAA regulations, professional conduct, and ethical practice
Works to encourage and promote Company culture throughout the organization
Other duties as may be assigned

QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college in related field or commensurate work experience
Previous experience in Business/Systems Analysis or Quality Assurance
Proven experience in eliciting requirements and testing
Ability to work under pressure and meet project deliver dates
Experience in analyzing data to draw business-related conclusions and in data visualization techniques and tools
Basic knowledge in writing SQL queries
Solid experience in generating process and screen design documentation
Strong written and verbal communication skills including technical writing skills
Strong knowledge of and experience with Microsoft Word and Excel

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer. Moderate to significant amount of stress in meeting deadlines and dealing with day-to-day responsibilities. Must be able to drive a vehicle and daytime/overnight travel as required.

BENEFITS

401K (4% Match, Immediate Vesting)

Accident insurance

Competitive salary

Employee Assistance Program

Health Savings Account

PRE-EMPLOYMENT SCREENING

Drug Screen and Background Check Required

Centene is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity, and values the ways in which we are different. What to Expect

Data Analyst, IT Applications Engineering The Data and Analytics, Applications Engineering team drives business critical decision making, and ensures cross functional alignment of goals and execution for all of Tesla. We stay focused on aligning the highest-level company priorities with strong day-to-day operations and build capabilities to power hyper-growth. As the Data analyst, you will partner with members of the Data and Analytics team and its leadership in Applications Engineering to provide critical data operations to support our demanding and fast-paced environment where you will work on critical subsystems of an incredibly exciting product.

What You’ll Do
Design, code, test, correct and document programs and scripts using agreed standards and tools to achieve a well-engineered result.


Collecting and processing large data sets from various sources, such as databases, APIs, and third-party tools
Developing and implementing data models and algorithms to analyze complex data sets
Identifying trends and patterns in data to develop insights and recommendations that inform business decisions
Creating reports and visualizations that effectively communicate data insights to stakeholders
Collaborate with internal and external data providers on data validation providing feedback and making customized changes to data feeds and data mappings
Developing and maintaining data pipelines and databases to ensure data accuracy and integrity
Staying up to date with industry trends and best practices in data analysis and reporting
Design and execute experiments to test hypotheses and validate findings
Gathers and processes raw, structured, semi-structured, and unstructured data using batch and real-time data processing frameworks
Ensures data quality and implements tools and frameworks for automating the identification of data quality issues
Provides ongoing support, monitoring, and maintenance of deployed products.
Work with systems that handle sensitive data with strict controls and change management processes
Provide timely and accurate estimates for newly proposed functionality enhancements
Develop, enforce, and recommend enhancements to Applications in the area of standards, methodologies, compliance, and quality assurance practices; participate in design and code walkthroughs
Utilize technical and domain knowledge to develop and implement effective solutions; provide hands on mentoring to team members through all phases of the Systems Development Life Cycle (SDLC) using Agile practice
On-call support, where needed
What You’ll Bring
Strong experience with relational and multi-parallel processing databases like Vertica, SQL Server, and MySQL. NoSQL databases experience is a plus
Background in data warehousing, data modeling, data access, and data storage techniques
Strong proficiency in query writing is required
Experience with design, development, and implementation of highly scalable, high-volume software systems and components, source of truth systems for different business areas, developing and maintaining web services in an agile environment

Ability to support multiple on-going projects in a fast-paced environment
Strong analytical and problem-solving ability to design an effective solution.
Strong communicational skills, organizational skills, negotiation skills, and flexibility to address competing demands
Passion for Tesla’s products and belief in Tesla’s mission to accelerate the transition to sustainable energy

Location – Austin, Texas (USA)

Work experience with Informatica
Experience in Big Data processing using Apache Hadoop/Spark ecosystem applications like Hadoop, Hive, or Spark
Work experience with Tableau or any visualization tool

Welcome to ConocoPhillips, where innovation and excellence create a platform for opportunity and growth. Come realize your full potential here.

Who We Are

We are one of the world’s largest independent exploration and production companies, based on proved reserves and production of liquids and natural gas. With operations and activities in 13 countries, we explore for, develop, and produce crude oil and natural gas globally. We are challenged with an important job to safely find and deliver energy to the world. Our employees are critical to our success, and with them we power civilization.

We’re grounded by our SPIRIT Values – safety, people, integrity, responsibility, innovation, and teamwork. These values position us to deliver strong performance in a dynamic business – but not at all costs. We believe it’s not just what we do – it’s how we do it – that sets us apart.

We strive to make a significant difference in the communities where we live and operate. We create an inclusive environment that values all voices and opinions. Together, the different backgrounds, experiences, ideas, and perspectives of our employees drive our success.

Job Summary
Permian Basin Overview

ConocoPhillips and its heritage companies have operated in the Permian Basin for almost 100 years. Across New Mexico and Texas, the company holds conventional positions in the Northwest Shelf and Central Basin Platform, and an unconventional position in the Delaware Basin. Permian saw significant growth in 2021 with the acquisition of Concho Resources Inc. in January 2021 and the addition of Shell’s Permian acreage in December 2021. At year-end, the company held approximately 1.5 million net acres in the Permian Basin.

Net production for the Permian in 2022 was 461 MBOED.
Job Description

If you are selected for the Land Analyst position, you will partner with the Permian Land Asset Teams in acquiring and maintaining oil & gas leases and Exploration & Production contracts. In addition, you will be a key contact for mineral owner questions, issues or demands.

Responsibilities may include:
Research and analyze leases and contracts
Calculate oil and gas mineral interest ownership
Research leases, contracts, and mineral title and provide recommendations to Land Negotiators
Prepare draft oil and gas agreements and exhibits
Input and ensure accuracy of data entries in well planning systems to set up operated and non-operated wells, this includes calculating and determining working interest and net revenue interest in various projects
Input and ensure accuracy of data entries for lease and contract information in Quorum Land System (i.e. ownership, burdens, payment, legal descriptions, depths, obligations, expirations, and payments)
Gather and analyze data for monthly lease and contract obligation reports
Maintain databases that track working interest ownership in wells and units
Create various reports from Land Systems, Spotfire and Business Objects pertaining to critical leases, contracts, agreements, acreage reporting, and cessation of production, etc
Emphasis is on research, creating various reports, and analysis of data
Advise and make decisions on due diligence efforts to cure title when divesting or acquiring acreage
Make recommendations to internal groups such as Finance, Land and Asset Teams on managing budgets as it relates to Lease Acquisitions, Exchanges, and other related land transactions
Develop and maintain network relationships with government agencies, lessors, mineral owners, and co-owners
Develop and maintain network relationships with other groups within the company, i.e., Asset Teams, Legal, Finance, Accounting, Tax, Production, and Audit
Basic/Required:
Must be legally authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis for anyone other than current employer
Intermediate level of proficiency with common industry Land systems i.e. SAP, Quorum, ArcMap, etc.
Intermediate proficiency with Microsoft O365 applications: Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, SharePoint, Teams and Word
Intermediate level of proficiency with financial and reporting systems i.e. SAP, Business Objects, Spotfire, etc.
Preferred:
Bachelor’s degree or higher in Business, Accounting, Finance, Economics, or other technical discipline or foreign equivalent
5+ years of experience in oil and gas Land and/or in a Financial Analyst role
Professional Lease or Title Analyst Certification
Proactively seeks opportunities for improvement
Well organized and detail oriented
Encourages new ways of looking at problems, processes, or solutions
Actively seeks out diverse people and organizations to collectively achieve business goals
Consistently demonstrates high integrity, behaves ethically
Builds effective solutions based on available information and makes timely decisions that are safe and ethical
Takes ownership of actions and follows through on dedications by holding others accountable and standing up for what's right
Builds positive relationships based on trust and seeks collaboration across organizational boundaries to achieve goals

Job Title: Senior Compliance Data Analyst, North American Surface Transportation Compliance
Job Description:
2+ years of professional or military experience
2+ years of working with computers and Microsoft Office products and applications experience
Experience with Microsoft Office products and applications
Work 40 hours/week, and overtime as required
2+ years of experience in a business analyst/data analyst/statistical analyst role, conducting analysis, data mining using Excel, extracting & processing data using SQL, and dashboard development, including Tableau.
Are you interested in working on a fast-paced team that pioneers ways to improve compliance within North American Surface Transportation? Do you have a passion for deep diving data and crunching numbers? Are you motivated to work on challenging problems or develop innovative solutions for Amazon’s supply chain? This is what the role is all about!

The NAST Compliance team is seeking a highly skilled and motivated data analyst to support business initiatives by identifying and analyzing data, driving process improvements, and eliminating defects. We are seeking a highly skilled and detail-oriented Inventory Analyst to join our team. The Analyst will play a crucial role in analyzing and interpreting supply chain data to identify trends, optimize processes, and drive informed decision-making. This position requires a strong analytical mindset, exceptional problem-solving skills, and proficiency in data analysis tools and techniques. The ideal candidate will have a solid understanding of supply chain management principles and a passion for leveraging data to improve operational efficiency.


Collect, analyze, and interpret large sets of data related to supply chain operations, including inventory levels, demand forecasting, transportation costs, and supplier performance.
Develop and maintain supply chain data models, databases, and dashboards to track key performance indicators (KPIs) and provide actionable insights to stakeholders.
Conduct root cause analysis on supply chain issues, identifying bottlenecks, inefficiencies, and areas for improvement.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including procurement, logistics, operations, sales, and finance, to define data requirements and ensure data accuracy and consistency.
Monitor supply chain metrics and performance trends, identifying patterns and anomalies and proactively recommending corrective actions.
Develop forecasting models to support demand planning and optimize inventory levels, minimizing stockouts and excess inventory.
Identify opportunities for process automation and optimization through data-driven insights, streamlining supply chain operations, and reducing costs.
Perform ad-hoc analysis and prepare reports and presentations to communicate findings and recommendations to senior management.
Stay up to date with industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in supply chain analytics and data management.
Monitor and track rebate programs.
Produce, manage, and present quality of inventory data to sales leaders.

QUALIFICATIONS AND REQUIREMENTS

Bachelor’s degree in Supply Chain Management, Business Analytics, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field.
Proven work experience as a data analyst or in a similar analytical role, preferably in supply chain or logistics.
Strong proficiency in data analysis tools such as Excel, SQL, and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Experience with statistical analysis, forecasting techniques, and data modeling.
Familiarity with supply chain management concepts, including procurement, inventory management, and logistics.
Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills, with keen attention to detail.
Ability to communicate complex analysis results in a clear and concise manner to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Strong organizational and time management skills, with the ability to prioritize and handle multiple projects simultaneously.
Familiarity with ERP and supply chain management systems (e.g., , Sage, Netstock) is a plus.
Knowledge of programming languages such as Python or R is desirable.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and independently with minimal supervision.

Title: Configuration and Data Management Analyst

Client: Bell

Duration: fulltime/contract

Job Description:

Job Summary:

The configuration manager establishes and maintains configuration processes; communicates these processes, variations, and deviations to the program; and coordinates, submits and maintains technical data and relevant processes.

Responsibilities:

Review program engineering configuration control methodology and variances in the Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) environment (ENOVIA) and provide specific direction to data owners that will prevent process or system issues and to ensure proper standards and quality are established and maintained
Monitor engineering release and provide appropriate and compliant data submittals to requesting or contracting customers.
Analyze program Functional, Allocated, Initial Product, and Product baselines in ENOVIA for compliance to industry and organization standards.
Analyze assigned program Feature/Configuration Item (CI) structure in ENOVIA and their related data and documentation elements
Analyze data to make recommendations that aid program and functional leadership to plan work, understand data flow, and reduce schedule impacts.
Coordinate with cross-functional teams to resolve issues and provide specific direction to data owners to ensure compliance.
Coordinate with contracts organization and customers regarding new or changing requirements.
Establish and maintain good working relationships with internal Bell and external customers (USG, regulatory agencies, partners, OEMs, and suppliers).
Schedule and manage activities related to program or product-related change boards (e.g. ****Technical Review Board (TRB), Configuration Change Board (CCB), etc.) by providing direction to participants and stakeholders before, during and after the sessions.
Support CM reviews and audits, including FCA/PCA and provide direction before, during and after the events to prevent or resolve issues.
Monitor the stability and health of the Engineering Bill-of-Material and Planning Bill-of-****Material for the assigned program and provide feedback to data owners regarding data issues.
Manage Contract Data Requirements List (CDRL) and Data Item Deliverable (DID) requirements.
Determine and apply the proper data marking to deliverable information.
Manage engineering data correction, consolidation, or system migration.

Education and Experience:

Bachelor’s or 4-year degree is required
Must have certification in configuration management
Configuration Analyst 3-8+ years of configuration management, data management, administrative or office environment experience
Familiarity with ENOVIA.
Familiarity with a Product Life-cycle Management (PLM) software, data management software, and document imaging software.
Practical and working knowledge of the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR), Export Administration Regulations (EAR) and associated markings.
Basic understanding of roles, tasks, policies and procedures required to execute the change process, configuration management, data management, and product-related data maintained in the ENOVIA environment.
Familiarity with the Configuration Management principles and methods contained in ANSI/EIA 649B, ISO 10007, and MIL-HDBK-61A.

Familiarity with the Data Management principles and methods contained in DI-SESS-81000E, DoD Directive 5230.24, and MIL-STD-31000A.

Ally Financial only succeeds when its people do - and that’s more than some cliché people put on job postings. We live this stuff! The Opportunity




As a leader in digital financial services, our customer and employee experiences run on data. We depend on the Ally analytics community to fuel these journeys and to help nearly 10,000 leaders and employees make countless data-driven decisions every day.

Reporting to the Director of Strategy & Analytics, this position's primary responsibilities will include strategy development and performance analysis to optimize portfolio results. The ideal candidate must be passionate about delivering results, must be an innovative and strategic thinker, willing to challenge status quo, can learn quickly, is self-motivated, detail oriented, and can sift through voluminous amounts of information to pinpoint which items are relevant to understanding Business results. They will be able to apply knowledge of business and balanced judgment in interpretation of data (analytics).

Provide analytical and data support in the design and review of strategy tests and current operations.

Apply sound control processes into daily/weekly/monthly processes to effectively identify, assess, and manage risk.
Maintain code logic to pull, sanitize, aggregate, conform, and produce operational and portfolio-level reports accurately.
Collaboratively work with business and operations partners to ensure alignment with Ally’s strategic imperatives.
Interface with various stakeholders within asset performance, credit risk, finance and strategy and analytics organizations to provide timely and accurate analysis.
The Skills You Bring
5+ years experience in analytics and knowledge of consumer financing. Prefer experience in a similar role focused on data/statistical analysis.
Candidate should possess outstanding analytical and problem-solving skills.
5+ years of practical experience working with large datasets with SQL and/or SAS knowledge.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to eﬀectively present proposals and vision to executive leadership.
Work well within a team of analysts and collaborate with individuals with technical and non-technical backgrounds.
Knowledge of statistics and quantitative models preferred.
Experience with designing and implementing champion challenger strategies preferred.
Bachelor’s degree preferred, BS or BA in Finance, Economics, Accounting, Mathematics, Information Technology or related field.

These tools allow internal customers to model sales force demographics, production, and more, helping them make informed decisions regarding sales force promotions, events, compensation, etc. Designs, builds, and deploys database tools using TABLEAU, COGNOS, SQL and PLSQL Developer. Research multiple technical solutions in order to determine optimum solution. Must understand the Mary Kay sales force demographics, compensation plans, sales force levels, and promotions to complete data modeling. Stays current with new releases of technical tools and keeps abreast of other data modeling tools. Must have a wide and deep knowledge of a particular function area in an application, system, or other technology.
Works closely with IST to keep current with the most up-to-date changes in technology. Partners with IST to ensure the U.S. Sales division is involved in projects and/or programs that affect the independent sales force.
Participates in assimilation program for the international markets. Meets with participants d shares crucial information about the role.
This job requires on-site work at a Mary Kay facility.

Skills & Experience

Experience: 3+ years of extensive technical and practical experience, including extensive knowledge of data warehousing, report development and data analysis and relational database design (normalized and dimensional) is required. Most recent 2-3 years of experience in project lead related work with a proven track record of consistently delivering projects as a Project Leader or a Project Manager.

Education: Bachelor/University Degree in business or technology area or equivalent applicable experience

Additional Skills & Abilities

1. 3+ years' experience TABLEAU, COGNOS. High proficiency in all COGNOS Toolset, Oracle SQL Queries, Microsoft SQL Queries, Microsoft Excel.

2. 3+ years' experience training business users for ad-hoc reporting and other tools.

3. 3+ years' experience dimensional modeling, the Kimball Business Intelligence (Data Warehouse) methodologies and ETL best practices.

4. Solid knowledge of software development, software deployment and post deployment software support processes are required.

5. Must be self-motivated and use business expertise to originate new ideas to solve business problems. Must approach situations from the business user perspective, gaining an understanding of business importance or value and leveraging technology to automate, simplify, accelerate or streamline business process.

6. Must be highly motivated with excellent analytical skills and possess excellent time management skills, a sense of urgency and be dedicated to completing tasks on schedule.

7. Must have a thorough understanding of or be able to demonstrate the ability to quickly learn the intricate details of the independent sales force career path and compensation programs.

8. Must have two-way communications skills that enable the incumbent to decipher and interpret user request versus actual needs and to gather requirements. Requires the ability to communicate data, information and solutions in such a way that the extensive information is easily understood and conveyed into actionable items that will directly and positively impact sales, team building, retention and independent sales force career development. Excellent verbal and written communication skills are required to communicate findings to all levels of employee including senior-level management.

We are looking for a Data Analyst to play a pivotal role in helping business stakeholders identify and solve business problems, improve processes, and make informed decisions. JOB SUMMARY:
The Incident Management Analyst (more daily event management) has a major role in managing ITSM processes based on ITIL best practices. Successful candidates will be focused on core IT Service Management/ITIL functions but not limited to areas such as Incident Management, Service Level Management, etc. The Incident Management Analyst will ensure that standardized methods and procedures (ITIL v4) are used for efficient and prompt handling of all incidents in order to minimize the impact of incidents on service quality and delivery. The Incident Management Analyst will be instrumental in identifying opportunities to improve day-to-day operations of the organization.

Proactive review of the environment – review for trends/work with service owners/bigger issue that warrants the creation of a ticket.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Determines, analyzes and formulates current practices, user needs and workflow processes, issues and potential solutions.

Obtains relevant data/information.

Analyzes, aggregates, assimilates, and validates data/information.

Coordinates resources assigned to complete projects. Includes managing and coordinating data, information and/or personnel.

Analyzes project impacts and dependencies across the IS organization.

Recommends process changes as determined from risk and failure points in the processes evaluated, with necessary modifications to workflows and/or current procedures to maximize the advantages of existing systems.

Analysis of current business practices, user needs and workflow processes.

Develop training programs and materials/documentation for all user types.

In the event of an outage, incident or emergency, ensures all Incident Management processes are adhered to. Making sure tickets are being generated/ parent/child tied correctly/ documentation accurate PREFERRED – experience with SNOW major incident module

Incident investigation and diagnosis.

Detection of possible problems and the assignment to the Problem Management team.
Participation in audit activities related to the Incident Management process.
Responsible for Incident Management reporting.
Collaborates with IS Leadership and IS Executive teams in driving service management best practice and ITIL process standardization.
Ability to create and deliver Executive Level reports based on ticket analysis. Pulling dashboard from SNOW to share with leaders
Identify areas of opportunities and recommend improvements in the execution of the process.
Continuous development and daily management of Service Quality.
Perform other duties as assigned.
Experience with SNOW dashboard – weekly aging report, working within SNOW to review tickets, looking at tickets that are nt being updated. Looking at incidents that are being re-assigned multiple times. Dig into the WHY. Opportunity to improve KA?
Monitor tickets for incorrect priority – just “watch the queue” real time
Ability to look at “what drove the tickets”
Knows difference between INCIDENT and SERVICE REQUESTS
Well rounded experience with incident management and how it all FITS TOGETHER
Participate in testing of new SNOW modules/upgrades
Take the data and TELL A STORY… what does it all mean?

KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS:

Excellent communicator with strong facilitation and soft skills.
Strong social, interpersonal skills, customer-centric attitude and ability to deal with highly complex and high pressured situations.
Analytical skills. Must possess the ability to understand business processes and workflows.
Ability to liaise with executive-level sponsors.
Ability to work well under pressure.
Flexible and adapts to rapid change.
Working knowledge of ServiceNow and other ticket systems.
Ability to logically analyze problems and develop efficient and effective solutions.
Ability to compile and analyze data, identify patterns, trends and problems, make recommendations for improvement, and prepare reports for management review.
Ability to plan, assign, and direct the work of others.
Ability to perform work requiring close attention to detail.
Ability to establish and maintain satisfactory relationships with other departments, employees, and the general public using courtesy, patience, and tact.
Verbal and written communication skills, planning, analytical and problem solving skills.
Good customer service skills required and ability to work well in a team environment.

Description:

By bringing together people that use their passion for purposeful innovation, at Lockheed Martin we keep people safe and solve the world's most complex challenges. Our people are some of the greatest minds in the industry and truly make Lockheed Martin a great place to work. With our employees as our priority, we provide diverse career opportunities designed to propel development and boost agility. Our flexible schedules, competitive pay, and comprehensive benefits enable our employees to live a healthy, fulfilling life at and outside of work. At Lockheed Martin, we place an emphasis on empowering our employees by fostering innovation, integrity, and exemplifying the epitome of corporate responsibility. Your Mission is Ours.

Sustainment is our tether to the customer. A lifeline that links Lockheed Martin to the front lines. An added layer of trust, demonstrating to our customer that their mission is our mission. Sustainment is what separates Lockheed Martin from the competition. As a Sustainment Support Specialist, your day to day duties will ensure our Lockheed Martin products are ready when are customer needs them, provide the best possible outcomes by using analytic driven solutions, and lower operating cost through dynamic data driven problem solving.

A Sustainment Support Specialist will perform:

World-class customer service
o Daily actions, no matter how small or large, play a critical role to ensure our Nation’s security is ready for threats near or far.


High level problem solving with real-world implications
o Using advanced analytics will provide insights into global supply inventories for LM products across the world. This data will ensure that parts are located, deployed, and secured on the flight line when our customers need them.


Reliability and Maintainability measures
o Forecasting maintenance using predictive health data, minimizing unscheduled downtime, reducing operating costs and keeping our products airworthy.

In this role, you will collaborate with our team to deploy advanced analytics for predictive health, enabling precise forecasting of maintenance actions and informing supply requirements. By implementing enhanced reliability, diagnostics, and new technologies, you will contribute to minimizing unscheduled maintenance, ensuring the highest level of system reliability for our customers. Furthermore, your knowledge of design principles will be beneficial in optimizing aircraft maintenance planning and execution, leading to improved mission readiness and fleet availability. Additional responsibilities include:


Collaborating with cross-functional teams to design, develop, integrate, test, and sustain complex systems and solutions for aerospace and defense applications.
Perform system modeling, simulation, and analysis to ensure the performance, reliability, and safety of developed systems.
Implement innovative technologies and industry best practices to drive continuous improvement to field performance.

Must be a US Citizen; this position will require a government security clearance. This position is located at a facility that requires special access.

Strong problem-solving skills with a keen eye for detail and an ability to think critically in a high tempo customer-centered environment.

Position Summary
The Production Engineering Cost Analyst will provide technical support for Production Engineering and Optimization Team. This role works closely with Engineering, Operations, and Corporate Planning teams to gather and analyze data in support of company operations. This position will report to the Engineering and Optimization Managing Director and is located in downtown Houston, TX. This role will support the production engineering and optimization team in developing, implementing and tracking various financial analysis initiatives, including budget and forecast processes. This includes the analysis and building of reports, presentations and other materials with the final product ultimately being distributed to team as well as executive leadership. Ideal candidate will have knowledge and experience in conducting financial analysis and preparing managerial reports. Knowledge of the energy industry, project management, and financial analysis techniques and modeling is highly preferred for this role. Level and salary commensurate with experience.
Essential Job Functions
Develop financial models for fixed, variable, and workover lease operating expense for accountability and planning purposes
Analyze current and past trends in key performance indicators including all areas of revenue, expenses, and capital expenditures as it relates to production operations
Monitor performance indicators, highlighting trends and analyzing causes of unexpected variance
Responsible for budgeting, forecasting, and planning process
Perform analysis between budgets, AFEs, field estimates, accruals, and actuals on a regular basis (i.e. monthly and quarterly)
Build robust financial models utilizing data in the system to support the aforementioned analysis. Modeling will require advanced excel skills.
Assist/lead in sensitivity analysis to provide external guidance for our plans
Partner with corporate planning to ensure data source consistency and reconcile differences between various financial models
Work with production department to ensure that the company’s long-range forecasts and models are captured accurately
Assist/lead with development of annual budget and monthly forecast processes
Identify opportunities to improve processes and alignment with various business development and growth initiatives, applying financial analysis advanced knowledge
Ad-Hoc reporting and analysis
Quarterly and monthly financial reports
Implement and work with a business intelligence tool and dashboard reports
Analyze complex financial information and reports to provide accurate and timely financial recommendations to management for decision making purposes
Work with engineers, operations, and IT group to improve processes and streamline data
Prepare data and reports to assist engineers in tracking performance against targets
Participate with special projects and other duties as needed
Ability to work on quick turnarounds with short deadlines
This job description is not intended to be an all-inclusive list of duties and responsibilities of the position. Incumbents will be required to follow any other job-related instructions and duties outside of their normal responsibilities as assigned by their supervisor.
Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor's degree
3 years experience in the E&P sector
Experience with financial analysis and forecasting
Excellent computer skills
Strong proficiency in Excel
Team player
Good analytical skills
Detail oriented and organized
Physical Requirements and Working Conditions: Must possess mobility to work in a standard office setting and to use standard office equipment, including a computer, stamina to maintain attention to detail despite interruptions, strength to lift and carry files weighing up to 10 pounds; vision to read printed materials and a computer screen, and hearing and speech to communicate in person and over the telephone
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Preferred Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in accounting
Experience with production programs (e.g. Aries, WellView, Enertia)
Experience in preparing and maintaining databases
Experience with Spotfire
Experience with SQL
Experience in building and maintaining dashboards in Power Bi or other visualization tool
Working experience writing python code or similar coding language to solve business needs
Knowledge of production operations

Job Description :
SENIOR HRIS ANALYST
JOB PURPOSE: The Sr. HRIS Analyst plays a vital role in enabling its customers to optimize the organization’s HRIS systems and create business value. Production support, reporting, data analysis, and configuring new Workday functionality are primary responsibilities. This individual works closely with team members and business partners to interpret data and develop solutions that provide value to our customers.
This position will require collaboration across the business to develop and implement data-driven solutions to ensure adherence to company compliance standards and maintaining internal audit process to ensure data integrity.
DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Manages end to end employee data flow, deep understanding the payroll implication of the data entered. Integration support with 3rd party vendors.
Works collaboratively with HR partners and team members to troubleshoot, research, and escalate issues as necessary
Reviews system data on a regular basis to ensure data accuracy, consistency, and completeness both within and across systems
Follow up with HR, Compensation, Benefits, Payroll and Department Managers to resolve data integrity issues
Escalate Data Processing issues to Management, along with recommendations for potential solutions
Must use discretion and independent judgment in data analysis and reviewing data integrity issues
Generate standard HRIS Reports as prescribed
Runs queries and reports to analyze data
Assist in the review, testing and implementation of system upgrades. Collaborate with functional and technical staff to coordinate application of upgrade or fix. Work to research and resolve issues with data
Lead enhancement projects and change management. Gather, build and document business requirements from corporate supporting teams, liaise with IT on these requirements and test the resulting enhancements to ensure accurate functionality.
Develop and deliver training
Identify/Develop/Implement streamlined process
Provide alternate solutions and recommendations for complex business issues
Provide Tier II Support via internal ticketing tool.
Identify and prioritize key optimization opportunities
Maintain awareness on applicable Workday updates and trends, including evaluation and system testing for Workday releases.
Develop change management communications for Workday enhancements
Maintain up to date documentation for job aids, Opus materials, and business requirements
Manage documentation, including job aids, Opus materials, and business requirements related to the configuration of the core Workday system.
Execute mass data changes in core system (e.g. EIBs), ensuring highest level of data integrity and customer service orientation
REQUIRED SKILLS:
Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field of study or 4+ years of HRIS work experience
Recent Workday HRIS experience is required
Strong technical implementation skills
Ability to maintain confidentiality to sensitive employee information
Self-starter. Ability to work independently and as a member of a team
Team-oriented with the ability to build relationships and foster trust at all levels of the organization
Excellent collaboration and communications skills; including oral, written, interpersonal and presentation skills
Demonstrated experience translating business requirements into technical specifications
Exercises independent judgement and discretion in developing methods, techniques, and evaluation criterion for obtaining results
Ability to create dashboards, metrics, and advance analytical reports in Workday
Advanced MS Excel skills and Proficient in other MS Office Suite products
PREFERRED SKILLS:
3+ years of Workday HRIS experience
Workday Certification
