We do not discriminate in any aspect of employment on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, age, veteran status, disability, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local employment discrimination laws where Progressive Leasing does business.

Job Role: Configuration and Data Management Analyst

Location: Dallas, TX (Onsite)

Client: LTTS

Duration: Contract/Full Time

Job Description:

Description/Comment:

Job Summary:

The configuration manager establishes and maintains configuration processes; communicates these processes, variations, and deviations to the program; and coordinates, submits and maintains technical data and relevant processes.

Responsibilities:

Review program engineering configuration control methodology and variances in the Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) environment (ENOVIA) and provide specific direction to data owners that will prevent process or system issues and to ensure proper standards and quality are established and maintained
Monitor engineering release and provide appropriate and compliant data submittals to requesting or contracting customers.
Analyze program Functional, Allocated, Initial Product, and Product baselines in ENOVIA for compliance to industry and organization standards.
Analyze assigned program Feature/Configuration Item (CI) structure in ENOVIA and their related data and documentation elements
Analyze data to make recommendations that aid program and functional leadership to plan work, understand data flow, and reduce schedule impacts.
Coordinate with cross-functional teams to resolve issues and provide specific direction to data owners to ensure compliance.
Coordinate with contracts organization and customers regarding new or changing requirements.
Establish and maintain good working relationships with internal Bell and external customers (USG, regulatory agencies, partners, OEMs, and suppliers).
Schedule and manage activities related to program or product-related change boards (e.g. ****Technical Review Board (TRB), Configuration Change Board (CCB), etc.) by providing direction to participants and stakeholders before, during and after the sessions.
Support CM reviews and audits, including FCA/PCA and provide direction before, during and after the events to prevent or resolve issues.
Monitor the stability and health of the Engineering Bill-of-Material and Planning Bill-of-****Material for the assigned program and provide feedback to data owners regarding data issues.
Manage Contract Data Requirements List (CDRL) and Data Item Deliverable (DID) requirements.
Determine and apply the proper data marking to deliverable information.
Manage engineering data correction, consolidation, or system migration.

Education and Experience:

Bachelor’s or 4-year degree is required
Must have certification in configuration management
Configuration Analyst 3-8+ years of configuration management, data management, administrative or office environment experience
Familiarity with ENOVIA.
Familiarity with a Product Life-cycle Management (PLM) software, data management software, and document imaging software.
Practical and working knowledge of the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR), Export Administration Regulations (EAR) and associated markings.
Basic understanding of roles, tasks, policies and procedures required to execute the change process, configuration management, data management, and product-related data maintained in the ENOVIA environment.
Familiarity with the Configuration Management principles and methods contained in ANSI/EIA 649B, ISO 10007, and MIL-HDBK-61A.
Familiarity with the Data Management principles and methods contained in DI-SESS-81000E, DoD Directive 5230.24, and MIL-STD-31000A.

Overview:
Veritex Community Bank is looking for an experienced Business/Systems Analyst to partner with PMO and Veritex business partners across Commercial & Consumer Lending, Credit Cards, Special Assets, Credit, and Treasury. The Business/Systems Analyst will serve as a liaison between Veritex team members, Technology, and 3rd party vendors as they implement process improvements and operational efficiencies across the bank.

In this role, the Business/Systems Analyst will be asked to analyze data and processes, problem solve, document project related information (project charter, business requirements, process workflows, test cases, etc.). Project related responsibilities include but are not limited to discovery, issue tracking, change management, testing, and additional needs as they arise in support of project efforts.


To succeed in this role, applicants should be a strong team player, have excellent time management, and communication skills. Although there will be independent work, this role focuses on collaboration with internal and external partners to deliver results on deadlines. The Business/Systems Analyst will support projects from concept to delivery and post-implementation.
Responsibilities:
Transform business requests into actionable deliverables (project charter, business requirements, process maps, costs/benefits, etc.)
Conduct stakeholder interviews and requirement sessions to capture and refine business requirements and targeted analysis.
Plan, schedule and facilitate meetings with business owners & SMEs
Record & distribute detailed meeting minutes
Track and monitor risks, issues, actions, and decisions
Obtain, analyze, and synthesize information from multiple business users to help distinguish request from needs
Become a product and/or, process subject matter expert
Develop and execute test plans and scripts, lead testing such as user acceptance and system integration
Act as liaison between business and technical members of the project, if needed
Ensure adherence to internal practices and standards resulting in consistent development and implementation of project components
Provide training and support to end users
Qualifications:
Job Skills and Qualifications:
Proven ability to build rapport and maintain relationships with internal partners at all levels within the organization
Ability to work in a fast paced, deadline driven environment
Highly organized and detail-oriented
Outstanding organizational and effective time management skills
Superior problem solving, analytical, and critical thinking skills required
5+ years of business/systems analyst experience required across one or more of the following project types: Business Process Reengineering, Strategy Transformation, Vendor Integration, SDLC projects
Proven work experience as a Business Analyst or Consultant from top tier management consulting, or similar role
Approaches work in a flexible, solution focused manner and is able to collaborate effectively with team members
Self-starter who can work independently with minimal supervision
Experience in data analysis, and general project management methods
Experience developing, leading, and executing test plans and scripts, including both user acceptance and system integration testing
An ability to prepare and interpret data, flowcharts, schedules and step-by-step action plans
Strong client-facing skills
Proficient use of MS Word, MS PowerPoint, MS Excel, MS Outlook, MS SharePoint and MS Visio
Hands-on experience with project management tools (e.g. Smartsheet, Visio, MS Project)
B.S. in Business Administration or related field
Assists in researching process and/or technical related incidents and issues, including conducting detailed root cause analysis to avoid further impacts and decrease the risk of recurring issues
Strong sense of urgency and ownership when resolving issues

Job Title: Senior Associate (Data Analytics), Disputes and Investigations
Job Description:
Description

Senior Associate (Data Analytics), Disputes and Investigations

Alvarez & Marsal is a premier independent global professional services firm specializing in providing turnaround management, restructuring, performance improvement and corporate advisory services. Our talent drives our success, resulting in our growing Disputes and Investigations practice becoming one of the most respected in the industry. From the boardroom to the courtroom, the firm delivers a wide array of solutions to contentious situations by drawing on the deep skills, diverse disciplines and experiences of its professionals. We are recognized by Global Arbitration Review as one of the leading firms of independent experts for arbitration and considered a top three firm by Who’s Who Legal based on the number of experts across the globe. Our clients include major banks, leading law firms, private equity firms and well-known corporations and upper-mid-sized companies.

What will you be doing?

You will be working closely with a team to resolve complex matters that pose a threat or disruption to normal operations for our clients. You will support incisive fraud investigations, create forensic analysis, and provide litigation support.

You will be helping our clients and their counsel understand and resolve the financial impacts around their legal matters relating to complex accounting and financial issues across a wide range of projects involving economic disputes, claims, misunderstandings, investigations of white-collar crime, forensic accounting and consulting, and post-acquisition disputes. Working as a partner to our clients by building consultative relationships you will develop an in-depth understanding of the client, the industry and the case to surface and address key issues, from the big picture to the smallest details. You will use your technical skills to help analyze various forms of structured and unstructured data, identify and deploy analytical methods for effective and rigorous analysis, and think creatively about visualization and presentation of insights. Relying on your initiative and flexibility to deliver results in an agile and collaborative team environment, you will build strong relationships with clients, legal counsel, and expert witnesses. Some of the main responsibilities are:

Assisting with compiling, normalizing, and analyzing disparate datasets to help our clients solve problems in an investigation, dispute, or accounting related matter
Working with large datasets, assisting our advisory teams in gaining insights through a variety of data-driven solutions such as statistical analysis, financial modeling, KPI and management reporting, utilizing tools such as SAS, R, Python, or SQL to interrogate and understand data.
Perform advanced querying techniques in SQL (and other database languages) to profile, summarize, make sense of, and trace information across systems
Contributing to the updating of complex financial models and analyses
Documenting analyses assumptions, methodologies, and sources of information used
Assisting with the drafting of reports and other client deliverables
Performing quality control review of reports and other client deliverables
Balancing multiple client projects and other responsibilities
Communicating proactively and presenting effectively to all levels of the engagement team

Who will you be working with?

At A&M, you will have the opportunity to work with a diverse team of supportive and motivated professionals that loves to share their knowledge and depth of industry experience with others. A&M's Disputes and Investigations practice comprises professionals from a wide range of backgrounds who bring and share their deep expertise in conducting investigations, delivering expert witness reports, and providing forensic technology services. We have an inclusive developmental environment where everyone has the opportunity to learn and grow. Our culture is characterized by openness and entrepreneurial thinking, with a foundation of mutual respect and high-quality standards for our work. We strive to remove bureaucracy in favor of recognizing our team through advancement opportunities and a motivating performance-based reward structure.

How will you grow and be supported?

As a Disputes and Investigations Associate/Sr. Associate, you will have the opportunity to take your career to the next level by gaining invaluable experience across different industries, sectors, and companies on a variety of interesting and critical projects. Building on your critical thinking skills, you will have the opportunity to develop your research and analysis skills in complex, ambiguous situations. Strengthening your communication skills, you will work to distill your findings into concise, intuitive, and compelling data stories. As part of a team, you will be working closely with our experienced professionals who will provide you with developmental feedback and growth opportunities. You will have the chance to gain exposure to a variety of disputes and investigation projects across an array of clients and over time grow and specialize within the areas that interest you.

We offer competitive benefits and opportunities to support your personal and professional development. Click to learn about our commitment to your well-being. A&M recognizes that our people drive our growth, and you will be provided with the best available training and development resources through formalized and on the job training, as well as networking opportunities with renowned legal and accounting experts. Learn more about why A&M is a great place work.

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree with a technical and/or analytical focus (i.e., computer science, information systems, engineering) with a minor or dual major in Finance or Accounting
An excellent academic record from an accredited university
Analytical mindset - critical thinking and complex problem solving
Technical skills including SQL, Python, R, VBA, Tableau required
Experience with relational databases
Experience with ETL software such as Microsoft SSIS, Alteryx ETL, and Pentaho preferred
Advanced proficiency with Microsoft Office
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Attention to detail and accuracy
Effective interpersonal skills - good team player with the ability to work under pressure
Ability and willingness to maintain a flexible work schedule in order to meet client needs
Hybrid - Ability to work in a flexible hybrid work arrangement, part time in physical office and remote.
Flexibility to travel

The salary range is $80,000 - $110,000 annually, dependent on several variables including but not limited to education, experience, skills, and geography. In addition, A&M offers a discretionary bonus program which is based on a number of factors, including individual and firm performance. Please ask your recruiter for details.

#LI-PD1

It's an exciting time to be a member of the Fisher Investments Technology Department. We're investing in the future of our firm's technology and are building our team to achieve global growth. We are looking for a Business Analyst to support our Technology Business Services team. If you are looking for an opportunity to make a difference as we develop scalable and strategic solutions to support our global growth, we want to hear from you!

The Opportunity:

The Business Analyst (Portfolio Management Technology) will perform daily health checks on Fisher’s OMS platform – Charles River – to ensure the following: System is up and running, daily data feeds are processed, system workflows remain operational and connectivity from Charles River to Brokers and Custodians are working (FIX, SWIFT). The Business Analyst will also step in to support the various business stakeholders in different aspects of the Order Management and Execution Management System. You will report to an Application Development Team Leader.

The Day-to-Day:
Troubleshoot any outages identified during health checks
Engage vendors and our teams to resolve any issues identified
Communicate Issues Identified:
Alert our users and other technology partners of any issues
Daily interaction with users:
Field issues reported by users throughout the day and perform necessary troubleshooting
Field training requests from users
Formulate and articulate ideal solutions in partnership with the stakeholders to gain operational efficiencies over time
Track Production Issues
Log and diagnose production issues and track resolutions to follow
Periodically communicate status or project plans to all partners
Identify trends and take proactive steps to prevent incidents
Coordinate and plan for regular maintenance schedules
Your Qualifications:
3+ years of experience supporting Investment Management - Order Management systems including system configuration & parameter maintenance, user interface configurations & permissioning
18+ months of experience performing start of day health checks on order management systems including FIX heartbeats, data loads, batch completions
3+ years of experience performing business analysis and troubleshooting of issues reported by users on Order management platforms such as Charles River
18+ months of experience with user communications to effectively notify users of planned or ad hoc downtimes, maintenance schedules
Bachelor's degree (B.A.) in Computer Science, Management Information Systems or an equivalent field
Why Fisher Investments:

We work for a bigger purpose: bettering the investment universe. We take great pride in our inclusive culture, our learning and development framework customized for every employee, and our Great Place to Work Certification. It's the people that make the Fisher purpose possible, and we invest in them by offering exceptional benefits like:

About AppLovin

AppLovin makes technologies that help businesses of every size connect to their ideal customers. The company provides end-to-end software and AI solutions for businesses to reach, monetize and grow their global audiences. For more information about AppLovin, visit: www.applovin.com.

To deliver on this mission, our global team is composed of team members with life experiences, backgrounds, and perspectives that mirror our developers and customers around the world. At AppLovin, we are intentional about the team and culture we are building, seeking candidates who are outstanding in their own right and also demonstrate their support of others.

Fortune recognized AppLovin as one of the Best Workplaces in the Bay Area 2022, and is a Certified Great Place to Work in 2021, 2022 and 2023.

Introduction:

AppLovin Games entertains people with the world’s best mobile games. Our studios create some of the most popular games in the world! Join the Product Marketing team that imagines and produces fun and engaging ads that set the stage for millions to download and play our games.

We are looking for a highly capable Analyst, Product Marketing to manage our creative production for AppLovin Games portfolios. In this role, you will be reporting into the Director of Product Marketing and your duties will include coordinating with different teams to produce creatives to ensure sustainable campaign growth. This will include strategic creative planning, execution, data analysis, and marketability optimization. The candidate should have experience and familiarity with project management, knowledge of marketing insight and creative design, and possess strong verbal/written communication skills.

Job Responsibilities:

Utilize internal/external creative resources to develop and execute creative strategies that drive acquisition, engagement, and retention during the entire product life cycle.
Collaborate with the designers, developers, and vendors to produce Videos, Playables, and Statics to ensure our games have sufficient and high-performing creatives across networks.
Align with the UA strategy and constantly enable high-performing results and optimize creative processes to help Growth sustain positive ROI.
Work closely with in-house creative directions and share qualitative and quantitative creative learnings across internal creative teams.
Periodically doing industry market research, trends, and competitor analysis across genres and sharing qualitative insights within the organization.
Continually synthesize market trends, think outside of the box, run hypothesis tests, and analyze data collected from different channels to optimize ad performance and gain valuable insights about our audiences through a data-driven approach.
Coordinate with Growth/Product/Dev/Appstore Optimization/Design on the creative support for studios’ published titles' LiveOps and testing titles' marketability.
Document best practices of creative learning and process improvement.

Position Requirements:

1-3 years of mobile gaming product marketing or product-related experience.
Ability to generate creative solutions and quick iterations, managing and inspiring creative teams.
Strong written/verbal communication and project management skills.
Able to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Solid knowledge of the growth, data analytics, product, and mobile gaming industry.
Strong creative sense and enjoy innovating

Familiarity with Sensor Tower, Asana, and Google Suite.
Basic design skills: Adobe Creative Suite applications, quick sketch, illustrations, video editing, experience sourcing assets (Stock Footage/Music/SFX
Can do attitude and self-driven, quick learner, and quickly adapt to changes
Team player loves sharing and learning within the teams
Multi-language skills
Play mobile games

At CES we have a bold ambition for growth. We are passionate about delivering an unrivalled service for our customers and providing a strong culture with career opportunities for our people.



Across IT we are on an exciting mission to ensure we harness our growth opportunities by designing our technology architecture and solutions for constant evolution. We have a fast-growing technology team delivering a portfolio of transformative work, expanding our digital options, and upgrading and future-proofing our systems to place us at the forefront of the marketplace.

We believe that teams who design, own and run our technology solutions are more connected to the value they create. We are always looking to improve, collaborate and innovate and this is where you come in…

Summary

Collaborate with Finance SME, support the change management process by helping teams adapt to new systems and processes, addressing any resistance or concerns.
Compile and manage backlog of user stories created in collaboration with the delivery team.
Utilize outstanding communication skills to be a conduit for technical and non-technical teams.
Facilitate workshops and meetings at all stages of the delivery lifecycle.

The Data Reporting Specialist will research and report data to multiple constituents of the university and collaborate with department leadership to maintain datasets, report data, and assist with Student Teaching Evaluations. The position will also assist with analyzing data, and coordinating assessment activities.





ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Conducts relevant research for the completion of various data requests.
Coordinates with internal and external constituencies, using large data sets to perform analysis for the completion of ad hoc data requests.
Assists with the administration and coordination of surveys and university-wide testing.
Assists in additional statistical or research activities required for completing internal and external reports reporting internally and externally.
Assists with the completion and dissemination of: federal and state reports, annual market reports and surveys such as US News & World Report; internal reports, such as the University Profile and Common Data Set; materials requested by accrediting bodies; and data exchanges.
Assists departments and non-academic offices with their assessment activities. Provides support for the assessment of academic programs, including providing the required data for academic program reviews.
Maintains the consistency and accuracy of disseminated data.
Performs other duties as assigned.




QUALIFICATIONS:

Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university in computer science, mathematics, business systems or equivalent fields or an equivalent combination of education and work related experience (Experience with or a strong aptitude for utilizing relational database technology, SQL queries, technological intuitiveness, database management and reporting tools are highly encouraged to apply)
Two or more years querying databases, conducting analysis, preparing reports and assisting with assessment projects, preferably within a higher education setting.
Must have valid driver's license, motor vehicle liability insurance and personal injury insurance; or have a self-reliant source of transportation to conduct business on a daily basis
Must clear and maintain a favorable background investigation and clearance.
Experience with one or more of the following: SPSS or other statistical software, Job scheduler applications (SOS), DegreeWorks, Recruiter, StarRez is preferred
Experience in a Higher Education environment preferred
Must have ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously and provide input in a team environment
Must have the ability to demonstrate intermediate to high skills in MS Office (Word, Excel, Teams, Outlook and PowerPoint) including experience with virtual platforms such as Zoom. strong Excel experience (VLOOKUPs, conditional formatting, etc) highly desirable
Must have a high ethical standards and a strong sense of confidentiality.
Ability to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing and establish and maintain effective working relationships with students, employees, and the public
Must have the ability to work effectively with communities across the university and the commitment to work collaboratively with a diverse and dynamic community.
Experience with data analysis and application of data analytic methods preferred; Knowledge of data management principles to include cleaning and maintenance of data sets.
Experience in a higher education setting, designing and conducting research studies, survey design and ethical research rules, preferred


PHYSICAL DEMANDS:

Working conditions are in an office environment and university campus setting. Must be able to move across the university campus to conduct day to day business.
While performing this role, the employee will be regularly required to sit, walk, and stand; talk and hear, both in person and by telephone; and use hands repetitively to operate standard office equipment; and occasionally required to lift up to 25 pounds.
Specific vision abilities required by this position include close vision, distance vision, and the ability to adjust focus.
Frequently communicates with others using approved technological resources; must be able to exchange accurate information through designated systems within a timely manner.
Constantly operates a computer and other office productivity machinery.

Job Title: Senior Data Analyst for Strategic Initiatives
Job Description:
Senior Data Analyst for Strategic Initiatives - (SCH00000179)
Description


Salary Range:

Salary commensurate with experience and qualifications

About SMU

SMU’s more than 12,000 diverse, high-achieving students come from all 50 states and over 80 countries to take advantage of the University’s small classes, meaningful research opportunities, leadership development, community service, international study and innovative programs.

SMU serves approximately 7,000 undergraduates and 5,000 graduate students through eight degree-granting schools: Dedman College of Humanities and Sciences, Cox School of Business, Lyle School of Engineering, Meadows School of the Arts, Simmons School of Education and Human Development, Dedman School of Law, Perkins School of Theology and Moody School of Graduate and Advanced Studies.

SMU is data driven, and its powerful supercomputing ecosystem – paired with entrepreneurial drive – creates an unrivaled environment for the University to deliver research excellence.

Now in its second century of achievement, SMU is recognized for the ways it supports students, faculty and alumni as they become ethical, enterprising leaders in their professions and communities. SMU’s relationship with Dallas – the dynamic center of one of the nation’s fastest-growing regions – offers unique learning, research, social and career opportunities that provide a launch pad for global impact.

SMU is nonsectarian in its teaching and committed to academic freedom and open inquiry.

About the Lyle School of Engineering:

For nearly a century, Lyle has been nurturing exceptional engineers who are catalysts for global change. Our commitment to shaping bold leaders who innovate, pioneer, and tackle society’s toughest challenges is unwavering. Embedded in our mindset is a culture of ingenuity that resonates through our research and curriculum. With an impressive 9:1 graduate student-to-faculty ratio, coupled with robust scholarship offerings, we are dedicated to fostering meaningful mentorship and breaking engineering stereotypes. Lyle has proudly earned the American Society for Engineering Education’s Bronze Award for championing diversity and inclusivity. Our focus extends beyond campus, addressing critical global issues through groundbreaking research. Our five departments—Civil and Environmental Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical and Computer Engineering, Operation Research and Engineering Management, and Mechanical Engineering—drive impactful innovations beyond academia’s boundaries.

Lyle’s acclaimed centers and institutes include the Darwin Deason Institute for Cyber Security, Hart Center for Engineering Leadership, Caruth Institute for Engineering Education, Hunt Institute for Engineering and Humanity, and the Hart Institute for Technology, Innovation and Entrepreneurship. Notably, the Research Center of Advanced Manufacturing is being evolved into a dynamic new Center for Digital and Human-Augmented Manufacturing.

About the Position:

This role is an on-campus, in-person position.

The Senior Data Analyst for Strategic Initiatives, reporting directly to the Dean will leverage data analytics to strategically execute the Dean's vision, forward-looking projects, and overarching business objectives for the Lyle School. This role encompasses active participation in high-impact school initiatives and assumes a pivotal position in overseeing designated projects under the Dean's purview. The Senior Data Analyst will craft impactful narratives through data visualization and other mediums to produce annual reports encompassing research and operational accomplishments. This position collaborates closely with Assistant and Associate Deans on recruitment and special ventures. They will play a key role in facilitating the development of the School's strategic plan. The Senior Data Analyst will forge strong connections with vital stakeholders within the Lyle School.

Essential Functions:

Data Analytics, Strategy and Planning: Will develop and implement data analytics strategies that involve the hands-on execution of data-driven initiatives, which involves a comprehensive process from data collection and analysis to the generation of concrete strategies and recommendations based on the data-driven insights that align with the school’s objectives. It also encompasses the implementation, monitoring, adaptation, and reporting of these initiatives while adhering to data privacy and compliance standards. This could include working with various teams or departments to ensure the plans are put into action effectively. Continuous monitoring and evaluation of the data is essential.

The Senior Data Analyst may establish key performance indicators (KPIs) and regularly assess progress toward objectives. As circumstances change, the data-driven initiatives may need to be adapted or optimized to ensure effectiveness and relevance.

The Senior Data Analyst will actively gather data from various sources, which may include internal databases, surveys, external databases, and data acquired through partnerships or collaborations. Once data is collected, it needs to be cleaned and preprocessed to remove any inconsistencies, inaccuracies, or missing values. This involves identifying and addressing data quality.

Strategic Plan and Annual Reporting Research: Will collaborate with Assistant and Associate Deans, Directors, Department Chairs, and other key school stakeholders to gather research and produce an annual report of Lyle research and operational activities, as well as assist with the development of a Lyle strategic plan.

Special Projects: As the Dean's trusted confidante, the Senior Data Analyst will oversee special projects of interest to the Dean and the school, including team-building, solving operational challenges, special event development, and synthesizing data for stakeholders.

Occasional evening/weekend hours will be required.
Qualifications


Education and Experience:

A Master's degree is required, an MBA is highly preferred.

A minimum of five years of work experience is required.

Managerial and project management experience is required. Experience working at all phases of projects, (conceptualization to implementation) is essential. Experience in data analytics, business intelligence, or related roles with a demonstrated history of successfully supporting new initiatives is important for success in this role. Experience with change management is a plus.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

Candidate must demonstrate strong problem-solving and critical thinking abilities, as well as a strong attention to detail.

Candidate must possess strong interpersonal, oral and written communication skills, along with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights for non-technical stakeholders.

Candidate ability to work with confidential information is required.

Candidate must be able to demonstrate proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, specifically Excel.

Candidate familiarity and/or fluency in programs and software that visualize data, such as Tableau, Qualtrics, GoogleCharts, etc. is required.

Physical and Environmental Demands:

Sit for long periods of time

Deadline to Apply:

Priority consideration may be given to submissions received by October 31, 2023

This position is open until filled.

EEO Statement:

SMU will not discriminate in any program or activity on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, disability, genetic information, veteran status, sexual orientation, or gender identity and expression. The Executive Director for Access and Equity/Title IX Coordinator is designated to handle inquiries regarding nondiscrimination policies and may be reached at the Perkins Administration Building, Room 204, 6425 Boaz Lane, Dallas, TX 75205, 214-768-3601, accessequity@smu.edu.

Benefits:

SMU offers staff a broad, competitive array of health and related benefits. In addition to traditional benefits such as health, dental, and vision plans, SMU offers a wide range of wellness programs to help attract, support, and retain our employees whose work continues to make SMU an outstanding education and research institution.

SMU is committed to providing an array of retirement programs that benefit and protect you and your family throughout your working years at SMU and, if you meet SMU's retirement eligibility criteria, during your retirement years after you leave SMU.

The value of learning at SMU isn't just about preparing our students for the future. Employees have access to a wide variety of professional and personal development opportunities, including tuition benefits.

Overview and Responsibilities:

At Republic Finance, we are building a leading consumer lending company. In business for more than 70 years, we are proud to be a trusted lender in over 250 communities across the United States! We specialize in providing flexible lending solutions and incomparable customer service. Driven by our shared mission to pursue excellence for our team, our customers, and our performance, Republic Finance is continuously improving our online customer offerings in tandem with opening more branches in new states each year. We also regularly promote from within and enjoy giving back to the communities we serve. In a nutshell, our company culture is about helping customers, investing in our employee's future, and ensuring that our overall performance makes an impact on our community.

We are seeking a Sr. Business Analyst for our Operations Analytics and Loss Mitigation Strategy team. This is a key role with significant and broad responsibilities and will be a member of a 3-4 person team with substantial opportunity for future growth within the company in concert with driving business expansion. As a team-member responsible for developing recovery strategies that balance growth, risk and profitability, you will be a key thought leader on all collections strategies and decisions and have significant input into all loss mitigation decisions and delinquency performance. You will work closely with operations, Branch managers, and internal/external partners to collaborate on broader strategic initiatives and shape the direction and growth of the overall business in a collaborative dynamic team environment. Come and be a part of our success story! Job responsibilities are as follows:




Continuously challenge and enhance loss mitigation strategies and scorecards through analysis of customer behavior data and sophisticated statistical and financial modeling.
Maintain a rigorous performance monitoring framework and management dashboards to highlight performance trends and areas of opportunity.
Develop best-in-class loss mitigation products that provide our consumers solutions while minimizing portfolio risk.
Establish a robust test and learn environment for continual loss mitigation and collections strategy improvement.
Build and maintain a robust economic framework that will serve as the foundation for business decision-making.
Ensure loss mitigation policy remains compliant with all applicable laws and regulations.
Maintain transparent communication and trust with all key stakeholders.
Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in a STEM major is required, advanced degree is preferred.
2-4 years of experience as an analyst in lending originations or loss mitigation.
Experience with statistical modeling and forecasting, portfolio P&L simulation, vintage profitability tracking and marginal expansion strategies.
Familiarity with loss mitigation and collections strategies, loss forecasting, and/or collections KPI’s
1+ years of experience with SQL and/or Python querying required.
Strong communication and presentation skills, leadership skills, a high level of initiative, intellectual curiosity and creativity

Business Intelligence Developer


Iodine is an enterprise AI company that is championing a radical rethink of how to create value for healthcare professionals, leaders, and their organizations: automating complex clinical tasks, generating insights and empowering intelligent care. Powered by the largest set of clinical data and use cases available, our groundbreaking clinical machine-learning engine, Cognitive ML, constantly ingests the patient record to generate real-time, highly focused, predictive insights that clinicians and hospital administrators can leverage to dramatically augment the management of care delivery.


Summary/Objective
Iodine Software equips medical care teams with the most innovative tools to solve some of their toughest problems in clinical documentation. By leveraging technology like Natural Language Processing, and ground breaking technologies like Machine Learning, and Artificial Intelligence, our platform drives significant improvements in how hospitals document patient health conditions, in turn positively influencing team performance and patient outcomes.


What You’ll Do
Iodine Software is looking for a Business Intelligence Developer with a strong analytical prowess and a passion for problem-solving and numbers. This contributor will use query and analysis tools to define and track key performance metrics related to the effectiveness of different areas of our business. This individual will also be responsible for summarizing and communicating, both written and verbally, findings to various internal customers.


Identify business trends utilizing real data, compile analysis reports that are delivered to developers and then follow-up on all results
Work with our internal database to build and optimize the underlying data set required to run various reports
Work with account managers to report on key performance indicators and help identify areas of improvement for our clients
Perform ROI analysis on various programs to help determine performance and success
Analyze healthcare data sets and medical records to compile analysis reports
Help design, document and maintain system processes
Report on common sources of technical issues or questions and make recommendations to product team
Constantly be on the lookout for ways to improve monitoring, discover issues and deliver better value to the customer
Work with our client success teams to identify ways to improve user experiences and outcomes.


What You’ll Need
Minimum Requirements (Education, certifications and experience):
3-5 years experience with data analytics in the healthcare industry
Master’s degree in Data Analytics (preferred) or Bachelor’s Degree
Knowledge of relational databases and SQL
Experience with scripting languages such as Python and/or R
Experience with a Business Intelligence tool (Tableau, PowerBI, Looker)
Experience with Excel (pivot tables, formulas, charts, data modeling)
Strong written and verbal communication skills including technical writing skills
Capable of working independently as well as part of a collaborative team
Outstanding problem-solving skills with a proactive approach towards assigned projects


Preferred Requirements:
Experience with working electronic medical records, healthcare payor data and claims data highly preferred
Statistical modeling experience
Proficient in R and Python strong plus
Knowledge of Shiny and/or Looker


See Something, Do Something
At Iodine, we are incredibly privileged to be entrusted with an enormous amount of Protected Health Information (PHI) amounting more than 90 million lives. Inherent to our culture is the need to live up to that trust in everything we do. Security is a primary responsibility shared by every Iodine employee and we expect everyone to honor that responsibility. That includes abiding by our security policies, being constantly vigilant to possible risks to the privacy and safety of the information given to our care and bringing forward any concerns about security.


What You’ll Get
This is a unique opportunity to join a close-knit, rapidly growing team and help us improve a key piece of the organization. You will have the opportunity to drive the strategy and direction of our product for our users. You will join a passionate and ambitious team, with a proven record of success building multiple companies. Learn more about us at www.iodinesoftware.com

Primary Purpose

This position serves as the Principal Project Cost Analyst for the Sempra LNG and performs various project control activities for mega LNG projects, ranges $1B and $12B during the Project Development and Execution phases. This position also acts as the Subject Matter Expert (SME) in project cost control and supports the group with establishing standardized project cost control best practices and manages project cost reporting.

Duties and Responsibilities

*

Working with project functional teams, update project forecasts, develop plans and budgets, support AFE development and financial model development, review actuals and ensure costs are mapped to proper WBS, and analyze various financial and accounting data and document variances. Using ERP system and project financial forecasting system, develop financial reports and distribute to the project team, management and stakeholders. Track accruals and work with Accounting to ensure correct accruals are captured. Monitor and track cash flow and use of contingency.

Perform financial analyses and generate reports on scheduled and ad-hoc forecast, commitments and trending. Evaluate and provide reports on milestones, progress and spend curves. Provide ad-hoc analysis and reporting for scheduled weekly & monthly and ad-hoc reports requirements.
Oversee and manage the E&C budget by working with the project team to update the forecast, input actuals and work on cash flow. Coordinate with cash management to forecast cash needs to support the E&C invoices and labor costs. Provide feedback to project team members for requests of information on cost, finance and budget.
Support establishing standardized project cost control best practices and ensure to adhere the standards across the organization. Provide operational audit guidance and recommendations for external and internal audits.
Review and understand contracts for various vendors and contractors, and ensure cash flows tie to the contract Terms & Conditions, contract type, payment schedule, etc. As the SME in project cost controls, provide training and guidance to other team members, offer ideas to execute best practices organization-wide and document the project cost control processes and project governance as required.
Perform other duties as assigned (no more than 5% of duties).
Education


Bachelor's degree - in Accountancy or relative discipline in Finance and Accounting required.
Master's degree - Master of Business Administration Preferred.
Experience


8+ years of experience in related field required.
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities


Possesses a high level of knowledge of project finance and cost management, and regulatory matters and is considered an expert in these areas.
Outstanding computer/PC skills with strong emphasis in Excel and database applications.
Prior experience in development of Work Breakdown Structure (WBS), Estimate to Complete (ETC), and Estimate at Completion (EAC).
Must possess strong mathematical and analytical skills, initiative/decision-making skills, and problem-solving abilities.
Must have the ability to identify issues, analyze data, develop, recommend, and implement solutions.
Good knowledge of “generally accepted accounting principles”.
Understand project schedule concepts including CPM, Earned Value Analysis.
Licenses and Certifications


PMP and/or other professional certifications/advanced degrees preferred.
Other Qualifications


Must be able to travel (up to 10%).

Our facility in Laredo, Texas is currently seeking a Business Analyst-WMS to join our Information Technology team. As a WMS Business Analyst, you will play a crucial role in analyzing, designing, and optimizing warehouse management solutions. Your expertise in WMS systems, specifically Blue Yonder (formerly JDA) and the Blue Yonder Luminate platform, will contribute to the successful implementation and continuous improvement of warehouse operations. You will work closely with cross-functional teams, business stakeholders, and IT departments to understand requirements, develop strategies, and drive adoption.




Values:
To perform the job successfully, the incumbent’s behavior must be consistent with the PRIDE values expected of all Mastronardi Produce employees: be Passionate; have Respect; be Innovative; be Driven and strive for Excellence.




Primary Responsibilities:

Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand their warehouse management needs, challenges, and objectives.
Analyze, document, and translate business requirements into technical specifications for WMS systems, including process flows, data requirements, and system functionalities.
Work closely with IT teams to configure, customize, and integrate the Blue Yonder WMS system and Luminate platform, aligning them with business processes and objectives.
Conduct a comprehensive gap analysis to identify areas for improvement and recommend solutions to enhance WMS operations.
Lead the implementation and upgrade projects of Blue Yonder WMS and Luminate platform, collaborating with third-party vendors, implementation partners, and internal teams.
Define and execute system testing strategies, including unit testing, integration testing, and user acceptance testing, to ensure system functionality and data accuracy.
Develop and deliver training programs and materials to end-users, ensuring effective adoption and utilization of the WMS system.
Monitor and support the production environment, addressing system issues, data discrepancies, and user inquiries related to the Blue Yonder WMS system.
Analyze and interpret data from the WMS system to provide insights and recommendations for process improvements and operational efficiency.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and implement strategies for inventory management, order fulfillment, and warehouse optimization.
Stay updated with industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies in warehouse management systems, specifically Blue Yonder and Luminate platform.
Participate in strategic planning and roadmap discussions, providing insights and recommendations on WMS-related initiatives and technologies.
Collaborate with business stakeholders to define and implement data integration strategies, ensuring seamless data exchange between the WMS system and other business applications.
Drive continuous improvement initiatives to enhance the performance, scalability, and usability of the Blue Yonder WMS system and Luminate platform.
Conduct post-implementation reviews to assess the effectiveness of WMS solutions and identify opportunities for further optimization.
Act as a subject matter expert on the Blue Yonder WMS system and Luminate platform, providing guidance and support to junior analysts and end-users.
Collaborate with business stakeholders to define and implement strategies for system enhancements, upgrades, and expansions.
Foster strong relationships with business stakeholders, IT teams, and external vendors to ensure effective communication and alignment of WMS initiatives with business goals.
Maintain documentation of system configurations, processes, and user guidelines to facilitate knowledge sharing and support future enhancements.



Qualifications & Experience:

Bachelor's or master's degree in supply chain management, logistics, business administration, or a related field.
Proven experience (5+ years) as a WMS Business Analyst or in a similar role, with a focus on Blue Yonder WMS and Luminate platform.
Strong knowledge and experience in developing, configuring, and supporting Blue Yonder WMS and Luminate platform.
Familiarity with warehouse management processes, including receiving, put-away, picking, packing, shipping, and inventory management.
Proficiency in business process analysis and mapping, with the ability to identify process gaps and recommend improvements.
Experience in leading WMS implementation projects, including requirements gathering, system configuration, testing, and training.
In-depth understanding of supply chain operations, warehouse management principles, and industry best practices.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to analyze complex data sets, identify trends, and make data-driven recommendations.
Experience in system integration, including data mapping, EDI, and API integrations with other business applications.
Solid understanding of database concepts and SQL queries, with the ability to extract and manipulate data from WMS systems.
Knowledge of Blue Yonder Luminate Control Tower and other supply chain visibility tools is a plus.
Strong project management skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and deliver them on time and within budget.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with stakeholders at all levels of the organization.
Strong problem-solving and decision-making abilities, with a focus on identifying innovative solutions to complex business challenges.
Proven ability to work independently and in a team environment, with a high degree of self-motivation and initiative.
Ability to travel as required for project implementations and stakeholder meetings.
A commitment to continuous learning and staying updated with the latest trends and advancements in WMS technologies.
